Review: We have a tiny car and it's pretty big, but fits well! I can tell it's long lasting and my kid loves it. It's very comfortable.
Works great!
Very easy to use and does not take up a lot of space.
Very happy with this car seat read many reviews and research very safe and comfortable for my son!
This fits perfect in our vehicle. My son always falls asleep in it. Love the cup holders too!

I bought this car seat because the one I had bought the day before was not what it was made out to be and definitely didn’t recline enough and the babies head hung while sleeping and such I also wanted the quick latch system being my husband and I switch from truck I have a small suv and three girls one which is 12 and not in a car seat so she is between the booster and all in one and there wasn’t much room at all between the other seat but this seat definitely has that check off list it has the quick latch system the recline isn’t a much as the  graco  4ever but the recline is definitely better then the Evenflo  Symphony my Favorite part of the seat is that it’s slim the cup holders turn in to make more room and that quick latch system is amazing I was able to get the seat very tight and it will not move so over all  very happy with this seat I returned the other that I bought and kept this one I hope you to find this help full will add pics as soon as I get some day light out

This product fit a need, as my 5 year old needed a new car seat. I am not quite comfortable with him using a backless booster. I was specifically looking into a seat that had somewhere to secure the seatbelt. We had tried another seat, and the seat belt kept getting stuck. The red little contraption it has keeps the seatbelt in place and allows for the seatbelt to move through easily. My son is able to buckle himself in and out without my help which is a huge help! The color is modern and the seat is not bulky. Great purchase.

My 4 year olds have been complaining about leg pain on any car trip over 30 minutes, so I found these foot rests and the boys are so excited about them. They fit fine in the third row of our suburban with Evenflo Maestro Sport booster seats. Installation was pretty easy, just took a little playing around with the different adjustments to get it right. We are going on a 4 hour trip next week, so I’ll update if there are any issues, but so far so good!
Perfect

Installation was a breeze and the carseat looked so comfortable! My son falls asleep in it everytime. I had read where this carseat was extremely bulky. I have a Nissan Murano and there is plenty of room for other backseat passengers. I bought this carseat from Amazon about two weeks ago and I checked back to see if the price was the same and it had dropped about $67 so I returned it and got a lighter color (waverly). All in all this is the best carseat out there, NO DOUBT. I have tried a few and they are either uncomfortable or I have to put towels under the carseat to get them secured. I would never think that carseats are made for you to have to put TOWELS underneath them, thats crazy! All other carseats moved around and I could never get them tight. This carseat doesn't move AT ALL!! Get it, you won't be disappointed!

Bought this for use on the airplane since it is very light weight. Worked great and we liked it so much we bought another for the extra car. My son likes it better than his Britax in our daily driver.

Was looking for something easy to install and this fit the bill perfectly! A little heavy but was still quick to switch from one car to another. Very nice, sleek looking. My son seems more comfortable in this one than our other one. The shoulder pieces and rubber shock absorbers are a little bulky. Other than that, I am very happy with this car seat.

This is a great car seat.  Don't bother getting a more expensive one, this one is a bargain!  It's easy to install and comfy for my son.  I recommend getting the "Gunther" style because it's made of a soft fabric.  I have another one of the seats in a different style that's made of a slick type of fabric.  It tends to get a little hot to the touch in the summer and cold in the winter.  The "Gunther" style is much more comfortable for my son.

We've had this carseat for more than a year now, and we don't recommend it to our friends. The installation is probably as difficult as any convertible seat. To get a tight fit, you basically have to lay across the carseat and tightening the anchoring system is difficult at any angle. To get it correctly installed, you have to guess where to set the anchoring strap and then try to snap the buckle in. If it's too hard, you loosen it and try again. Too loose and you unsnap it, tighten the strap and do it again. This method takes a long time, and is much more difficult than the advertised system of snapping the buckle into the seat and then tightening the strap. Like I said, though, most of the larger carseats aren't easy to install because of how bulky and awkward they are.
The other complaint we have with this particular carseat, which drives us crazy the most, are the harness straps. It seems so easy; you buckle up your child and pull the tightening strap to make sure they're held in safely. We had this system with our infant carseat, (Chicco Keyfit 30), and loved it. It was easy to tighten and loosen. With this carseat, we have a very difficult time tightening the harness enough to be safe. Sometimes the gap between the straps and my son's chest are large enough for me to put my hand under and I have to brace myself to make it any tighter. The booklet instructs you to tighten the carseat straps until you can't pinch them together. It is very difficult to get the straps to this point. We have tried pulling the tightening strap at different angles and made sure it wasn't tangled in any way and yet it still requires way too much arm strength to pull tight. Buckling a squirmy toddler is never fun, but this carseat just adds to the frustration.
The other annoyance is how close together the straps are at my son's neck. If the pads get moved or if my son pulls them off, (which is easy), he gets painful looking, red lines on the side of his neck from where the straps rubbed.
The reason we bought this carseat was because it was rated one of the top, safest ones and we could keep my son rear facing for longer. I feel like the design of it could be improved, though, so that reaching it's praised point of safety is easier.
Excellent!!  Great for the in between kids!  Looks good!  Great colors.  Bought one for myself, and my picky daughter grabbed out of my care and gave me her used one.  Apparently she like it too!
Good size to fit in a Jeep Liberty which has smaller seat depth. Also used in a Polaris Ranger UTV. Good quality and easy to get child in and out of.

I love this car seat, I have one for my 2yr old and 1yr old. They are easy to install. I only wish that it was a little more secure. When I hook the bottom, it’s secured to the metal clips in the seats but the car seat still moves from side to side. I was it to tightly secured to the seat.

This was bought at a discount through Amazon Warehouse Deals. We are thrilled to have gotten it at such a reduced price and it two days. Although the outside box was a bit damaged (as advertised), the car seat is perfect! It will work with the car bases that we already have as well as our stroller. I will definitely buy from Amazon Warehouse Deals again!
I love the durability and the soft material. It a little high so I feel like I have to pick my kid up higher to get her in it. Still worth the buy though!
Fast shipping and great quality. Loved the fact that it came with the base.

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review:
This is the most comfortable carseat ive ever seen. My one year old loves it. It was quick and easy to install. Adjusts super easy. Definitely worth the price.

My box came opened and damaged causing my carseat to be dirty and wet from snow melting on the box. Amazon delivery is an awful service.

Nice looking seat, but car anchor connector system is flawed. Installed seat like I normally do. I typically give a shake test after all my installs, and I realized this seat was losing tension against the seat of the car. I was able to manually pull the seat to the full extension of the anchor connectors without pressing the release button.. I have never seen this with a car seat. I reinstalled multiple times with the same results. Not good....

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review:
We were going for a long trip abroad and we decided to get these boosters for the kids instead of renting boosters from the rental companies for an extremly high price.
They saved us a lot of money and room.
the big + is that the sit is very compact, light for traveling and easy to push into your bag/suitcase.
The - is that the inflation system isnt to great and anoying. Also they are not as comfy as the real boosters
Also they are a bit soft and obviusly not as safe as real boosteres.
All in all, they are a great solution as portable boosters for travling and we are very happy with them.

This car seat is great.  It is pretty light and easy to install.  I would say that the release button is a bit tricky when you are trying to manage a 1 year old and pull the straps out while pressing the release.  I supposed as she gets older it will be a good thing it is not too easy to release the straps.  As far as size this thing looked to be the smallest one out there but it barely fits in my VW MK7 Golf.  The passenger seat has to be pulled up at least half way and the car seat is less than an inch from touching the passenger seat. This is in rear facing mode.  It also took a few tries to get it level since it is such a tight fit.  In the end we moved this seat to my wife's car and i havent decided if we will get a 2nd for the VW or not.
I love it! I have two and would buy more!

I purchased 2 seats for my car to use with my  grandchildren. They are great, light weight and easy to install. My babies have plenty of leg room and they are both forward and rear facing so they are adaptable to the different ages of my grand babies.
Uncomfortable for child. Strange posture while sitting in it unless it's reclined all the way

Love this carseat because it comes with the piece for the winter when its cold , the only thing i did replace was the infant insert because i felt like it was kind of cheap looking and would rip or dirty easy so i bought a jj cole insert . Other then that i would highly recommend .

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: It worked great and arrived fast. Simple and easy to use. Very easy to take off during security checks and put back on.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: We now have 2 of these.  They are very simple and make transporting car seats through airports manageable.  It is not uncommon to get comments like "that is a great idea" or "you almost couldn't get anywhere without that."  It is true.  We got chased off of a gate walkway because I was stopping to attach the straps and had to carry EVERYTHING by hand while my wife took the little ones.  It was only 100 feet, but it made me realize just how wonderful these things are.

As a long time fan of Britax car seats, the Click-Tight Advocate with Anti-Rebound Bar exceeds my expectations. With the many new safety features and the amazingly easy click-tight technology, I am so happy with this car seat. No more wrestling with the latch bars for this mama. With the turn of a dial, the whole seat area lifts up and you simply run the belt through the belt path, lower the seat until you hear it click and voilà, car seat installed. Safe baby, happy mama!
My grandson loves his new avengers car seat.
Carseat is very nice. Takes a lot of room so won't fit in a small car but works good in a suv.
Used this on a trip where we would be traveling using ride share mainly. Very easy to blow up and install in the car. Wouldn’t use it day to day but great for travel

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: I was on the fence but this is so worth the extra money—- oh my gosh I wish I knew about this sooner. I absolutely love it! It makes getting my daughter in and out of the car so much easier! Highly recommend!
My kids like it. They are very comfortable sitting n it.  I have peace of mind thinking they are in safe place.  The downside is that, the price is expensive but I think it's worth.

Was skeptical buying these but after researching em I went ahead. And so happy I did . Love these car seats super easy to inflate and deflate love the non slip bottom great for small back seats and love the travel bag it comes with. Great purchase
Such a nice seat!! He loves it!

My granddaughter fits comfortably in it. It turns around and the baby can see everything. She is a happy camper. Love it! It’s nice and roomy for her. Love love love it. Thank you for making this product. Nice.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review:
We were going to travel across the country and I'm a big believer in having the baby have a separate seat. We tried lugging a big britax seat on a short airplane ride by hand and it was overwhelmingly annoying. All the baby gear is cumbersome (stroller, carry ons, car seat etc). This little tiny strap enabled us to lug a Sunshine Radian 65 (which is narrow enough to roll down the aisle of the 767 on our rollerboard carryon luggage) with the baby in it (1 yr old).

It definitely would be fiddly for only one parent if they were juggling child, baggage, car seat, stroller etc. But it really worked well for us. Practice putting it on and off. It is definitely one of the best solutions for taking a convertible car seat on the plane if you need to bring one on your trip. Once our baby is older, we would consider using the CARES harness. But the car seat enabled our baby to sleep in familiar environs.

One thing to consider is if you end up taking the baby in the car seat, they may want you to check your stroller in rather than gate check (if you use a stroller bag to protect your stroller). We had no issues in SFO, but we ran into resistance at JFK and ended up checking the stroller in at JFK.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: This is perfect for traveling or when you need to fit a car seat in the middle of 2 other car seats. We used this on a recent trip to Puerto Rico and it worked as expected. Definitely recommend this!
the pad is different from one I bought at target. its more soft. overall is good
My daughter absolutely loves this! Hard to secure into the car but that’s because I gave up and let my boyfriend do it.
Excellent ones

love the 4ever car seat!! It's so cushiony and sturdy! I feel like my 5 month old daughter is much safer in this seat than in the "click and go" style. She loves the bright color, and recline position. The cup holders are a great bonus! They hold binkys or toys now, eventually a sippy cup. Well worth the money spent, amazon never fails to provide the true quality products at a great price and FAST shipping!!!

Love the dinosaur pattern on this booster. I have actually purchased a total of 3 of this booster, though 2 were store purchases. After needing to get another booster for Grandma, I let my son pick out the pattern and he was excited to get something besides the basic black/grey. The adjustable arm rests and cup holders are great on this booster and my son has never complained about being uncomfortable in this seat.
These were perfect. Exactly as described, great quality, very pleased

We loved this car seat with our now 7 year old and love it with our 21 month old! My only complaint about the newer technology is the rotating adjustment piece is rather stiff. I expect this to loosen over time. I think our son's was like this, too, 5-6 year ago. I love being able to tighten it securely. My biggest complaint with the strap-tightening car seats is I never feel like they are truly tight. This one, I do, and it has great crash test ratings.

UPDATE: A year later. I loathe the cup holders on this thing. Everything else is still awesome (this is our second Triumph seat and we love the adjustment mechanism). But, the stupid elastic straps that hold a cup a guaranteed to make whatever it is supposed to be holding fall out even if you take a more gentle turn. We always put our tot's cups on the side our 8 year old sits on and when the stupid cup falls out (and it will), he simply puts it back. Horrible design. BUT, we still really love the triumph seats!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: After reading the reviews, I decided to purchase two seats. Seats are easy to install but not comfortable; both of my kids are constantly moving in the seats and seem come off the seats easy even when tucked in tight.

We purchased this to fit our 49in tall son in the Volvo XC90 (2017 model). This booster does not work for this car as the headrest in the backseat has a slight forward tilt that is not adjustable. This prevents the seat from sitting flat against the cars seat back when the headrest is extended to fit the kid. The extended headrest in this Britax seat is so flimsy, I don’t see how it would provide any extra protection in a crash. It does appear to be comfy for sleeping though. We will have to return this seat sadly.

I had this car seat shipped to our destination when we went on a trip and I threw it away after we were dropped off at the airport for our return flight. So I bought it because it was cheap and I was going to throw it away anyway. With carseats, you definitely get what you pay for. This car seat has no padding and is pretty difficult to install, especially compared to our Even Flo Symphony, but it got the job done, and for this price, I didn't feel bad abandoning it at the airport.
A mi Nieto le gusta y fácil de montar y limpiar

My son and daughter inlaw have a typical sedan for their family of 5...the car seat sits great in the middle and the 2 older  kids each sit by a door!!! The older 2 r 10 and 12 years old and Lil Man is 3...!!!
Super útil y bonita!
My daughter loves is opposed to her baby seat. Super roomy and she’s excited about being able to see all the other cars on the road. Great price, good quality.

We needed a car seat that can be easily removed and quickly but is very secure when needed. It also lays flat so it can go to the back of the car and doesn't bang around when driving.  And compact enough so all the sports gear from Volleyball, basketball, softball, soccer and dance can go in the back.

I like the overall seat, but don't like that you can't recline it very far for a rear facing child..Also that the seat doesn't come off the base. So if I want to bring the seat inside I will have to take the entire seat and base.
Very usefull and easy to use. Plug and Play.
This is for my grandson and was recommended by my son and daughter in law.  It works very well.
Great price, great product!

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: I like that it's small and compact. But u hate how unsafe it makes me feel. My 6 month old was eating and leaned hard against the tray trying to reach me handing him food and it popped off! I assure you I had it on tight and all the way. Now I don't even want to use it. Maybe later when he's bigger and I can use it as a booster seat.
Good stuff easy carry adjustable car seat
Very comfortable for a wonderful price

No Isofix.
But comfortable with cupholder and secret space.

It is a good seat once set up properly but the instruction manual is confusing and very poorly laid out. The engineering of the seat matches the writing in the manual. I question how many of thesw aren't installed correctly because of the design and instructions.

It’s been quite a few years since I needed a car seat so I decided to research care seats again. Once again Britain’s convertibles stood out for safety.  This makes it the 3rd one I’ve bought! The baby loves it as he is huge for his age and made me feel better switching him early!

My baby was so whining when she sots in a baby carseat even she was small enough to fit in. So I decide tried out her sit in the the advocate carseat when she was 5 months. Very satisfied so far.  She got very well sleep and easy to put her in and out. Even easy to install with just open the carseat with a ted button. But in Texas summer weather, she got all wet in her back when she sit for few minutes. Otherwise, I love the quality. Recommend to buy this.

I ordered this car seat for my 2 year old granddaughter. Easy to install. Tells you exactly how to position it and the straps are easy to unbuckle for someone who has "nails" like me.  Cup holders for drinks or snacks. I recommend this seat.
Loved this car seat. Although, the directions were hard to understand. I had to take it to my local Police Dept. to have it installed the correct way. The baby loves it.

We were able to get this car seat on sale just before Prime Days. I am impressed at the value. My son is large for his age, 30 inches and 23lbs at 9 months. We opted to transition him out of his infant seat and we know Britax has a great safety history, so we purchased this seat. We do not have any regrets. My son fits in it perfectly, it is a quality material, and the install was easier than the Graco Extend2Fit we purchased for our other car. My son doesn’t seem upset with the recline position and his head doesn’t bob around either. I wish we would have purchased two of these and skipped the Graco.

We have 2 MiFolds and use them regularly for travel while living in Germany. My boys are super tall for their ages (7 and 9) but still don't reach the German height limit for riding without a booster. My oldest uses his MiFold daily, but my younger one finds it uncomfortable for daily use. We flew a lot last month, and it was so nice that both their seats fit in my backpack; no carrying bulky seats to and from the States any more.

I will say that it is a very new product, and it still has a few kinks to work out. If you're not rushed, I would see if they make any updates in the next few months. Our biggest complaint is that the red sliding guides on the sides don't 'lock' sturdily into position. It doesn't affect the belt position on the lap or shoulder, but it can be annoying.

Our oldest has figured out how to adjust it when it slides back in. My little one says the bottom is 'spiky' and therefore prefers his cushioned booster for daily use. I find it totally worth it for travel, though. We took them on a cruise 2 months ago, and it was so nice to be able to throw them in the backpack when we got off the ship for excursions.

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: Seems comfortable and obviously safety is the top priority. Only 3 stars because the straps are very frustrating. They somehow get twisted at the buckle and it takes 5-10 minutes to fix it. Happens frequently and I haven’t figured out a way to permanently fix the issue.

We love this, and now own one for each child despite the high cost of these seats. Such a snug, secure fit in our car. We had attempted to use a cheaper $80 seat, knowing that all car seats must meet safety standards, and wanting to save some money. Even being a certified passenger safety technician, I could never obtain a secure fit with the cheaper seat and (for us, in our vehicles) it simply wasn't a safe installation. Our 2 year old is at the 90th percentile for height and in the cheap seat he was right at the maximum height for the seat (rear-facing, head was an inch from the top) even though he's only 27 pounds and well within the weight limit of 40. In this Britax, he has plenty of room to grow height-wise and this seat truly accommodates tall kids. This seat is worth the price!

Wow, I really couldn't be happier with this purchase. Bought the Graco Affix for my four going on five year old daughter who was ready to move on from the old car seat. Set up and install was very easy, seat is comfortable and looks to be very secure and well padded. Just a couple comments for you while you're making your decision to purchase:

1) I'm really happy I spent the extra money for the LATCH attachment. I've had boosters before without it, and its just a very nice feature. The Graco's hooks are super easy to use - much easier than the typical child car seat - and very easy to secure and tighten. Awesome.

2) My daughter is very petite, part of why I've waited this long to move her to a booster. She meets the weight requirements but I was concerned about her height. The back of the Graco is easily adjustable and the seat belt lines up properly on her frame.

3) I do kind of prefer the hide-able cup holders that the other Graco boosters have.

4) Keep your eye on the price. These boosters go on sale periodically and you shouldn't have to wait long to get it at a good price. I think it was $70 when I put it in my cart, and I finally purchased it for like $56.

My daughter is really happy with the booster seat, glad to be sitting in the car like a "big kid". She can't quite buckle herself in yet, but she can unbuckle which is a start. Highly recommended.
Great car seat and fits well in my car. Easy to use.
Best product ever! I’ve ordered this brand 7 years ago and it’s safe and durable!
such a great seat. So easy to install or switch cars in.
My little man loves this chair, so do I. He sleeps easy in it. I have recommended it to my sisters and they all are buying it as second car seats for their little ones.

Special Features: Parent Link Customer Service, Live Video Installation Support
Review: Was replacing my daughters car seat due to a wreck, and thought this one looked great…. WRONG!!! It looks good but is very very flimsy, wobbles even with my 60lb child in it, doesn’t hold seatbelt properly! Definitely a waste of money!

I love how sturdy and safe this carseat is.  You can definitely tell this is a very high quality carseat compared to other cheap brands.  But it is very heavy and bulky.  It takes up a lot of space.  However, iit is easy to install and I love the ClickTight feature.

I love Uppababy products! This car seat was everything I expected it to be! Great quality, nice and sturdy, easy to put together, easy to take apart to clean. My daughter fits great and has lots of time to grow with it! I love the latch system for an even more secure fit!

The old version was much nicer!  This one seems cheap, more plastic. But mostly it was uncomfortable -- crotch buckle was too tight, the new "hugs" chest straps made it super hard to properly tighten. We returned this item -- not worth the price at all!
I love this car seat. Very safe and very good car seat.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review: great seat.

My kid puked in it the first week we got it and I can't find a way to get to base layer of fabric off without Uninstalling it.  Kidd are messy, there should be a way to take all fabric off without Uninstalling.
I have twin grands. Bought this car seat for each of them. Very roomy and comfortable. I highly recommend it.

Serves it's purpose tho I wouldn't call it lighter than any other infant seat. Kinda on the cheap side as far as build goes and my handle is exceptionally difficult to raise and lower always getting fetched up on the canopy which is not fully removable

The car seat is great, definitely seems comfortable and safe! My only complaint is that they sent me the wrong color. I don’t have time to exchange it, so ugly color will be fine. Just don’t get your heart set on a color if you order from this seller!
Not the safest, the button on the chest peice is super easy to push once the child learns that move, my child keeps unbuckling herself while I am driving and taking her arms out

This product seems to be of good quality, and operationally works well. It installed very easily, The materials are all durable and washable, which is very important, and it seems very sturdy. I have a Graco Extend2fit Convertible Car Seat in my other car, and while this product is very nice, it is not as intuitive, nor does it have all of the features of the Graco, for instance:

- The Graco has a built in level with a ball mounted on the side that tells you that you have installed it properly.
- Both units have an adjustable head rest, but on the Graco, the head rest height controls the shoulder strap height as well. This is very convenient.
- The Graco has a foot extension so you can have it set further away from the seatback to keep older kids rear facing longer with enough leg room, which is much safer.

All in all, while not a bad product, there are other products in the $120-140 price range that seem to have more features (Safety First grow n go 3 in 1 car Sea), and for the extra $70(40 for me because I got it on sale) the Graco Extend2Fit is a better product and worth the additional cost.
Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it. I think iv'e filled the word requirement. You can't go wrong with Britax.
Easy to clean and light

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: I wanted to love this chair but my main issue was my 7month old baby kept leaning on the sides even though I had the straps on and regarding cleaning wise if the straps get dirty you would need to hand scrub it I will be returning mines unfortunately
It's a really good product! It's set up allready when you get it. Easy to move positions.
Love it and quick delivery and great price

So much easier to use than my sons Graco mysize65! I have to have my husband buckle my son in (I physically can't tighten it enough), and I can buckle my daughter in this seat perfectly fine! The color scheme is adorable too! Can't wait for the rude comments about my daughter rear facing until she meets the limits of this seat! At least she will be safe!

Bought this as an extra carseat to use while traveling. We took it to Colorado over the holidays and it worked very well. I don't think I would use it everyday given the lack of padding, but the price was right for a travel seat.
The button to loosen the straps is very hard to access.
Very strong heavy seat.  I love it for forward facing but hate it for rear facing!  I like that it has a rear facing tether but it's hard to get this seat as tight as I like it.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: We really like this product.  It took about 10 seconds to attach the car seat.  However, we did not think our 3-year-old daughter could sit in the car seat as the photo shows.
very nice seat for my 3 yrs old kid with cup holder and good materials. can take off to clean.
Great booster. Great for my Odyssey. Good fit and easy to move. I love having LATCH for when my son’s not in the car.

This is a great car seat. It is very light weight and looks sleek. I love the colors and the padding. The cover is machine washable and that is a wonderful feature. We loved this seat and used it for a year with no complaints. The base is easy to use and the seat snaps in and removes easily.
Easy to install in vehicle.  Grandson loves it.
We like this one. We have two of them now.
Grandson

My wife and I have owned 3 Britax Marathon car seats, a Britax booster, several other brand boosters, some 3-in-1 conversions, and now we were shooting for this one as it was rated well for the price. We have 3 car seats shoved together in a Nissan Pathfinder and there simply isn't enough room for the oldest child to insert a seatbelt on his own. We needed a harness system to handle my growing 6-yr old. The other two are almost 3 yrs and a 5 week old.

Overall, the seat quality is just fine. The one struggle we deal with daily is that my 6-yr old struggles to pinch the harness buckle together to release the two metal clips. It's not a problem for me, but it frustrates him to no end because he wants to be able to do it himself (as he does on the Britax models just fine). I have 2 rather independent boys... and the 3rd boy will likely join the ranks. Occasionally he'll also fight with the breast strap, even though I think he's just grasping it wrong. If you're going to have a problem with this carseat, this is the RIGHT problem to have. Better that the carseat hold your child tight and fast than release him/her easily.

Other the harness release issues, the seat has worked out well so far and at least does make it so that we can have the 3 car-seat-bound boys in the car at once. Uhh, that's rather important, I'd say. The search for a minivan is underway -- something I never thought I'd say.
Great chair and for the price even better
This was purchased as a gift and all I know is that the parents were quite happy.  I wish I could help more but I haven't strapped a young one in a car seat in a long long time, sorry!
It got the job done but not the best quality
For my grandson. Not sturdy enough. I want to return. Missed by 2 weeks
Cute color. My kid is comfortable. It was kind of tricky to get right in our truck and using the seatbelt in rear facing is in the a little in the way, but we love it!
Amazing! Just had to adjust straps by looking under seat cover in the front and Pull silver clamp.
My grandson

Recently purchased this carseat for my 9 month old. Although he still could fit his infant carseat, he wasn't comfortable and car rides would be a nightmare. Since installing this carseat (which took approximately 30 minutes) he enjoys car rides and surprisingly it's not as bulky as his infant car seat and is much more comfortable with the infant insert. He has to use the infant insert since his weight limit is below 25lbs. Overall, It's much more plush and he actually looks comfortable. He fits perfect and the carseat fit perfectly in my vehicle rearfacing. I have a very small crossover with very few leg room in the back which is why I opted for this carseat. It definitely is a space saver! I know several people have left reviews that indicated how difficult instillation was. I didn't find it so horrible since I watched plenty of videos and read the manual in it's entirety. I suppose the horizontal reference line and the tether anchorage system could be a learning curve since most are used to the balancing bubble and just a more straightforward car seat installation. I would definitely recommend reading the manual for setup. Other than that, I have thoroughly enjoyed this car seat and my baby has loved it just as much. Which is most important.

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: Good product/easy to use

I bought this about a month ago for my 14 month old. I bought it because it was ranked highest on consumer reports for safety and came at reasonable price. It was not super hard to install but we have the latch system. I will say I did want to put it in the center seat but our car only has latches on side seats and when I tried to combine them in the middle it left more than an inch of movement...so on the side she goes!
She is also still rear facing per the new recommendations and even with a towel wedged her wee head still flops forward when she sleeps... will be trying pillow soon.
I do like the room it gives her within the seat and the seat itself does not take up that much room in the back of our 4 door sedan....it still allows 2 other people to sit in the back.

This is the primary seat that we use for our daughter. This is a quality seat that is easy to install.

Pros:
-Easy to install. The only reason it took me long was because I could not believe it could be so easy so I started to read the entire book and watch YouTube videos to make sure I did it correctly. Yes, it was that easy.
-Solid. This seat is sturdy. When you grab it from the top section and move it, it stays solid. Our other seat feels flimsy.

Cons:
-Our daughter is a petite and I have to keep adjusting the shoulder belts so they don't fall off her shoulders while tightening up the belts. This should go away once she get's bigger (and it did)
-It takes a little more effort than our other seat to buckle our daughter in. I have to adjust all the parts constantly
-No head cushions to keep a kids head straight when they fall asleep

Give all of the above this is still our primary seat and I would recommend it. It feels solid and our daughter does not get fussy in this seat
Love this seat, fits my 7 yr old perfectly
I love this seat! It's comfortable and easy to use with my toddler, who is tall for her age so have a harder time finding seats that work well. Great price for a great seat.

According to the seller statement you should be able to fit 3 in the seat. I have a Grand caravan and no you can not fit 3 in the seat.  So I basically spent money on 3 of these seats for nothing. What a joke.

A flight from the West Coast to Michigan on my own w/3 kids on a RED EYE with a 3 Hour Layover...this cart made it possible! My 2 year old was able to sit in her carseat during our flight and she fell right to sleep. The familiarity of her carseat was so helpful and there is no way she would have stayed buckled w/o her carseat. I could not have carried her carseat w/3 kids all around the airport and there is no way I would take a stroller AND a carseat without another adult traveling w/me to help. This cart turned her carseat into a stroller and it worked great. Super easy to use. We have a Graco car seat and it fit perfectly. The car seat was too wide to "roll" down the airplane aisle, so I did have to unbuckle her and carry the carseat over my head through the narrow aisles. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it took a little effort to tighten it and get the carseat sitting just right on the cart without it wobbling. Our 3 hour layover was manageable because I could use it as a stroller and take her on a long walk to keep her settled and sleepy. Traveling with a wiggly toddler is so much easier with this!!

We bought this as an upgrade from our infant seat (that came with the stroller) because our little one was screaming every time we put her in the car. We felt she was being scrunched down in an awkward position. We switched her when she was 5 months old (13 lb) and she absolutely loves car rides now. This seat is comfortable and safe! It has the option to use the anchor system or seat belt (anchor is safest). We also loved that it would grow with her and we wouldn't have to buy another seat for her. I highly recommend.

We have been using the car seat now for a few weeks and so far we like it. It was easy to install and it’s so easy to adjust. We have not been in an accident to know if it’s a sturdy car seat and protects my child, which I hope we never have to experience that anyway. The product looks good as well. Nice dark colors to hide all of my child’s dirt lol.
So far all of the Graco car seats we have owned have been our favorite in comparison to the Evenflo ones we have owned. They seem more sturdy and safe and have been easier to adjust and get the children in and out of.
Just the right size for my 7 year old grandaughter, and comfy, too!  fits in our minivan and sedan.  Not s problem transferring it from car to car.
Loved it!!!

This car seat is clearly safe, which is the most important thing. It appeared to be comfortable for my child. What i like most about this car seat is the latches in the front are very easy for an adult to snap and not so easy for a child to unsnap. My child has used two other car seats (both Gracos) and at a young age (less than 1 yrs old) she was able to unlatch the top part of the harness (as it did not take much pressure to unlactch it).

It is also easy to install so if you have to move the car seat into another car you will not spend much time adjusting and tightening.

The reason I am givign this 4 stars is because after removing the cover to wash it I noticed how cheap the cushionng material is (although it was clearly comfortable for my child). Also, once the cover was removed I was never able to get the cover to fit back on the car seat the same. It constantly came loose or came off. When the car seat cover becomes loose the frame of the car seat became exposed and there is a hole between the back of the carseat frame and the side of the careseat. My child was able to stick her arm in that little hole and got her arm stuck. I had to pull the car over and remove her little arm from the hole.
My granddaughter LOVES her booster seat.
It’s great seat just not for middle chair won’t fit properly
Comfy. Great cup holder. 2yr old lives

My 5 1/2 year old loves it. She said it's really comfy. It took her a couple of days to get the hang of strapping herself in properly. However, once my 7 year old son showed her "the trick," she's become a pro. They strap themselves first without the belt positioner, then after the seatbelt has been fastened, they will slide the belt positioner in place and lastly pull the shoulder strap tightly. Great price on Amazon! Highly recommend. One more thing- We removed the headrest from the seats in our Honda Odessey van so that the carseat would sit flat against the chair. My son said it was more comfortable that way!
Very light weight and good height.

The only small complaint I have is the large pads around the head. They limit the kids sight when rear facing, causing him to squirm and be frustrated when he really wants to see something. That being said, he really appreciates how comfortable it is and likes to be in it.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: I loved the sturdiness and softness of it. Quick delivery too.

We have had this carseat for about a year and haven't had any problems with it.  My favorite feature is the ease in which you can take out and quickly put back in the car.  My only complaint is the strap to tighten, it can be tough and awkward to pull and tighten.

This caddy is lightweight and easy to fold. The wheels ride really smoothly. BUT, there's something off about the way our carseat -- the Cosco Scenera -- fits on the platform. It's hard to get it to stay attached, and it often wobbles or comes off when we go around corners (to be clear, my son never rides in the seat while it's on the caddy!). Also, it's hard to attach tightly with the latch straps and then unstrap it quickly to go through security or get on the plane. This might work better with heavier carseats or the type with a closed base. Despite it's flaws, I've been traveling with this caddy for nearly two years and plan to take it on another trip later this month, so I admit that it's easy to use this than to carry even a lightweight carseat.
Son and Daughter in law love the seat for transporting my 18 month granddaughter in while she is riding in the their vehicles.
Love that this booster has LATCH. The only one I will use. I feel more secure that my precious cargo is safe.

It was very easy to switch back and forth between my vehicle and my husbands. That was nice! Easiest car seat to install as far as getting it buckled in... BUT.. I could not get the angle right in my suburban for my daughter. She's 27lbs, so I am supposed to have her level with the ground, according to the line on the car seat itself. She's only 18 months, so I do have her rear-facing. I just cannot get it level with the line. I tried putting a rolled up blanket under the front to put her at the right angle, but how safe is that really? And I cannot get it where it does not move. I live out in the country. There's gravel roads and curves. I swear, her car seat slides around. It's barely noticeable, but it makes me nervous! In my husband's Nissan Sentra, it works great!! Seriously, it's great! It fits well. It doesn't slide around. Perfect angle! My mom's Odyssey, same thing! But in my Chevy Suburban, it just does not seem to work. I don't know if it's because the seats are leather or the angle of the seat.. I don't know. It just doesn't work. My husband's Nissan and my mom's Odyssey both have cloth seats too if that helps anyone to decide to buy. Overall, it's a great car seat. Don't let this deter you from buying it! It's easy to clean, easy to adjust, and I like that when she falls asleep, her head doesn't just fall forward or flop over to the side. It looks very comfortable for her. We did keep this car seat for my husband's car, and my mom has one as well. They both love it and use it often. For my suburban, I did end up buying a different one though. Hope this helps someone!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Amazing and easily portable. My 9yr old does not mind sitting on it and we like how it fits between his brother and his sister. Easy to inflate and I like how high it's rated. Would definitely purchase again and probably will when my daughter gets older

My LO is still under a year so my reviews for leg room can’t really be evaluated until later but we’ve been really happy so far.  I have to take it in/out daily for carpool and it very easy to install/uninstall. It’s very easy to adjust the height. Much more user friendly than my Diono in my other vehicle. Time will tell on leg room.
Great price on well researched booster seat!
Love easy assessable for chiy
In my opinion this Graco highback is a Excellent product, easy to use and very save for children. Nice colors.

I did extensive research online prior to purchasing a booster seat for my daughter. The graco affix was one of the few that tethered into the seat, for me this was a huge factor that I wanted. I didn’t want the seat to be able to move around easily and with this it does not. The seat stays right into place without any play. I can see where people can complain about the headrest falling but I’m curious as to how many people leave the car seat strap in the holder constantly to strap in. I remove mine from the holder, buckle in then place the strap back into the holder that keeps it in place on the child’s chest. Prevents constant tugging on the back booster
This is a big car seat but very good for the price.  Love it
Wonderful car seat. Love the quick latch system, very easy to install. My son is comfortable. I would purchase again.

I spent hours looking for the right car seat, and I believe I made the right choice!
The top clip does have a bit of a learning curve, which makes other people using the car seat hard...but I love it.
My favorite feature though is how the clip between the legs and the arm straps stay up making putting your child in the car seat so much easier. You don’t realize how convenient it is till you go to use a different car seat.
Overall I’m so pleased with this product.
good item for the price

After purchasing this seat nearly two years ago for my daughter, we're so excited to be using it this fall for baby #2. It has held up so well and has been on 8 plane rides, several cars and 4 states over those couple years. Some installs have been tricky but once you realize it needs a rolled up towel or pool noodle in some cars it works great! Seats that sit at a recline work best. If you have a car that back seats are more of a 90 degree angle you may want to try installing before you buy (if you can or be willing to try and return).
The best part about this seat? My TALL 2.5 year old still fits rear facing in it! Its not our main seat but I really didn't expect her to be able to stay in it this long in our sitter's car. Wow!

Here are the pros:
-Fits rearfacing on even small planes with arm rests up. Approved for flight and is EASY and quick to install on a plane.
-Light enough to carry around with luggage on trips.
-Rear facing to 2 years and beyond.
-Comfy-my daughter loves this seat.
-Comes in so many fun colors, easy to clean.
-Mesh stays cool even in the hottest of cars on steamy summer days.

Cons:
-Tricky to install in some cars. Use youtube to figure out why its not fitting well in your car, when in doubt, get a pool noodle.
-Eventually your child will outgrow it. Darn it! ;)
It fit perfectly for new born.
Arrived late
Very hard to tighten starps. Does not reclin once secured in back of car in forward position.
Love this, my son can grow with it. Super easy to install with easy clips. Easy to wash
I gave the car seat a 4 star review because when I got it the manufacture date was already a year and a few months out. I would've prefer one much closer to the date I actually ordered it.

I like the car seat but the hood to keep sun away from the babies face tore within 2 weeks and keeps coming apart from the inside making it a hazard for babies because the plastic comes out of the material dangles in front the babies face which can poke their eyes. It is very easy to assemble and is light weight. I also like that it has a good amount of cushion compared to other carseats. It also has side protection for baby's head. In general I like the car seat but could definitely be made better and less hazardous.

I know this car seat is very safe and that's why I never returned it but it is next to impossible to buckle my child in.  You have to twist the latch in a way that is very hard to do.  My mom has a very hard time when she watches the kids.  I guess they have to be somewhat hard to undo or else toddlers would unbuckle themselves but this one is extra hard to unbuckle.

My son loves this car seat!  It's comfy and durable. We've had this seat for 6 months and I can honestly say my son has destroyed everything he own except for this. I bought two since it's heavy and not the easiest to move back and forth multiple times.

I like the price and I like the car seat. It was easy to install and can be used for rear facing and then front facing. I do think the straps get twisted a bit but I usually just take it out and redo them. It’s simple to do. It was a great price and exceeded expectations
Easy to install

Overall I like the seat but wish the warranty covered parts and mechanisms to match the expected lifespan of the product.

The sure latch connects and disconnects quickly and easily and ratchets down automatically when I press into the seat. Sometimes you have to adjust the angle of the latches for a tight fit but overall it’s much easier than our other seats. The kids seem comfortable and happy in these seats, even on 10+ hour car drives.

Over the course of the past 5 years we’ve had these seats, we’ve dealt with a couple of recalls. One of which I called about prior to the official recall release and was told that since the seat was out of warranty, it wouldn’t be covered or fixed. This specific issue was related to the locking mechanism that keeps the seat straps tightened down on the child and it was malfunctioning and completely unsafe for use. Eventually they issued a recall and it was fixed but we were unable to use the seat for nearly a year.

The lifespan of this item is longer than many other car seats, however the warranty does not coincide with the lifespan. Meaning, you will have issues with parts and mechanisms, as well as fabric tearing and peeling and it won’t be covered by the manufacturer.
It's easy to install.
Kids love it and even though one of them is old enough to ride with just a seat booster, it really helps to have a back and sides especially when they fall asleep on longer car rides.

I have this carseat for my 1 yr old and 2 yr old both of which still use it rear facing. My only complaint was the buckle as it pinched their legs when I would fasten their belts and I have read other ppl had the same problem. NOTE I saw a review where someone said there is a way to adjust the buckle UNDER the seat. You will need to take the seat out to adjust it there but it solves the problem of leg pinching. I tried it and both my boys are much better and no issues buckling the belt. I am mainly writing this review in hopes other parents having the same issue will see this and it will help them!

Update-I originally thought you had to completely remove the car seat to adjust the buckle underneath but I was able to reach it and move it without removing the seat.
Hard to install initially but very safe

Very well made. Very sturdy and looks safe for our baby.
Love the foot rest.

We have been using this car seat for my son for almost a year now.  He's a bit on the small side so this car seat was perfect for him as a front-facing car seat.  We had no problems with the transition from rear-facing to front-facing.  He fits snuggly into the seat and when he falls asleep his head never flops down.  My older son has a different front-facing car seat and every single time he fell asleep his head would flop down uncomfortably.  I have also heard that Britax makes very reliable and safe car seats.  I would definitely recommend this to any parent.
Ty

Overall a great carseat. I have this exact one in different colors for both of my kids in multiple vehicles. Once I figured out how to install it, it was easy but it took watching a youtube video on how too. Its a little bulky but overall a good investment. I will say it takes up quite a bit of space but that personally doesn't bother me. My kids seem to be comfortable in them and I know they are safe when in the car. The cushon is nice and thick and has options to adjust how far back you want them to lean depending on age and milestones. Front facing is easy to adjust and anchors easily to the car.

We love the seat! I 100% recommend buying!! My son was almost 9mo. Old and hated his infant seat. He constantly tried sitting up in it, it was a nightmare going anywhere! Bought this and he loves going places! Falls asleep in it almost every time or is content looking out the window! (I use it front facing) also it feels very safe!! I love the reclining feature, and his head doesn’t fall front as it is nice and supported. Also love the cup holders, perfect for his sippy cup or toys. The only thing some people might not like is it’s pretty heavy. To me it’s worth it!
We have had this seat for over a year now and it still looks great.  My son is 2 1/2 and still fits comfortably rear facing in this seat.  Britax is always a good buy in my opinion.

We love this car seat. I wasn't sure if the zebra pattern would get old over time. It totally hasn't. Very easy to put my son in and out even though he is still rear facing. Straps are much improved from the slightly older model, which we also bought accidentally. Very happy with our purchase, worth the money!
This is a sturdy, safe, easy to use, easy to clean booster seat.  Works fine, lasts long, reasonable price.

Absolutely love this car seat. Love the different positions available. Love that you can use from infancy and up.

Only issues:
Don’t use the magnetic pins/ hands that hold the seat belt clips. It ripped the fabric.
The cup holders are a little shallow and my child’s cups constantly fall out of it.

Still a great seat!!
My son is just over 9 months old and has been not a happy camper with his other car seat....sat him in this and he absolutely LOVES it !

I love this car seat so much that I bought another one for my nephew. This car seat is a little complex, but once you get the hang of it, you'll love its functionality. My daughter cries in every car seat except this one. Maybe because its up high enough for her to see out of the windows, or maybe because of comfort. I don't know, but I know that my nephew had the same reaction when we switched him from his old car seat to this one. I highly recommend it.
lightweight and cute. my daughter has no complaints about it either.
Super Easy to install
Compact and easy to use!
Very nice
This car seat is too heavy. It makes it hard to transfer from one car to the other. I can't return the item since I ordered it in July and did not open the box until now to find out it's too heavy.

I bought this as a Open Box through Amazon Warehouse and it was new, not like new, but new. It did not look like it had ever been out of the box.  This was my second purchase of the Graco Nautilus 3-in-1 Car Seat.  I'm working on replacing the car seat for my 3-year-old great-niece in three different cars. I was very impressed at all the features of this seat and I am glad that the 5-pt harness goes up to 65 lbs as I would like her in in a 5-pt harness as long as possible since it is the safest configuration. This seat has a little bit of recline adjustment which made it easier to transition her from a regular car seat.  The connecter between her legs has a longer strap than all the other seats we have used which makes it easier to get her buckled in and it is comfortably situated so that she has room to grow. I can release the chest buckle and the lap buckle single handed - this feature is a definite PLUS. The only feature that is missing on this seat is a second cup holder but the two side pockets (under the arm rests) almost make up for that.  She is quite tall for her age and I like the extendable head rest so that the seat can grow with her.  It will be quite a long time before we will be forced to convert to backless booster.
We like this car seat, but we’re disappointed to find out if you have to have 3 in a row, the slim fit lx is a lot slimmer and easier to use for that.
This seat is compact and fits our small 16 month old very good with out taking up the whole back seat. If your child large in size you may not like this seat. Made in the USA is also a plus.
This is one of the best baby seats out there!
Love this car seat. I’m a first time mom and all the directions were very easy to understand. It was a breeze to instal. My baby girl loves it.
This seat is plush and comfortable. The material is nice. My biggest issue is the seat belt gets stuck in the guide and doesn't retract. It even got stuck in my van door when I opened it.
large seat, especially if you are facing rear, forward facing still large will be hard to fit in a small car but suv and midsize should be fine.
i hate the recalls

We transitioned from the newborn rear facing to this product (we use it forward facing). The best part about this car seat is that baby's head does not lean forward if he falls asleep. We did remove the extra headrest padding for this reason. Baby has a lot of room in the seat. We are very happy with this purchase.
Love it!!

WOW! I’m really surprised at the quality in this seat! The material is high quality, it’s SUPER heavy compared to my Evenflo and Chicco seats I currently have. The padding is thicker, I was a little hesitant with changing up brands but this seat has a 10 year life span, recommended by a friend, reviews were great, and the price was right. I’m so glad I went with it! The pictures do not do it justice, we bought two, one for our 1 year old who is still rear facing and 1 for our soon to be 5 year old who is now forward facing. I would have to say these are better overall compared to the other brands we have checked out in stores.
Great idea. While it lasted it was nice, but broke too easily. Had 2 of these, both broke. No customer support from what I can tell.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Great travel booster. Make sure you strap in correctly and kiddo can move around more than in regular booster so make sure the can sit forward and still.

I bought the black and pink version at walmart when my daughter was about 2.  It is a great seat my 3 year old 39lb 40-41in just turn forward facing at about 3.5 years.  She was so comfortable rear facing.  Forward facing took some getting used to.  She liked forward facing in this seat versus our complete air more leg support, recline options.  Ok so I love and recommend this seat hands down or the new graco seat that last rf, ff and booster.  That said I want to warn every time you clean your seat check the foam in head rest both mine and a cpst's friend both have come undone.  Refund process through graco was easy but with backlog from buckle recall took over a month.  Overall I would buy anothet graco hands down.
Awesome product ! The price was great

I was reluctant at first to spend more on a carseat but after reading reviews and safety ratings, I took the plunge. I have NO regrets. This seat is worth every penny. From first observations I was impressed with the sturdiness of it compared to our previous seat. I feel very safe with my daughter in it. Also the higher weight limit will keep her safe for several years.
Love this booster

I could not get a tight enough fit rear-facing with the belt or latch. Very cheaply made and unsafe. I forked over the money for the Graco Extend2fit. It fit like a glove. This product was a waste of my time.
Product was as expected arrived a day early in great condition. Grandson loves it.

I have a Ford Edge and it fits perfectly in the back seat.  When it's time to put the foot extention out I think it will be snug.  We have it on the lowest reclining setting possible for rear facing.  If we had it on the highest it would be a little snug fitting.  It is VERY easy to adjust and install.  I ended up buying another one.
Very nice seat for the money.
Very nice convertible car seat.  Very good padding.  Feels like a super expensive carseat but it is fairly affordable.  Easy to install too!
Love it
The parts that supposed to hold the orange part (the leg) got broken since the product can move left and right but the plastic is not strong to hold the moving leg... I can't use this anymore...
Super easy to install — just set in the seat — and easy adjustments for child’s height. My girls seem comfortable even on longer rides.
Buen producto, cumplió con las expectativas
A bit too wide for a Prius. 8 yr old has difficulty using.

I love This car seat and so does my child!!
So incredibly easy to install!! The latch system is awesome and gets seat very snug to the seat.
Very nice car seat!
Very easy to install. We ordered 3 and use them in all of our cars. It is slim and fits well.
Amazing product
Like the easy way the seat converts as granddaughter grows. Will not need another carseat.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: When my daughter was pretty small it worked great.  Made it easy to keep her with me and move through the airport.  Easy to use and install - works well.

This is the worst product I own by Graco and I have owned multiple strollers, pack and play, swing, carseats galore: snug ride, safe seat 1, safe seat 2, smart seat, nautilus and backless booster. This seat feels like lightweight junk and the quality of a doll seat. Mind you the highback falls, the kids have trouble raising it back up and more. I will not buy this seat again and am replacing its use but originally sought it based on size and wanting to fit a third car seat on the same row.

I bought this at Walmart for $119. It's pretty good. Solid construction and easy to get in and out of the car. But the ratchet dials for tightening the straps is hard to use. On the door side the ratchet is too close to the seat and I can't get a grip on it to turn it without rubbing my hand against the seat and that hurts after a few turns. The dial on the other side is easier to reach but I have to reach all the way across the seat from the other side to turn it. It's also hard to turn sometimes. If you have any kind of arthritis or issues with hand strength this may be difficult for you to use. When it works though it works good.

works great.  east for my 5 year old to buckle himself.  the arm rests and cup holders are perfectly placed and easy to use.  the only downsize is the headrest.  while my 5 yr old hasn't complained, it doesn't look like he has much support while sleeping in it on long rides.
Easy to use
Great car seat but the ones we received were almost a year old already, pretty disappointing seeing as they expire after a certain time.
So far looks good!
As expected. Easy to assemble. Happy with my purchase!

Love this car seat. My grandson is 4 1/2 and still using this. So well made. Adjusts easy. The only thing I will say on the negative side is overtime sometimes the strap To tighten it’s a little hard to pull
So soft and comfortable and affordable too! We got 2 one for my car and one for my husband's. I love that i won't have to buy nothing else.
SO far so good. Easy to put in the car and it seems like the baby is quite comfortable in it. Great look too!

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: This thing is a lain in the butt. We have had so much trouble fumbling with it in the airport and it’s probably something you could make on your own. After taking it on several trips including international we will be purchasing something else.

I have to admit that I wanted to love this car seat since we have the old Britax Marathon and loved it.  However, was disappointed to find out that the bottom seat belt strap (the one that comes up from the bottom and goes in between my daughter's legs) was too short.  It's much shorter than on the other two Britax ClickTight car seats and the hard plastic pieces dig into my daughter's inner thighs and hurt her.  Even with the cushion that comes with the car seat. Since it's so short, it also makes it difficult for me to put on and take off the seat belts.  I tried to use this for a week but do not think it will work for us. I am returning it and getting the Advocate instead since that bottom strap is longer.  I went and compared them at Buy Buy Baby. Love everything else about the car seat but I just don't understand why that bottom strap is so short and you can't even extend it.
My done love his new big boy seat. It has an anchor system for safety

With four kids close in age, I knew we needed to get some of these for our van. previously using Graco extend2fit, no problems, but they take up more room of course. But for example, the extend2fits have headrests and at least when ff their heads would still dangle down if they fell asleep. My kids have slept ff in this seat many times and as long as properly buckled they're okay and don't seem put off by not having headrests. So I have two of these in the 3rd row of a Toyota sienna 2005, along with a Chicco myfit harness and booster for my almost 5yo, all fit great with each other. For reference, my 4.5y has a sitting height (shoulder to floor) of about 15in, he would still fit in this seat but probably not for long. 3y has a sitting height of about 14in, she still has some inches left before outgrowing this seat. I did a ton of research before buying this seat and am really regretting the decision. I have no idea how this seat has such a high review unless our family just has really bad luck. Either we happen to have two defective units or two cars that don't work well at all with this seat. These were installed rear facing in a 2004 Jeep Liberty and a 2003 Honda Accord. Here are the issues we have:

-Installation was a nightmare - I can't understand how people say how easy it is. There are two straps to tighten - one on each side. The first strap (you pull them sequentially) does not tighten at all if it is clipped to the latch connector. When you go to tighten the 2nd strap, it pulls all the way and is still too loose. We finally got it tight enough by pre-tightening strap 1, turning the seat sideways and having someone lean on it and then clicking the latch buckle in. This made it tight enough to pull strap 2 enough to minimize movement, but required 2 people and was a major pain.

-Positions are somewhat a gimmick. We thought it would be great to be able to let our son sit up or lay down. No such luck. In the accord, only one setting falls within the bubble level. In the Jeep, only 2 settings are accessible.

-The tighten/release strap and button are jammed up against the seat. We have to leave the seat fully reclined to be able to access the release button for the straps. My wife complains because she has to stick her hand between the seat and carseat to release the strap every day.

-The buckles are a pain. They always get caught under my son and catch on his clothing. Somehow the buckles get flipped every couple of days, but are a pain to flip back around. My wife works in some pretty sketchy areas and is terrified by the amount of time it takes to get our son in and out of the seat.

I don't know if we have two defective carseats, or if we have two incompatible cars, but these seats have been nothing but trouble. I wish I would've read about these problems before hand and saved them money.

Update 03/2015:

We had bought these in advance and it was too late to return them by the time we installed. We've been using them now for months and none of the issues have gotten any better - some have gotten worse:

-Tightening - We have to brace ourselves on the door frame of the car and pull as hard as possible. There is a loud screeching sound when we tighten them. This is from two different seats bought from different retailers. I tried tightening before doing the middle clip as some suggested and noticed no difference.
-Installation - We've had to take them out and put them back in a few times now. Same problem - strap 1 cannot be tightened enough. Strap 2 maxes out and the seat is still loose. We're still having to pre-tighten strap 1 and use 2 people to get it tight enough. More people have tried thinking we were crazy and all have had the same problem.
-Recline - still not usable. Like I said, this was one of the factors that made me choose this seat, but it cannot be used.
-Clips flipping - still a problem. About 1 in 10 times pulling my son out of the seat flips the clips. They flip backwards easily, but are a pain to flip back. It's a ton of fun when this happens when it's storming outside. Leave it flipped you say? Nope - no chance of tightening with it flipped!
-Support - Support was non-existent. They required all sorts of documentation (thanks for making me uninstall the seats for the serial number!) to even talk to me and were no help.

Right now I'm hoping forward facing is better - I feel terrible being tempted to flip to forward facing and decrease safety to make our carseat usable.

Update 10/15:

We've now turned the seats forward facing. You can tell that they were designed for this and that rear facing was added in hindsight. Strap management is still a pain - if I forget to prep the seat in advance (completely loosen the straps and hang them over the sides) they get caught under my son. Trying to fish them out has about a 50% chance of flipping the clip backwards. Flipping it back takes forever - especially with a restless toddler squirming. We no longer have tightening issues, and the tightening strap is no longer jammed up against the seat.

If this were only sold as a forward facing seat, I would rate it a 3. Because it is advertised as convertible, I maintain my one star review. There were just too many safety concerns to be worth it. Find something else that will tighten to the car and child tightly enough. There are a ton of reviews that mention the tightening problem, but Chicco doesn't want to acknowledge it.

I would not use this as an everyday seat, but it is good for travel when luggage on a plane can be an issue.

Review: We used this when we went to Florida and rode in an Uber vs. renting a car.  Easy to inflate and deflate - I carried a backpack so it fit nicely in that when deflated. Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: This worked fairly well for a recent trip. We tested it out a bit before we went and quickly realized that it will slide around on cloth seats (as others had mentioned in their reviews). I took a piece of that non-slip rubberized cloth often used for lining kitchen drawers and cabinets, etc., and it helped a bit. This seat is much smaller than a conventional booster seat, but still not really small. My personal item for carrying on-board flights is a great, small Rick Stevens knapsack (sadly, appears to have been discontinued! :-( ), and this booster mostly fills that up. At times, the shoulder strap holding strap gets out of position, basically getting in my son's armpit or behind his head. But. all in all, we felt safer and were able to avoid the highway robbery of renting from the car rental agency (basically, the same cost as this seat!).
Wonderful uni-sex carrier. I highly recommend.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Rolls up nice and compact so it's one less car seat to take when we fly. Use it for traveling and so quick and easy to install.

I read so many reviews on this site and on others that said this seat did not come with all of the extra support cushions or a cup holder. There is a Sport version of this seat and that one is not supposed to come with the extras, thats why its cheaper. This exact product does come with everything shown in the picture plus a detachable cup holder, which is all listed in the product description. Okay, now that I have covered what you get let me just say that I love this seat! It is a great size, was easy to install and fits my 6 month old perfectly now and will adapt perfectly for him as he grows. So glad I went with this seat and not a more expensive one! BTW I got mine from Overstock for the same price, but they had free shipping.

I got this for my 16 month old after deciding we wanted smaller car seats for my Chevy Malibu. Installation with LATCH was impossible as we couldn’t find an angle to tighten the seat down, so we went with the seatbelt installation. While I sat in the seat, my husband tightened it down. It doesn’t move at all on the belt path + feels very secure. It came with 2 infant inserts, a buckle cover + 2 sleeve-like covers for the shoulder pieces. We couldn’t use the inserts due to the age of our son but they felt comfortable. I ended up removing the buckle cover because it kept getting in the way of me buckling my son. It’s a good idea, but poorly executed. The shoulder belt covers are amazing. They stop the belts from rubbing on my little one’s neck + also make pinching him with the belt clip impossible. The seat itself has a memory foam pad for underneath my baby’s butt + it is so cushy! He normally cries right away with other car seats but he seemed more comfortable in this one. My only issue is how far forward my seat has to go for it to not be leaning against the car seat. I’m 5’8 + I’m sitting up uncomfortably STRAIGHT to drive now…. But at least my little one is happier, comfortable + safe.

I searched for weeks for a car seat that was safe, comfortable and affordable. I was happy to find this seat! Putting it together and installing was a breeze. I love how the seat grows WITH my son not my son growing out of it quickly. In the beginning the belts were hard to push into the bottom strap but with use it is easier. We transfer this seat between cars easily as well.

We bought this for our granddaughter. We can easily move it to both of our cars. I have a small SUV & she still rides backwards. Her legs seem a little  squished because of the back seat is limited. No fault of the car seat. My back seats don’t move. When she starts riding forward this car seat will grow with her. I also like the side cup holders fold in. Very well made & easy to clean. A big plus is it’s not really wide so the dog has his space too. We bought a two pack of seat protectors. Pop the seat in & go.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review:
Unless you have a very sturdy carry-on (and I mean VERY sturdy), this item will ruin your luggage.
The idea is good, but car seats with kids on them tend to be quite heavy, and our 80$ samsonite carry-on was almost ruined after using this for a couple of hours. The wheels buckled outwards because of the weight added, and even after unstrapping them, it wouldn't run as smooth anymore. I guess luggage are designed to withstand a certain load in them, and adding that much unbalanced weight can make them fail, which is what ended up happening.
It is also expensive for what it is. You can mimic the same behaviour by just getting a ring, and strapping the car seat hooks on it (2 sides, and top hooks used to lock the car seat in position in the car).
I give it 2 stars for the idea. It might work to just move your car seat around and not have to carry it, but definitely not with a toddler in it (my daughter was only 1 when we tried this).

After spending countless hours researching convertible car seats we chose this one for our 11 month old. We had the Peg Perego Viaggio SIP30-30 for his first "year". He never seemed to like that car seat. He cried most times he was in it. He has a long,thin build and seems very happy and comfortable now in this new seat. I believe it's because this seat sits up higher(so he can see more) and is wider/more roomy. The safety ratings for this seat are why we purchased it after reviewing Peg Perego convertible, Recaro, Diono and other Britax models. While Diono is also a very safe seat, its much taller back may not have fit as well in rear facing position in our car. The installation was not hard at all and if you go to Britax web sight you can watch videos to help make sure you are doing it correctly. Also, the Advocate is in its own league with the "true side impact protection" and "click and safe" harness indicator.

Love the soft feel of every surface, and the boys love it, too! I currently have two other Graco car seats for them (will be moving those to dad's car in order to ditch our cheaper Safety1st seats that we don't like at all!) that we like just fine, but love the improvements of these newer models.
