Long post alert as I felt like posting some useful installation steps for front facing seating position as it is missing in manual.

First of all, the seat looks comfortable and secure. Good padding everywhere which ensures kid’s protection. Amazon delivery was quick and efficient as always. Now I will move on to the tricky part of the installation and will add some pics for other people benefits. Feel free to click the “Helpful” button so that others may also benefit from these steps missing in the crappy manual.

Now you will notice that there are 2 lower anchors straps present at bottom of seat which will come hooked in rear facing position out of the box. One has to move these anchor straps to front facing seating which is tricky. To do this, first press the buttons on the anchor hooks and slide both of them out. Then open the cushion at bottom section by opening the hooks and buttons inside. Pull out both anchor hooks from either sides and hold it against the red rod inside. Slide it up the red rod to the label where it says “Forward facing anchor strap here”. After you have done this, pull the anchor hooks out from either side of marked section. Refer images for additional info. Do ensure that this belt is straight and not crumbled up inside. Put the seat cover and padding back in original place. After you have completed these steps, the booster is ready to be anchored. In case you are not aware where to anchor these hooks in your car seat, check your car manual or just search online to find the exact location. Hook the anchors up in desired position and pull the tab by pressing the button to tighten and secure. This strap should not be loose in any case. Once you have tightened it properly, you will realize that the booster seat is firmly secured and will not slide. Finally anchor the tethered belt located at back of the booster to rear car anchor. Each car will have the anchor hooks placed at different location, so check car manual or search online again. In my CRV, this anchor hook was present in car trunk top side hidden by a cover.

Once you have successfully completed the steps to anchor the hooks in all three positions, adjust the position of the harness buckle. There are 3 levels to pass the harness buckle so ensure that the harness buckle at bottom passes through the same position in cushion as it is inside for maximum comfortable sitting of your child. You will notice that if the harness buckle passes through position 2 inside but then passes from position 3 in the cushion, the cushion or padding crumbles up. Adjust the booster height as desired and check whether the level indicator on left side of booster is in blue region. All set and you are good to go. Thanks for reading till end of this long post and I wish you and your family a happy and safe driving experience.

Review: Disappointed this didn’t anchor to car seat like other Chico seats.  Wouldn’t have bought it if I had known
100% compatible with the 2013 Quinny Buzz Extra stroller. Just click and it's good to go. No need to buy separate pieces.

Love these seats. We have two and my only complaint is that it's hard to tighten with the kid is forward facing. Maybe it is the same on other brands but it is pretty tough to get these snug. Whenever I take the kids out of the car when someone else like Grandma or Grandpa put them in the straps are loose even though they swear they tighten them. I find if I pull out on the chest strap to take in the slack around the legs and then pull up on tensioning strap with two hands I can get it snug. It just doesn't seem to go as easy as it should. When the kid is rear facing you can reach behind the seat easily to take in the slack and then tighten the tensioning strap with the other hand.
I ordered 2 of these seats for my boys ages 5 & 7. They are perfect!
Great seat for my daughters. Older daughter moved from rear facing seat to this and now onto a booster only so my youngest could move into this seat. Just bought a 2nd for my wife's vehicle.

My 4 year old is pretty tall and is still rear facing because of rhe extra leg room this seat provides. Its also very comfortable and easy to clip in. The max limits for rear and forward facing are higher than most.

This is a wonderful car seat. My son is 10 months old, 32 lbs ad 31 inches long and doesn't mind at all being in his seat. Very comfortable,no sweating, easy to adjust for his size. From research there is no fire retardant chemical applied (if worried about SIDS). The head protection doesn't limit his view around him. I also was looking at Graco seats, and after having the one for his infant seat he did not enjoy being in the seat, and was always soaking in sweat, this was a major concern of mine. Peg Pergo car seat has made taveling so much easier and creates more room in the vehicle. It was expensive but, I don't need another one until a booster seat is needed. I only gave 4 stars because of the seat angle in my vehicle when buckled in, I placed a blanket to adjust becacuse of how my back seat is for rear facing. There is no level bubble just a line to make sure seat is at the right leveling, not a big deal to me.

cushion is a bit slim, but my kids don't mind at all. super lightweight. durable (taken on a few flights without any damage).

cupholders on the side are a nice touch. they are a bit hard for the kids to pull out though.

detachable cover for washing.

strongly recommend these boosters if you want a lightweight option. along these lines though the big uprights are better cushion and protection perhaps, but when they get to 5+ years old, they start wanting to go on playdates and riding other parent's cars. these have been a godsend in taking in/out of cars frequently. the seatbelt aligns very well into these and my kids can buckle themselves now. Besides the biggest factor for safety is how safely you drive and how big your car is in comparison to the other assuming everyone is buckled in.

Note as well on the rare occasion my kids fall asleep in the car they do flop around more in these than the uprights as there isn't a side for them to lean against. I just deal with it as they don't do it often but if you road trip a lot maybe something to consider.

Love this booster with Dino’s all over. Well made, we bought a second one after the first for our other car. Two hidden cup holders which we didn’t even realize at first. Great purchase. The arm pads don’t really stay on, but it doesn’t matter - we use them without.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: We recently used this with my 26 month old son on his Britax Marathon.  It was so simple.  With my husband's help, we were able to attach it to the carry-on while my son remained sleeping in his seat.  My son is a real busy body and hates strollers, so I worried that he would not want to sit in it during our layover after being stuck in a plane for 4 hours, but he loved it.  He actually couldn't wait to sit in it and be wheeled through the airport.  Once we got to our final destination, he actually threw a fit because we would not take the seat out of the car and wheel him inside the house.

In theory, this would be a good product...if it actually stayed aired up. We had to blow it up every time we stopped. It had a slow leak after the first day of use. Very disappointing. Would be a great product if it didn't leak.  Ended up returning.
This is a great carseat. My grandson is so comfortable in it. And very light in weight.
Great value and works great !!!

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: I bought these for my twins and wow what a workhorse of a chair. Folds down for easy transport. Its not super duper lightweight but if it was, the chair would no be so sturdy. I havent had any issues with any parts coming loose or breaking. I either spray them down in the backyard or put them in the dishwasher for a deep clean.

I can fit 3 car seats across the back of my surburban with these, but its very difficult to attach the seat belt when they are crowded together. Unfortunately, my other car seat which have there own built in straps are easier for the kids to close, but they were too wide to fit 3 across so we just end up struggling to put the car seat straps into there holders ourselves since the kids find it too difficult to do when the car seats are so close together. Works fine when we only have to use 2 car seats in the back instead of three, and then the kids can fasten themselves in.

im a father. i have my son every other sundasy, for now. i can tell you how to wire up a chemical plant, but car seats..... they tricky son! this one was easy to install and understand. personally thank you to the designers.
It arrived on time at a great price. It works. My wife loves the safety rating, and my boys love sitting in it.
My son loves that his feet no longer hang making his time in the car more comfortable. My only problem is that the button to flip the foot support down are so hard to do. I can barely make them work.
Just what we needed.  A very quality product.
Very complicated installation process. Belts are not well design as 18 months old kids can remove them without help from adults.

This seat has one of the best safety ratings and is overall good quality.  The spitfire design is fun and the fabric itself is good quality.  I did purchase a Graco booster pad as well to give it a little more cushion.  But, from what I've seen this booster doesn't have any less padding than most other boosters on the market

This car seat feels very sturdy, safe and very heavy.
One complaint would be that it's difficult to remove the base from my tiny car and my other complaint would be that it takes up so much room in my Fiesta that the front passenger seat is almost unusable.
We had a second baby and decided to go with a more compact car seat that still felt well built and safe. We have the new car seat behind the driver seat so the driver isn't crushed up against the steering wheel and this car seat is behind the passenger seat which gives me just enough room to slide in sideways and leaves my knees scraping on the glove box, I'm about 5'4".
I'm sure this car seat would be perfect if my car wasn't compact.
Perfect for my superhero!

No issues with this car seat. It looks so comfy and such good quality. The cup holders are nice. the recline is nice too. I can still fold down the seat of my suv with this being installed because it’s not as bulky as others.
The cup holder do s not stay on at all. I was so disappointed. We have now lost the cup holder and can't use it.

This car seat was easy to install.  I love the harness clips and how easy they were to clip under the seat.  We took this to Florida and was super easy to travel with as well.  Most of our other boosters would come apart and took forever to clip the back on.

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review:
I couldn’t decide on a convertible car seat that I wanted for my son to grow into. I wanted something that was built to last for many years despite “destruction” caused by use and children. After months and months of researching, I decided to stick with Chicco which is also the brand of our infant car seat. For some reason, I couldn’t stop looking at this convertible car seat! It has everything I wanted regarding safety features and looks.

Pros: Leg room. Chest buckle is protected against touching the skin by the “extended” cushioned shoulder straps. Breathable mesh fabric for baby’s back. Zip off pad for easy cleaning!

Cons: Push-release button is very hard to access because it’s hidden by the fabric. I always struggle to maneuver my finger under the fabric to loosen the straps when taking my son out of the seat. If this was more easily accessible, I’d rate this all 5 stars. That’s my only hold back!
Very impressed with this car seat. I have ordered a second for when I have my grandkids.

I love the fast install with the quick latch. It's my favorite feature. I do not like that there is only one rear facing recline position. It doesn't work that well with the back seat in my car as it's almost too reclined and my kid hates that.
Also, the car seat holds in heat too much for the summer months.
Overall, it's not awful. I just wish it was a little more adjustable. I'd like more than 3 recline settings, or at least one that's in between 2 and 3 for the older rear facing children.

I did a ton of research and this booster had great reviews.  We have  a range rover and the booster is so wide that it is super hard to connect the seat belt.  We tried it in 3 other cars (ours and grand parent's) and same issue.  It also fits my daughter oddly. The waist belt lays across her legs rather than near her waist. I'm just not confident that it would hold her in place if we were in an accident. I re-read how to use it and looked at videos to make sure we are buckling it right and I believe we are correct.  Just bummed by it.
Over all a great car seat. It arrived on time, has plenty of leg room, and super easy to install!

I am a 68 year old grandmother who has been picking up my grandson from daycare every day since he was 2 months old.  I have arthritis in my shoulders and back, and have had both hips replaced due to arthritis.  We started out with the Doona car seat/stroller which made getting the child in and out of the car easy.  However as he got past age one, the weight became an issue for me.  I switched to a regular car seat.  Within a few weeks of twisting to get him in and out of the seat, I was in agony everyday so I splurged on this seat.  It has been a godsend.  It fits into my Subaru Ascent as well as the Doona did.  The seat is just at the right height for me to buckle the toddler in and he has no way to avoid me.  I wish I had one of these for my other grandchildren.  My daughter easily installed it after watching a video.  My grandson appears to be as comfortable as in his earlier seats.  My sole complaint is that the strap which goes between his legs should be longer.  Everytime I place him in the seat, the buckle/strap is under his rear end and I have to lift him to pull it out.  I am not sure what will happen as he gets bigger as I do not want the strap to cut him in a sensitive spot.
Bought this years ago and it has held up so well.  Attractive looking and also so safe.  Love the fact that it grows with my child.  I would definitely purchase again.
Perfect
Easy to put together.  Comfortable and cup holders great.

Its solid, nice looking. But its extremely firm, especially back. The back is like a board covered with only 1 layer of fabric. My daughter refused to seat on it even 10 min. I put some foam rubber between plastic back and the fabric to mitigate this. Probably different styles-colors differ in terms of comfort as i can not believe that Our chair can have 4.8 comfort score. Our color is red and without any extra foam rubber its too firm.

I kept this chair as this is the only chair that does not require to remove headrests in the car to install it. Its a huge advantage for me. I can not remove headrests in my car therefore the options are limited.

The chair is very big that is good. but in my car its hard to fasten a seatbelt as the chair hardly fits in the space. My child used to fasten the belt herself in previous chair but with this one its hardly impossible. Also we can not use a cup holder due to the same space limitation. But most probably its not relevant for bigger cars. And minor :)

Summary:
With the foam rubber addition it’s ok, and it looks great.
Nice
Great safety reviews
Very convenient for traveling or every day use. Easy to set up and inflate, even quicker to deflate. User friendly and very packable
Cheep
Great deal on a quality seat.  My son is happy to finally have cup holders!
For the price this is a great car seat. Easy to install, I used the seat belt instead of the latch system. Also very easy to adjust the straps for a growing baby.
Nice quality.
We like this seat so far will review later more in depth
Loved the color my grandson pick it out easy in and out

I bought this carseat and installed it and it constantly rattles. It is so annoying, do not purchase this Seat. The levers at the top of the seat that adjust the straps are loose and any motion of the car makes a rattling noise. I wish I could return it.

I love this car seat. This is the second one I have bought. I bought one about a year ago and my husband and I would just share it. Well we finally decided to buy another one for his truck. It's very easy to install and take out. Definitely a great purchase ☺️

We’ve had this car seat for about 10 month and love it. We bought a second one for the child grandparents. It’s very easy to install and remove. We also have a britax car seat, which has been 10x more difficult to adjust and remove. Regret spending more money on Britax.  This is So easy that we bought it to another country and easily installed/removed daily on foreign cars.  Adjusting height of chair and reclining position is 100x easier too.  Highly recommend

I'm confounded by the number of 5 stars this car seat received. Did y'all buy a different seat than I did? I spent an hour trying to install the car seat before finally giving up. I couldn't get the LATCH on the Nautilus to, well, latch properly. The problem is that I just can't seem to tighten the strap so that the seat is installed correctly and won't move during transit.  It's a similar problem that I've had with other Graco seats.  There is no way that my kids are using this death trap. This Nautilus is going back as soon as humanly possible so that I can purchase the Britax Frontier instead. I know that the Britax will latch properly within minutes. The most I have ever spent trying to install a Britax seat is five minutes--and that's if I'm having a hard time with it. An hour is way too long--especially considering that I will be removing the seat often so that the grandparents can take the kids in their car.

Did not meet my needs because the Shoulder pads are not allowed after 40 lbs, due to testing showing higher chances of ejection with the slippery pads on. However, without those, it cuts into my daughter's neck. Not cool.

They have another model [Graco Argos 70] (more expensive) that allows the pads up to the harness limit. Ended up with that model and happy.

Edit: the model we ended up with that we like is the [[ASIN:B007F337NM Graco Argos 70 Toddler Car Seat Martin]]

Overall, it's a good seat. I wouldn't recommend against it, however, there are a few shortcomings that I don't love. We purchased this as a second car seat for my husband's car. I have a Ch**** Next*** brand car seat in my car. So, it was interesting to compare the two. Our daughter is 1, and we are converting her from an infant carrier to a car seat, so we still plan to have her rear facing.

Things I don't love about this seat:
- It's hard to install. We used the anchor clips. First of all, the default position for the seat out of the box is front facing, so there's a little bit of up front work to move them to the rear facing position. My husband has a '16 Acura MDX. I'm not sure if it's the way the seats are positioned or what, but neither he nor I could get the seat tight enough. The Ch**** seat in my car is incredibly easy to tighten - I can do it by myself (I have a '15 RDX). This seat was a completely different story. I read online that you can purchase swimming pool noodles, cut them down to carseat width, and use them as a wedge between the carseat and the seat. We ended up needing to wedge about 3 pieces of the noodle in there before it actually fit securely and didn't move more than in inch from side to side. But, we did end up getting it tight.
- The shoulder strap pads are too small. The strap pinches my daughters neck, so we had to buy additional strap pads. Not a huge deal, but just seemed like something I shouldn't have to worry about.
- The cup holders are huge, and make it a little tricky to lift the child into the seat when it's rear facing.

Things I like about this seat:
- It is easier to tighten the straps on the child than the Ch**** car seat.
- The seat pads are very cushy and soft.
- It has cool little pouches to hold the buckles out of the way when you put the child in the seat. This way, you're not constantly having to pull the buckles out from under the child each time you place them into the seat.
- The cover is relatively easy to remove. I figured this out when I had to move the anchor straps to the rear facing position.
- The shoulder straps are easy to move up and down.

I gave this 4 starts because it's over $100 less that the Ch**** carseat that I have in my car, and overall has more pros than cons. However, if you need a carseat that's easy to move from car to car, this might not be it. If this is going to stay in 1 car, I would say it's worth it.

So overall I definitely would recommend this card seat!

Installation: it’s quite a large seat and not exactly lightweight. I installed first using the seatbelt and then I used the car hooks. I felt more secure with the hooks but that’s really just a personal choice and you have the option for both. Because this seat does require tightening of the belts I did have to enlist my husbands help to get it tightened. We’ve used the britax click tight before and that one does all the tightening for you (which is nice) however I feel this one is more padded. Overall took about 10 minutes to install.

Safety: this seat feels very padded and secure. I like that it sits your child up much higher than other car seats we’ve tried. Since it sits up high enough for our daughter to see out the window I feel it has helped with her motion sickness. It also has the slide to unlock harness which is great since we’ve recently started dealing with children unbuckling themselves. They can no longer do that with this seat.

Converting: This is super easy to adjust the height of, just squeeze the handle and pull up, which is similar to the way britax works. I think it’s going to be very easy to transition this with our kids growth.

Cleaning: So far it wipes clean very easily and I haven’t had to take it apart to wash the pads yet but it doesn’t seem like it will be too difficult.

If you found this review helpful please vote accordingly.
The sides got separated after 6 months of use... concern about its safety!!!
The seat is not very soft at all
Delivers what is promised.  Note that the entire assembly is very light....  We'll be using this until my 5 year old is 10 years old.!

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: We bought this because we travel to a different location every 6 weeks. and i have to say this chair is amazing for our son who is 15 months. Such a light weight chair but sturdy chair to hols him while eating. Definitely recommend!!!
I had this seat sent to my dad for when he picked me and my daughter up at the airport. It's easy to install, very pretty and convenient.

Received this item and spent tons of time getting all the strap placement correct. Went to install it rear-facing using the latch straps only to find that one of the latch buckles was sewn on backwards. It was impossible to latch it safely. Attaching it the correct way (like a stapler) would cause the loose strap used to tighten the latch strap down to be underneath rather than on top. This rendered it impossible to tighten the strap to a safe tension. If you wanted to make it to where the loose end was on top so you could actually tighten it, the latch would have to be buckled upside-down and the strap would be twisted (huge no-no). I sent it back and exchanged it for the same brand and model car seat we have already been using. I was just too displeased with the quality control check off that was missed on this particular seat. It makes me nervous about what else may have been missed before it left the factory.
Works great, cleans up good too. For the price you can't beat this deal. Very secure and sturdy for the little ones
Best purchase for travelin with a toddler when flying.

This Baby Jogger car seat is the first car seat of this brand that I have reviewed. It is a substantial seat that reminds me a bit of the Chicco, Maxi Cosi, and Britax seats I have used in the past.

This is the first seat that I have used where the seat can swivel a rear facing child toward the door for easier loading and unloading. I find this feature to be intriguing, but I also suspect that if a recall were to happen on this seat in the future, my best guess would be that this novelty feature will probably be the problem. I see potential for the seat to not fully lock into the rear facing position after being swiveled.

The seat is generously padded and the head rest of the seat is easy to adjust. The shoulder pads on the harness have a grippy material on the interior and the back side of the pads. I don't like the textured material on the back of the seat pads because I see it as an issue during the summer months where a child may be wearing a tank top or sundress. I wouldn't want the grippy material on my baby's skin on a hot day. It is probably the feature that I like the least on this car seat.

Installation for this seat is pretty easy. For the rear facing seat, there is a built in lock off in the base of the seat that allows you to get a secure installation. For forward facing installation, I find it is best if you fully extend the head rest so you have ample room to maneuver the seat belt or LATCH belt through the pathway.

Overall, it's a nice seat. It seems to be very good quality and attention to detail is evident in the design.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: It gives the child a nice lift, level with the table, but the tray is very difficult to take on or off. Now you don't want the child to take the tray off, but when the adults complain they can't get the tray on or off, it is an issue. As a nit pic, the tray is a bit narrow; ok to toss food on, but not hold a plate

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Item came dirty, used and damaged. I thought I was buying a new item
Nice quality and size

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Great price for a good quality seat.

Kids really like this seat. The retention clips to hold the seat in place are also a plus, keeps the seat from moving around when no kid in the seat. Only minor issue is the adjustable height headrest. It is too easy to accidentally lower, if a kid leans or pulls on it when getting in the seat the headrest lowers itself without the red button being depressed. Otherwise it’s a great seat.
Works good and My son loves it! Only downside is covers are a bit tricky to put back on after washing.

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: I love the carseat. Installation is easy, but trying to tighten the straps is so difficult. If I could return it, I would. I have to put all my weight into it and i struggle for a while to get it just 1/2 inch tight.

The Hiccapop UberBoost is the perfect portable car seat for kids about toddler age and up, to about age 10 or 12, depending on your child's size and weight. It's easy to inflate, deploy, and deflate. The carrying bag makes it perfect for travel. We also now use it every day, as our kids are older and don't need more than a booster.

A few years ago, we spend several months researching portable booster seats for travel, with a lot of confusing reviews and advice. After an initial look through US, UK, and European approved models, we were down to a few brands, using the top car seat review websites.

A look at reviews narrowed the choice to the two that we tried, the Mifold and the Hiccapop. While a little bulkier, the Hiccapop is lighter in weight and was our kids' clear preference in terms of comfort. Hiccapop has a great line of products overall and excellent support as well.

You get what you pay for. Strapping the car seat in with a seatbelt through the back of the car seat is trouble. It’s a super tight space and it doesn’t guarantee the car seat will be secure. Without having the car seat anchored from the top, it’ll still tip over on sharp turns. The cup holders also fell out.
Gift for my daughter
I love this car seat, it doesn't move around while my little girl is in it.  And she loves it too.
Should have read more on the product.. Doesn't have straps on the actually car seat and I felt that was unsafe for my 2 yr old.
I don't dislike it at all
We love this car seat!

We've been through so many car seats as a frequently flying family. Living overseas on a temporary assignment has us constantly in the air, and so few seats have tolerated the constant switching of cars, getting tossed into airplanes and onto baggage carousels.

We had a Britax literally disassemble itself after about a year - we found a screw under our floor mat that we traced back to the frame assembly of the seat. Another version Graco still works and is our back-up seat, though like our Maxi-Cosi is very difficult to pull the strap on.

This seat has withstood all of the torture, is perfectly narrow (yet still just as supportive) to fit through the aisle of an airplane - even the regional ones - and the straps are still easy to adjust. Other things to note:
- The seat is still light weight and easy to move and very easy to install
- The anchor system stows nicely and out of the way and doesn't get caught on baggage carousels
- The shoulder pads a a little on the thin side, but they stay in place and don't affect our son. This would be my only complaint
- Living in the desert of the GCC, in the summer months the seat doesn't get burning hot, compared to another Graco seat where the label can be searing.

This is our fifth and last car seat we will need to buy!
I was skeptical, but for travel, there is no comparison. Perfect !! Will take it every time with ease!
We love this carseat.  The installation is straight forward and easy.  Our daughter seems to find the seat comfortable, and she is easy to get in and out of the carseat.
Good, safe seat. Would purchase again, but it is very large and not conducive to small cars and doesn't work well in our Honda Civic.

This car seat does not tighten well for install or securing baby. We’ve been using it for four months and keep trying new adjustments and retightening but doesn’t make my husband or me feel good about leaving our child in it. We’ll be switching to another brand.
My son is so comfortable and I know he is safe. Definitely worth  buying.

As a parent of four, I have purchased many car seats. This one is the best so far. Very sturdy, comfortable car seat. Even as a seasoned parent, it was a bit complicated to figure out at first though. Definitely not the car seat you want if you need to move it frequently. Very heavy. Fits great in the middle of a mid size SUV rear facing. Could not install behind a seat rear facing unless the seat was up uncomfortably close to the dash or steering wheel. With a ten year expiration, definitely worth the money.
im happy with the car seat but it did not come with the  harness pads like it says it does

The seat is great my little one took to it right away but installing it was a pain. I couldn't get the latch strap tight enough and when I did the seat wasn't at the right recline. Hours installing, honestly.
works great
Es excelente producto. Mi hijo tiene otra silla pero esta le gusta mucho mas!

Bought this for my 10month old, because he outgrew his carrier. Was sceptical at first since I bought it last minute as a "lightning deal", but it is absolutely perfect! I have a 2011 Kia Optima and it fits great in the back seat. I should mention I am  5'4 so my seat is about average distance away. My son loves the cup holders to put his toys in and he seams to be very comfortable in it. Haven't taken it on a long distance drive yet, but I don't foresee any problems
It's worth paying that much money..very safe.
We used this brand for our travel system as well and we LOVE this seat it’s very light weight and easy to switch back and forth
Bought 2, easy to use, compact and lightweight for travel!
Love it, but my 5 year old can break out of the belts though.  It is still the best car seats I’ve ever had, which is probably 6 different kinds already.
This is my favorite convertible car seat. I have the same one in grey and purple for my daughter since she was one and it’s fantasic. Very very sturdy.
Very good.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: It fits perfectly on a chair. Has the seatbelt on the waist and crotch so the child can’t get out or slide down. The legs are great for a smaller child. Great quality. We’re really happy with it.

Got another one.  It installs and moves between cars easily, and has good head support/protection.  I like that it relies on the seatbelt, and is adjustable (to a point) in elevating the neck strap to accommodate growth. I personally wait to transition to this till the kids are almost out of being required to be in car seats, and they enjoy the cup holders, elevated seating to see out the window, independence of buckling themselves in (with assistance usually), and headrest for leaning during naps.  Changing cars? Undo belt buckle and move. Too tall? Remove the back and just use the booster bottom itself.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: The tray is hard to put on.  You have to align the holes and press hard.  Takes time to get it on.
By far, our favorite car seat. I have it for my infant and toddler and won’t ever use another one.
This safe car seat was what my son and daughter-in-law picked for us to give them for our first grandchild.  They seemed pleased with it.

We like this carseat, but the cupholder is missing. I hope the seller can see this review, and contact me, so that I can get the cupholder. Otherwise have to return it
...

This is an incredibly impressive car seat that feels much stronger, sturdier and solid than others we have tried (e.g., Maxi-Cosi Pria 85). The ClickTight system is the best I have ever seen -- the seat will not budge in the least -- and it is very easy to use. While it might be heavier that competing products, that's what adds to its safety and awesomeness.

Bought it for 22 month baby. It seems to be comfortable as the baby doesn't complain as with the older seat we had.
Very light easy to buckle up !

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Very nice booster seat. Good quality and solid padding.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: We've used this now for six flights, one of which was to Alaska. It works as advertised, but I would not advise having a toddler sit in the car seat while it is attached to the bag...it makes it heavy and very hard to pull. Other than that, it's pretty convenient and easy to use and store. However, I think that the Go Go Kidz travelmate would be better for me since we do fly a lot and sometimes we want to check all of our bags. With this accessory, we always have to "save" one carry-on so that we can attach the car seat to it.
Very good
My daughter loves it Plus it's something I can use for the next 5 years or so.
Baby stopped getting upset in the car the INSTANT we put her in this seat! Super easy to use, secure, latch system is awesome, adjusts very easily, bonus - pretty colors!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: We needed something to use in a rental car when we travelled for spring break. It worked well for this purpose, but I wouldn't count on it for everyday use. Over the course of the week, we needed to reinflate it two or three times.  My daughter said it was fairly comfortable, though it did slide around a little on the leather seats. It is very convenient to travel with, and doesn't take up much space in your carry-on bag. I would definitely recommend it to a friend for travel.
My little man loves it. I can't move it because it's just too heavy but it seems to be very safe. I love the tilt lever at the front.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: This was perfect for my 18mth old grandson. I like it most because it will grow with him. Lots of easy adjustments to get just the right height! Would buy again!
Awesome!

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Works great and made of quality materials. Actually bought another right away. My daughter loves it.
Exactly what I expected
Very easy to anchor and reanchor as we play musical car seats with our four grandchildren. It is durable for its light weight.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Great product.  Kids just did an 18 hour road trip. No complaints on the seat.

(I'm Roger's partner- the mamma, really.)

While this seat is clearly safe, and I love the microfiber fabric better than the plasticky alternatives, I'm not real thrilled with this seat.

I've had the same problem as others with moving the handle back and forth. One side works okay, but the other side is tricky. Here's how we make it work: first, take a deep breath. Then grab the handle/button and squeeze hard without putting any pressure on the handle to move it ANY OTHER direction. AFTER you have depressed the button, THEN you can try to move the handle. The handle has to be perfectly centered before the button will be depressible and the handle therefor movable. Not an easy task if you've got a screaming baby to attend to (and taking them out with the handle up is pretty awkward-- its very easy to bump babe's head). If you look at the mechanism you can see why it doesn't work very well.

The triangular handle seemed great, but the seat is still very awkward to carry. I'm probably on the weak side in terms of mothers, but even my 8.5lb newborn made this thing tough to carry. I dread carrying him around at 18lbs. Its too heavy to carry away from my body, so I end up having it banging against my leg while I awkwardly hobble around. Or I hold it sideways in front of me with two hands. However, I must admit, I haven't tried to lift other seats.

Everything else works fine, and I'm sure glad its easy to adjust. The crotch buckle is annoying though in that it takes two hands to hold the two sides together before it can get inserted into the between-the-legs strap. Maybe that's typical, but I'd rather not have to do it that way.
Baby gift and loves it!!
Love it so far.

I loved everything about it the fact that it'll turn into a booster seat is a plus! Love love the little slots to put the harness in on the sides so they're not in the way for when you try and put baby into carseat. The padding is amazing as well. Color is practically exactly as on the picture. Worth ever dollar!!!!
We got these to use in Hawaii for our quick ubers and they are great. The kids were comfy and they fold up nice and small.

The straps are impossible to tighten using the pulling strap by the crotch, even while pushing the button. I do not recommend this seat and would not buy it again. Without being able to tighten appropriately it is not safe.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: This booster seat doesn't attach to the car, and my child is floating side to side in the car. I dont know how a product can even be made this way. My conversation with their customer service was equally disturbing. Stay away!!!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: So easy for travel, love not having to check car seats! I only have 2 kids, since these seats mhave less bulk than a regular low back booster it would be very easy to fit an adult + 2 kids in the back, or 3 kids in this style booster in the back. I’ve even lent my set to friends of mine flying with kids. .. so convenient!
I liked everything about this carseat it works great!! No dislikes!!
We love this car seat. This is our 2nd purchase.
Easy to use

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: This was amazing for our trip through the airport.
Super light weight and easy to take in and out of the car. Easily adjustable and easily washable.

Why did I wait so long to buy this? I don't know. We previously bought the Brica car seat dolly. It was garbage. We have a Britax clicktight marathon. The seat attaches much better to this dolly than the Brica one. This dolly is also so much sturdier. I can actually put my son in his seat on the dolly and wheel him unlike the Brica dolly. I finally decided to buy this one after a near disastrous airport trip with my 3 year old son by myself. The Brica dolly was so terrible about every 50 feet I was having to stop and stabilize it. I could not put my son in the seat with that dolly as it was too unstable. I had my son sitting on top of our luggage on a luggage cart. We were walking to the curb waiting to be picked up from the airport and the Brica dolly tipped and I let go of the baggage cart with my son on it (my mistake) to upright the Brica dolly. The baggage cart almost rolled into the street. Someone else had to catch it for me. The Brica dolly went in the trash and I promptly got on amazon to have this dolly shipped to me on vacation for our return airport trip. So much better. So much better.

Update 2/9/18: after another airport trip with this dolly I am more in love with it than I thought. If you have a Britax clicktight car seat this dolly is wonderful. It attaches to the dolly as firmly as in the car. When we put the seat on the dolly my son can ride in it no problem. My husband jokes that it is almost as good as traveling without a kid as it feels like just a carry on bag being wheeled around the airport. We fold it up at the gate and put it in the seat part of the car seat when we put it in our bag and gate check the car seat. It’s far better than any other car seat dolly I’ve tried.

No matter how I install it (and I followed the directions to a "T"), it wobbles from side to side. Doesn't really seem very safe. Also we have a CUV (a Mazda 3) and for this to fit on the back seat, the front seat has to be moved all the way forward with the back in an uncomfortable forward position.
I bought this for travel. It was light to carry through through the airport and easy to install in the rental car.

so far the seat is safe for the baby but the biggest issue is the base size, it's ridiculous, no matter what i do i cann't buckle the back seats anymore because the base is way too wide. when people need to sit in the back, only 1 person can buckle their belt. kind of useless. wouldn't recommend this seat

Coming from having a Chicco keyfit 30 and moving to this, I had a very hard time adjusting to how hard it is to pull the straps tight. We've had it for about 2 weeks now, and I still get frustrated with how hard it is to get tight. Other than that, I love everything else about the car seat.

Update: I finally figured out that I needed to lift the back up because he was taller than what I had the car seat set at. It only took one position higher and it helped a ton with how hard the straps were to pull. I love everything about this car seat and highly recommend it.

I am very happy with this infant seat. My daughter is 7 months old and still has plenty of room in it, though it is now mainly a back-up seat in grandma's car as we have the Britax Boulevard in the main seat. It works great with both of my strollers- Britax B-Ready and Bob Motion. It clicks in and out of both strollers with no hassle. I've also traveled with this car seat and it was very easy to install in multiple cars using either LATCH or a seatbelt with the built-in lock offs.

Since some are complaining about the size here is a breakdown of the cars I have I have installed it in:
- Hyundai Accent (with LATCH)
- Scion xA (with LATCH)
- Peugeot 207 (with LATCH)
- Older Peugeot mini van with a seatbelt

I had no problem with it fitting in any of the cars, though the front passenger seat in the Scion was closer to the dash than I would normally sit, and more than the others. Very happy with this purchase and I highly recommend it!

Car seat is fantastic when rear facing. We own a 2016 Ford Explorer and sadly the latches do not reach when forward facing. I am not sure if the latches will reach on any other type of backseat. If I had tried to have it forward facing before the returning policy expired, I would have returned it. Try car seat in all directions before deciding to keep!

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, No-Rethread Harness
Review: This car seat is extremely easy to install and has high safety ratings. On top of that, if your kid gets motion sick, like mine, it’s easy to unzip and clean. I have 4 of these (2 for each vehicle for my husband and I and our 2 kids), we love them
Very comfy seat

I really wanted to like this however there is one major design flaw.  As a rear facing car seat it is extremely difficult to access the lever to wish you can recline the car seat.  It seems once you graduate to a front facing position, the problem will be solved and it should be seemingly a good carseat. In the meantime though, it’s a pain in the butt.

We purchased this seat as an extra car seat for our second car and for when we travel.  Pros are that it is relatively lightweight and affordable compared to some of the other seats we were considering.  Cons are that it is a little difficult to install and I don't think my son was all that comfortable in the seat.

If you have a toddler, buy this and you will never regret it. It's very comfortable, easy to use, and the cup dispenser are a nice touch. Your todd will really enjoy the trip if you have this plus, because there are cup dispensers, they will feel like it's an indispensable feature so they will explore putting and getting their cup back in and out of it, drink from it, etc. It's very affordable too and it;s very well-made.
No llegó el paquete a mi dirección.
My grandson loves it.
Has been amazing value for money!
Absolutely excellent car seat all around
Nice seat but the wrong color was sent. Wish I would have gotten the one I requested. I cant return it because I need it today to travel.
These are large, not for compact car at all. We have three and have to put them in separate rows in our full sized SUV. But I feel safer with the kids in these.
I don't think any car seat is easy to install. I love the car seat. My granddaughter is comfortable and safe. ✌

Great product, bought it for my daughter and she was so excited because it sits higher then her old one.Also i have the seat in another vehicle but it has no backrest like this one does. I like the fact it clips on to the seats others i looked at do not so i feel this is safer.The youngest sits in the old one
It was perfect
We got the gravo forever for my son and this for our second baby 2 years later. Wish I would have saved the cash and got 2 of these.
Missing cup holder. Overall I like how you can adjust the height.

My Great Grand daughter constantly cried in her rear facing carseat, she does not cry in this seat. She can see out the window and can see us in the rear view mirror and now laughs and plays when in the car.
I like the safety features and the comfort of this car seat for my daughter. Although it wasn't easy to install and it's not easy to tighten the straps.
Exactly as expected.
Great upgrade for a one year old!
The tether strap would not tighten enough to  keep it from sliding around and the seat bels when tightened tightly pulled the cars over sideways. Just didn't seem very safe or easy to install
Nothing really to install except the two cups holders. My 1 year old grandson loves them! I like the fact that it is a disney product without costing an arm and a leg.
Like it and my daughter loves it too. So far so good
It works really well. My daughter loves it!
Very good seat. Well built.  Be aware it is heavy and sturdy.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Very nice seat.  Plenty of room for my grandgirl no problem. It seems pretty comfortable compared to most.  Dont know why theres not a ton of cushion in these booster seats period, but we are happy with it & it should last a long time.
Great product. A little confusing on how to install, but otherwise great!
Excellent prod3

We bought this car seat from a different source after finding a better sale price, but thought I would share my thoughts here.

Great, quality car seat that I felt met my high safety expectations, after a different high-end brand let me down (having had recalls regarding their China-made plastic and removal of their anti-rebound bar design in the new bases). I read many safety websites and comparisons regarding this car seat and other competitors', but seeing the actual results of the crash safety tests and the amount of G-Force transferred to the baby (this car seat rated among the best for dispersal of G-Force and impact energy) I felt happy going with it. The fabric looks like it will breath well and I'm impressed by the different inserts and quality of construction. The base is also narrower so it has a better fit if you want to try doing the three-across car seat setup in your truck or car. My husband loves that the seatbelt lockoff is a big panel that easily pushes down instead of those flimsy narrow lockoffs you see on other car seats. I love the European belt routing if you're installing without the base. Honestly, it's everything I've come to expect from a modern car seat.

Cons:
The shoulder pads - someone else mentioned that the velcro is sewn on the inside where the fabric meets the harness belts, and it is still this way with the one we purchased. It catches on EVERYTHING, including the harness belts themselves at times. We tried different dolls and stuffed animals in the car seat for fun, my children enjoy it, but I have to be careful they don't get caught by this velcro. I can foresee issues with this and will probably remove them and use a different brand or something. They are great material other than this one design flaw.

The canopy - it's a great UPF protected canopy made of breathable fabric, again quality materials. but it CLICKS loudly into place once fully extended, and I can see this startling a baby. Also, as many others have mentioned, the clearance for your hands is barely there while trying to carry. Honestly, I bought the car seat anyway knowing this and having seen it in many videos. I am not bothered by it as much because the car seat is so light and easy to handle that I don't need to do too much "manhandling." I'm sure my husband might disagree with his bigger hands, but we will see.

I'm happy I went with it, and look forward to lots of road trips! The car seat should last past baby's first year!
The only problem is that I want to get de back part of the seat and there's any place that sale it. If you know about it please tell me.

My kid has been using this booster since 2+ years now and it has been great. We have been able to move it between cars in a matter of seconds. Its very easy to move and install. Its pretty comfortable for my kid.
This was a baby shower gift and expectant mother was very happy with this product

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: My 6 year old daughter loves this seat. My parents bought one and my daughter used it and was in love. Small and works well in my prius. She fought with the regular booster seats because they always covered the seat belt on the seat. This one she feels like a big kid .

My daughter loves this carseat, she talks about it all the time. She is kinda small for her age so we waited for her 4th birthday to get it (she is only 30lbs), and she fits perfectly in it with loads of room to grow. I truly did not want to buy a $20 cheap booster seat, and I am super happy with this seat.
Very good choice
Bought two of these. Great price. Works perfect for our 5 year old. Easy to install. He loves the cup holder and the little storage compartment on the side.
Good all around booster seat. nothing to complain about

I love the color on this I see it sell out all the time and I’m only 13 weeks but I had to get it because I actually need it and it’s sold out. Nice and soft seems Easy to place in the car( two different options) I think baby will enjoy it. Nice cup holder too!
Looooove it!  Makes our old car seat look like an apple box with straps.  I think everyone knows how well respected these are.

I bought this product and despite some of the reviews, I was more than happy with it! I didn't want to gate check my stroller, so I used this to pull my car seat and my 2yo all around the airport and right on to the plane. It is easy to hook the car seat to it, and it pulls or pushes easily throughout the airport. My 2yo loved riding in it. Worked perfectly, very sturdy, and a lifesaver!
I really like this car seat. It's lightweight which is nice going from my car to others cars.
Came quickly. Installed in about 5 minutes! My child loves it. Haven’t cleaned it yet so I cannot review how easy it is to clean and put back together. I may update later.
Great car seat. I bought 2 open box ones and saved $100 on each one. they both looked brand new.

I like that it was easy to install and fit perfectly in
My car for my 8 month grand daughter

A great seat for the price.  Not horribly easy to install, but manageable with some patience. Seems comfy enough for my 11 month-old grandson.  We don't plan to take any long trips with him, so it's fine for occasional use, as it advertises.  I would have loved for some way to attach some diversionary toys to it, but there are none, so when he tosses a toy out of the seat, it's gone. I'll probably figure out some way to clip a strap on to hold toys.  I don't care about the cup holder (someone mentioned it) because I don't plan for him, at least not at this age, to be drinking anything he could choke on - not on my watch.  The strap for the headrest runs side to side and the slot is up and down, so the headrest is tilted a little, but that's minor.  We took our first little jaunt with him a few days ago, and he fell asleep. Make sure the arrows are perpendicular to the floor for the right tilt so their head doesn't fall forward.  Also, I do recommend getting some of those fuzzy guards for the straps that go beside the neck because the edges of the straps will rub on their tender skin and leave a mark/sore place.  I'm tickled that we can now take him on little outings, and I think the price was very reasonable for such a high safety rated convertible car seat.
Nice just like the picture...

I had to give the dangerous seat one star to be able to post this warning to parents!
Open the box to discover what appears to be a gray/white powdery substance (mildew) covering the entire underside of every piece of the seat. The one time I purchased based off stars and didn't read the reviews.. Shame on you Graco and Amazon for selling this even after this is a known issue. That is a dangerous health hazard!! If you own this seat CHECK IT!! Your child could be breathing this stuff in!

My only complaint would be the strap covers don't stay on & not padded enough & the seat is not as padded as I'd like. Otherwise a good car seat & my child enjoys being higher up to see out & I like the snaps have to be pushed a certain way so it's too difficult for my child to try & let herself out.

Works well and is priced well. The buckle is okay. You get used to using it. We use this as more of a backup seat for our other vehicle. My daughter looks more comfortable when she’s sleeping in the Graco 4ever seat (forward facing).

Great seat especially for the price! I was a little skeptical about it bc it wasnt a big name company and the price seemed a bit too low for a good quality seat but i was convinced to give it a try and im glad i did. Great quality product, it definitely gives you that accident ready toughness. The cushion is soft and seems comfortable for our toddler.

Thankfully we havent had a test run in this product and hope we never do but as far as quality for the price, we are very satisfied!

Special Features: Kinetic pods help to move forces away from your baby in case of a side collision., The ARB spacer allows for extended rear-facing use by increasing your child's leg room by 2 inches., The Anti-Rebound bar protects baby by minimizing forces and reducing rotation in case of a front or rear collision. The ARB is integrated and stow able.
Review: Must have!! Looks great, holds up against toddler!
The seat is easy to use and cute. The bad thing is there is no more padding on it than the cheaper ones. The arm rest won’t stay on. I would stick to the cheaper models, they are just as good.

If i could return it after the first day, i would have.  I got this for my 4 1/2 year old to have and use it as a 5 point and then a booster later.  There is not much room for an older child, so after 2 months she usually cannot do the 5pt seatbelt anymore and has to use it as a booster.  Was hoping for longer time with more straps but it is too tight.  She is slightly tall for her age, but slender.
This one went back. My daughter wasn't thrilled with it so we continued the search.
Was the one my mother picked for my little sister and it lasted awhile before she grew out of it and it was easy to clean when she would waste cookies and stuff on it.
The chair is light weight and portable. I rotate between two cars. Don't need any type of installation. Just put the chair on the seat and buckle up.
I live how comfortable my granddaughter fits in it...and the fact that she can lay back if she falls asleep in the front facing position.

Easy to install and to Buckle your child in. Good for multi stages of the child's growth. This is a direct replacement of the seat we are replacing do to a MV accident. Seat was not occupied at time of accident. Followed manufactures recommendation to replace the seat

$35 cheaper direct from manufacture with free shipping

I really liked this Britax Highpoint high-back & backless booster car seat and ordered it for my newest grandchild. We now have 10 granddaughters and 2 grandson's and want to keep them safe. What attracted me was this tallest head protection as the newest grandson will most likely be very tall. This booster seat is for children 40-120 lbs. which is nice to have that range. But the best part is the 3 layers of protection which is (1) head restraint that will go up or down into 10 different positions in dark gray (2) back and built-up sides like a wing-back chair that will protect your child from impact by keeping their head within the chair (3) extra dark gray side plastic padding for further impact protection. The RED areas are for the seat belt guides with padding in the center. Easy to attach seat-belt. And 2 dishwasher-safe removable cup holders which is great for sippy cups, bottled water, and snacks. You can also take the back off and just use the bottom when your little one is no longer little, The booster seat will raise them up in order to see everything outside the windows but keeps them safe with the seat belt and shoulder strap. I believe all these different levels of head restraint features validate safety for my new grandson, and your child too.

Offers good protection to the child sitting in the seat. Side pillows offer good support if he or she sleeps during the drive.

The seat cushion can be improved a little.
Great car seat. Absolutely love it. We have another one on the way and will definitely be getting another one!

We purchased this booster for my 4 year old daughter who was becoming too tall for her 5-point harness-style car seat to fit appropriately and safely. The back is high enough to allow for napping in the car, which was an important consideration for me. She loves having the slide out cup-holders, although they are not deep enough to prevent cups on the tall and skinny side from tumbling out (as I learned the hard way).

Although this is true of nearly all booster seat on the market, I love the convenience of not having to wrestle with the latch system every time I want to have an adult passenger in the back seat. The colors are nice, and my daughter loves her big girl seat. We have since bought several more of the same brand for other cars in which she rides (grandparents and such). My only slight quibble is the fact that the arm rest covers come off very easily, which means that I have to put them back on nearly every time I strap her in. A slight annoyance, but for the safety rating, quality, and price, you just can't go wrong with this seat. I would definitely recommend for anyone looking to purchase a high-backed booster for a transitioning toddler.
Love it

Best car seat I have ever seen or owned!
I think every new mom should buy one.
It is so easy to adjust and to clean which is HUGE with carseats. It is heavy but it is meant to be kept inside the car, not lugged around.
My almost 2 year old loves it. Came with removable infant insert. Very comfortable and I love that it has the 2 removable cupholders so I can easily take them inside and clean them.
She weighs 36 pounds and I can easily rear face her with no problem for a while! :)
Then it will forward face and then it says it can be a booster seat until 100 pounds. Very happy with my purchase and the price isn't bad for having 3 or 4 carseats in one basically
Love the cup holder. Hold well in seatbelt

My 18 mos dausghter loves this, i could tell as she is either uiete, cooing or blaberring and in our long drive she would fall asleep. She cries when its uncomfortable but in this car seat ahe only cries when ahe’s hungry. This is a good buy doe the price. We habe not tested the safety and of cousrse we don’t want to right? But by the looks and feel of it md other’s review it has all it needed to keep my precious one safe. I love to find good quality stuff without paying the price. And oh we bought another one for our new car!
This car seat is great. So nice having a booster that still uses the latch system. It keeps the seat in place while the child is getting in or out of it.
Bought this for my growing Nanny kid. I love it! Super easy to set up in the car
So much better than traveling with massive car seat! It is also great to leave at school when my mom or someone else needs to pick my son up.
Does the job well.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review:
Took some getting use to. It fits in our second row so all 3 are safe but my 6 year old doesn't love it... I think if it had some way to stay still and not slide so much especially when getting his seat belt on it would be better.

I wanted to send a follow-up to this 8 months later. I AM NOT A FAN AT ALL!! My son looks extremely uncomfortable in this seat and every time I carpool and someone has to use the seat they always complain.

Bottom line.. if you NEED to fit a booster in a 3rd row they get use to it but if you have the option PASS on it. deflates, slants to one side. Overall I would not buy this again.
Baby feels comfortable
I really love the material super comfortable the reclining is super easy. Totally recommend.

We love this carseat.  We also have an older version of this carseat and have been very happy with it.  It's sleek and newer looking.  My only complaint with this newer model is that they changed the way the harness is put together.  The non slip grips are a lot more stiff so they don't contour their chest very well.  It makes it hard to tighten and loosen the straps.  But overall I feel that my babies are very safe in these carseats and would definitely recommend them.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: This seat is great. It is so light and easy to move from car to car. It’s a nice design and does what it is suppose to do. I would recommend this seat!

Disclaimer:  I do not have children. However I am known as "Aunt" to multitudes. I first got the recommendation from my niece upon the birth of her second child. She got HER recommendation from a family friend w/ twins. Between the two of them, both educated professionals who are intelligent and analytical, I knew this was The Macdaddy of seats! I have since given it several times w/ nothing but glowing reviews from parents, a couple of whom already had seats but switched after receiving this one.

We used a Britax infant seat and stroller for years, and we were very satisfied with their safety, sturdiness, and appearance. When our now-seven-year-old was clearly tall enough and weighed enough for a booster earlier this year, we shopped around but decided to stick with Britax. She loves her purple "big kid" seat and reports it is very comfortable. It is easy to latch into our CRV and weighs very little compared to her behemoth infant seat.

I would note, though, that one may be limited as to which back seat to place the booster in certain SUVs because it may block part of the driver's view (our daughter's seat has to be place directly behind the driver's seat to keep all sightlines clear).

Great product. Highly recommend!
I have two of these in each car for a total of 4.  They have functioned very well so far.  No issues with front facing or rear facing.  Easy install and removal.
Es un producto muy seguro y se adapta a niños de varias edades
Very safe and comfortable car seat. I bought it for my 2nd child and it's the best car seat we have ever owned. The only regret I have is not buying it sooner.
It works great.  The only complaint is that it can never get tightly bounded to the seat.  However, it still works fine.

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review:
This Evenflo car seat is a very sturdy, with excellent padding to protect our toddler grandson.
Easy to understand Vvdeos available online to assist in installation.
Very nice!
So far so good. My boy rides and sleeps comfortably. I also love the cup holder. Good for holding snacks!

This car seat is amazing. I wish we would have purchased it for our infant when she was a newborn. It has a fantastic newborn insert. It is large and roomy for our baby, but compact enough for our tiny 2000 Dodge Neon! While I hope to never be in a crash with my baby, it seems very safely padded and secure. It sits well on the seat and doesn't wobble any which way. Our last car seat I had to move my seat up as far as it would go for it to fit, but with this one I have ample leg room. Right now we are using it as rear facing and our baby, who has long legs, is not cramped up. It was easy to install. The straps are easy to adjust. Color is great! I will be purchasing another for our next child.

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: Esta bonito práctico pero a mi me costó asegurarlo no se si porque era la primera vez que pongo un asiento de esos

Major flaw with the "Extend2Fit". If you have a smaller car, you will not be able to use this feature! Extending the leg rest requires that you move the base to the edge of the seat. No big deal unless it already takes up your entire back seat! It was the biggest reason why we wanted this car seat, to rear face longer.
Unfortunately, my child is in the 100th percentile for height and, at 8 months, his feet are touching the seat of the car so he'll probably need forward facing before he's even a year old.
Great carseat otherwise but I'm glad this was gifted to us instead of paying out of pocket for a feature that doesn't work for us. (Use a crochet hook to pull the loops of the cover back through the tiny holes to save yourself a ton of frustration.)

Our biggest catch with this carseat is the buckle is SO hard to undo. We've had this carseat for a few months now, and sometimes I have to have my husband help me unbuckle it because it's too hard for me, and it's very hard for him to unbukle too. It's installed in his truck, so we don't use it daily, but we wouldn't buy this one again for that reason.

Such a useful and easy use seat! The installation is a little confusing but won’t take you more than 5mins to install in car, highly recommend it!! My niece lovees it and the cushions are super comfy👌🏽

I do a lot of research, and this car seat is rated number 2 on consumer reports.  Prior to purchasing this car seat we bought a advocate for our other car.  However, the Marathon is rated a lot higher than other Britax models on consumer reports. Therefore, we purchased this as our second seat.  These click tight seats are SO easy to put in;making installation a breeze.  I would recommend the click tight models to others.
It seems really cheap because it is so light weight but we sure lived this seat on our vacation. Super easy to install and carry around.
Loveeeeeee it!!!! So easy to install. And the latch strap was long enough for my truck. Some carseat the strap is too short. So happy with my purchase
Super cute, my.son loves it. He feels like a big boy using his new booster seat.  Great product for transitioning.

I'd like to chip in my two cents about the harness, especially. It is very difficult to tighten. My wife always asks me to help her get it tight enough and, now that I have a broken rib, it is very hard for me to securely tighten it, too. This is just so unnecessary. For a seat this expensive, you'd expect it to be fairly easy to tighten. Also, loosening again is very hard, requiring two hands, which is difficult when you're the only one taking your child out of the seat or putting him/her back in again. I have some buyer's remorse, and I'm mulling returning this and using the Nuna Pipa infant car seat until our baby grows out of it, then perhaps trying Nuna's more expensive convertible car seat, given our relative success with their products so far.

As for install, this thing goes in such that it is pretty easy to torque it when trying to tighten the harness, so you can easily end up with a crooked seat, which makes me nervous. I'm inclined to switch to the LATCH installation instead, but given our issues with the harness, we may just send the whole thing back.

Otherwise it's fine. Relatively easy to adjust height and recline (though not great on the recline, actually). LO seems comfortable in it. We used it for a trip from Boston to New York, and he was less fussy than he was the time we went down with him in the Pipa carrier, but it's impossible to know if it was all due to the seat itself.

I switched my tiny 15lb 9 month old out of the standard carrier to this Graco.

PROS :
- I like the different recline positions - love that they are perfectly labeled on the side
- I thought install was easy to get into the car. I feel like people tend to complain about taking seats in and out of cars and it’s not that bad
- LOVE that there’s holders for the clips to get baby in and out without the harness in the way
- everybody loves cup holders - and TWO of them
- cover comes off
- price is reasonable

CONS
- I have to adjust the crotch strap and I am not exaggerating that I was sweating trying to get it out of the hole it comes in
- cover, although it comes off, is a pain to get back on
- this is not a small car seat
- instructions aren’t clear on when to remove the padded inserts
- the seat tilt is in a weird location so it’s hard to get your hand in
Gets dirty fast!

As a city dweller with a young child, this is tops!  I feel so much better being able to carry something with me for taxi/uber/lyft rides.  My son still uses a 5 pt harness in our car, but this is great for on the go or traveling to countries where carseats/boosters are not commonplace.
Easy to install. I have Kia soul and it fits pretty fine to me. My son loves it. I'm happy with my purchase!

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: I’m sure it’s great for most cars but didn’t hook into my 2017 crv
Very sturdy, and easy to install
I liked how slim it was, sucks there isn’t a cup holder, but wasn’t a deal breaker for us.

This seat is comfy and seems VERY safe - rock solid, like it's a part of the car.  We are pleased with that!  We were hoping to keep our daughter rear-facing as long as possible (she is 18 months, but barely 20 lbs). When this is installed rear-facing there is no room for legs to hang over the edge of the seat. We ended up installing forward-facing. It was especially easy to install with the LATCH system. So all worked out well and we are happy with the seat.  Just be aware that, if you are buying this because of the rear-facing up to 40 lbs. feature, there may be no room for your kiddos legs to hang over the edge in that position.
Great carseat for the price! Love it. Very comfortable for my 14month old
I purchased this one for the cup holders. Highly recommended.
I love love love love this car seat. I bought one for my daughter in 2017. It was definitely worth the money. So I ended up buying one for my son. I will never use another car seat again.

We have two of these seats now. One for my car and one for my husbands truck. I’m not one to just buy any brand either. With my little one I have way more anxiety than I ever had when my oldest was little. So I need quality. I’ve been a graco fan for years and still am. It was hard for me to sway. I went to reviews which is something I actually rarely do since I want to form my own opinion. But with two other kids between my husband and I and needing two seats (because no mom wants to constantly take them in and out) we needed something more budget friendly. I love the material on the seats. Like a scuba wet suit in comparison versus that scratchy material on many. It’s easy to tighten the straps. Has awesome cushion around her head. And it’s fairly easy to install if your seatbelt will cooperate and not lock (rear position. I have a tiny child). These were my first product purchases by this company and I will say I’m impressed. So if you’re looking for top quality without busting the budget and a safe design, give it a shot.
This seat was easy to install and was a perfect fit for my granddaughter.

The large side protection makes it hard to get your baby in and out of the seat. Overall, it fits well in the car and secures the baby well. Cup holders with elastic on the side are nice for any size cup/toy.
I bought two of these car seats, one for my car and one for the husbands. It's pretty lightweight, easy to install, and holds up with daily use.

Purchased this product through Amazon from Diapers Direct. Wrote Diapers Direct and told them that I needed to return/replace it due to the headrest was unable to stay up/broken. This item was installed in our third vehicle as a "just incase car seat." A few weeks later we needed to put my son in the car seat and tried to adjust to his head height, no luck. I wrote them they responded with basically tough luck. No returns accepted.
No problem with our other two seats, same model, different colors. If your a neat freak, don't buy this color by the way. (Green seat) It does not was well. We do not eat in our cars, dirt/sand from shoes or shorts caused dingy look that washing did not help. I wash on gentle cycle, air dry. Three washes, dulled color on cold wash. Three stars for this due to seat material quality.
Now I'm actually needing to use the seat more these day's and he's taller requiring me to buy another. Buy strictly from Amazon is my suggestion!

This is great. Only regret was not buying it sooner. My son sometimes gets really hot in it, but don't know that you can avoid that in the summer anyhow. He's tall and it is comfortable for him still.
Great buy.
Love this seat. Grandchild can get in and out easily. It is secure and minimal.

We can’t stand this car seat! We have seven children and have used a LOT of car seats. An inexpensive Walmart car seat works better than this one. We hoped it would be worth the money- it’s not. We got it for our 12m old as the description said it would fit her. She slides from one side to the other in it and it leaves significant red marks on her neck when she’s been in it. She can also slip her arms out because the shoulder straps are so huge. We thought it might be user error for a while or that she might grow into it, so we kept looking into it, and missed the return window. When I reached out to the company in hopes that they’d back their product, they refused to refund us. I highly recommend not purchasing this seat!
Only issue is that the buckle in the middle keeps slipping under.
I love these carseat and so do my boys. They live riding in them and the "secret" cubby for treasures. I love that they are sturdy and I feel safe with my kids in them.
Love it, fits great in car, my granddaughter loves it. Seems durable and love the color
wish had bought it earlier when my son was born.

My wife and I really like this car seat. We purchased this car seat after our daughter out grew her Infant car seat (Graco Click Connect 35). We use it on our Dodge Durango and have it placed behind the passenger seat in the rear facing position. We like how easy it was to install, just install the base and then attach the car seat to the base. We also liked how easy it is to change from rear to forward position and how the seat grows with my child. The padding is great, and the buckle is firmly secured. I have to push it at least twice with my thumb to unbuckle it, so im sure that my daughter wont be able to remove it on her own. It has an indicator on the side of the seat that tells you when its level (in the rear facing positon) and it ends up being in a recline position however, my daughter does not mind it. It does take up a lot of space in the rear facing position, thats why we have it installed behind the passenger seat so the driver can be comfortable but once turned around to the forward facing position we will recover some of that space. If you drive a smaller car then this seat might be an issue as far as space.  It is on the heavy side but, we have no need to be moving it from car to car so it works out for us. We are expecting our second baby and I placed out Infant car seat next to this one and it fits perfectly for my vehicle. It is a little pricey but in my situation it was a great investment, plus we wont have to purchase another seat since it grows with my child.

It's much darker than the pictures. More of a reddish color
The lap buckle is ridiculously hard to adjust. The anchor doesn't fit through the slot to move the bottom buckle farther out for an older baby. The length is also shorter than in my other carseats
