These are very good seats...some of the best. Daughter was finally big enough to get one so we shopped on line w/amazon....easier than running through the store. Fits her great.  Average size and weight for 5yrs
A bit tricky to adjust to best level for your child's shoulder height (it took us 30 minutes!) but finally a very good and safe product with a nice european design. Very happy with my purchase
Easy to install, and practical to transport from car to car,

We have 2 seats, this one & another well known more expensive brand.  I prefer this one to the more expensive one.  It is sturdy & a ton lighter than the other one.  The harness is very easy to latch!
Life saver for all mommies!
Decent carseat but our friends babies look much more comfortable in their more expensive carseats.  We don't use the weather shield.  Sometimes it gets stuck in the base as well.
Great seat. I've bought two and they do the work well in my Honda and Explorer. Its great they can be converted.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: My son loved this. It fits between my two other car seats and puts him in perfect position for the seat belt.

In the rear-facing position, there is a secondary securing strap that is constantly in the way and is a hassle to disconnect and reconnect as necessary while loading and remove the child.
In both the front and rear facing positions it is very difficult to loosen and tighten the harness.
Overall it seems very secure and safe, and it isn't ugly, it's just not particularly user-friendly.

I bought one of these for my 1 year old and loved it so much I just bought another one for our soon to be expected baby. We took a long 12 hour drive and our daughter was very comfortable the whole trip. She loves using her cup holders for drinks and snacks or toys.

I bought this as a travel car seat and a backup car seat for my husband's car. It was lightweight and narrow enough to fit on most airplane seats. As soon as I opened it, I regretted purchasing it. You obviously get what you pay for. It's cheap and flimsy looking and the seat cover is really thin and provides no real cushioning. Also the cup holder that came with it is a really stupid design that bunches up the seat cover. It also wasn't the cup holder pictured on the box or in the instruction manual. I wonder if it was even the right cupholder....? As a backup car seat, these issues alone are not deal breakers, but what made me return it was when we tried to install it rear-facing with a seat belt we could NOT get it tight enough. With two adults, we couldn't get this seat installed safely. It would slide several inches side to side and the worst part was it would tip forward into the seat back.

Our main car seat is an Orbit Baby and with the base you can install it really securely. There is no budging once it's installed. We ended up buying the Diono Radian r120 and I was able to install it safely by myself. No sliding or tipping (because it has a rear-facing tether)!
Se ajustan muy bien y fácil de armar

5 STARS is not enough to rate this one. I'm a mother of 2 girls under 4, so we had to buy 2 so they would match. :) We originally purchased Eddie Bauer car seats for our first daughter, and this one is by far WAAAY BETTER! These carseats are SUPERIOR in many ways: cushion, materials used, safety/comfort features. It has 3 reclining positions! The head rest grows with your child and wraps around enough for them to rest their head when they fall asleep. It fits like a cockpit, they look snug and feel much safer in these car seats. My oldest can't unbuckle the 5-point harness anymore! She loves the fact that the straps have cushiony wraps around them, and the buckle on the crotch has a protective cover for their groin area. Read the instruction manual, it's in plain language, with clear instructions and pictures, it even has a separate manual in spanish. I can't believe what a good deal we got, we won't have to buy another car seat since it converts to a booster seat, safe for up to 100 lbs. I highly recommend this carseat! Thanks Graco!!!!
Sonia from Katy, TX

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: I was so excited about this little chair. But the tray is difficult to put on. I am having issues getting the legs to fold back down and my daughter can tip it over easily. I will be returning
ordered by my newest granddaughter.  Quality should last for a long time as she grows.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Happy with the quality!
I've got a small car but wanted big safety, comfort and easy to clean. This does it all!! I'm very happy with it, I even bought one for my mother in-laws car!!
Purchased as an additional set for Uncle - girls love them! Easy to install and move if needed from car to car!
It's exactly what I wanted for my grandson and he can still use his cups in the cup holders. There are 2 of them
My baby love her new car seat.
Fanfreakingtastic. It's big and slightly heavy but safety is the point. Easy to clean and grows with your child. Buy this an enjoy.

I like this car seat because it does allow good leg room and the cup holder is nice. When the back part is removed and no longer needed the seat is secured to the seat anchors and just buckle the little one up with the car seatbelt.

My son today said his privates hurt while sitting in this car seat. Like other reviewers said the bottom buckle is way too close to the baby - there should be 2 more slots to extend position. Would NEVER buy again.

You can not beat the clicktight install, it is so easy and a rock solid install every time. I think the main issue people have with this seat is they use the lower anchors which it wasn’t really designed for, they’re there solely because they have to be, it is designed for a seat belt install. It’s also important to know that you don’t pull the belt super tight and lock it and then try and close the panel, simply remove the slack and close the seat, it’s that easy. The fabric is soft and I absolutely love you can put it in the washer and dryer. It is just an easy to use, non complicated seat. I also love that it has the option to use the anti rebound bar. We have had other Britax seats, some Gracos and a safety first. We hated the safety first, the Gracos were nice but not as easy to install and I loathe the top tether on graco seats, it is so hard to loosen. We prefer the Britax seats for sure. I also like that they’re made in the US.
Fantastic seat!  My 3 yr old is comfortable and the straps are a breeze to tighten.

It originally took a few minutes to get the car seat on properly and anchors lengths set. But now that they are set, it should only take a matter of seconds to attach and detach the car seat. Sturdy, solid construction. My Safety 1st car seat fits perfectly on this Britax trolley.
Going to buy another for the hubby car

So, it took us a little while to figure out how to strap him in at the hospital parking lot 😂 but, we got it figured out. I have a bunch of back issues, and this seat is amazing for getting my baby in and out of the car!
Easy to use booster.
Graco safety and my kids loved the color!
Great booster seat - great price
I love this car seat. We got this for my little one and its grown with him. Its very comfortable and all the different positions are great. The safety rating and reviews for this was great.
Very comfortable..
Great review on consumer reports and Amazon... the recline is minimal if your seats have no slope to them (VW Jettas), but an excellent buy. We have two now.

Instead of having the belt in the middle of the seat (at the front bottom part), it is so helpful to have it on the side.  Having gone through several car seats, this one has been our favorite, by far.  You don't have to pump iron in order to feel like you've got the belt tight enough.
Very well built. I have two of these. The other one is for grandparents car.

I have bought some very high end carseats. This one is by far the easiest to put together and install! Super comfortable! Skip buying expensive carseats, they all have to pass the same standards of safety. But this one!!!
Car seat is really solid and the skinnier base it what we need with baby 3 on the way. This is a heavy duty car seat. TIP: The owner's manual is hidden inside the car seat.
I was worried it will not hold, but everything is great.

Love the car seat. It is easy to install and take the pads off to clean the seat. My daughter is comfortable and I am sure it will last for a while. I gave a 3 star review bc the chest harness clip has melted. It isn’t even hot here yet and it wouldn’t unbuckle last night. I tried to “warp” it back this morning but it wouldn’t click into the other side. Disappointed in this aspect as it seems like it shouldn’t do this.

I love all but one thing about this carseat. The buckle is kind of tedious. Its not bad yet, but I'm dreading trying to line up and buckle it in with a squirmy, screaming child once my daughter gets a little older. Other than that, the features are wonderful, easily accessible and very flexible.

I fell in love with this carseat whilst shopping for baby to be, but I was not in love with the price tag! I feel like I got such a great deal on this carseat through Amazon! It is advertised at $160-200 at other retailers. I am having a difficult time finding another base for this carseat as I would like to have 2 bases. However, I really like the removable liner that you can throw into the washing machine. Baby has not arrived yet so I have not used it, but so far I am very happy with it.

Waste of money.  I bought this and tried it for my small 8 and 10 year olds who still use backless boosters.  Both kids found the hard front lip uncomfortable under their legs.  The lap belt fit was horrendous.  Way too low on their legs.  LEGS.  My kids are thinner so if you've got a really chunky kid, you might be fine.  It was also extremely dependent on the belt geometry of the specific car.  The red side belt guides need to be adjustable front to back, not just side to side.  Speaking of which, they kept sliding back in.  My kids have been asked to try many seats over the years and this was a fail for both kids in both cars.  Try the bubble bum or incognito or harmony boosters instead.
Not good for a smaller baby. I might have been more comfortable with this for a forward facing larger child. It didn't have a lot of support for a baby.
My daughter really loves this seat so far. Appears sturdy, will definitely support her better than her previous booster seat. Her favorite part is the lights that are built into the headrest.

Great little booster seat for kids 4 & above, that has a shoulder strap in back, that keeps kids held in, that attaches to the car shoulder strap. Very durable and no complaints from the kids that they are uncomfortable. I now have 2 of them :)

I don’t understand how everyone else’s babies fit comfortably! The angle of the head rest pushes my little guys head so far forward. When sleeping there is always chin to chest positioning. He’s small (20lbs) and I’m already his legs are pushed pretty tight to the seat. This is in the rear facing position so perhaps it’s different when front-facing. I drive a Toyota Tacoma and it is a tiiiight fit.

Lives up to the name...Slim Fit! I have a Pontiac G6 and needed something not as wide as other car seats due to having a 3 year old and 5 year old. So now in the backseat I have a Graco Contender 65, a Chicco booster (no back) seats and this seat. I previously had a Chicco Keyfit 30 and it was pretty tight back there. Now there is actually a little room in between the seats. My son is able to kick his sister somehow back there, maybe because the bottom is more open and doesn’t keep them as separated... but that is my only issue that’s not too much of a concern to me. It seems very safe and comfortable and well made. I am very happy with the purchase!
A great product and well made. works wonderfully.

We have been loyal Britax fam for years. The time came for a booster and I wasn’t stoked on moving my son from a 5 point harness to this bad boy, BUT, the belt positioner helps me know that the belt will stay where it should, especially in an accident if he slides down a bit.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review:
Received the travel booster 3 days after purchase, arrived quickly. BUT its missing the arm rest? I'm actually a bit surprised an issue like this would make it's way through quality without being noticed. Very obvious error. Tried contacting the manufacturer via the number listed on Amazon, and their website but the number is not working. I was able to fill out the "contact us" form on their website.

update: 1/9/2023 - attempted to call both numbers listed by Amazon (again) for the seller and still not working. I have not received a response from the contact us form, submitted on the 6th, on their website.

1/10/2023 Returning, No response from seller, contact form did not work nor did the phone numbers listed on their website.
Horrible. Uncomfortable. My kids reluctantly use when we go on trips. They complain the entire time.

In the past week, my 7-year-old grandson and I have traveled to three different cities with his Graco backless car seat. It has kept him safe in five different private cars and three taxis. In between, we have carried it on two airplane rides and the New York City subway.

I love this car seat! It is comfortable, easy to buckle (my grandson can usually do it himself), and super light. In fact, when I was wrangling our suitcases through the subway turnstile, my grandson was able to carry the car seat himself -- on his head!

I cannot recommend this car seat highly enough.
Bought one of these on here opened box CHEAP... can't beat the quality for the price, that's for sure.  I'd gladly pay full price for it, even!
My kid loves the seat. Very comfortable and light enough to move between cars. Setting up was super easy.

The car seat comes completely assembled. It was kind of tricky figuring out how to move the lower buckle out farther (you have to take the cover off) but I figured it out. I love the easy latch system. Feels like good quality (not too light/not overwhelming heavy). Would definitely buy again!

Our daughter loves this carseat. She is a very tall 2.5 year old, and needed something she can grow in. It is clearly very comfortable, and she is a big fan of the little pockets on the side to put books in. We researched lots of 3-in-1 seats, and wanted something easy to install since we travel a lot with our seat. This is great. Its a bit heavy, as are all seats this size, but with a Travelmate it is super easy in and out of airports. We have connected it to airplane seats, taxis, and multiple kinds of cars and it is much easier to secure than other seats in our experience. Great seat, daughter loves it and I would highly recommend.

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: Had this seat and was in a hit and run accident and it kept her safe so we replaced the seat with this same one. We reccomend it to our friends as well, it kept our little one safe.

Great car seat but huge ! Make sure you have enough space for this. As its recommended to have the seat rear facing as long as possible. This makes most drivers and passengers move thier seat all the way up.

Very nice durable car seat however my daughter is 6yrs old and she complains about the straight up and down back. She's uncomfortable sitting straight up for long periods her other car seat gave just a little bit of recline but other then that very nice.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: it's a lot smaller than i expected and the tray is not easy to get on and off
If you are going to spend this much, may as well add a couple bucks for one with a wheel in front and rear brakes.
Really happy overall. Safe, easy to use. All carseats are a pain to install. It's quite large when rear-facing.

Love the carseat itself, however, the pictures all over the internet make it seem to look more pink than it actually is. It's not as bright red as the Fuego model but does definitely look somewhat red. This obviously will not affect the quality.
Allows room for passesgers and even a middle person between 2 of these seats! Good quality and easy to install and take out of your car.

Well it was my mistake that I didn't read the description before I bought it. My big 6 month old outgrew his infant car seat, so I bought this. It turned out that my son was not ready for this car seat. This car seat cannot use it rear facing. This is only front facing and can be used for one year and older. Now that my boy cannot fit in the infant seat and still cannot use this one, I have to buy another one till he is one. The product itself is great, but for us it was a waste of money.

If I have known, I should have bought 32 Graco infant seat that he could have used up to 32 lbs/32 inches (I'm sure that should be good till 1 year old), and then switched to this one.

The seatbelts aren’t smooth. I have to pull really hard to get them to tighten. They fit my car though. I’ve got two in my Santa Fe and then an infant seat, so three seats across my backseat. The instruction book has a ton of instructions, and for an exhausted mom, they were hard to disseminate. So the YouTube videos were way more helpful and the seats are actually really easy to install. In summary, seats do their job, seatbelts are stupid to tighten.
Have had three of these over the years for grandchildren.  Love them.
This is our second child and the second time we have chosen this product. Great in all aspects.

When my 2 year old outgrew her convertible booster seat the Nautilus was one of my first choices.  Unfortunately it is not great for tall kids.  She has always been off the charts for height and she was already sitting on the buckle at the age of two.  I ended up sending this back and getting a Britax Frontier instead.  It's more expensive but will last longer.

Special Features: 2 cup holders, 3 harness height positions, 5-point adjustable sagety harness, Superior side impact protection, Padded shoulder and crotch covers
Review: Great for my 6 year old with moderate special needs
I have the older model in my car and it is good.  I wish there was more strap room in the crotch area.  My grandson is a big boy.
Amazing car seat worked great
Great buy! Perfect for my grandson

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Great booster seat for travel.  Very high quality construction yet folds up pretty compact.  Great value.
Really easy install and fits great in a compact car!
Grandson says it very comfortable to him, very light weight

We have always been a Britax and Recaro family. Love those seats. But when my 40# 2yr old outgrew his Roundabout and was so heavy that picking himup to get him into the Marathon was a chore I started looking for a 65# harnessed alternative. ( We have the Recaro Young sport but it only harnesses to 40#) After much research and checking them out at the store I found this seat. It is wonderful and my son loves it. He can get in & out easily and loves the cup holder, which is far better than any cup holder on any seat I've used. The only thing that I wish they'd change is the front buckle doesn't have an attachment to keep it from falling back. So when he gets in the seat he is usually sitting on the buckle so I have to dig it out from under him. A minor inconvenience for such a good seat at such a great price.

This seat gets great safety ratings. It is nice quality, but my daughter doesn't seem to like it. The rubber impact absorbing things on the straps are uncomfortable to her and make it a little difficult to buckle her in sometimes.
So there are two ways to install this seat. It has a strap to install using the Latch system, but it can only be used up to 30 lb. The other way to install is to use the seatbelt in the clicktight system. However, as of right now Britax says that the clicktight system cannot be used with inflatable seat belts found in some Fords and Lincolns. I didn't do enough research, and now I have a $300 seat that I can't use. If it was still useable to me, I probably would have given 4 stars.
Not the products fault I ordered the wrong seat. Meant to get a 4 in 1. This seat is great though!
We love this car seat.  Safe durable good size.
very comfortable for my 8 month old !
Huge but quality product.

We bought this to be a second carseat and actually I took it from the USA to Canada and I left it there to be our seat when we visit there in the future (at my parents). It was quite lightweight (compared to our large Britax) and easy to transport. I was able to install it into my parents SUV quite easily. The straps tend to get a bit twisted up easily, but I have the same problem with the Britax. All in all, for the price this was a great buy!

I ordered this because it had good reviews. Positives: Small profile to fit in vehicle. Has latch and anchors to the seat. Can be a 5-point harness or a seat belt booster. The price was good. Cons: The padding is minimal and it's feels like a hard plastic bench. My child complains about it hurting and we went over a bump in the road and he bumped his head on the back of the car seat. With no padding it hurt his head. I ordered another brand of car seat and will be returning this.

Great quality. Installed into Acura MDX SUV a couple of weeks ago. Would definitely buy again. Daughter is amazingly cozy in it. Top rated safety as well- hopefully will not be in an accident to test that though. Only con- is bulky/ does take up a lot of space in back row....
Great product ! Fits perfect in the car , and the kid likes it ! Very good build quality ! Easy to travel , very small
Good value for the money.Looks good too.
Had to have my niece's husband install it it was a bit confusing.

The only reason this didn’t get five stars is because my son can no longer buckle himself. The seatbelt won’t thread through the safety attachment with ease. So I have to mess with it to get it to slide through. But I assume this is the position of my seat belt. This would never prevent me from purchasing another one! This is a great car seat and my son loves it!!
very nice great price!
Bought for nanny baby great car seat
Great

I had some difficulty figuring out how to loosen the straps sincere he button to push down was different than the lever you pull up in my former britax model. Since the call in to Britax's helpful support line, the car seat has been a hit with the family - particularly for my kid. The seat is still heavy to lug around, but I figure this is the price I pay for the quality of the car seat.

I just received this and have not put it in the car yet- I will add more later. tt seems like a nice booster seat and I like the latch system to hold it in the seat, that it can go to just the bottom seat later, and most importantly, it has good safetly ratings both highback and backless. I don't understand the lower stars from people on here because they couldn't find the cup holder. All you have to do is look on the bottom and you will see it and just take it off and insert it in the slot on the side- the manual says not to take it off once it's in place. There are some negative reviews that the back falls apart when transporting to other vehicles. I don't see how this is happening unless it isn't locked into place good to start with. It does take 10-15 minutes to line it up right to the bottom piece and lock it in and then raise the back upright- look at the manual to help you. It can recline some when you are carrying it but holding the back and the bottom should alleviate that. The snack tray is handy and is a little tight when shutting and opening back up but not too bad. The cup holder worked great for the large soft drink cup we tried. I'm used to our Britax Marathon for over 5 years now which is heavy, big, and nicely padded. So that being said, the padding on this seat seems ok/adequate but definitely could be more, especially in the bottom seat piece. I will comment later about comfort level when used in the car. This seat is definitely lighter. The latch straps look short but they fit with my car's latch system fine and after adjusting the straps on the front the seat is pretty snug. I think the complaints on here of the latch straps being too loose may be due to how latch systems vary from car to car. An updated review to come soon.
Good quality..

Five starts because it worked as described.

Used this for a trip to Korea. Total 4 different flights both long and short haul. This thing made it easy to transport our 2y/o through the airport in her car seat without a stroller. On some of the flights we gate checked the car seat and opted for a CARES harness on board (another great purchase) instead.

It collapses easily. It's all metal so the only caveat is careful holding it as you can damage or dent things if you accidentally hit it with this thing.

Some people mentioned this broke on them but I had no issues. Seemed quite solid and sturdy to me. As I said this made it easy to roll our kid around airports and hotels (after arriving from the airport). Served it's purpose well so I give it 5 stars.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review:
This is an awesome thing! We use it for taxis and uber cars around town,or for a ride with someone without an installed car seat. Very portable and perfect for that purpose. Will probably use it with travel as well once I decide not to use a car seat on the plane (this can't be used on a plane).

Update: this was well made and lasted past the expiration date, so we will be buying another. My 7 yo fits perfectly on it and likes riding on it, although it is not our primary booster seat. We use it as above, and it is great to travel with. I have seen both my parents not use it appropriately though, so you do need to take a few minutes to make sure lap belt goes through red thingies on the side of the seat and that the shoulder clip part is adjusted appropriately.
Works great, but hard to install.  The straps the attach to the LATCH system are very difficult to tighten.  Love the cup holder and toy stash pockets.

I am loving this car seat so far! My daughter is 5 months and was almost ready to transition out of her infant car seat. I decided to buy it early just to have it for when we did need it. When I got it and saw how sturdy and secure it was in comparison to my graco infant seat I decided to switch it out! I LOVE how easy it was to assemble!! Great car seat for a great price!
Love

He loves the big boy cup holders.  The adjustable height of the back is great for proper seatbelt positioning between the neck and shoulder.  It would help if the connection to the base was a little stiffer when connected.  Great seat overall.
Product is exactly as described. It is the perfect car seat for my needs
great for the price
Initialy I loved this car seat, but i am not so impressed anymore. White edge is falling appart and its been not year and four months since we started using it :(

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: This seat is beautiful and comfortable for my 10 months old son, I love the cup holder and how it folds in when not in use. It’s a great purchase.

We had the older version of these but needed new ones.  My boys say they are much more comfortable than the old ones, which is great because one is very picky about things being soft.  They’re just as easy to use and store and they love them more, so win win.
Nice and wide for my stocky 7 year old. She says it's very comfortable.
Love the safety features that many other car seats don’t have. It’s lighter than many others I tried. I don’t think any car seat will be absolutely perfect but this comes pretty close!
So glad we bought this car seat. It’s so easy to install, and all the little features, like the strap holders on the side, make life a bit easier while trying to put a cranky toddler in the car seat.
I like that this car seat is latching while other booster seats usually do not.

Hace unas semanas compré este car seat para cuando nació mi  bebé y a mi esposo y a mi nos encanta, porque es fácil de poner, fácil de llevar y lo mejor es que puedes mover el aza muy fácilmente con tan solo un clic, también me encanta porque luce de lujo, y la calidad del arnés lo puedes ver a simple vista, llevamos usándolo ya más de un mes y lo recomiendo ampliamente! Ade

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: We have been big fans of bubble bum seats for years - they are wonderfully convenient for travel or when the kids are riding in someone else’s car. They take up so little space that I can fit 2 bubble bums in a carry on size suitcase with my clothes and a kid’s clothes. We purchased our first seat more than 3 years ago and noticed it started deflating a bit during use recently. We contacted their customer service and they immediately sent a new insert to us free of charge even though it was such an old seat. They also followed up to ensure we received it and were able to install the insert correctly. Great product and customer service!!!

When I got this, I felt like it was overpriced for the item. Having used it, I am ready to retract that concern. We compared this cart to a no-name heavy duty luggage cart. The generic one - not designed for carrying a car seat - cost slightly more and the car seat didn't fit. We have only used it with a Cosco Scenera Next for airplane travel, but it worked great. It's not an absolutely perfect fit - I had to get it balanced carefully before tightening the straps. But once I did that, it was stable. We didn't put our daughter in it, but instead piled our backpacks and diaper bag into it.

This item rolls smoothly and is quite sturdy. The only thing I'd change is that it tends to come "unfolded" too easily. A length of velcro solved that problem, but a better clip would have been nice.
amazing

With a little over a year of constant use, this booster seat is holding up just fine. Just remember when you take the covers off to wash them, do it on the delicate cycle in cold water. The 2 cup holders are awesome. This was a great value.
02/17/2014 - after numerous washes and daily use (and abuse), this seat still looks and works great!
A little to big tho
Great find!

My four-year-old can easily buckle themselves into the seat now. It took a few weeks of both her and I learning how to use it because it’s a lot different than your regular booster seat. Now we are use to it and I’m confident she can buckle herself. I use a thin foam pad under it to expand the comfort but it is safe as we were run off the road recently and hitting the breaks hard on a highway was scary but she had zero marks. *NOTE my 4 year old is tall for her age she is 46 inches tall and weighs 42lbs

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: This is my car after I got t-boned by a car going 75mph. I have 2 year old twins that were riding in this car seat, and the ems workers told me continuously how lucky we all are. These car seats when pulled out had minimal damage (the backs were barley loose) and are really what protected my children. Will be buying again and again until they put grow them!
Recommend for anyone

I love this seat for my 4 year old. It’s much roomier and versatile than her “ grow with me” seat. I love the extra cup holder with storage and I love that it has latches to secure to the seat. So far she’s loving it!  I was a little hard for me to put the cup holders in, but other than that it was easy to set up

Love this car seat! We just got it and I’m happy I decided to spend the extra $25 from the graco one. It is solid, not too heavy, and comfortable. It seems a lot safer than the other boosters I’ve seen.

We ordered these because of their advertised smaller footprint so we could fit them side by side.  Although the bottoms where they sit are smaller, the upper part of the carseat defeats any benefits you get from the bottom as it's wider than even most regular carseats we have.  Not recommended unless you have a very large backseat like in a full size SUV. Will not fit 3 across in a car even with a larger backseat.

Not only it helps us when traveling to take Taxis, Uber or Lyft. It also serves as a booster for dinners in restaurants - and a cushin for the kid to sleep on when we too a bus. So easy to blow up - really 2 minutes.

Quick installation. Love the click to connect restraint and how it self tightens. No more pulling on straps to secure seat. Kiddo seems to like the seat although we had an issue the first day. He fell asleep and his neck was caught in a weird position resulting in a neck crick.
Not designed for boys in mind. The lower buckel when they get big or older cannot buckle.

Overall I like this carseat and am satisfied.  I find the straps a bit hard to adjust compared to the other covertible car seat we own.  The "belly pad" (behind the buckle) also started fraying and wearing out only after 6 months of use. I was a bit disappointed since this car seat only gets used by my 1 year old on the weekends.  However, Britax is sending a replacement of the belly pad free of cost.  I also like the tethers- adds to its safety.

everything they say is true. it was super easy to put in. my son loves it. looks like it will be easy to clean. but most important, the clicktight system is rock solid. i could never get a car seat in this tight with a different system. i suggest that everyone should get a carseat with this system.

Love the easy adjustable straps! Very easy to adjust height of shoulder straps (my 4 year old can do it). Love the new easy release clips for the latch system! 18 month old seems comfortable rear facing. Only critique is the shoulder straps seem too far apart (wide) . Ot seems almost like my son's shoulders could slide up through them. They lay more to the outter part of his shoulders rather than close to his neck. I have several other graco seats that dobt seem to do this. It seems to be alright as long as I  have the chest buckle a little higer than the instructions suggest (above armpits, not at armpit level.
My big boy was out growing  his car seat but to small for a booster this was great and when he gets bigger it becomes a booster seat I love it. Hes a car sleeper.
Great car seat glad I went with this one! It is definitely a space saver!

I have owned two of the Graco Nautilus' as well as a few random seats (my child goes between 5 cars and it's easier to just have one in every car). I was involved in a rear-end collision at 35 MPH (the woman was talking on her phone) a while back while my child was in the car, even though it was my car that was hit, she was uninjured. I purchased a new Nautilus and about a year later was rear-ended in stop and go traffic at 60 MPH (again, the man was talking on his phone) and again my child was uninjured. My in-laws were rear-ended less than a month ago at 70 MPH (severe enough to be taken to shock trauma) and the seat I had in their car was a less expensive Cosco seat which shattered upon impact. I am again in the market for a car seat and because of how well this one has held up I am purchasing three of them as I am replacing the other Cosco seat in my in-law's car.

The base to this car seat seems like it is not complete because when base being placed in the seat it is WAY TOO LOOSE!! Looks like there might be something missing on it because it’s extremely not how it’s suppose to be.

This seat is rickier for my kids to use and less comfortable than I'd hoped. However, I mostly purchased for vacation, and they were awesome to fit in their backpacks as carry-ons. Sad that they are not particularly comfortable for my kids though.  They did ok on vacation, but really don't like them on a regular basis.
I love it the head part can go up or down there’s a deer pull out easy to clean wish the seat covering wasn’t 2 parts but still very comfortable!!!
excellent

Complete junk dont waste your time and money. This seemed like a good idea but is a very poor design makes it unusable and impossible to get a safe tightness with harness points. Have tried in multiple vehicles with no success.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Good for tight fit and travel.  Not good for every day use
Awesome carseat

This is a very nice seat, I wish it had latch, but that's my fault for not cheking 1st, 1 deducted 1 star because I really hate the cup holders, they're not really deep enough, or wide enough to me, my son's cups are always fallin over because of this, it's really annoying cleaning up juice all the time, but i might consider getting a booster with latch, and good cup holders, and donate this seat to someone else in need
Great car seat for the little baby that will grow it with him.
This adjust to child size, its a bit bulky but, looks very safe.

This carseat is really cool and very soft. It's a bit hard to figure out the installation though. The guide videos are a great source. We also have a tiny car so this seat is quite a tight squeeze, but we can make it fit. It's also a bit hard to get the lining off of it to wash. Now that I've done it a few times it's easier, but still difficult to get at first.

Bought this as people stated this was the safest and can be used for a long time. Thankfully and hopefully has not needed to test its safety. Also, like the color and the feel of the fabric. I am petite though with not a lot of upper body strength and in a dodge journey, I have to really lift (approx 5 inches or more than the base of the car seat) my 20 lbs niece just to place her in the car seat---its a lot of work every time. Most importantly, she's not wide. In fact she is pretty average in weight but she's already pretty snug on the car seat. She's only 9 months so I'm worried I might have to buy another one pretty soon...

Con first - a deeper sun canopy would be great (it goes to half-way). The handle requires two hands to move, which can be tough given everything else a parent is carrying. It is also many expensive.

The baby seems comfortable in it. The bottom is somewhat rounded and provides a train-track style sound when you rock the baby back and forth. It's supportive while also being plush (at least moreso than most of the carseats we saw). It's easy to adjust on the fly. Our baby is in cloth diapers that vary in thickness. The easy adjustments make accounting for the changes simple and safe. It's not super-easy to break down for cleaning a major...uh, spill, but it can be done in less than 5 minutes, down to the foam lining. It works great with the stroller & base (as you'd expect), and looks good, too. It's weight is good (not the lightest, but still good).
It's a great car seat!
Great Seats!
Purchased for my employee. She loves it!

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: This was a baby shower gift.
Easy to install. I wanted a safe comfortable seat for my grandson this is it
Quality is great! Great for big kids.

After a good deal amount of research on different convertible car seats, I decided on this. I was so happy with how it looked whe we first received the product. My husband thought that we could have been find with a less costly convertible but after having it for a couple months, my husband has changed his tune. This isn't our first rodeo in the car seat arena being that this was purchased for our 3rd child. I did more research this time around since my son has very bad reflux. My son also tends to run warm and sweats pretty easily. Living in Southern California does not help.

The convertible car seat was easy to install and the fabric was easy to remove for cleaning. It still looks and smells brand new even after having multiple episodes of projectile vomiting and blowout episodes that I thought would have ruined the seat by now. Our son also looks much more comfortable, sleeps easily, and last through long trips in this seat. My only regret was not purchasing the seat sooner. I have even recommended it to friends. It is so easy to adjust for different heights without taking out the seat. I tend to go shopping with my sister who usually brings her daughter along. My sister no longer has to bring her high back booster for her daughter when going out with me. It is easy to adjust the seat for her size. We noticed that my niece easily falls asleep and looks more comfortable in the convertible too.

I love this booster seat for my 4 year old. It has both cup holder and tray which my child loves, I choose it because of the "latch system' and tightening feature. Many boosters that i found did not attatch to the car in any way and were ONLY held down by the child's weight and the seat belt combo. I did not like that the booster could move around in the seat. The Graco Affix is attatched to the car by the same latch system that the infant seats are. It cannot move around and lifts my daughter up where she needs to be while being stable.
Plastic and fabric are very qualify.

This car seat seems like a good car seat. My only problem is that it says it's for kids up to 50lbs and my son is not even 40 and it is to small for him. The straps are fully maxed out and it's to tight on him. So if your kid is on the border line of this one or one bigger go with the bigger one. I'm giving this a three star just because of the not living up to being big enough for a 40lb kid.

My daughter is 5 and has been out of a 5pt for a year now. I was so happy to get her back in one! This carseat worked in my 1999 Grandam (I did have tether anchors put in when I got the car) She didn't like the thought of going into a "baby" seat again but we talked about it and she got to pick her fabric out and now she wants to just drive places so she can ride in it! I used a center lapbelt and installation was a breeze. It was easy to get it in and it's in there so tight it doesn't move at all. She loves the cup holders are always open to her.
Over all I 100% love this seat!

Perfect for my 4 year old.... in my PERSONAL opinion - I would not feel safe having my 2 year old in this seat due to lack of surrounding padding. I think it is absolutely the perfect size for my 4yo.
Great car seat. Have had it over a month and no problems. Going to buy another for my husbands car.

I was wanting to get a better booster seat for my daughter. I was really wanting one with the cup holders like this so that it could easily accommodate different size cups as well as little stuffed animals and such. It is exactly what I needed and it sits up a little higher than her older one which is a plus.

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: Quick ship and good value!

I love the look and comfort of this seat and it looks great out of the box. I have an Evenflo for my other child and I don't like how the harness tightens so was looking for something else. My daughter fits in this seat comfortably. Everything is easy to adjust and I love the harness hooks to keep them out of the way when putting her in the seat. I also like the additional padding on the shoulder straps and the buckle.

However, when you go to put it in your car it is EXTREMELY difficult to latch it down to your backseat! You have to pull at just the correct angle but even so, it is still hard to get it down tight.

If you are installing this seat and there is rarely a chance you’d need to move it, go for it but if you have to reinstall frequently don’t get this seat. I'm going back to one with a quick latch system that's way easier to install
Grandkids love it!! Easy to switch out of cars when getting Grandkids! Love it!!
Loved everything about it

Love the carseat. My baby looks comfy in it. I really like the pink and black with the little bow detail. Easy to adjust and install. My babys sippy cup fits in it perfectly. My baby is on the higher percentile for height so its good to have the extra leg room.
Cute color. It's a little big for my car but we deal with it.

Once we got the fasteners down, it was all adventure from there. I do not drive and the inconvenience (not to mention bruises) of lugging a booster seat around just to run basic errands was frustrating to the point of tears. Our family decided to try out having 2 sets of mifold seats and cases to start, and we cannot be more grateful for the thoughtful design and execution. The compact size is easy to throw into a bag. The little guy keeps one in his backpack for carpools and play dates, and I carry one in my daily gear bag for car service scenarios. And best part...we can keep the clunky booster in the family car!

We ordered this seat on Saturday afternoon (using Amazon Prime) and received it Monday!  The seat is exactly what we expected from Britax.  Excellent construction and design.  Easy to use.  We are extremely satisfied with our purchase, the price we paid and service from Amazon.

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: This car seat is the best! The fabric is a dream to clean.  It keeps baby warm in winter and cool the summer.  All it’s extras make the seat so adaptable and convenient.  The seat is safe, durable, and a piece you trust in.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Great chair! Makes my kiddo feel like she is part of the dinner party. Hard to get stains out of straps.

Seat is very good quality from all I've seen and used. All adjustments feel secure once clicked in place. Child fits in there very good. Usually set the seat up in home and then adjust angle once in vehicle. Have purchased 3 of these for all our vehicles, don't like moving seats in and out of vehicles, and could not be happier. Cup holders are nice to be there but not yet function since she is still to small to reach them. Seem comfortable for child, doesn't sweat anymore than normal. Would suggest to anyone in the market.

Update*** Purchased March of 2018, now it's May 2021 and we have been happy with these seats the whole time. Have not had one single issues with any of the features, straps, buckles, adjustments what so ever. These have proved to be a solid high quality seat for us. Our child is now 4 years old and size is now 45 inches tall and 50 pounds in weight. So she is now starting to come to the end of this seat sizing. So I am now starting to look at seats that will meet her needs going forward. I will 100% suggest this seat to anyone still. Some have had issues with puling apart the cushioning for cleaning but that has not been a issues for use at all. If you are thinking of this seat, I would say go for it.
Acceptable.
The crotch strap was way too short. It was jabbing into my toddler's thighs. Had to return it. We purchased the Chicco Nextfit Zip instead and love it.

Perfect 💺 for baby and kids , nice design ....
Thanks also for the perfect service and fast shipping!!!!!!!!!!
We really didn't want a car seat that disconnected from it's base, but the larger one I bought first wouldn't fit in my car's back seat. This car seat has worked out perfectly!

Great seat.. only complaint is there is no clip/fastener to put the staps to hold them to the edges of the seat when putting a kid in or taking them out.  Our other seat had that and it was a great feature.
Buena silla y económica

I searched high and low for a great car seat for my growing child. It's stylish, easy to install and the attached cup holders are a bonus for small toys and of course, cups. It fits nicely in our medium-sized SUV and is very comfortable for my child.

The only reason for 4 stars is because the straps do tend to twist easily after my child is removed and usually need to be untwisted when getting back in, but it's not a big problem.

I have always loved the side knob to tighten the belts and loosen them up. so when we needed another I did not hesitate to buy this seat. The new release mechanism is a little more difficult but still way better than dealing with a strap to pull. Very comfortable and Baby is happy so I am happy.

I bought this to fit in my husbands matrix. It’s fits but the passenger seat has to be all the way pushed forward leaving no room for a person to sit. However, when we switch to front facing this will fit great! Narrow enough to have someone sit in the back with the seat and we will be able to push the passenger seat back so someone can sit there too. I don’t regret the purchase
We bought this based on several recommendations of friends.  Our daughter is still facing backwards but she is a little more upright in this and very cushioned.

Super easy to install if you have anchors. You really need to push down on the seat when you're tightening it down. This biggest issue I've had with it is when it's rear facing, it's really difficult to loosen the harness.

This is my 2nd purchase of this car seat for our 6 year old. She loves it, bc she can move around more and get in and out by herself. She’s been used to a regular car seat. We kept the top back part on it for now. Eventually we can get rid of that part too.

We love this car seat. After an extensive research process my husband and I decided on the Boulevard and it does not disappoint! It's super easy to install, is sterdy and my son seems very comfortable in it. The clicktight system is also convenient in helping know when the straps are tight enough. We highly recommend this seat!
Baby is comfortable for fairly long trips SLC TO MOAB once a month! It’s slim fit so leaves the pup not cramped up next to it.

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: Super easy to instal and comfortable! It’s more slender than the non-sport, so it fits awesome in SUV Sport.
My son loves it, so comfortable.

I am very happy with this booster seat. It works out well for my 6 year old grandson who I take to school every day as well as pick him up. I was tired of having to be without a booster seat for him when my daughter forgot hers or left it at home. Now I always have one and he likes it very much. Very good investment.
Love this carseat! Much more than the other model my husband has in his vehicle. Very pleased with this purchase.
My 17lb baby loves this car seat as do I!!!

After reviewing a lot of car seats I chose this one. It is really nice but a bit bulky. My son falls asleep easily riding in the car and seems to be very comfortable. Only thing is I wish it had 2 cup holders.
We love our car seat and feel our toddler is safe
Love this car seat. Wonderful quality, comfortable, easy to use, long lasting.

Honestly love this way more than our 4ever Graco car seat. There's just more space and it fits better in our Ford C-max. I put the 4ever in our Lexus and it's definitely bigger than the extend2fit. I love the design and haven't found any issues. I use it for our daughter. She's always been taller and skinny so I definitely appreciate the leg room she got with the extended2fit compared to the 4ever. I wanted to get a car seat that was smaller but obviously not giving up the safety features and how easy it is to install. This seemed to be the best option. Haven't tried cleaning it but I'm sure it's not hard.

I enjoyed receiving my granddaughter new car seat. Loved the pink little flowers, almost exact same car seat as her brothers but pink. Adjusted to when she grows. Small enough to still leave room in my backseat for the middle seat. She sits up comfortable. Good to know she is comfy while i drive.
Very satisfied. Good quality.

Good instructions made installation easy. Hardware and seat adjust easily for easy of use and security of baby.
Select with confidence.
Hard to tighten down on my underweight two-year old. Otherwise quite nice.
Excellent car seat
Awesome

cons:
-Too big for Sedan. we fit this in the center seat and very little room left for any adult to seat comfortably on the either side.
-The cover of the car seat does not stay firmly in place. It comes off easily when i try to lift my daugher out of the seat or try to recline the seat. I can see thermocol padding underneath.
- The grey plastic strapps on the belt is too high and you can't lower it much. My daugher chew off the plastics on both the sides.

Pros:
Recline and Safety.
Easy Installation
nice

We are expecting twins & ordered 2 of these car seats. Love how big the canopy is & how easy it is to zip & unzip the extra covers. The material is great, feels super comfy yet very safe. Can't wait to use them when our twins arrive. Wish these were around when my older 2 were babies.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: I bought this product to carry my 15 month son at the airport. It's such a simple idea, but works great! I put my son on car seat and it was life saving for me. So many people turned their heads to see how it works. Only thing you want to be careful is to make sure not to tip over when you are putting your kid in the carseat. Because it can be bit unstable, depends on your luggage.
Nothing to strap the child in the seat
Great car seat. It's held up perfectly for 2 years and looks like new. Easy to clean, child is comfortable and safe. Love the cup holders
Perfect for travel! We took this seat on a 12 day Europe trip. It is easy to pack in your child's backpack to access quickly for shuttles, cabs and Ubers.
Nice car seat. Cool cup holders. Stylish and functional. My grandson loves it. You wont be disapointed. Lightweight and easy to handle.

Very happy with the Evenflo Symphony car seats!  This is the 3rd one I have purchased between our own vehicles & for grandparents. I love the easy install with the Surelatch. It's so quick & secure.  And my kids are very happy in them!

Purchased this for my 5-year-old daughter for use in my husband's Dodge Ram Rebel. It matches the interior fairly well and my daughter loves it. She really likes the cup holders. She uses them for toys, drinks, etc and they hold things well. It's super light and very easy to clean.
Was great my grandson loved it

I could not give this seat a worse review. It is huge and takes up so much room that no one can sit in the seat in front of it when rear facing. The chest clip was broken by two year old, which doesn't inspire confidence in an accident. It's bulky. It's not comfortable. It's extremely hard to install. And every certified car seat tech I've spoken with has advised me that this is not a recommended seat.
Don't buy it and don't let anyone you know.
Price was good..actually bought (2) so we didnt have to move it from vehicle to vehicle...it is lightweight and easy to move if you have to..
LOve it!!!
My daughter has the pricier model of this but she likes this one much better for baby. Easier to use, same features, great size.
Amazing quality really comfortable, my baby loves it. Really good invertion. Just for the records I have a toyota camry 2015 and it fits perfect.
Nice car seat

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Daughter used it and it really worked out.

I've also used a Graco Snugride, Evenflo Triumph, and a Sunshine Kids Radian.  Contrary to other reviews, I found this seat the easiest to install and able to withstand every day use.  My son started using it at 3 months and has grown easily with it. Big purchase, but worth every penny.

I bought this product reading other positive review on Amazon.
I'm very happy with the overall quality of the product.
The belt system is easy to use and sturdy. The product is rock solid.
Like the cup holders as well.
Overall we're pretty happy with the carseat though the seatbelts are not very easy to put on or take off, it takes longer to get on and off.
Perfect
Installed easily. Easy to buckle grandson into. He really likes it.

This seat is great, but unlike a car seat with a 5 point harness, the child can loosen the seatbelt and move around in unsafe ways. If your child isn't mature enough to follow instructions to stay seated then this seat isn't for you. We've only had to pull over once because of the 2.5 year old messing around, but I was briefly concerned that we would have to get a booster with a 5 point harness.

Other than that, the seat is fantastic. Easy to use, appears to be comfortable and safe, has all the features that make Britax fantastic.
Bought for precious cargo. Grand Children.
Be advise this sit does not latch system

I upgraded my infant car seat to this convertible one and my child loves it! He used to cry a lot in his old seat and that stopped after upgrading to this which feels super comfy.  I like that you can recline it and it is not heavy at all. I bought this about 2 months ago and have no complaints.
Its cheap and it works. Great buy
Very spacious and comfortable for our sweet girl!
My daughter is 10 months old and she loves her new car seat! Highly recommend.
Son is 19 months, 26 lbs and he loves this car seat vs our old one. Seems very comfortable, well padded, harness is very strong and sturdy. Overall a very good car seat for the money.
We love it and Bebe loves it too!
love it :)
Clean lines and fun fabric. Love the double cup holders. Easy to buckle the seatbelt and adjustable armrests grow with child.
Does the job for a booster seat! I like that it hooks into the car so it isn't jostling all over the place
My kids love this
Easy to install and adjust.
Easy to istall

My three year-old daughter (thirty pounds)has been using this carseat since she was six months old, and she has always been comfortable in it. I'm hoping she'll be able to use it for a couple more years. I have never had any problems adjusting the harness. I totally disagree with the reviewer who says it is difficult to do so. This is a great carseat. It is very safe according to the Baby Bargains book, and the price is reasonable. I am about to purchase a second one for my son. I recommended this seat to my good friend and to my sister-in-law. Both loved it as well.

The only complaints I have about it are that it is very wide and it is difficult to clean. Since I am about to have two of them in the same car, I assume I won't be able to put them right next to each other, so I may just lose the middle seat in the back. But I haven't tried it yet. I think it's worth it though. Yes, my daughter has thrown up in it, and I had to take the back apart in order to get the cover off. It seems like it should be easier to remove a carseat cover, but it's possible that doing so would sacrifice some of the safety aspects of this seat. I think anytime your child throws up in the car, it's going to be messy! So at least it is possible to remove the cover, but you have to take the seat out of your car, bring it into the house, unscrew the back, remove the cover, wash it, hang it up to dry, and then reverse the process.

But I like this seat. Did I mention I'm buying another one?
Super nice and comfy

After researching online and shopping and comparing at several stores. I really believe this is a great car seat for the money. I bought this car seat for my three year old grandson, because we needed a third seat and he really loves it. iIt is much more comfortable than the other car seats he had and they were more expensive. The seat has more padding then the other car seats in the same price range and the Head cushon is great.

Being a Child Passenger Safety Technician Instructor working with Law Enforcement and Fire Rescue personnel all over the Country for 30 plus years, I was very interested to see this product as I love to see new innovations in the field of child passenger safety. The quality of the Mifold was fine and the claims were impressive, but it I feel it stopped there. I tried five different kids of varying ages on the Mifold. The belt fit was “ok", a little too low on the thighs in my opinion, but certainly not up on the abdomen. Before we had even left the driveway, the kids had moved forward on the seat to fold their legs over the edge so I had to take them out of it.
In a real world setting, a child does not behave like a crash test dummy and when they have no “BOOST”, which this seat lacks, the child slides forward on the seat to get comfortable. In order for a child to be able to fold their legs over the vehicle seat, they will slide forward, leaving a gap behind them, which in turn loosens the seatbelt. This is exactly what an actual booster seat should be designed to prevent. Booster seats are designed to position the seatbelt AND to boost the child up to prevent the child from slouching or sliding forward on the vehicle seat. The Mifold seems to only address the belt positioning.
I am not happy with the product and definitely not convinced of the safety and will return it.
On time, and nice.

We've been using this car seat for my now 14mo and so far love it. We still have it rear facing for extra safety reasons. Our state allows to go forward facing at 12mo, but we left it rear facing to reduce the risk of injury as recommended by the American Academy of Pediatrics. We debate flipping it forward facing since my child gets car sick and we think it will help but are trying to delay since rear facing reduces the risk of internal decapitation (ie the neck breaks usually leading to death or paralysis) if an accident occurs.

What I like about this Graco is the one-handed adjustment for shoulder harness height WITHOUT removing the car seat or rethreading the harness. After a baby car seat that required rethreading this is awesome! I also liked the extra padding for the head and around the seat for when my child was younger. I've now removed the extra head padding and only have the seat padding. I also like that I can snap each side into the crotch buckle separately - I had a different baby seat that required both to be pushed in together and that was a nightmare with a squirmy child!
I've washed this set twice in the washing machine without issues (my daughter vomited in her car seat). The only negative is that the straps don't come out to wash - I had to wipe them down.
My child at the 12mo check up was the average height of a 22mo. Right now at 14m there is plenty of space for her legs in rear facing position.

Perfect product. It comes out far enough on my sons long legs to fit well. The two cup holders are able to be hidden and he loves that.  Also has an adjuster that comes up the back to clip the seat belt away from his neck. Awesome product and reasonable price.
We took the car seat with us while traveling and it was damaged by the airline carrier. The airline wouldn’t compensate me so Maxi Cosi replaced the damaged parts at no charge! I love this company!

Have used this in three airports with a infant now.  Very easy to navigate through O'Hare, Den, SLC, all of which have a bit of walking. Sturdy, didn't tip over, easy to attach the car seat to and baggage handlers didn't bend/break when we gate checked it. Easily paid for itself already.

This car seat's straps are terribly difficult to maneuver. Installation is very difficult, too. My husband is an engineer, and we read through the instruct upsilons plus watched YouTube videos. We had to go to a certified NHTSA person to finally get it done. I am afraid to move it because it was such a hassle.

For our second vehicle we have the Chicco Next Fit, which I love. I can even install it on my own. It does take a bit of time and is heavy (all convertible seats are though!), but it is way better than our Britax. When we travel, we take the Chicco.

We have been struggling with car seats because our newborn is tall and is growing so fast. The previous car seat was so uncomfortable and as our son was approaching 1 months, it just wasn’t working. This car seat here is the MVP of car seats. It has just the right amount of soft padding for our babu to be comfortable especially for long car rides. Our son is 2 months old and is tall, I love that we are able to adjust the car seat to different lengths (for a newborn this car seat can fit perfectly, everyone’s baby is different but buy extra newborn padding because our babies are tiny when they leave the hospital but will grow before your eyes in a matter of days)!  I also love that our son will be able to grow in this car seat because this is years worth of money saved. I haven’t attached the car seat to the car yet but I will make a separate review for when I do.
I absolutely love it’
Perfect fit for my 18 month old & 3 year old. Ordered the pink one for my daughter and this one for my 3 year old.

I will admit I am a research freak-so when buying car seats I might have gone a bit overboard, but I love these carseats.  My 2.5 year old and my 1 year old both have one of these. They have withstood dirt, puke, juice, graham crackers, ice cream, and are still looking good. They both fit comfortably in the back seat of my VW Jetta, but a 3rd person could not squeeze in.  I have also flown on AA with one, fit good in the seat (rear facing, so we could avoid seat kicking).

Great seat from a functional standpoint, but rattles like crazy when driving over even small bumps in the road. I’ve tried everything to get it to stop, but nothing worked. I may be going crazy with it, but my kid is safe.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: So convenient for carpool!
Would recommend

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Good product And good delivery time.
Color is bright and very nice
Easy to put together.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: We purchased this to use for our 18 month old in her Safety 1st Complete Air carseat. It was amazing! We could quickly connect the seat to our suitcase and our daughter loved sitting in it. It made running through the airport to make our connection so much easier than having our hands full with a suitcase, carseat, diaper bag, and kiddo. When disconnecting at the gate, we were easily able to just put the strap into the front pocket of our suitcase. We considered just checking the carseat so we wouldn't have to deal with it at the airport, but were so happy we chose otherwise. When we got to our destination, our checked bags had not made the connection. Thankfully we had our car seat with us. I would recommend this to anyone traveling with a child and a carseat.
The perfect booster seat when switching from an infant carrier to the toddler/child stage.
my Favorite baby carseat, trust me i own 2 of them.
El producto es muy útil. El cover de tela se rompió el mismo día. De lo demás funcionó bien. Excelente para viajes

We needed a convertible car seat for our 8 month old. I was looking for a seat that was comfortable, safe and wouldn't break the bank. I was really looking for something that reclined so we wouldn't have to brace our child's seat with towels to get the perfect recline position while rear facing. This seat checked all of our boxes! It is so plush, but also supportive. It has a removable insert for added comfort. I like that I can adjust the height of the head support without rethreading the seat. The recline feature is simple and easy. I wish we would have bought one sooner!
I like that this carseat is so customizable to fit baby.
Love it, very sturdy safe car seat.
This car seat is very easy to use, to move the straps and change it from one car to another.  Nice cover.  We like it very much!
love the comfy seat! The Chicco is so much easier to get in and out of the car than our other seats! It is great when they are older, this is his to and from school seat.
My son loves it easy to put together comfortable

This is my 5 year olds new booster seat, so he can be king of the back seat. After selecting a few booster seats that met my safety expectations this is the one he choose. The quality seems very nice, he likes sitting in it and says it is comfortable, and I like the pleasant red color. I wish more children’s gear came in pleasant shades rather than gauge your eye out primary and neons.
great

Safety first. Good deal. Got it in about 2 days!!! My kid is growing fast, but there is still room for her to grow into this.
It’s as described wide... comfortable for my son just wish there was more padding.. back end does hurt as others have mentioned... this is on the back of a Silverado and yes it is big..

My husband and I bought this seat when my son was 6 months. At 6 months he was able to hold his head up and we were able to use position 2 rear facing. In this position it fits in most vehicles. We have used this car seat in the following types of vehicles: Toyota Corolla, Honda CRV (old style), Hyundai, Tucson, Ram 1500 Crew Cab, and Ford F-150 Crew Cab. We did have trouble in the Ford F-150 because we had to use the seat belt method and it would rock from side to side more. This car seat takes up less room then our infant one did and we are vary pleased with it. We have since bought three, one for each vehicle, so we don't have to swap in and out; however, my husband has become an expert and can install it in 5 minutes or less. It's like any car seat the first time sucks and you need to watch YouTube and read the directions but after that it's not bad. I like that the padding is all machine washable which comes in very handy. I have also found packing tape works well to remove crumbs from the cup holders without removing the whole seat. Finally, what's the kids opinion? My son loves his car seat. He likes that he can see out. He's comfortable in it and it stays pretty cool in the summer.  We have taken two vacations with this seat and my son was a champ with the 13 and 15 hour trip. Bottom line, for the money this seat is awesome and we are pleased with our purchases.
The cushion is much better than the cushion of the previous version.

I got this car seat as a gift for my daughter. The car seat is ok to fit in the car and also the safety features are good. My wife is a fan of Nautilus but after getting experience with this car seat she is thinking twice before going for the next one.

Eventually this required reinflating after every use.  An excellent idea but the product must be much more durable.  Until these problems are fixed I would recommend not buying this.

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: This seat by Evenflo comes with a lot of cushion and removable padding which is what allows for the weight range 4-120lbs. For infants you can recline it so the baby is not slouching forward. As the baby grows into toddler, padding is removable to accommodate. As the toddler grows into little kid, headrest is adjustable to accommodate. As the little kid grows into big kid, back is removable and seat turns into booster. It’s really great. 5 point harness is a must but it’s worth mentioning that the child is buckled from 5 different points:2 shoulders, 2 hips and crotch. Buckle is not difficult to handle but it’s childproof. Shoulder straps are padded for added safety and comfort. Color gray is gender neutral and doesn’t get dirty easily. The only downside with having convertible carseat is that you still have to figure out stroller ride for infant. Newborns are too small to only be secured by straps but I guess stroller with the seat that converts into basinet is a solution so that you don’t have to buy nothing other than a stroller and a carseat. I recently reviewed Graco Nest that converts into basinet and back to toddler seat wonderfully. This seat is cushiony and comfortable. My toddler and my 8 months old are both equally comfortable.
Great car seats. We have 3 of them and they fit all in a row! They are very heavy, but well worth the space savings.

I am beyond pleased. Although I should say we have not been on a ride yet I just received it today as a Easter gift for my baby and couldn't have been more pleased. My baby looks like a princess it is the easiest car seat to install ever took me about 5 minutes to figure it out and about 3 to install into my Mazda 5 which is pretty small but fits perfectly. The car seat is BEAUTIFUL, our car is all black interior and exterior so love the nice all purple color. We had a really cheap car seat since we couldn't afford anything else at the time. But now this is like a very high-end car seat comparing to CHICCO NEXTFIT or a BRITAX, but on a very nice budget. We are ready for our next family road trip and couldn't have been. My babies head will no longer be jerking around when she is napping.

I will update to see how well my daughter enjoys riding in this baby!!!!

Also we ordered April 3rd and received April 7th I order the back mirror and window shades and for some reason it said it was delivered but it was not yet I received it so much faster. Will be going on a test drive tomorrow.

Seems very quality, well-built, sturdy, etc.  Is certainly large and cumbersome though, if I were pressed for a complaint, so I wouldn't really plan on being able to move this from vehicle-to-vehicle on a regular basis (maybe ever). Its secure and safe for child. Little hard to understand and fit into a car. But once all set. Its really very comfortable.
Good carseat for the money and it is very easy to clean I would reccommend this car seat for those on a budget

The Mifold is an innovative option for children who are ready to ride in a booster seat (over age 5, has the maturity to sit still 100% of the ride). It is NOT an option for all children. I am a CPST.

Here's what I love about the Mifold:
1) It's tiny and can fit anywhere, it is a good option for three across situations
2) It's a great carpooling option because it's so portable a child never needs to be without a seat
3) It fits my child (age 7/55lbs/48in) in almost all of the seating positions I tried her in
4) It's flat and holds the belt over the strong bones of the pelvis without boosting the child up. This is really useful in cars that don't have head restraints in the back seats
5) It doesn't look like a "baby seat" so it can be great for older kids who are still too small to ride in just the seat belt.

Here's what I think could be better:
1) The fit is dependent on the size of the child and the vehicle that it's used in. I personally had issues in the third row center seat of a 2012 Pilot and the center seat of a 2009 Mazda6. The reason these seating positions were incompatible was because they had belts coming from the ceiling that had a larger second buckle on the side opposite the normal buckle that would not allow the lap belt to get fully tight (see picture). Larger children with more "junk in the trunk" may also have issues with the Mifold because the belt guides must not be touching the child. In a normal booster, this restriction does not exist so this is a problem unique to the Mifold.
2) It's not as easy to use as a standard booster. This isn't necessarily a problem- you just need to make sure you're following all the directions and if you're letting your kid carpool with it, make sure they understand how to set it up correctly too.

All in all- I'm happy to have it for a travel/ carpool seat. I consider it a niche seat for specific situations- it may be just what you need to keep your kids as safe as possible!
Typical good quality from Graco. Design is simple but functional. The cup holders are a nice touch. My son loves the Cars print

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: I have a little hard time folding it and putting the tray on but this is my far the best of the three we have. It is sturdy and perfect for home or on the go

Decent seat for the price. Installation is a little trickier than my NextFit (when it comes to tightening the LATCH) and the straps are set pretty wide. My child is 2 yo average build, still rear facing and even with correct chest clip position and strap tightness I have to fuss with the strap placement at her shoulders every time she gets in. I have never had this issue with any other car seat that I have used regularly (5 so far) and its enough of an issue that I don't really want my husband to use the seat. Whereas in the NextFit he really only has to adjust chest clip position and occasionally strap tightness.

We bought this car seat for our 9 month old son who was outgrowing his Graco infant carrier car seat. I didn't realize how poorly constructed the Graco seat was until I installed the Britax seat into my car and put my son into it. He seems both comfortable and very safe in this seat. He also use to squirm and throw a fit about being put into his infant carrier. I don't know what it is about this Britax seat but he settles right into it with no fussing. I can't say enough good things about it. The cowmooflage fabric is also adorable.
Nice car seat I wish it had a cup holder

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: Perfect .. I used my carryon as a stroller in airport ; although I didn't put my child in it ; I used it to carry two booster seats ...perfect when I arrived at my destination ... Car rental would have charged a small fortune and who knows how sanitary it would be ; great investment
Very hard and uncomfortable, slides around too much. Not what I expected

Purchased this seat about a year ago and have been extremely happy with hit. My daughter is very comfortable, easy In and out of car and very lightweight. Would recommend and will probably buy a second one when my son gets a little older.
I have 3 grands each one in a booster. My grandson loves his dinosaur booster. It lightweight and he can carry it himself between our family cars.
Nice booster, my kid loves it, but couldnt use it on my Odyssey only works in a car that has one seat not two divided seats.

I bought this carseat because my sons other hybrid carseat was too big to fit in the back of my jeep with the headrest. This carseat is a lot lighter then my other one. Love the material and colors (red and black). Easy to adjust and tighten the straps to keep carseat in place. Headrest adjust easily and it's easy to convert to the booster seat. I would buy another if I didnt already have two carseats.

By far the best car seat, everything works like it should and isn’t bulky like others! Definitely worth every penny especially with not having to keep buying new car seats as your child grows. Highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for the best car seat for their money and is comfortable, adjusts easily, unbuckling with out a headache, and extra leg room for your child and extremely safe!!

I love this seat!!! Bought my granddaughter one a couple months back and wanted one to match for my grandson!!! He loves it!!! They will fit them both till they are able to come out of them and just be in safety belts!!!
