Good seat kind of a pain if you have to take it in and out of the car for any reason
So easy to install, very compact, leaves driver plenty of leg room, baby is comfortable in it.

This car seat has been awesome for our two twin girls. It snaps into the base so easily, which is vital since I'm often carrying one in the other hand. Also, they are pretty easy to carry two at a time.

i went back and forth.. should i buy the clicktight or the standard G4.1 Boulevard. I figured..its foolproof so I got the clicktight...wrong! I have trouble with making this too tight and it gets stuck closed. Ive had it for almost 3 years. With my second child I decided to spend a little less and try my luck with the G4.1.. which is the same boulevard without the clicktight... I love it! The release buttons are GENIUS and the latch connectors are  so easy to grab and guide into the latch. Save a little money. hope this helps you decide! I had a hard time choosing.

No problems except for the small cupholders which don't fit some of our cups. In rear facing mode, legroom might be an issue after 18 months, so I don't know about the idea of rear facing longer with just a taller seat... Needs legroom as well as the kid grows.
For 18 months boy it is portable and safe. The thing we dont like is this car seat keeps the child in sleep position

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Loved this little chair. Easy to set up and he can use it as a booster for a long time. My son was a big baby so I was worried he wouldn't fit but it was perfect. Sturdy construction and the table was perfect size for him to pick up little bits.
Love this seat. Super easy to move in and out of a vehicle.

FIt snug to hold my baby as if his being hugged. Very light....!

My only complain is that the head padding doesnt have to same blue as the rest of the car seat
I like the way Fits in the backseat of my truck. it aint too big but it aint too small either. Does the job that it needs to do Was an easy install And easy to remove
Excellent car seat. It was a little hard to get it tight.  You have to really push down on it.  Once installed, it is a great car seat.  I love that it will grow with her. I highly recommend!
Doesn't give a great discription on how to use the car seat in regards to rear facing.

Purchased this as a 2nd seat as my 2 year old daughter will be heading to "school" and we needed another seat for dropoff & pickup. I have installed many car seats in the past but nothing like this... Purchased based on reviews & Consumer Reports.

Seat is light and durable looking. Fabric does look like it may snag easily though. Cupholder and kid accessible storage is a bonus.

Installation was almost impossible on my 2003 Subaru Forester:

1) tried LATCH - I could not pull it tight enough to secure the seat so that it would not move. Upon further examination I found that the tightening side of the LATCH strap had run out of room. There is a strap which attaches the LATCH strap to the seat preventing me from pulling any tighter. Very disappointed that the LATCH did not work.

2) tried the shoulder/lap belt install - I was able to get it tight, had to use the locking clip on the seatbelt but it was almost impossible to get the locking clip on because the seatbelt buckle (when tight) is behind the seat.

After about 1.5hrs of fighting with this seat & a steady stream of profanity, it was in but I am not convinced it's as secure as our Britax Boulevard or PegPerego infant seat that were a snap to install via LATCH.

Summary:
1) The one strap LATCH system on this seat is awful
2) Does not work well in a 2003 Subaru Forester
3) Nice lightweight design
4) Don't expect to easily move it between vehicles
5) It's your kid's safety... pay a few $$ more and get a Britax (which I will likely do and put this one on Craigslist)
We purchased this carseat for our first child and returned 1 year later when we found out we were expecting our second. Secures with latches very safely into the car. Great purchase for the price.
Perfect size for my 45 pound five year old who will be 6 soon. Larger & taller than a few other brands I've tried, which I like.
Easy to put , but uncomfortable for sleeping

It is easy to install. If you have an escape artist of a toddler like ours is then this car seat may just be for you all too. Where the latch is versus other styles of Graco’s makes a major difference. It is comfortable and great for taller toddlers. I feel secure in knowing this is a well made safe car seat for my son and that he isn’t trying to get out of it. This car seat is definitely worth the buy.
I love these. I got 2 for my grandkids for my car for when I have them.
Love it!!!

We hydro planed into a concrete median for a near full side impact. There is next to no side impact protection for a child's head here. My sons head hit the sid eof the chair gard enough to leave a huge bruise and swelling behind his ear. Scared the hell out of me.
This is a perfect booster! So cute and safe. Great quality.

I really like the variable seating adjustments and ease of strap adjustment. We had a unique "spill" that covered most of the fabric while traveling home. I discovered that taking off the entire fabric for cleaning was pretty easy once you took the time to view all of it's various connection points. One item was an EXTREME pain to get off were the cup holders. Once the cup holders were off, it was an easy snap back into place. Fabric was easy to clean thoroughly and dried faster than I expected on our shaded picnic table. That was an adventure I hadn't planned on but allowed me to view the intricate build of this seat. Well thought out and designed (except maybe them darn cup holders for removal HaHa!)
My son loved it
This is a no frills carseat. However having to use a towel to get the correct angle for rear facing is a huge pain and was very frustrating.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: saves alot if space...but with safety in mind
The seat has worked very well; however, the front side screw cover had broken off and had to be fixed. So far, the seat has worked as expected. Thank you!

This car seat is incredibly easy to Instal and use. The straps are easily adjusted for your growing baby. I love that it reclines back, makes for a smoother transition from the first car seat to the bigger kid seat.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Very sturdy & cute BUT...can easily topple over if child isn't sitting all the way back. The base should've been set wider to prevent any imbalance.
Love it, But cheaper at Costco
Very easy to use, just seat fabric tight, I'll get the baby to sleep sweaty.
It’s great for a baby who is wider and wants to sit up a bit more whole rear facing. When old enough I’ll flip her but I cannot review that asks for yet.
excelente empaque , llego en buenas condiciones tal cual se ve en la imagen, responsabilidad al enviar mi producto, Gracias!
Sturdy, well made booster seat. Fits nicely in my 2005 Honda CRV. My grandson can clip the seat belt himself.

I’ve never write bad reviews. I never write reviews in general. But my experience with customer service has been so awful, that I don’t want anyone to ever have to bother.

My husband and I have the exact same seats. His is great. The back support on mine however is completely defective and forces our daughter chin right her chest. It doesn’t matter how much we adjust her seat, the back support is never there. We’ve been going back & forth with customer service for a month now and they refuse to do anything to help. Don’t bother with this seat.
A quality product
The car seat suits my daughter well and looks great in my car.I would recommend this seat to anyone looking for a car.seat.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Light and easy to carry in and out of the car. Kid liked it
Great product but hard to figure out how to install

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review: My son seems to like it which is great, because he can be very picky sometimes.

We had the Alpha Omega Elite for DD1 when DD2 came along and I realized we needed to graduate DD2 to the Elite and get another convertible seat for DD1.  While DD1 is close to being able to just use a booster, I liked the idea of keeping her in harness as long as possible.  Nautilus goes to 65# in the harness, and I love we won't even have to buy another booster (however cheap they are) when she outgrows the high-back.  The cupholders are great, better to be built-in than removable (like the Elite) so they don't stick out/fall off.  The cubbyholes are nice, too, for storage.  My only criticism is that I wish it had the ability to adjust the harness height without taking it out (like the Elite).

I've bought this car seat twice. The first one was involved in a collision and although there was no damage to it,  it's recommended that child safety seats be replaced following a moderate or severe crash in order to ensure a continued high level of crash protection.  My SUV was hit very hard from behind and totaled. Thank God my grandson was not with me.  I wanted to buy this same car seat again because I feel it provides a very safe, snug and comfortable seat for my grandson.  I would recommend this car seat to others.

easy to install, comfortable for my daughter, and comes with the safety of britax.  we were planning on getting a 3-in-1 but a friend told us that this is better for a 2-year old since the straps are lower and the seat is more padded.  we are happy we went with his recommendation.

With our daughter outgrowing her infant car seat, we researched and decided on the Britax Boulevard 70 (2012), which we purchased at a local store and put into our SUV, which we drive more often. When it came time to get the second car seat, we purchased this 70-G3 for my car, only because the 2012s were no longer available at as good a price. This one is in my 2-door sports coupe and it still fits rear-facing and in the center seat. I worried it might not fit there, or that it might be hard to see over when looking in the rearview mirror, but all was for naught. It fits great, and it doesn't obstruct my view at all.

Between the two versions we have, the main difference that I've noticed is that this 70-G3's straps don't lengthen as much as the older version, meaning we have to work a little harder to get our daughter's arms through when buckling her in. This appears to be a safety feature ("Versa" Tether related). Otherwise, it's a great seat so far. She sweats quite a bit in it sometimes (living in AZ), but car seats are not breathable anyway, so I imagine this would happen in any car seat, especially when rear-facing. The head support is plush and this has the true side impact protection, as well.
Love this car seat!

The best car seat I have ever had.

Only con is that it indents the leather seat but it does not bother me because of how secure the seat is.
Great and easy instruction manual amd easy to put together.

We bought these car seats for our twins.  The straps don't twist like with the graco snugride 35 car seats we have.  The boys liked sitting in them.  The material is comfortable.  We are really happy with these.
Purchased for daughter-in-law to use for her grand-daughter, my great grand-daughter.  Her only issue is that it seems difficult to get the baby in and out of the  seat.

I bought this to use in our car child's seat when our grand daughter ride with us.  I always thought if her legs would be hanging, blood circulation might be cut off.  This pedestal fixes that and she can put her feet on the platform and not hanging down.
Pretty awesome car seat
Excellent. Roomy and comfortable.  Well worth it.
Roomy and we’ll put together
Lightweight, effective, and easy to move between vehicles. The only downside is that it wouldn't be comfortable on a long trip. Works exactly as expected though.
Great car seat for my 4 years old. Fits in the truck snug and she fits snug in it!
Great car seat..safe and comfortable
Heavy, but not much heavier than our Maxi Cosi Pria 85. Less awkward to remove and reinstall than the Maxi Cosi too. Our three year old loves her new seat.

Nice simple car seat, easy to clean, strap operation is easy (reason i bought this car seat). Only draw back is that the seat is a bit wider than I expected. I could do without the cup holders however great car seat for the price.

Works as expected.  This is for my granddaughter to use in our car.  Her parents already had two of these (one for each of their cars) so we were familiar with the product.  When you have three you can assume the product is good.
Great car seat! Only complaint is that it does take up lots of space. But it is overall amazing. My 11month old fits perfect in this while it’s in rear-facing position.

The Diono Sit Rite allows the user the ability to easily level rear-facing child seats, placing children at the proper angle.  The dense foam material does not flatten during tightening and installation.  This is a must-have for any rear-facing child seat installation.
My son loved it and looks nice in the car blends right in. Easy to set up.
More leg room the expected.

My 1 year old is big and broad shouldered. This car seat squeezed his shoulders together slightly, which would have obviously gotten worse as he gets bigger. He did not seem comfortable and I did not like getting him in and out of it. I returned for money back. It might work just fine for a more petit kid.
Love maxi Cosi and how the brand treats their customers

So. I bought this because if the safety features. I have not tested them. hope never to test them actually. And I think they are all that the manufacturers say.
However, there are also other tested really good options in the market that would be more friendly for you and your child I think.

I do not regret buying it, do not misunderstand me, however, this is not a 5-star product. some design flows are way too evident.

1. newborn. definitely not suitable for my newborn. she weighs around 8 pounds, 1-month-old. but still no head control. the result in this seat rear-facing with all the things on to get as vertical as possible, a child with the head bouncing a little, the crushing is not "puffy" enough or how could I say it, it does not have enough stuffing at least at the head part, it is too wide! so I put my maybe and she drops her head to one side. that would be ok if she was totally reclined, but this models do not do that, therefore they need a really good Cushing for head control! this is no the case. In addition, even when it is all reclined (at least all it can go) the newborn goes deep into the seat. so the positions of the baby end up really unnatural, the head is not only that stable, but it goes down, her chin touches her chest, that is definitely not good! for a newborn, they need their airways to be totally open.
I am not saying that there no solution for this, you can put some stuffing to rearrange the child. BUT, that would make the seat not as safe as intended! so it is a no-win for anyone.
MAYBE, I am doing something wrong, I have tried everything to set her upright, but if a regular person cannot adjust her newborn correctly in the seat I think something might be wrong with the seat actually the whole idea is that the car seat needs to be SIMPLE to use. otherwise, it does not matter if is made of titanium, it would not protect the child-like it should
which brings me to my second point.

2. installation. it is a pain!!! the 1st time it took me 2 hours to install the seat. the manual is not helpful, I had to look online for some video to see how you install it. you have to pass some stuff with your hand through a hole and then adjust it if you want to rearrange the belts on the seat is another hour, because you need to unmount it. It is NOT user-friendly definitely. which makes me go again to my 1st point a seat not easy to install is not a good seat. however, after you do it 1 time next time it would be easier. still a pain, but easier. I am afraid of when I would have to install it forward-facing.

3. the instruction manual is not good in my opinion, not easy explanations.

4. the seat is rigid, which is good for safety but not for comfort while on a long trip with an older child who needs different positions.

5. you need angle adjuster and straps sold separately. come on DIONO!.

but here are the things why I do not regret this purchase

5. We liked the material, they are extremely good, really good material.
6. safety seems really good and the safety design seems really good. not tested. but you see this not plastic and some foam like a most car seat.
7. many options, one of the few that has together in rear-facing mode.
has an extensor for the together also. just too many things around that could get really messy if you are not careful.
8. it looks like for an older child this is a really comfy car seat.
9. EASY to take around. ok it is HEAVY, but if you get the straps you can carry it as a backpack. really easy to go around! no seat does that.

well we will see how it goes in the next months.
We couldn’t get the tether straps to tighten like the videos we watched, so we ended up using the seatbelt as well. Great car seat, my son loves it!  And he loves the cup holders.
This will be a direct to the point review... we were rear ended by an SUV. BABY IS 100% SAFE!!! Thanks to her WONDERFUL carseat!!!

Very happy with this seat! I am pleasantly surprised with how easy this seat was to install and adjust in my car. Also, how well it fits. I have a Ford Fusion and our infant carrier was a tight squeeze in the back seat. This seat fits with room to spare and my baby loves it because he can look all around. He can be rear facing for quite a while, too! Highly recommend this seat!

I like this car seat, but it takes up a LOT of room. Like I feel like it almost doesn't fit in my Ford Edge. It's also hard to tighten it with latch when rear facing without making it completely un-level. Just purchased a pool noodle to try to fix that. I do like that you can pull off all the padding to put in the washer, as we just had a vomit incident this week. The manual is completely inept at telling you where the pads hook back to the seat, though. I gave up on a few of them. I love that the straps position is dependent on the headrest. You don't have to worry as much if the straps are in the right position, because it's easy to adjust. Love the two cup holders, but my 12 month old can't reach them, so that's more for older kids I guess. It's OK. I would definitely look at it in store though before purchasing.
Love these boosters!!! My 7 year old feels like a big kid but is still safe!! Easy to move car to car. Easy to wash.
Son loves his new high back booster !

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Perfect for my 6 year old! Also the latch is a great idea.
my granddaughter loves her new car seat she can sleep without her head leaning she can eat while she's in it she loves it thank you

This chair has ruined the leather seats of my car even with THREE towels under it!!!  There is something about the way the bottom of the seat is designed that causes pressure and divots in the seat that can't be repaired without replacing the seat covering or seat itself.  Very unhappy about it.
Best buy ever. Our toddler loves it. No more him being fussy since we bought this seat
Awesome deep cup holders, but the little toy/snack drawer is hard to pull out even for me.
Comes in and out of the vehicles we own all the time. Easy to move around if you have a crew cab, also grows well with your child

[[VIDEOID:45d33e0815bf35555455a77113fcefcc]] The first thing i noticed about this car seat is that it came in a super large and heavy box. The car seat I was previously using was a Gracco and it weighed 10lbs-so I wasn’t expecting this. Thank goodness my super brought the box up my 4 flight walk up! When you remove the car seat from the box it has significant weight- which I guess is normal for stationary car seats. So I would suggest having someone around that can help carry the box.

The car seat itself is absolutely beautiful! The color, and cushioning really stand out. The car seat comes with instructions as well as a quick install guide- which I thought was cool. I read the entire manual and felt comfortable installing the car seat. My boyfriend (who is a firefighter) would normally do this but he was away on business and I needed to install the car seat ASAP since I already donated the old one. For added safety I watched a few install videos I found online and on YouTube.

My son is over 25lbs and I decided to place the car seat forward facing. Per the instructions you can use this care seat in rear facing until 40lbs (I think) but I decided to forward face. The installation was very easy. The only trouble I had was that my car is an older model suv and I couldn’t locate where the tether strap anchors were located. After some googling I figured out they were in the back of the seat located in the trunk. So if you are forward facing I suggest checking on that before you try installing.

Once I figured that out installation was super easy!

So far my son is super comfortable and seems very happy during our car rides. Everything on this car seat is convenient and easy to operate.

Overall this car seat is amazing!
I love this car seat, it has so much room and the leg rest is awesome! My daughter loves it too!
Bought one for each of my grandbabies. My daughter and daughter in law both say how secure there babies are in the seats, easy to adjust. great quailty.
Got this one, used for about a month until I need to reinstall it on the other vehicle. The latches are much more difficult to install or uninstall compared to Britax. Not worth the price.
very safe and sturdy car sear. i had a different kind to start and my baby grew out of it . this one seems to be more comfortable for my little girl.
I like the warranty, and it is rated good.

I purchased two of these from Albee Baby and we love them! First off Albee Baby has very fast shipping!

I have a two year old son and he needed a few more car seats because I was tired of installing my Britax marathon in different cars every few days. I bought two gracos so my husband and I each have one in our cars and that way the marathon can stay in grandma's car because it so easy to buckle him properly for her hands.

I like everything about these seats! They installed with latch super easy and the install is so tight, it's as if it was built into my cars.

I love the fit. My son fits so comfortable in these seats and with the recline feature, plus the natural recline of my back seats it makes naps comfortable for him.

Right now he is on the lowest setting and middle crotch buckle slot. I like that there are 3 crotch slots it will make extended harnessing longer easier as he grows.

I also love the 10 year expiration(from the date of manufacture). That truly means this seat will last him until he no longer needs a seat, so now I Will just have to replace the britax marathon when he outgrows it.

I do love the no rethread harness feature as well, it makes it so much easier not having to take the seat out(which is what I love about my britax.

I don't know what some reviews are talking about when they say they can't get the straps tight enough and that it's hard to adjust the straps. On both of our seats it's super easy. Actually it easier to adjust these straps then on my britax.

My son loves his new seats!

I would recommend these and I love our new seats! I'm glad I opted for two of these instead of the britax frontier.

I would rate this car seat 0 stars if I could. We have only had this car seat for 4 months, Last night we had to cut our child out of the car seat by the straps. After 45 minutes of trying to unlatch it in the cold and rain we could not get our child out. This car seat has major latch issues. Extremely hard to latch and unlatch. Last night it would  not give. My husband is a strong man, he actually bruised and made his thumbs bleed in his attempt to get our 2 year old son out of this seat before having no choice but to cut the straps. After that amount of time trying to get our toddler out, our toddler was in obvious distress. I have wrote graco and am waiting for a response. Considering an attorney and contacting local news station! This is a clear safety issue. Had there been an accident or fire our child would have been in serious danger!!! Why has there been no recall on this car seat??!!!!! Graco are you waiting on a child to be seriously injured or killed first??????
Very happy with it. It is comfortable for my big baby.
Great car seat. Only down side is the fastening straps. They are very hard to adjust which makes it difficult to install and remove.

I loved this car seat until I needed to clean it. Anyone with an infant knows how often you need to clean it. Unfortunately this car seat does NOT come apart. The only way to clean it is to spot clean or hose it off.

After really liking the east of the Chicco Keyfit, we went with the Next Fit.  I would return it if I could.  Even after taking it to a car seat check, the pull strap is incredibly hard to tighten.  They didn't understand it either.  And I don't think it's a fluke because we bought two of these carseats and BOTH of them have the same issue.  I have to kneel up on the seat to grab and yank at the strap and it still doesn't feel as tight and secure as the KeyFit did.
Love this but very complicated instructions. Not easy to assemble/adjust at all. But it’s great quality.

Love that it is machine washable,  BUT I  followed exact washing instructions,and still has the back of the cushion rip apart... but it’s the back so no big deal.  Love the infant insert, my baby looks so comfy!

This car seat fits in my Honda Civic Type R! My toddler still even has leg room!! Every other car seat was too bulky, even ones that claimed they were slim or could fit 3 across. The back seat of the civic type r is actually two seats that are bucket size, so it’s actually a little bit smaller than a traditional civic back seat.  I love this seat so much that my husband and I plan to buy 2 more for our other cars.
Grand babies love and my daughter said she will definitely recommend

We are using this seat in the third row of a 2012 Honda Odyssey. Our 9 year old daughter originally said this seat was "like strapping myself to a board" and very uncomfortable because she was used to the recline of her harnessed carseat. However, she found the seat much more comfortable when we reclined the actual seat of the vehicle just a smidge. So it should be fine if you have a vehicle you can adjust the recline of the seats in, but your child might find it uncomfortable if you have seats that are more upright.

The other thing to note about this vehicle fit wise in the Honda Odyssey is that although it extends a fantastic 63in, when in the outboard positions in the 3rd row of the Odyssey (and I suspect many other vans), the slope of the roof/side don't allow the seat to raise to it's full height before it hits the sloped side. Still fits well beyond other comparable high backed boosters though and has a longer expiration than other comparable boosters as well.
We love this booster seat so much that as soon as my daughter outgrew her seat we bought her one. The latch system gives me a better piece of mind when we go on long trips.
Great fit and price.  This is our 3rd Graco Extend2fit, for another vehicle.

Absolutely love this seat! Bought it for my 2.5yr old. He’s now 3 and it’s been great. I was torn between this one and the extend2fit but went with this one since it can also be used as a booster for all stages! Only one down side I have with it is that unless you have it on recline, when forward facing the child’s head flops forward as the head rest sides do not come out far enough to really support their head when asleep, forward facing. When in my vehicle however my three year old still stays rear facing a so this is not a problem when in rear facing position and on full recline or the one just before it. I also absolutely love the basin color! I’ll be buying another for this baby I’m currently pregnant with as well at 1 year!

I ordered 3 of this carseat for my mother in law, me and my husband. It's a great deal for a Britax, which I'm told has the highest safety rating of all. What makes this just ok is that the button to loosen the straps is not so easy to get to- especially when rear facing. I would buy it again.

Love the seat, but within two weeks, the rubber coating on arm rests ripped/ cracked and pulled off. Bummed. I think this is the safest, chicest booster on the market. Clearly there is a quality control issue in this area.

I like that you can extend the seat out to support growing babies, in rear facing position and forward as well.
Also, you can raise the seat back as they grow also.
Nice So far just waiting for the baby to come now
An excellent All in 1 seat for my son.
My daughter loves this car seat!
Great booster seat option, just didn’t work for my car. I loved that it had a latch system and the color was nice. I have a 2010 Hyundai Elantra

We have had this seat for our son since he was born. He hates it! We had to put a towel under it so that it would sit the way the directions advise and his head still falls forward. I had gotten this as a deal on prime day but wish I would have saved the money and just went with the Graco 4ever which is what we have for our other son. I am hoping that as our son grows that the seat gets better for him as we spent a lot of money on this seat.
Great car seat . Think the best car seat on market . Highly recommended.
Not as plush as his first car seat but good as a backup

Honestly, once I saw how it was installed it was pretty easy. I wish the directions were more clear though. Hats off to the fireman who installed it for me! It’s a very comfy and secure car seat. Lots of leg room and I love the cup holders!

This car seat did not work for us at all. I have never seen my husband enraged before until he tried putting our son in this thing. And he's a car seat pro, we have a Diono in our other car and there is no comparison at all. He got so annoyed at the piece of junk he had to cut it out of the truck and put our Diono in it lol. A 100 bucks completely wasted unfortunately.

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: As a mom of 3 under two it’s almost impossible to find a way to get all the kids in the car without a challenge. Three rear facing is even harder. These seats are amazing and I wish I bought them sooner. Really easy to install. They don’t wiggle around like the safety first  seat did in my Yukon.
Sturdy, cute.
Good seat
Very easy to install and use.  Love that it takes up less room than our previous carseat and my 4 year old can get into it herself
Amazing seat. It was so freaking easy to install. It’s a bit large. But it’s perfect!

We've owned  5 car seats combined for our 4 children in the past 9 years and this one is FAR AND AWAY the worst and most uncomfortable. I LOVE the look of the car seat and I LOVE Graco products for their safety and affordability, but DO NOT buy this seat. My baby was SO uncomfortable. The head rest sticks out a good inch from the back rest, forcing my 13 month old's chin into his chest. Rear and front facing it looks like he's totally slouching forward and miserable. We fed him a bottle on our road trip and because he was hunched over and unable to burp, he threw up everywhere, something NONE of my children have ever done in their other car seats. Also when he slept his head kept hanging forward, even in the most reclined position. Not at all safe for his airway. Literally the most uncomfortable seat ever. Needless to say, we've returned it!
Easy to install!
Easy to install

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! This car seat is great! It is super heavy which I love because it feels sturdy and safe. Install literally took minutes. It took us longer to adjust straps to fit him than it did to install it in our vehicle. The clicktight makes it super easy! Tons of side impact protection. Not to mention it feels like it is incredible comfortable!
Warning sticker on the seat gets hot in the sun.
As expected
I love this car seat

This is flimsy and cheap.  It moved all around and we made it tight as we can with our seat belt.  We had to slam on our breaks and the back pushed my son forward. It's snapped into its position too.  I wish I didn't get this and forced to go back to 5 point harness where my kid doesn't  move around in the seat and the seat itself. This needs to be strapped to back of the seat not just seat belt.  This might be good for a 55+ kid. I can't believe it's even sold on the market. We drive a 2013 Honda Pilot and nothing wrong with our seatbelts.

We have had 2 Graco Nautilus carseats in pink for several years now. Each of my daughters used these seats for 2-3 years, before moving out to a highback booster around age 5 and a half.

The other reviews have pretty well covered the pros and cons on this seat. The cupholders and "cubbies" are big pluses. My girls both rode for very long distances and slept in these fine. As my oldest got taller, I found that if we put a footrest (or a suitcase or duffle bag) on the floor under her feet for long rides, she did better. I think her longer legs started to stick out further on the seat and caused some discomfort on 2.5 hour or more cartrips. Providing some support under her feet fixed that problem.

The big disappointment for me about this seat was that it did not work well as a high back booster. As a new mom, I really believed the sales-pitch that this was a 3 in 1 seat and we wouldn't have to buy a booster. Not so. While it does function fine as a belt-positioning booster, the child sits so high up that it is nearly impossible for him/her to reach down to actually buckle the seat belt. If you have the time and patience to buckle your child in each time, this will be fine. I don't. So, when the girls got big enough for booster seats, we ditched the Nautilus and went with a true booster (we got the Turbobooster) and they have a MUCH easier time buckling -- which is especially important when you have to move so quickly when they are jumping in the car at carpool pickup.

Hope this info is helpful!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review:
great product. here's some things I've noticed:
you can fold it up and your child can carry it in his own backpack. super lightweight and compact.
easy for child to buckle himself in.
it's good for traveling, carrying it on airplanes, using in rental car/rideshare cars.
can inflate or deflate in like 20 seconds.
works inflated, as a booster seat (raises child) or deflated as a belt positioning seat (lowers seat belt).
it works great for sports cars with very bolstered seats or tiny rear seats. or 3 across the back.
it also works as a high chair when we go out to dinner.
mine lasted me 2 years (light use) until it started leaking.
I like how easy it is to install but it is way more lightweight than I expected for the price point. It's made from cheap plastic.

this is a very good booster for your child. The dual cup holders are really good addition. my son likes putting his cup in one and then putting his toys or his little bag of food in the other. Pretty decent for the price.
Super soft, easy to install. So far my baby loves it.

I purchased this for my sister who was having twins. I have two children of my own, and used the Graco quattro tour set myself. I have helped my sister out with the girls a number of times, and I have to say I love Chicco. The seats are very sturdy and fairly lightweight. The handle folds up and down with ease. One of my biggest issues is with the 5 pt harness. The Graco was a little tough to undo the belt, but this one is so easy. It clicks together very nicely and is easy to get undone. If I have another baby myself, I am definitely going to be purchasing this car seat.
I like it

This was so easy to install and adjust for my little guy. I was so happy to see the easy push-button latches and I love the little side pockets to keep the buckles out of the way when taking him in or out. I do wish it were a little easier to access the release button to loosen the straps... my husband might have trouble getting to it, because my tiny fingers do... but overall, it's great and pretty easy and quick to recline or adjust the headrest height. Really happy with this purchase so far!

We’ve had it for about a week. It’s easy to inflate and use. My son thinks that it’s comfortable. I’m very happy with it as our travel seat. It is a little hard to unhook the seatbelt when I unbuckle him. I think that is a necessity on a booster without arm rests, but I probably wouldn’t choose this as a daily seat because of it. Day in and day out it’s easy to just run the belt under a seat’s armrests and be done with it. But yes, for travel this is great. It’s more comfortable and easier to use than the folding one we tried.
I like the car seat, but am not impressed with the amount of leg room.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: I have carpal tunnel and it a little difficult to snap the tray on. But that is the only downer.

I got these as my kids are older (so they use boosters) yet they fall asleep in the car a bit. These are lightweight yet provide good protection. For longer trips, these are our default car seats. I own at least 6 of these between all of our cars. For reference, when younger my kids used the Britax Boulevard and Recaro Performance Sport car seats - both extremely well made, but a lot heavier and pricer. These Graco ones do the job for the older kids without compromising on their safety.

This is a very good car seat. It’s our second one. This review is more about the open box than about the car seat itself. I wish I would have bought it brand new instead of open box. This car seat was used. It’s has crumbs in it and what looks like slobber/spit stains. I feel like it was just used for a trip or something then sent back. Anyways, lesson learned. Im going to send it back tomorrow and buy it brand new. It’s definitely worth it. Thanks for reading.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: This is my second BubbleBum Inflatable Backless Travel Booster Car Seat.  Due to the cramped space of the third row in my SUV, having two hard seated booster seats can be a problem for my grandsons putting on their seat belts.  A flexible booster fits the bill.  However, I am confused regarding the pricing of this item.  I purchased it on Feb. 15th and less than a week later the price when down 20%.  Is there any way to get a refund?

God forbid your kid does something kid like such as puke or spill something in this seat because it's all but impossible to get the cover off to clean.  We managed to get it off but now are struggling with getting it back on.  Biggest pain in the ass imaginable.  Beyond that I've never been happy with the harness tightening system on this, it's no where near as easy to use and effective as other systems I've tried.  Save yourself the headache and buy something else
Luv it

This car seat is great and simple. The base is pretty easy to install in the car. Easy to remove. I know there is a new seat available, but we already owned all the other accessories including the single stroller and double stroller that this seat snaps into. So it was great to see the older model still available as a new unit. Saved us tons of cash when adding in our already big set of accessories.

what I love about this seat is how easy it is to install.  The crank lever really allows you to get this seat tight and safe.  I use it for my grandson in my 2013 PriusV.  I use the outer seat anchors and strap it down in the middle seat.  There's a level on the seat so you can see when it's installed properly.  It took a while to get the seat, over two weeks but it was really worth the wait. I would highly recommend this seat to anyone.  The only draw back about installing the seat in the middle and using the outer anchors is that there really isn't enough room on either side of the baby seat for another adult to the seat.  This is only a slight drawback for me because the installation is so quick and easy.

Only had but a week but I love this car seat and so does my little boy he seems so comfy. I purchased this seat because I'm looking to rearface as long as possible and this seat can rearface to 50lbs. Was very easy to install and I love the color we got the coral.
Very nice we love them
Product is reasonably priced with all the safety features of higher priced models
I like the color it’s nice and light sturdy the cupholders good and the snack compartments nice
No secure hooks to attach in to seat.

Why is choosing a carseat so difficult and emotionally fraught?! We kept our slim, average-height daughter rear-facing in her Graco Snugride 35 bucket seat until she grew too tall for the straps (22 months, 22 lbs), then started looking for a convertible seat for her to use for the next several years. After subscribing to Consumer Reports and reading everything I could find on the internet, I narrowed it down to this seat and the Maxi-Cosi Pria 70 based on safety features and user reviews, considering ease of use, comfort, and vehicle fit. I just couldn't decide, but I knew we would want two seats (one for my CRV and one for my husband's Tahoe), so we bought one of each. The Maxi-Cosi went in my car, the Britax went in the Tahoe. I really like them both (and my daughter has no complaints) but I like the Maxi-Cosi better for the following reasons:
--the fabric feels and looks nicer and like it will be cooler in the summer (we live in TX)
--the seat feels much more cushiony
--the "wings" around her head offer significantly more coverage in case of a crash. They also give her head more support. (I was afraid she wouldn't like them because she can't really turn her head to the side, but she doesn't seem to mind so far.)
--the Maxi-Cosi has a nice cupholder and more room for her toys to sit with her.
--the Britax between-the-legs buckle is strangely positioned -- she's almost sitting on it.

Both seats are attractive and fit well (enough) in the vehicles rear-facing. We have only one child, so she sits in the middle seat. If there were more than one seat, it might start to be an issue in my CRV, but she will be forward-facing before we have another kid, so I'm not too concerned.

The Britax does win, hands-down, in one area so far: cleaning. The M-C seat has to be taken apart to get the cover off, and then has to be hand-washed (what were they thinking?!). The Britax seat cover comes off easily and washes well. I know this because it got thoroughly broken in with a spilled cup of milk AND A bout of diarrhea on its very first outing -- UGH! We were grateful to be able to yank the seat cover off with no trouble, hose it down, and toss it in the washer. The trickiness of washing it is a definite downside of the Maxi-Cosi, but we're hoping to minimize the issue by not allowing her to eat or drink in that seat. So the fancy cupholder is just for toys, but that still comes in handy.

The bottom line is, both seats are terrific and seem very safe, and I would recommend either.

I was a little surprised as to how big it was. I figured it would have plenty of room in my Buick Enclave, but when it's reclined down in to the 1 position it is actually a really tight fit!  Please know though that I am 5'9" so my seat is back a decent ways, and it wouldn't fit if my husband moved the seat back to where he usually does for his 6'5" frame!  It will definitely work though, especially as the recline the position up as baby gets older. I haven't had baby in it yet (due in two weeks) but the padding is very soft. The only thing I didn't see that I was wanting was little slots for the clips to go in while putting baby in. It does in fact have these, which I was very excited to find out! I have been driving around with it in the car for about a week and have yet to notice any of the rattling that people have mentioned. The only thing I saw that could be causing this was the top latch connected to the top back of the seat, which I am not using yet being rear facing. It was kind of a loose fit, so I unstrapped it and tucked it in to the pocket on the back of my seat. However, I plan on trying it how it is supposed to be to see if that makes a rattle.  Very happy about the purchase so far though!
We love the seat and how easy it is to put in.

We have a 12 passenger Ford Transit van. One would think that such a large vehicle would be able to accommodate any seat with ease...one would be pretty sadly wrong. The second row can fit anything since it’s got the most leg room, 2 sets of latches and a tether anchor (which is by the door so I’m not sure why anyone would tether anything there but that’s beside the point). But the second row is the coveted row in our family since we have carsick prone non-car seat riding kids.
The third row has less leg room and the fourth the least amount. So fitting anything rear facing is a bear unless it’s something small like a Combi Coccoro...but those don’t accommodate kids for very long since they are so small.
I read in a Transit thread that the Extend2Fit will fit in the third row rear facing on recline #4 without the foot rest out. I was skeptical but hopeful! I’m here to tell you it’s true. The seat it’s in, drivers side, has to be reclined, and the seat directly in front of it has to be upright. But it fits and doesn’t even touch the back of the seat in front of it. There is no latch in that position but I got a really solid install with the seatbelt. I know I need to stow the latch in my pics, just didn’t get to it yet :)
I’m excited to be able to put a rear facing kiddo in the third row of our van and hope that my 17 month old is comfortable in it and reclined enough not to get the neck flop when he falls asleep!
The other features of the seat speak for themselves. Rear facing to 50# is a feat that I hope we can get close to. Gotta keep the kiddos safe!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: We have used this car seat for travel twice. It is very easy to pack for a plane ride, inflates easily and stayed inflated for our whole week of travel. My kids seemed comfortable sitting on them.

[[VIDEOID:c7894210d1ba47208fb14286e0775e91]] Only draw back is that it's pink no other colors were available. Evenflo please send me a boy friendly insert.

Great price, flexible and holds 5-22 pounds. It's light weight too.
Cup holder always falls out.
Perfect, not too heavy and easily installed.
Easy to install and she still has plenty leg until I switch her forward facing. I have a Honda Civic and if I had two kids both two of these would fit comfortably.

Great seat that my 16 month old is very comfortable in. Have it behind the driver seat (facing backwards) and it is a bit tight. I'm 6 foot tall and my seat pushes against the back of the car seat but not terribly and not enough to cramp me or put the cars eat out of alignment. Once it is facing forward it will be no problem at all.  Cup holders are great and kid sleeps easily and comfortably for extended periods with no issue.  Adjustment strap for latch system is tough to get to loosen so just do it before you clip it in or it will make you crazy.  Have the older version of this seat that I call "the throne" due to its size.  That version does NOT fit in my car so kudos to Graco for slimming it down.

Bought this for our 10 month old son. Our daughter has an older marathon that we like. I like the new click tight. It is simple to do but does take a little strength to get it to click! I had to put my body weight into it. It feels secure. He seems more comfortable in it. I love the recline option to be sure it is the right angle for his age. (You need to adjust the recline before installing) I did manage to put this rear facing in the middle and our marathon (made in 2011) forward facing on the side next to it in the backseat of our Mercery Milan. I highly recommend. I also love that it came with the bottom buckle protector built in. We bought one of those separately for our marathon. We also have he britax waterproof seat protectors on both seats.

Special Features: Online Chat via ParentLink, Live Video Installation Support, EasyClick LATCH
Review: Safe and comfortable
I like brand Chicco , I like color , I like this car seat . The child is comfortable, easy to install and likes that 2in1 then you can remove the backrest and there will be a seat booster.
The car seat is so heavy and washing it a couple of time the threading is coming out
I love it!!!

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: pretty good value my son been using this for a while and even though he’s a big boy he can still use it because it’s an as they grow car seat
Easy to install. Seems comfortable enough for my son and hes a big boy. There are definitely no bells and whistles on it, but for the price I'd say it surpassed expectations.

I have the Britax Roundabout for my car and I love it!  I wanted the same safety and comfort that I trust for my son in my husband's truck but frankly I just didn't want to spend as much for a second car seat.  We decided to try the roundabout and I am so happy we did!  It offers my son all the same safety and comfort as the roundabout but it just isn't quite as convenient.  The straps have to be manually moved from slot to slot so I don't feel like you can custom fit them as well as on the roundabout.  Also, the straps don't lay as nicely in this one they can twist and turn so you have to fiddle with them to get them lined up correctly on your child.  Bottom line for an extra 15 seconds when putting your child into the seat and ten minutes every six months when they grow significantly this is a wonderful bargain.
Awesome
Super easy to install

First booster for my son.  He is happy to be free of the convertible car seat.  I am happy that he can buckle and unbuckle himself now which makes getting on our way much more efficient.  The cup holders are an added bonus so we don't have to pass him his water bottle anymore.
Great seat for a great price
Love this!

The handle which allows the carseat to recline at various angles breaks and then the carseat is useless as the baby grows. Ours is stuck and we have had other parents work on it. No luck. Its stuck in one position and we are so angry we spent all this money on a useless seat! DO NOT BUY.
I feel like my LO is safe in this carseat. My LO seems like she  likes it to and seems more comfortable in this than the other one I had.

Great product! Only why I put a 4 stars for “comfort” is the buckle that sits between her thighs hurts her legs but I think if we purchased pads for that then that problem will be solved! Other than that nice car seat and nice quality
Only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because it is very heavy. I really like this car seat out of all of the ones I bought
good

Very convenient to carry with us on trips - can't even compare to trying to cart around fullsize booster and carseats. This would be a 5 star review if it were slightly more comfortable. Both my kids complained about it being very hard on their bottoms; one kid was OK with it, the other complained a lot. Better for short trips than long rides in the car, for that reason.

The price is fantastic, the seat itself is a lifesaver. Really great product.
Ok for travel short distance, but the child needs to be awake and sit straight to use it.

So I have had a horrible time with car seats fitting perfectly in my car. I have an Acura TSX sedan. It’s very small. Most rear facing seats were wiggling and not secure or too large to where my front seats had to be up very high. Just installed this one and it fit great. The latches hold it in place. Also I love the head rest that can be adjusted up or down easily. I also love the swivel cup holders. The padding seems extremely comfortable. It doesn’t take up too much width either. I can still fit my other two booster seats on either side. Love this car seat!

Excellent design and material. My goal was to have a car seat that could be left in the car in addition to the one that would stay in the stroller.  This one is beautifully made with all the options you need. Nice quality material.

This product is perfect for a growing child.  We bought it originally for my 3 year old son who out grew every car seat we have.  I loved it so much we bought another one.  After the holidays we are replacing the other two we have for my 1 year old daughter.  I even bragged so much about it to my friends they bought it as well.  I'm happy my son and daughter will both be able to be in a 5-point harness for a long time.

Side padding on the head area and adjustable back are a huge plus.
The hide-away double cup holders are nice also.
Great car seat and easy to set up!

I tried to install this using the latches, and then the seat belt method. They both do not work properly in the Ford Explorer either. It does not tighten, even when I put my knee into the carseat to ensure the seat belt was tight enough, and the latch belt method.

Special Features: 2 in 1 High Back and No Back Booster
Review: I love the color and my daughter loves it even more. She says it’s comfortable
My son loves the cup holders and we like that it seems very well made and robust with lots of cushion. Looks like it will hold up well if needed.

The strap release button is awful (to loosen straps when getting kid out of seat), even worse than older model of carseat. The clicktight button is too prevalent for something you do not use everytime you put kid in/out of seat, but strap release is hidden. Grandparents cannot figure out this feature. Installation required a you tube video because instruction booklet is not clear enough. I HATE that the fabric is not machine washable. The carseat itself works fine. I feel like I can get kid in and strapped in safely. The kid doesn't complain about comfort. I have 2 of these plus an older model of this seat all in the second row of a Honda Odysseu.

WAY too hard to tighten the straps. No matter how hard I pull or even if I loosen them all the way out and start all over the straps don't tighten enough. You shouldn't be able to pinch the straps/fold the strap fabric and I always can. I wish I hadn't bought this. Now that I know it's a problem I see other reviews here that say the same. Buy something else!
This car seat is amazing! Easy to install, all of the features are so easy to use, easy to clean, so much leg room, easy to adjust. I'm honestly amazed.
The base isn’t very wide so when it’s strapped down it feels very wobbly. I sent them back.
I believe this is one of the best car seats out there I love how it has four straps to Buckle for security

Perfect for my 3 almost 4 year old girl, very confortable and easy to install and adjust the harness. We also have the Graco Nautilus 65 LX but the installation is pretty hard compared with the extend2fit that has the best latch system.
I love it

I bought the Triumph as an "extra" seat (for babysitters,grandparents).  I have a Britax Boulevard in my minivan and my husband has a Britax Marathon in his sedan.  I love the Britax seats, but they carry a hefty pricetag!  I decided to buy the Triumph after reading many positive reviews on Amazon and seeing the recommendation in Consumer Reports.  The seat is very user-friendly (easy to adjust) and it's not quite as gigantic as the Britax seats (the Marathon eats up my husband's whole back seat!).  I didn't give it 5 stars because it doesn't seem quite as comfortable as the other cars seats I own.  But all in all I would highly recommend this product, especially for the price - I paid $105 on Amazon!
Works great
Great size and easy to use. Bought 6.

Amazing car seat!!!
Love everything about it!!!
Worth the money 100%!!
Safe and feel good about the safety and comfort.

The head rest is too bulky, put my sons head at what looked like an uncomfortable incline. I did NOT like the latch system, it would not get tight enough in a rear facing position. Seat moved from side to side no matter what I did.  Save time and just get britax car seat.

Now my baby is one year old.bought it here when hes on his two months.could not stay in it anymore now..its too small for him.i have a big boy!its easy to set in the car.good quality .i Need to look for another car seat for my baby.

works great and has multiple options on how to install it in your car. rear facing was a little lacking in leg room and the moment he got to state requirements where i could turn him around i did because the poor guy was cramped back there and shoes always got stuck on the cup holders when putting him in during the rear facing. love it for the forward facing. its slim but just not as slim as i thought it would be in a 3 seat row you really only are going to be able to fit the car seat and one adult comfortably. otherwise it needs to be skinny people sitting next to the car seat and if there is another car seat you only can fit 2 not 3 next t one another.

This seat is definitely small and compact. Unfortunately it doesn't work very well in the bucket-like back seats of my sedan. Since it doesn't boost his body up, his legs either are left getting hyper-extended, or he tries curling them up sideways while sitting (an extremely unsafe alternative is to let them slouch/slide down so their legs can bend over the edge of the seat). About 15 minutes into the drive to the store (16 minutes away), he began crying and screaming in fear as he felt his leg was being broken. It took a few minutes for the built-up stress/pain on the leg bones to go away.
I read something similar in another review, and it seems like a 'booster' seat is needed to raise the child up so their legs can bend naturally without encouraging them to slide out. This seat does not accomplish/allow that.

It's cheap for a reason. If you can't a afford a better one, then get this, you gotta keep your kid safe. However it is very difficult to install (I've installed several others and this is by far the hardest) and it's just generally the least user friendly one I've used.
Good price. Quality product.
Very easy to install, light weight, and looks great.
Beautiful! Luxurious comfort for my grandson!

Agree with another reviewer that it is built like a tank. However, it just seems like the most awkward design being user unfriendly and uncomfortable for my son.  We started using this when he was 9 mo old almost outgrowing the infant seat.  The straps going around the thigh and buckle between the legs are one, hard to get on him and clicked in, two: too tight, three: the buckle is so wide it does force his legs to be frog leg and I imagine as he starts walking and his legs straighten out it will really dig in.  Ugh just frustrating to use this and I wish I could return it

Nice quality car seat!  I got this for my 6 year-old.  I like it because it's gender-neutral and can be passed down to her brother years later.  Kids love the compartments that can hold 2 drinks AND 2 snacks!  Nice!

I wanted to love this car seat, I had used baby trend previously with my older two sons but this one was very disappointing. It’s very cheaply made. You can tell by the plastic of the car seat, it feels like it could snap easily. Maybe that’s what makes it “lightweight” Especially once comparing it to other brands of car seats it was obvious. The base is also very flimsy when installing into the car, it wobbles and flips everywhere, the tighter you pull the seat belt the more the base flips up on the other end. I do not feel like my son is safe in this car seat system. I wish I could exchange for another brand.

Our daughter was too tall for the booster with the back attached so we opted for this one. It is definitely wider than most but since we only have one kiddo and she has the whole back seat, it isn't an issue.  She says it is comfortable. We got the blue and she loves the color.
Great product but a little difficult to tighten to the seat in my car.

We have a Chico NextFit it my truck and this in my wife's MDX.  My wife went with the Britax based on the glowing reviews and not liking the force it takes to tighten the straps on the NextFit (until you get the hang of it I admit it is tough while hanging out of a full size truck).  That said, after struggling for close to an hour to get this Britax installed and leveled we were about to send it back.  We finally found out there is a line to use for leveling instead measuring the angle as shown in the manual. Why they don't have a level attached like others and why they would recommend using a pool noodle or towel to level it instead of having more reclining positions is a bit bewildering.  For me, after messing around with the Britax, I'm sold that I made the right choice with NextFit.  It went in way easier, it leveled in seconds, our son has more room to grow and stay rear facing, the excess strap had places to tuck it in, and it just feels more secure.  Sure it's a little more work to get him in and out of it, but I already trust it way more than the Britax.

Car seat is great, this was my second purchase of one to replace my oldest's car seat to match his little brother's style. Downside however, is the Taylor looked grey to me in the picture. Unfortunate mistake, luckily my three year old doesn't care. Haha. Anyways, you can't beat the price of the seat. Seems nice and sturdy in my truck, pays to get a seat protector with a rubber style non slip coating. Seems somewhat mobile on my leather seats even when cinched tight. So if you happen to be a color blind Dad, 'Taylor' is pink apparently. :)

I am very happy with this purchase. I received it today the padding is better than expected, it is very easy to install. The insurrection booklet was easy to read and understand, but there is also several instruction video's on you tube. My little guy was happy to get rid of his infant car seat, this one is nice and roomy, but still secure. I have a Toyota Avalon, the car seat fir and balanced perfectly. So glad I choose this one. I read lots of reviews on Amazon and Target, Walmart, etc this one seemed consistent with high feedback marks, it was a few dollars cheaper, faster shipping and if you have prime, free shipping  on Amazon also. .
Nice, but too heavy to move in and out car
Totally great!

My husband is a Certified Carseat Technician for his police department - needless to say, he was pretty picky when it came to getting our son a car seat.  We bought this one for him for his first birthday.  He's a little guy (always in the 5th percentile for his weight and about 20th percentile for his height) and he fit perfectly when we moved him to this carseat the week after his first birthday.  He's now almost 19 months old and we still have his rear facing... it's the safest way to be in the car and he fits just fine still!  His legs are a little bent against the backseat but he doesn't know any different and has never complained.  And as my husband says, he'd rather have a son with a broken leg from being rear-facing than a son with a broken neck from the whiplash of being forward-facing if we're ever in a crash.  We've owned this for about 7 months now and I'm noticing a little bit of discoloration where my son's head rests, but you have to look pretty closely to see it.  Overall very happy!!

PLEASE READ! SAFETY ISSUES!!!!
I purchased this set 14 months ago and absolutely loved it until recall after recall for serious safety issues! One recall was with the connection for the car seat not clicking into the stroller, causing the car seat to fall out of the stroller while in use. If that doesn't scare you, I drove out of town by myself today with my 14mth old and the chest plate buckle harness broke. I called the manufacturer and they are closed for the weekend. I looked up my Warranty with the manufacturer and only have a 1 year warranty. Come to find out, there was a recall for that harness buckle breaking and becoming a choking hazard very recently. I had to find the closest store and drive down side roads for miles to buy a brand new car seat with my baby not safely harnessed !!!!!
This car seat only lasted 14mths! Not worth the money spent... unsatisfied customer.
Britax B Safe, more like Britax Beware!
Easy to install, looks great and safe.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: we find it ideal for day to day, and to take in the house of friends!

They don't install as easily as the previous model. I have the older model from my son which is from 3 yrs ago and the clips are easier to clip in. The newer model doesn't seem to secure. It moves a lot even though the tethers are extremely tight. The seat itself seems comfortable for the kids and the headrest keeps their heads secure. The install is tricky for me because we are constantly changing cars with child care.
Arrived right on time - the recipient was very grateful and happy that she can use if for years to come.
We just got this for our son. He's very comfortable it. its a great quality and I'm happy with this purchase
Awesome car seat! It's comfortable and you can recline it.

I purchased this car seat because of the high safety reviews for Evenflo Triumph.  I first looked at other Triumph car seats at the retail store to take measurements, test the sturdiness, and have a visual on how my 14 mos. old would look in it.  This seat does not disappoint.  I like the convenient knob feature to adjust the harness.  The recline feature is  nice but could only be fully utilized when the seat is in the rear facing position.  The seat itself is a nice design and the cushions appear to be easy to remove for washing.  The only disappointment was that the picture is deceiving, in that the color is not the light beige with gray trim, but actually a light gray microfiber material with black trim.  As far as the size, it is big but so are many others, with the different being a couple of inches.  I am very happy with this purchase, and my baby loves this seat in that she can easily see out the car windows and it is so soft that she is comfortable enough to fall asleep during the long car rides we take.
good build quality and comfortable to my kid. setting up is very easy.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Wanted to love this seat since other chicco products are very nice but the tray is so hard to attach. It requires both hands and a lot of manipulation to force it to snap into place. We have a fisher price booster and that tray can be attached with little effort compared to this.

This review is after 3 months of use. The bad: it's heavy, it's expensive, the shoulder straps twist and never pulls to even lengths. One side always has more slack than the other despite me checking and reinstalling multiple times. The crotch lap button is super sticky, so is the chest buckle. I get that it's suppose to be child proof but it's parent proof too.  My 20 month old is in the 15% for size and I am not sure how this seat is going to seat him as he grows. The thumb hole is stupid. My kid got car sick and it was filled with puke. My husband's finger can't fit in the hole to loosen the strap. I almost broke my finger trying to press the button. The button itself is deep down that hole and if you yank your hand out too quickly with a squirming toddler you can get hurt. I've already tore my fingernails a few times. That stupid twisted click tight button  gets stuck all the freakin time!!!!! I struggled to get the seat down to "click" but it doesn't, so I try to lift it back up, but it won't. It was stuck in between not properly installed and a f-you state. Mind you this carseat came highly recommended, price wasn't in issue for me, I read multiple reviews, watched all the instructional videos online and bought the dang thing. The good: It's cushier than most convertible care seats. I hear it's safe but I don't see how if I get hurt using it on a daily basis, the straps are twisted and uneven and I'm sure my son would be injured in it if I don't take the extra 5 mins to try to even the legnth of the strap. It should take one or two mins to strap your kid in, max! An exrtra 5 mins is eternity.  Basically it is more bad than good. I don't understand how this monstrosity gets such high reviews. We got a Safety first convertible seat for my husband's car. It was a pain to install and not as cushy but I feel better that I can strap him in properly on a daily basis. Don't pay the extra $150 for brand name and the sound of that click. I promise you, you will hear more expletives coming out of your mouth trying to deal with this car seat on a daily basis than that elusive click. I am looking into returning it but the husband toss the box. I may put it out to consignment.

The seat belt buckle is too wide that connects in between the babies legs. It crushes her legs and make her very uncomfortable while riding no matter how much I adjust it. The rest of it is great but because of the leg room, I’m going to have to purchase a new seat smh
great for my granddaughter
Useless with only one cup
Great seat. We have 2
Its broke after months not worth it

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Works perfectly with three kids in one row and for taking on trips to pack in luggage.
Easy
Holds my grandson and keeps him safe

I bought this car seat for my car when my great niece came for a visit with her mom. It was perfect. Not big and bulky like most. Light weight too. She was very safe and comfortable in it. So now I have it for future visits!

I bought this to have available for my daughter when she flies here with her baby. The car seat will last through all his growing phases. It was easy for my daughter to use.
It fit the baby snugly and comfortably.
Worth the price!!
Basic no frills booster. Cup holders can be tucked in. Easy to get in and out of car. Wish there was a tether for the top though.

Mom 3 year old is very tall for his age so his old booster seat that had the straps already made into it would rub up against his neck and turn it red and it was just painful for him. So we bought this one and he loves it!! The seatbelt no longer rubs up against his neck and he loves his 2 drink holders . PERFECT

We are very pleased with our new Graco carseat! Our daughter loves it and it's so easy to get her strapped in and out of her seat with speed. It fits perfectly in the captains style chair of our Mazda 5 mini van and was fairly easy to install. We feel very safe traveling with our daughter in this carseat and love the fact that it will serve her until she no longer needs to be in a carseat. Thank you Graco!
We have been using it for about a year and would recommend it to anyone.  Our daughter spends an hour per day in it and it seems like she is comfortable.  It is easy to put in and take out.
It is adorable, and my little guy seems to fit in it well. My only thing is it seems more difficult to anchor and make stable in my car.
Nice basic seat for the price.  My daughter likes it and so do my husband and I.
So far so good! Great product for the price.

Am using seat for my grandson. it was easy to assembly and he does not have a problem using it. At first I thought he may have a problem as the seat before this  buckled him in tighter. He does not have a problem< and feels more grown up by using the same seat belt that grandpa uses. Good product.

20 lb, 30 in twin babies. I wouldn't put any smaller in this. Seat has a lot going on for such little boddies, even though itsays can go down to 5 lb baby.  Seems comfortable. Seems safe. Good deal. Babies like being up higher n can see out windows now.

You can never be 100% sure when you order online, but this was EXACTLY as I hoped!! The material has a nice soft feel, but appears easy to clean, the shade is HUGE and provides GREAT coverage! The little back and body rest are awesome, exactly what I was hoping.

BE AWARE, it's PURPLE. From the picture I thought the highlights were more of a blue, but IT IS a purple color, It wouldn't bother me to put a boy in it, but it may some!

This is our fifth Britax car seat for our son. I've never been disappointed in these products. They are sturdy and durable, and install soundly in all three of our vehicles (full-size pickup, crossover wagon, and sports coupe). They are a little hefty to install, but that's to be expected with a quality car seat. This will probably be our last Britax, since this one will accommodate him until he grows out booster range. I strongly recommend this brand to anyone in the market for a car seat of any type.
update: this carseat doesn’t secure correctly in a subaru ascent bucket seat. It wobbles a lot even when I installed the security belts. :( great seat but doesn’t stop moving on the seat.

I love this car seat. I looked online for weeks looking for the prefect car seat for my growing lil one. I read lots and lots of reviews on so many different seats that I was almost totally done and was just going to get a cheap one out of Walmart and worry about a bigger one later. I love this car seat!!!!!
Works really great for my grandson 😊

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: This worked extremely well for our vacation.
This car seat is fantastic.  It installs easily enough, sits steadily, and will adjust/convert as our kid gets bigger.

This car seat is pricey but its value lies in how long your child can use it safely and comfort. It’s easy to install and feels sturdy with great release buttons.  My daughter is very pleased with how it looks and how her child is secured safely. The teal is a beautiful color.
Excellent
We have 3 grandsons that we sometimes haul around.  This seat is so easy to adjust to fit them and to install.

We got this seat for our 3 year old moving out of a Britax Advocate. These are our first impressions after a couple of weeks.

It was easy to install with LATCH.
It has 2 cup holders and 2 little square holes behind them from snacks, which is great.
I was worried about the armrests being in our kids way, but they seem very comfortable for him.
The harness (only used as 5-point) is easy to adjust, and has padding at the shoulders. He can almost put in on himself, the straps gets very long, but he can't open it.
Our son really likes the red accents on the seat, makes him think it looks fun, while the dark colors still make it look nice in the car.

I really like the fabric, unlike the Advocate which is cloth, this is more like a clothy polyester like fabric. It is soft and comfortable, but it feels liquid repellant, and you can easily wipe it off. Big bonus!

we have not used this as a booster yet, but so far we are very satisfied.
Definitely worth the money

This seat is quality made.  It felt very sturdy and we liked the cup holder. Unfortuntely we had to return it because it was too large for our seats.  It didn't fit well in the car and it covered the seat belt.

I love this carseat
Easy to install
I bought this because it was on the list for the best top 10 carseats for infants and I wanted a good carseat for our new baby.
The only issue I have had is the red button gets stuck and wont work that's the reason for the 4 stars. It can be frustrating
It is everything I expected it would be. I'm confident that it would keep my baby safe in an accident and that's what is most important!

My 8 month old loves it, now she can sit forward and look out the window. No more carrying her around in a heavy car seat, this one stays in the vehicle and adjusts as she grows. She has more room and fits comfortably even in her bulky snowsuit...worth it.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: This is without a doubt the coolest booster chair I've ever seen!  Unlike other reviews we had ZERO issues attaching the tray and with the dual strap setup it holds onto a chair tightly and securely. Perfect for visiting grandchildren and folds flat for storage when it's not needed. Can't beat it for the price-so glad I made the purchase!!!
Easy to install. Toddler loves the drawer and cup holder. Bought three total. Gray and purple is very light and would show stains. Recommend darker color.
Arrived a day early. Easy to install.
These sits fit THREE WIDE across the backseat of my babysitter's Dodge Journey & if that doesn't sell you on this seat, maybe the fact that it's the easiest to install/uninstall will! 11/10!
Perfect for our 4 year old. Definitely has room to grow also.
I bought this car seat for my grandson. They love it. I just wish you could take the infant seat out and put it in a stroller and not have to take him out of it completely.

We bought this car seat about a month ago and so far it has met every expectation :)  The only downside is that when rear facing the car seat is great but we know when we turn it around to forward face it is going to take up more room in the back seat area because the gray plastic things on the side of it stick out more.  Also I didn't find the strap "holders" useful.  Its just Velcro and doesn't really keep the straps to the side the way the video says but all in all we would definitely purchase another one if needed!

I bought this car seat for use in the back of my 2000 VW Beetle. We normally take my daughter places in our Jeep, and I wanted this for a second seat. I like this one 10x better than the more expensive one we bought for our main vehicle. [[ASIN:B005CG4K6W Evenflo Titan Elite Convertible Car Seat - Camille]]. We have had no trouble with the straps twisting like the other one. I am seriously considering switching the two. This just goes to show that a higher price doesn't always equal a better product!

Bought this for my 9 month old, with the hopes it will last him for several years. It has held up great so far and seems incredibly safe. Lots of padding without being constricting. The belts each snap in individually, which is great because other car seats models often have them overlaying each other before snapping in, which is a giant pain. Our only slight gripe with this seat is that it does not seem to have any declining angle to it. Generally this is fine, but with the kid falls asleep, he's essentially sitting straight up and his head bobs and knocks. I feel if it had just a few degrees of decline the child would naturally be able to lay back just a bit. But all in a great seat.
