I am a big fan of Britax. The strollers, the car seats, all of what I've used by them, I love. With this model, there's a lot to love... The clicktight feature is very cool and convenient. The tightening strap to snug in your wee one's safety harnesses feels way better than any other I've used. The stowaway compartments are very neat. The backside tie-down is well designed. The only thing keeping me from "5-star loving" this one is the reclining feature being a bit tricky, When you install the seat in it's standard position, my assumption is you want to have it safely strapped tight and firm, but this works against the ease of reclining. It seems like in order to recline your little tyke, you'd need to loosen the safety straps, which would require you to raise the clicktight latch, which would require you to remove your kid. To be fair, this might all be intentional and unavoidable for safety reasons and I might be wanting something that would then make the car seat dangerous and defeat the whole purpose. Whatever the case may be, I still think the product is great and recommend it.
Good

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review: After a play date, while the friends were loading up in their vehicle I saw they had these booster seats in the car, and mentioned how they were such big girls. Instantly, my daughter wanted one and didn't want to sit in the "baby" car seat we had. So I had to buy one. So far so good. It installs super simple, and is even easier to uninstall and transfer to another vehicle. My daughter loves it, and loves that she is a big girl now.

I don’t write reviews a lot but I got my 6 month old baby this car seat which came in today I was scared it might be hard to hook up because this is her second one since birth but it’s not only easy to hook up it’s not too big for my sedan car it also have seat cushions that I am loving my baby hates car rides but surprisingly didn’t cry in it today🤗
Car seat for my granddaughter. It serves the purpose and the weight limit is higher than some of the more expensive brands
Good product

It was a little more complicated to install and took up more of the back seat (2 seats) than I thought it would be, but my son-in-law did it for me. It's really pretty. ☺ Most of all, it's very secure and comfortable and I know my granddaughter is safe in it!!!

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: This is an absolute MUST for traveling!!!!  Clipped on quickly and held up amazingly for our trip out of the country with our 1.5 year old!

We just upgraded my 3 year old from her convertible car seat to this seat. She loves the little cubbys to store her toys and also loves that the cup holder holds larger water bottles (such as kids camelback) instead of sippy cups. The fabric looks easy to take care of and take off to wash. I watched a few YouTube videos about this seat before buying it and loved all the features it has-We've always been happy with Graco!

Finally it hit me about my 6 year-old's safety...He was using his functional Evenflo booster seat but he ends up looking uncomfortable in many of our long hour drives here in CA. I never thought Britax could offer a booster seat this secured. I had my first experience with Britax right when he graduated from a baby carrier at 4 mos old. So when he graduated again from Britax convertible seat, I thought I could just grab whatever booster seats out there, which I did.. however there's always a cloud of guilt whether I was doing this right for my Julian. We have upgraded 2 different new cars for more comfort but how could we missed Julian's comfort! Until one day off from work, I started browsing online and bumped into this Britax Pinnacle. I got it on sale too! Click tight system is awesomely the BEST! I have my hubby moved the installed Britax Pinnacle( I did it myself too) but hasn't budged an inch-LITERALLY! This will be the last and the best car seat in the household. Please, parents out there don't miss out on this!
Love the latch

Bought the same seat a few years back for my first. Love that it appears to be the same quality in the structure but a little surprised by the fabric. Seems not as soft but maybe it is easier to spot clean? Pattern is super cute and love the infant seat pad as well as the shoulder indicator.
This booster seat is the cutest thing ever. Ordered it friday got in on wednesday!!! The back goes down very easily when you carry it. Other then that i love it.

Love this carseat. Our son loves the cupholders. We love how it can recline a bit for when he falls a sleep. The material is soft and durable as well as easily washable. We looked at several car seats of this nature and read a lot of reviews before deciding to purchase this particular seat. Could not be happier. Would highly recommend.
Fit great in the car, nice pattern. Wish I would have had this for the other two children.
Great fit for a sedan and a Chicco Keyfit right next to it. His head hangs down when sleeping, but not all of the time.
I really love Britax products but it is really hard to get the straps tight enough on this carseat.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Bought for grandchildren, so I wouldn't have a highchair. Love it. We leave it hooked to a diningroom
It fits great in our Jeep and minivan, easy to switch from one car to the other. I love the way the straps adjust to get the perfect fit on our little man to keep him safe.

I did a lot of research and chose to go with this one based on price and safety. I wanted the Diono Radian RXT but it was way more expensive and new so the reviews weren't out yet. I can't say since I haven't actually tried a radian but I think I should have forked out the extra cash. Yes, the Nautilus is heavy and safe but it is extremely annoying as well. I have a 2010 RAV4. The Nautilus sits up so high that I literally have to pick my 3 year old son up with both arms with him in a sitting position and plop him into it. I end up banging his head, twisting his arm, etc... every other time. He can't climb into it himself unless I want him stepping all over the seats with his wet shoes. Even if he does climb in himself I then have to dig for the belt buckle from under his butt. I'd say most parents put their kid behind the pasenger seat so they can see them when they turn around, why then is the cup holder on the right arm? If there is a cup in there I have to remove it everytime I want to get him in and out. Like I want to juggle a cup when I am already usng both arms to lift my son into his car seat. Also, a lot of car seats are tough to tighten and unbuckle, this one is no different. It was not the "best buy" I was looking for.
Good quality

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: I was gifted 2 car seats and I got one that transitions to a toddler seat during an Amazon sale. 7 days before my son was born, I felt like I needed to get a better newborn option for bringing him home from the hospital. I bought this on sale after doing tons of research. I had a surprise c section, so I was not able to install the car seat. My partner had to with zero experience. He said it was super easy, and he was happy that we purchased it. Our discharge nurse also really like it as well.
The product rattles all the time. It can get really annoying on a long car trip. If rattling metal does not bother you this is a great car seat.

We bought this as an ERF seat for our 14-month-old for Christmas and LOVE it so far! I have a 2005 Dodge Caravan, a 2003 Dodge Ram 1500, and a 2013 Ford F-250 and it's easily installed into each of these vehicles. (In the trucks, we have this seat in the middle flanked by a booster on one side and a Britax Frontier 85 on the other - no problems with fit.) The harness adjusts differently than any previous seat we've ever owned - read the owner's manual and it will explain how to get it to loosen. After much research, we chose this seat and I feel 100% confident it would completely protect our baby in a collision.
Very nice, comfortable and safe!

Me and the wife needed an extra sets of carseats for my parents to take the boys around town with them. Purchased these due to price and reviews and they are good. Better than the costco carseat for 99 ( DO NOT BUY THAT STUPID CAR SEAT!) and much easier to remove. Overall they are very very very lightweight, which is good and bad, but they are easy to install and i feel they are safe.

First, the seat is heavy.. I am not trying to complain.. trust me.. it far exceeds my expectations ..  It was easy to install, and the only one thus far that I have found to go to 100 lbs.  My son loves it.. I couldnt be happier and neither could he.. :)

We got it for a long trip.  Unfortunately did not arrive in time, but still kept it.  My daughter loves it she doesn’t kick the seat anymore and she loves to keep her feet there.  Can tell the difference for sure.
Sturdy and safe.  Adjustable straps allow you to tighten for easy installation into auto.  Appears very safe.  Cup-bottle holder is a nice extra.

Ordered this seat for my son. He is 7 months. We already have the original marathon for my daughter.
- The shoulder strap adjuster is absolutely the most amazing thing I have ever seen on a carseat! When the harness straps need to be moved up as the child grows it literally takes 1 second..no rethreading!

- I use the LATCH anchors, so I cant comment on the ease of installation with a belt, but the lock offs are under the seat padding now rather than on the outside.

- I have camouflauge and find it adorable!!!

- The seat it visibly shorter than the original marathon...I think I read somewhere its about 1/2 inch shorter. I dont think we will make it to 40 pounds RF. My son at 7 months is only 16 pounds but 80% in height. Not that 1/2 inch makes a world of difference. My daughter is 2 1/2 and still RF at 28 pounds.

- I really like the little body pillow pad...my 7 mo old still uses it because he is so skinny. Makes the carseat nice and comfy.

Great carseat. Glad I got it.

We have two of these; one in each car.  I like that this has the 3rd strap near the back of the head to anchor into the back of my wife's SUV seat.  I like that this is adjustable at the shoulder level, and not just the 3 or 4 preset adjustments that other kid seats have.  We chose this seat based upon consumer reports, and they were correct.  It's a great seat, easy to clean, study, stylish, and with plenty of adjustments.  It can be used front or rear facing, so this helps us because we can re-use it with our 2nd child.
We looked the seat, but it was $50 more than other colors.
small enough to fit in smaller areas,  but very user unfriendly, ended up returning,  doesn't provide much of a "boost"
Not made in the USA
Easy install

This is the car seat in my wife's car and she loves it. Install was simple when using the anchor straps and not much more difficult using a standard lap belt. The release and buckles are easy to disengage but positively locked to keep the precious cargo in place. The extras are awesome; side pockets for toys or snacks are a great feature as is the cup holder. Quality materials that should hold up to wear and tear. The kiddo didn't like riding in the wife's car until we got this seat, which makes me think that it must be comfortable. We love it, try it for yourself and see how it does for you;)
Very nice and cute
Best car seat to get! Save so much compared to the 4-ever and get a fresh new booster (without years of stains and blowouts) for under $30 when the time comes
Love this carseat. My baby is super comfortable and has enough leg room. I like the collapsible cup holders alot

I love these for travel for my older (but still below 4’9”) children. I wouldn’t like it for every day use in our own cars, but to be able to throw it in a day bag and take it instead of larger boosters while traveling or for city use in Lyft/Uber/cabs, it is such a fantastic design.

Doesn’t elevate the child, but brings the seatbelt strap to a safe level for their shoulder height. So if your child will be fussy about not seeing out the window, perhaps consider a different option.

These seem sturdier than the Bubblebum travel booster, in that there’s no internal part to inflate (or get leaks, which happened after significant use with one of ours).

I can’t wait until our littlest just needs one of these to travel instead of a full car seat! It makes travel without your own car so much easier.
Lets me keep baby safer by riding rear-facing longer than other seats. What a brilliantly designed seat! Nicely padded and comfy, too!

The best high back booster I’ve ever had and this is my 5th kid to be in one. It is great. I love how it latches and the pull tabs to tighten are so easy. It has so many great features. And my little girl can not get the shoulder belt out of the guide herself which is great!
Great seat! Not a fan of the straps, they fit weird on my daughter
My daughter in law loves this for my grandson.
More spacious and comfortable. My 13 month old daughter loves this new car seat!
If you have a larger toddler this is perfect!
Easy to move. Works perfec.
The gf and I got this for our three month old daughter and we love it. Only problem is that our baby's feet hang off, think is was made for tiny babies. Still love it tho

Great seat. Description is accurate. It is heavy, it is a pain to install the first time, it is skinny enough for small cars, and it is a beast. I love it. Just beware that if you take it out of the car a lot you better be eating your Wheaties because it's not lightweight.
Bought this for my daughter.  She loves it! So much easier to get baby in and out of car seat now.

My son is 7 months old and 23 lbs. He loves his new car seat. This is one that I should have bought off the bat but bought a newborn instead. It doesn't appear at times to be as secure as the ones with a detachable base but it works well. I would recommend.

Lightweight, arrived in perfect condition, set up was a piece of cake and installation was even easier! Perfect for big kids. The price point is great. I'll be purchasing two more, one for my spouse's car and another for grandma.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: it's good for containing small children.
Amazing car seat
This booster seat is very well constructed and I feel very safe with my great grandchild riding in my car.  Was very grateful that is arrived quickly after ordered and in perfect condition.
Looks comfortable and baby fits good, but the two handles to adjust the back are super annoying it’s like having Bells ringing all the ride.

We bought 2 of them for our daughter. The shoulder strap height adjusts super easily as well as the strap length. It switches from rear facing to forward facing easily as well. It is very light and easy to install for the rare occasion that we have to move it to another vehicle. I would not use it for a newborn, though that is my own preference, and not in any way based on a lack of confidence. I just prefer the cart infant carseats for obvious convenience reasons.
This is hands down the best carseat.

My wife has a better brand in her car, she got this one for me because it was a good price.

I've only used this rear facing. Using a lap belt with this thing is impossible in my car (honda accord). The belt does not tighten evenly with the seat and that causes the entire thing to tilt towards wherever the lap belt buckles in.

Also, this thing has straps everywhere. Nicer seats will have spots for you to keep straps stowed when not in use. This one must be very proud of them.

The chest buckle is janky and gets caught on shits easily.

Is it usable? With the right conditions... Sure. Next time I'll put a little more interest in buying a car seat so I don't get stuck with something like this.

Best car seat I’ve very used HOWEVER I do miss being able to just grab the car seat and take it along while baby sleeps.  But I knew what I was getting when I went in on this purchase and I don’t regret it one bit. GET THIS CAR SEAT!

Caught this carseat on a black Friday mark down, this is the second time we purchased this carseat and will repurchase if we need another. My toddler is comfy in this, he moved into it when he was too long for the infant carseat and he'll be good for forward facing this year in this seat. Washes in the washing machine well, I put the pieces in a lingere bag and washed on delicate with tide powder with no issues. Toddler doesn't seem to overheat with the Coolmax fabric.
Used a while , it works as advertised
My 15-month-old granddaughter fits comfortably in this seat, and with little practice, I've learned to secure her in it. This seat will work well for their family.

The ONLY negative thing I have to say about this booster seat is, (with my daughter anyways) her seatbelt holder on either side (at the top next to the head rests), we have a problem with the seatbelt sliding out and not wanting to stay in the holders. It could be just be her being a kid and slipping it out when I’m not looking, so I wouldn’t even call it a negative thing! And the little cup holders aren’t very deep, so cups without sealed tight lids seem to fall out on some corners or turns, but that’s about it!
THIS BOOSTER WAS EVERYTHING IT SAID IT WAS. LOVE IT. AND MY KIDS DO TOO!

I just got mine unstuck! I took the whole thing out of the car to do this, but the gal on the phone said in the car might be easier so you have some leverage... anyway. Hold the top of the seat at the recline lever with one hand (pulling the lever) and with the other hand hold the bottom of the front, as if you’re going to pick up the car seat. Lift and slam down quickly! (I put a foot on the base to hold it down) When I did it, I heard a kind of click and release and the seat rotated! Then immediately put it in the right position so you don’t get it stuck again :) Hope that helps!
May need little more cushion for the childs bottom.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: This booster is okay for short trips, but my rather wide bottomed 4 year old boy could not stay comfortable after 15 minutes. There just isn't enough support.

Look no further, buy this seat!
I do not work for chicco, I am not being paid to write a review. My daughter just turned 4 months old, is 15 pounds and 26 inches long. She fits perfectly and will be able to use this seat until she is 65lbs or reaches the height maximum.
I honestly don't think I'll ever buy any other seat.
This seat was super easy to install in my Kia Sportage SUV. There is also a level on the seat to show you if the seat is level and good to go. The latch system has a cinch thing so you don't really have to do much other than pull on the latch and it tightens super tight. My daughter is rear facing and my husband is 6'3" in a compact SUV and still has room to move the driver seat back and be comfortable even with this seat behind the driver seat. The nextfit is however extremely heavy and is one of the heaviest children seats I've ever picked up but that makes me think that the seat will be super secure in the event of a crash. The crash test ratings seem pretty great, the seat itself isn't flimsy so I honestly feel like my baby will be safe in the event of a crash.
This was the easier car sit install I have ever experienced.  My daughter can sleep in it comfortably and I am happy knowing she is safe.
Best car seat ever!!
Very comfortable

It is hard to install. But padded well for the price and is lightweight. I’ve used many car seats and this one is nice in our second vehicle but in order to get it in you have to pull the latch system and the right angle or it is almost impossible to tighten. But it looks nice and is soft. It isn’t bulky and actually fits behind the seat so the front row people aren’t in the dash!
Me encanto. Muy practico y seguro.
Worth the money and baby looks so much more comfortable compared to other car seats. So nice to swivel.
Sturdy and material of cover is thick. Got the comic, Batman, and Spider-Man for my boys. They love them.

we bought this to use on flights from the east to west coast and it was great. FAA approved and very comfortable for our 14 month old. we wanted to purchase seats for both of our twins but the flight was full so only one had the car seat and one had the lap--- the car seat twin slept awesome and felt more secure since kids are used to sitting in car seats. we use expensive diono seats in our vehicles which are great but WAY too heavy to bring on a plane. this seat does the job and is very LIGHT to carry through the airport. we also purchased the JEEP brand car seat carrier to use the shoulder strap through the airport and that was perfect too. we did use this car seat in the rental car at our destination and it was easy to install. PERFECT if you are looking for a great light seat for air travel. as far as everyday use we still will stick with our super high quality heavy seats.
Great car seat! It is bully but all in all I love it

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: We wanted to transition our son to a big boy car seat from the infant carrier. We had a long trip coming up and wanted to give him a more comfortable ride. Easy to install. Style is nice, I love the colors.
This is a great booster. Exactly as posted.
Nice material and easy to install.  Sturdy quality and feels solid.

I was looking for a booster seat coming from the Britax Frontier 85.  Not even close.  One would ask- why would I even do this?  My youngest is outgrowing the Britax Marathon ( despite not maxing out on pounds or height- in a coat it is impossible) My oldest is in the Britax Frontier and, although, I could keep her in this seat with harness until 85 lbs- I was tempted to put her in a simple booster seat and move the youngest into the Frontier.  From my perspective, is really is hard to consider the Evenflo. The foot print of the seat is smaller than the Britax.  The booster seat requires a small amount of assembly.  I will use it as a back up option for carpool pinches but for the meantime I will keep my children put- but the oldest really likes the idea of being a big girl and using a seat belt...

This is a nice seat. It's soft, and it fits my 18 month old very well. I do wish it had a built in cup holder. The most annoying thing about this seat was the sticker Britax placed on the seat cushion advertising how to turn the ClickTight button. I removed it immediately after opening the package and the sticker left a large area of sticky residue on the seat cushion. I spent a good amount of money on this seat so I found this to be particularly irritating. The sticky residue has already turned into an ugly spot within a week of use (baby shoes & fuzzy clothing rubbing on the sticky residue = black gunk). It's possible the gunk may come off in the washing machine but I haven't had time to take the cushion set off and wash it.
Britax, get rid of the sticker!
Perfect for the price!!!

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review:
Folds flat for storage, which is great, and it's fairly easy to clean. But the straps don't get as tight as I would like

EDIT: So I've been using this more often with my now 9 month old and I love this seat. She did have to grow into the straps, but they work great now. The tray is a little narrow so most silicone baby plates don't fit, but I can make it work with a smaller plate. Overall this thing is great.
Bought it for my kids and is perfect for small cars, easy to use and easy to remove after some practice. Overall happy with but definitely can improve a little bit more.
Like the ease of installing in different cars. Easier to strap child in compared to other brand we have. Head doesn't fall over to bad if installed correctly.
Perfect ! My baby just turned 2 months old , not gonna use until she’s 6 months but I love it perfect fit just what we wanted !
Grandson loves the car seat

My wife and I love this car seat. Very comfy for our little girl, relatively easy to install, looks great, feels very sturdy and rigid in the car. Definitely trust the safety of this one and would recommend it to any parents looking for one.
This seems to be holding up well and also is nicely padded. Love that this will be the last seat we buy for my son.

We switched my son to this seat when he was 8 months old. He was too long for the infant seat so we purchased this one. He has tons of room to grow while rear facing. The color is just as nice in person as it is in the pictures. The only con is the harness! Like others have said it’s a pain in the butt to pull tight.
My grandson is happy with it, easy to handle
Perfect car seat for my daughter.  Love it.
Fits perfectly in the back seat of all my vehicles
Perfect
Perfect for the growing toddler!  This well designed, sturdy car seat is ranked #1 by Consumer Reports.
Easy to install

This booster seat it great. Really convient and positions the seat belt perfectly. My only gripe is that the extender bars do not stay extended making it difficult to remove the seatbelt when exiting. This is why I only gave it 4 stars.

We have the model # 1993220, and our toddler is able to get out the upper straps on the harness. We've adjusted and adjusted. The straps are thread at a really bad angle, and we really regret getting this seat.

My Toddler just made the switch from rear facing to forward facing, and she loves this seat. I love the cup holder and how it reclines and she looks very comfortable in it. when she sleeps her head is supported but will still fall forward if she is not using her neck brace that I got for her.
Over all I like it and would recommend it.
Love this car seat! Super compact and easy to install. Very happy with the make and comfort of the seat

Was a little smaller then I thought but it’s a great car seat and I love the cup holder. My son seems comfortable and safe and I love that it tells you to put the chest piece at armpit level for parents!
Just what my Dino-crazy lad wanted and very useful

Love this car seat! I ended up ordering 2 more for my younger daughter when she gets too big for her infant carrier. They’re the same style as the other big graco seats, just slimmer! Easy to adjust straps and buckle into car.
Love this car seat.  Even better the butt pad comes out if you need to wash.
The cover slips off slot other than that it’s good
We love it and have bought two!!  One for each vehicle.

I absolutely love it and so does my daughter. I had been looking into buying this kind of carseat but a different color but this one was the deal of the day and i couldn't pass it up and i wasn't too sure on the color but i when I saw it in person I actually love it.
My granddaughter loves the 2 cup holders for snacks...it's lightweight/ efficient
Very compact and light perfect for traveling! Son did slide a little on the seating as it's not padded though but definitely worth the money.
Our new born (now three month old) seems to always fall asleep in it.  It is really easy to use and pretty lightweight.  It also works well with our UppaBaby Vista with the adapter.

My son absolutely love this car seat! Installation minus the tighten strap to strap to car is hard to pull super tight.  But I just slip the cover up over the car seat and pull the strap through the hole and it’s so easy to tighten.
good

We bought this seat because we love Chicco and are very pleased with all their products. This seat was no exception. We love how it has several recline positions. Our son is enjoying it as well. It was kind of difficult to install but once I figured it out it has been a breeze since (hint: lift up the cover slightly to slide the seat belt through for the rear facing installation!)
Really easy to install! Attractive car seat, and the lap belt positioning clip is a nice touch.
Perfect for my six-year-old granddaughter.  We have a highback seat in the vehicle also, but she much prefers this one.
Great car seat, especially for the price.
Don't have e any complaints about this. The Dino print is cute! It seems to be keeping my son safe.
Good safe carseat.  Comfy and reasonable price
Fits perfectly for my baby he loves it !!
Bought this for traveling with my 3 yr old son. He loves that it’s a “big boy” car seat and I love that it’s safe and convenient for his age. Lightweight construction makes it ideal for travel.
My son is 18 months and no longer fit in his other car seat. This car seat provides him with much more space and comfort, while keeping him safe.
I wish there were some velcro to hold the harness while seating a child. Every time I have to get them out from under him. Everything else is pretty good!

It was time to upgrade my daughter's car seat as she has outgrown her Chicco Keyfit 30. I LOVED the Chicco seat, but couldn't afford to spend $700 for two Chicco Nexfits, so I did some research on a more affordable, yet easy-to-install and easy-to-clean convertible rear-facing seat. After much deliberation (and asking around), I settled on the Extend2Fit.

The seat itself is plush, sturdy and comfortable for my daughter. She dozed off easily in it. It fits well in the backseat of my Honda Civic and my husband's Jeep Wrangler, though taller drivers in compact vehicles may have to install the seat on the passenger side in order to have enough room.

The Latch install was pretty simple. I had to tug hard to get the seat tight enough, but I was able to manage.

Loosening/tightening the harness straps is not as convenient as it was in the Keyfit, but it's not the end of the world. For half the price of my original first choice in convertible seats, I'm really pleased with the Extend2Fit.

I have yet to try to wash any of the padding, so I can't say it's easy to clean as the infant seat was. This is an important feature to me and the seat does advertise as being easily cleaned. So let's hope it's true.

This was super easy to use, but after just 1 month of use, it no longer holds air.  It's flat every time we get in the car.  Big bummer because my son really liked it.  He said it was super comfy and it wasn't in the way for him to latch his seatbelt.

Love this car seat for my 1 year old daughter! It's very comfortable and easily adjustable in every way possible. I especially like how it 'clicks tight.' Highly recommend. Not to mention the safety rating on the car seats are incredible.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: So easy to install and use.

I like the convenience of the latch system on this booster because it keeps it from sliding around and losing the buckle.  You won't like it if you move your booster from car to car, but ours stays put in one car.
I *LOVE* this car seat. It was so easy to install, and my 2 year old daughter is incredibly comfortable in it. Material is easy to clean. Super happy with it, great quality for the price.

I met a lady at my library and she saw these car seats in my van and said that her child was saved from a nasty car crash from this seat. I'm glad I bought safe seats and it was good to hear her story. Recommended.

This car seat is so versatile, even the safety inspectors at the police installation event were impressed. This carseat can take a beating from a toddler, but is also very padded and comfortable for long car trips for both rear facing infants, and forward facing toddlers. The cover is also easy to wash, and it's so nice to have a second base in our other car so we can easily move the seat from one vehicle to the other. It is quite heavy, so moving it from one base to another can be a little challenging, but the safety ratings make it totally worth it! I also love that once the base is installed, the seat goes between rear and forward facing without ever having to change the base. I can't see us ever needing to buy another carseat now that we have this one, but if we did, we would come back and buy this one again!

Had this seat for almost a year and was never able to properly install it. I’ve had multiple people try to install it and get it to stop moving from side to side however none of them were able to fix it. Invest in a Graco or anything else really. I should have listened to all the reviews saying that this seat wouldn’t install for them either no matter what.

My son loves it. The cup holder gets knocked off easily, but other than that, it's the easiest to install and take out quickly and it's really comfortable. I appreciate the ease with the cover, no struggle to take off to wash.

Great car seat, very safe, easy to install. I did it by myself in about 10 minutes. Great quality, roomy (we just took a 10 hour one way trip and he was very comfortable in it and slept no problem without even reclining it) It's a big car seat so I am not sure how much room it will take in a small car but in my MDX fits perfectly even with adults seating on either the side. It's high and he loves it because he can see all around him. This is my second Britax and I wouldn't purchase any other car seat!

This product is well built and easy to install. It gets really hot though, which is a big problem where I live so that's not good. I find myself having to put a thin sheet or blanket under my child when I want to take him out of the car but keep him in the car seat.

I wanted a seat that would last a very long time for my boy. I have used a few different seats before I gave in and tried this one. The most important thing for me was that his head does not fall forward when he falls asleep in the car. He is forward facing (over 18kg). The material is nice and the seat very plush. I would want to sit in it if I could. Installing it was a little hard but I found some great tips in the questions section that made it easier.  The seat is also nice and wide with enough room for them grow. I am saving up for another.
I love this car set ordered one in pink and one in mint green for my twins. Happy kids, happy mom!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: GREAT for traveling and inner city taxing, AND, it helped with getting a few more miles out of our stroller with baby long legs while traveling!

Very easy to install, looks great and seems very sturdy. We have Grace products and it is a good brand we trust. I don’t have any complaints, can’t comment on the durability because we have only had a few months.

This car seat seems comfy for my little guy to sit in.
My major complaint is the little pieces sticking out on the sides where the lap belt can go through. When I carry the car seat on my arm it’s normally rested against my leg as I’m walking. I seriously have like 10-15 little dot bruises on both legs from the plastic pieces sticking out the side of the car seat. I would not buy again or recommend to anyone else.
It also gets stuck in the base when trying to take it out of the car, you have to kind of jerk it and grab the bottom and lift while holding the release on the back.

[[VIDEOID:7d6d7e8ff8c11632b36217b7a32e7589]] We tried this and one other compact booster for 2 our kids, both of kids said this one is too hard to seat on and uncomfortable, and it is! All the instructions about putting belt properly are for adults, you have to teach kids it for a 30 mins, can you imagine this? It's not easy and intuitive. Returned.

I was having back issues all throughout my pregnancy and it never went away afterwards. This car seat swivels so it's super easy to load up your baby and to pull them out. I did need a little bit of installation help from someone who had already installed another one of these seats in a different car, but we were done in under an hour from start to finish. The installation booklet is kind of vague on details, but there is a video on YouTube from the company that does a better job of showing you what to do.

Big pro: The inserts and cover are really easy to take off and figure out how to put back on after a wash. I think there were only four or five main pieces. Other car seats are like a 500 piece puzzle.
Very easy to get the boy in and out of the seat.  It insalled easily as well.
This car seat is awesome! I love that it has a cup holder and also has little storage compartments on either side of his legs where he can put some toys or snacks. He loves this seat!

Just be aware that it does not have the additional leg room on the trueshield model

I thought I was getting an extend 2 fit with the added Trueshield impact protection but I noticed on install that it does not have the leg room extension.

This is a nice car seat, it cleans well and my toddler does not mind getting in it at all. She sat comfortable for 2 hr time spans in the car with short stretch breaks while on vacation and still willingly climbs in on her own.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: I purchased two of these booster seats for my granddaughters.  Their parents already owned this same item, so it was an easy choice.  My only complaint is the way they were shipped in two separate shipments.  The first one arrived and the second one arrived later, even though tracking was showing it had been delivered. NOT!  Anyway, it's a great product, but mine were shipped separately and that bears watching.

This seat is so easy to use! My 16 month old grandson helps to snap himself into it. He seems to be very comfortable in it and the price is comfortable for us. The safety rating was good too and that is vital!
Great for traveling. Compact and easy to use. Fell in love with them right away. Beats the hassle of larger car seats or booster chairs. Smaller than the inflatable options. Perfect for Uber/Lyft.

I hate this car seat enough to leave a review which is rare for me. We bought this car seat because it was on sale and needed a second one for our other car. It is thee biggest pain in the butt to install.
great
I have 3 children total and the other two have full size graco 4ever seats. And this slim seat fits perfectly in between.
This was a great investment for our first child! It is so simple to set up with the bases if each of our vehicles. The only thing I wish is that the seat was a tad lighter.
This has been the most cumbersome baby seat we have dealt with. whenever we try to put the shoulder straps on our daughter it's such a pain to get more slack.
durable, easy to keep clean, comfy for the kids - great buy! don't think twice about this one. the cup holder comes in handy as well.
I expected at least one seat belt.

I don't think I've ever previously felt comfortably with my children sitting in any car seat but this certainly takes the cake for making me feel confident and comfortable. Should we ever get into an accident, I have no doubts that our children will be protected. This thing is solidly built and offers so much protection it's almost ludicrous. I love it.

In terms of ease of use, it feels well built and I haven't had any reason to complain. I'm glad we purchased this car seat.
Excellent
The car seat didn't feel secure after following directions on the seat and you tube.  Had to purchase another car seat of another brand and it worked great.

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: Looking into car this seemed to be the best reviewed one in a more friendly budget range, and it delivered.  Everything was easy about it.  Changing the straps as my daughter had added was simple, removing the base and inserting the base was simple.  It has everything you need at a good price.  We also got the Caddy for this which works perfect with it.
Great for my kid as a spare car seat (for when we travel or my friends want to take her somewhere).
Would not fit three across as stated but definitely good quality and worth the money if you need one or two but not 3
Very functional and convenient, arrived at the right time and place😊

This thing rocks. Easiest "in and out" car seat we have used. Comfy for kiddo and easy to clean. Good sturdy straps. Just a great transitional chair. Might not work if you want a seat for rear-facing pre-walkers. We liked the Graco car seat that you could detach from the base for our pre-walker. This seat is great for toddlers.

This seat is really big! I have an 07 Toyota 4-Runner & rear facing is do-able but really tight! It fits better when it's forward facing but takes over the part of the seat next to it. Would be good for mini van or larger suv but wouldn't recommend for a car. The design is so cute (apples) and my baby LOVES the new ride.

This chair is a Waste of money and a big safety concern, for me. The hood and handle are very stiff and flimsy. . Very easily damaged. The seat belt seems as if it was made for a tiny toy baby. . Very short and frustrating to try to secure newborn baby in.
This car seat is very easy to install and move from vehicle to vehicle. Cup holders are good size and convenient. Love how the seatbelt holder holds the seatbelt secure

Ordered three of them.
Perfect for growing child.
Great product, kids are happy to have new car seats.
Great seat! However very hard to disassemble and reassemble

The car seat I really wanted wouldn't deliver to an APO, but this one is good.
Pros:
it will fit a tall child
has a cup holder
can use be up to 100lbs
will deliver to APO address
Cons:
the cup holder is not removable and cannot change sides
the crotch strap won't last until 65 lbs (for my child)
My issue is where the seat belt buckles from the crotch area. My kid is 4.5 years, 43 inches tall and 40 lbs. he has plenty of room in the head and torso area, but the crotch strap won't fit him much longer. Ideally I'd like to use the 5 point harness until he is at least 5. I'm sad about this because I bought this car seat to replace one he grew out of. If using the 5 point harness is not an issue after 4.5 years or 65 lbs then it is not a worry. My child sometimes tries to escape which is why I like using the 5 point harness. Graco if you read these reviews try to increase the distance the crotch strap goes for older children. I'd do it myself, but I don't want to jeopardize my child's safety.

Update: If the Frontier (my first choice) would have delivered to my APO address that is the one I would have bought. I'm saying this now because quite frankly my friend's frontier is holding up better than this Graco. This one is okay, maybe it is better for a petite girl, but it doesn't have the same shoulder height or distance in the crotch area however width wise it works fine. My friend's tall six year old can still buckle up in his Frontier. I had to remove the harness for my five year old and I had to cut out the crotch strap (the only way to get it out) because my kid was doing stupid things while playing with it. I also hate where the water bottle goes. I have to bend over it to buckle my kid in and it hurts getting a water bottle poking in my chest. If my kid followed instructions I could have him hold it and put it in the cup holder afterward, but I'm not going to put it on the driveway only for it to rollaway as I stand on my tip toes to buckle the kid in, or place it on the floor only to be kicked in the head when I retrieve it. It would be nicer if I could have chose where the cup holder went or if it was on both sides because then I would still have a choice.
Also I had to remove the harness When my son was 5 yrs and 45 inches tall (OCT 2013) because the chest and crotch straps were too tight. I hope this review can help a parent if they are looking for a car seat for an older child. Currently my child is 5.5 and can unbuckle himself, but our rule is only when the engine turns off. Somehow he follows that rule.
For my god daughter
Awesome, very safe car seat
Super easy and looks nice. My 5 year old can buckle himself in with this seat, so Iove it! Yay!

Our daughter fits perfectly in this seat and LOVES the cup holders.

BE ADVISED PARENTS THAT THIS CARSEAT DOES NOT COME WITH A 5 POINT HARNESS. IT IS STRAPPED IN WITH THE SEAT BELT ONLY!
So far so good
Love how it sits and is comfortable for child.
Perfect car seat!

I love that this is XL. I purchased this for my grandson. The first kind I had he outgrew quick and was very uncomfortable. He says he likes this much better and that it's not putting pressure on his hips & thighs. It's lightweight and easy to install when we have to change over to PopPop's truck.

So easy to install!  Every time I need to remove my car seat out of the back of my jeep to load in things I end up struggling to get it back in and I was sick of it. I love the fact that this had the easier installation and oh yes it was! For the first time I did not have to enlist the help of my son-in-law to get the car seat back installed in the backseat. What I really liked about it was the cupholders because my grandson is six years old so he always wants a drink or some toy with him in those cupholders are invaluable for holding those things. This foam is much plushier that my previous seat. For those with infants and toddlers, you will love the magnetic chest harness! So much easier to get on and off and no struggling searching for straps. Like all of these car seats it’s expensive, but I found that the convenience in so many of these features made it worth it and it’s the same price as all of the other higher quality seats. So I felt it to be a good value.
Love it! It has been a great and sturdy car seat.

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: Perfect car seat for my daughter. The directions were extremely clear regarding install. The secure latch provided easy access to hook in the base, which is always the hardest part. Additionally the recline allowed my daughter to feel extremely comfortable. I was actually a little skeptical of what I was going to receive because the price was so favorable to other seats I was looking at. I was so pleasantly surprised with what showed up!

We just bought this seat yesterday from a local "big box store". EXCELLENT INVESTMENT! BEST VALUE!!

Our 6 month old is in the 97th percentile for height. 90th percentile for weight. At 6 months old she is the size of most 12-14 month olds..
Anyhow, it was tough finding a seat to accomidate her height and still function as a rear facing seat. We took a gamble, and it sure paid off! This seat was a huge upgrade to the previous seat! She no longer crys when running around town (did to discomfort). She sits back, cozies in, and is 100% comfortable and content.

Other reviews mention that installation is difficult, and takes 2 people...
I managed to vacuume the van and install the seat by myself in under 30 minutes.
If you take a peak at the enclosed manual (located on the lower back/bottom of the seat) it clearly shows (with pics), and dictates how to properly install the seat. Super simple! I used the anchor strap method. If you absolutely have to use a shoulder belt or lap belt that can be somewhat trying, however just pop the clips off the seat pad, flip back seat pad, an bam!!! Convenient little openings to fish the belt or anchor strap through!
I think My son is comfortable in this seat. Good seat overall just a little large. If you have a smaller car it might not work out to well.
my son loves his car seat
Great seat for a great price
Difficult to install. And price was too high.

Easy to install, I love that you don't need to retread the straps as child grows, looks comfortable and stylish.  Very happy with this purchase because no need to buy anything else since it's a transitional car seat!
Perfect! Almost like the 4ever grow with me. Definatley recommend this carseat!
good item
Took more effort to put together than expected. Does not come out of the box ready. Great for grandkids.
Perfect seat for kiddos that aren’t quite tall enough without a booster but over weight limit for other seats. My son loves it
great buy just perfect for my granddaughter!!!!
Easy and perfect grandchild car seat!!!

My son LOVES this car seat/booster! It’s easy to install and I love that it clips to the seat like a car seat would. We also bought the Chicco booster that doesn’t have the back but still has the clips for the seat for my husbands car. It also works great. My 4 year old (47lbs and very tall) is not usually in my husbands car more than once or twice a week for 5 minutes so that’s why we didn’t buy two of these. But I love all the chicco car seats and boosters we own. Solid product.
It's a good car seat, easy to get in and out of base.  The low review is due to the handle being so hard to move backward. Buttons are hard to push.  Overall satisfied

This car seat was impossible to get security tightened into my vehicle. It was also way to big and I drive a Ford truck.  Almost hit her head every time I tried to put her into it because there was so little room between the ceiling of the truck and the car seat. I got it because the reviews were good, but I ended up returning it.

Special Features: Parent Link Customer Service, Live Video Installation Support
Review: Product seems cheaply made
My favorite car seat

The feature that allows you to press the red button and detach the car seat from the car is the best. thing. ever. So much faster than the car seat we were using before. I bought this car seat for my oldest 2.5 years ago. It's been great! We recently bought a second one for my younger child because our experience was so good. Easy to install, easy to take out. Great cupholder.

Solid car seat! I did a lot of research. This one is great! The biggest selling point is the 2year warrenty. All the other car seats we looked at only had 1year warrenty. Cleans well. It is heavy! I expected it to be because of the quality of the built.
Amazing. No complaints.

My grand daughter has this exact product and I bought this for their second vehicle! It is a wonderful and quality product! I definitely would order again and the product arrived without any issues and very expeditiously!

Very easy to pur together and to affix in the rear of the truck. Son says its comfortable. Just make sure to snug it tight around the chest so that the seatbelts secures your child properly.

Great buy

This is absolutely the best car seat of this type we've had. We bought it after our nephew was in a car accident and we felt we wanted a safer seat for our 3-year-old. It is very sturdy, the fabric is cute and durable, and it fits surprisingly snugly in my car. It fits better than our old Graco carseat, which LOOKED narrower but was actually wider. My son tells me it is a lot more comfortable than the old car seat too. It is a bit heavy to carry, but I'm assuming that's because it has metal side-impact bars which are heavier and safer. It takes a little more time to install in the car, but, again, that's because it is safer. It comes with all the attachments you'll need to fit it into any kind of vehicle. It's easy to buckle so kids can do it themselves (with supervision, of course), but they can't unbuckle it. It is easy to adjust the straps. You have to take the time to read the manual when you are setting up the straps initially. Overall, a great product and so well-worth the money. Car safety is one area we don't want to be cheap.
A very good product, strong and durable. A great choice in car seats
I Loved The Seat , It Was Comfy And Smells Good And Cute ! I Put My Son In It As Soon As It Came Out the Box And He Loved It !

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Buena calidad y proporciona seguridad a los niños

The obvious advantage of the MiFold is the tiny size. This is much smaller and more convenient than anything else I've come across. I have been using a SafeRide4Kids vest before now.

The downside is that as a first generation product, it has some unpolished aspects to it. The huge one is the very irritating seatbelt clips. Neither the lap clips nor the shoulder clip are convenient to use- they are fiddly to put on, and the lap clips are a huge PIA to take off quickly.

A minor downside is the long shoulder strap flops around when the device is folded down. An elastic loop would go a long way to helping with this.

All in all, I like this product, but the clips are causing me to consider buying the new SafeRide4Kids vest which has seen a lot of hot and bulky body material removed.

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, No-Rethread Harness
Review: It is a gift, so I can't rate its features.

This carseat has all of the safety features that is required by the law and mom!  It's also beautiful to look at and the leather covered handle makes it a bit more comfortable for carrying.  This is a great carseat for the newer vehicles that have the rich leather interior.  This is an infant carseat up to 32 lbs.

I love absolutely everything about this car seat I have had my fair share of different ones and this one takes the cake. My 1 year old daughter fits wonderfully along with my 4 year old son with room to grow!
Very simple set up and easy to use! Fits well  in my mini cooper!
Love the color! Easy to install, she can get in and out easily too
easy to use and ppve the cute design!
Looks good and my son likes it. I have a very hard time tightening the built in strap on rear facing, took my husband and me both to get the seat in and tight.
Other then the weight, this was pretty easy to install. This thing feels like it would protect my son from just about any accident.
Great for the money
Easy for this grandparent to use👌
Works well
My 10 month old fits in it great! He loves all the space and that his bottle fits in the little cup holder! Would defiantly recommend buying this! It also fits very well in my Audi Q5

I absolutely love love LOVE this booster. My son and daughter are both the size and age that they require a booster, so we have 4 booster seats between all of the different vehicles they ride in. We like this one so much we have it in 2 colors! (pink and blue).

My kids say these are really comfortable. They enjoy the cup holders on the sides to keep their water bottles (or even small toys) in. They really like the bright colors.

I like that it's super light weight, so it's easy to move or take out. I love that it's black and doesn't show spills or stains. The cover is easily removable and you can toss it in the washer. The hard plastic pieces can be wiped clean.

It was super easy to assemble. It only takes about 5 minutes.

These boosters are great. Any time the kids and the parents are both very happy with a product (and it's safe of course) it's a win-win!!!KID

We have had this car seat for 8 months now and I HATE it! We hardly ever use it and when we do it stays in the car and never comes out. The handle is broken and stuck down so I can’t carry it or move it in and out of the car. The back panel doesn’t stay closed so the harness settings are exposed. The seat is also VERY heavy. The only thing I like is that it’s comfortable for my baby. Such a disappointment and waste of money!

As I'm currently pregnant with my 2nd, I personnally think it's difficult to loosen the straps to get my daughter out, but we do love the other features and it really feels like a good safe seat.  My 2.5 year old, at 32lbs is very comfortable in it.  And although there are a lot of fabric pieces, I can attest it cleans up well when needed.  Our need was in its first use, and my daughter became carsick on our way to the Grandparent's house....what a mess.  But you wouldn't know!--cleaned up great.

I bought this seat for a plane ride and to use in Europe. The light weight was a big factor in this. Carrying a Britax Boulevard around on your back (using pac back) is doable, but at almost 24 lbs also really cumbersome and heavy when traveling solo with a toddler.

What I liked was the fact that the straps can go quite high. My daughter is 30lbs at 3.5 years, which means that we can use it with the 5 pt harness for quite some time, it'll allow for her to grow.

I'm spoiled with the Boulevard though, install with seatbelts is much easier with that seat than with this one. It's very hard to get it tight enough so that the seat doesn't move. It lacks the built in snaps that tighten the seatbelt with the Britax. The clip is a bit of a joke, I have not been able to get it tight with that at all (this was after trying for about 1 hour).

It installs very tightly with the latch belt though. However, in Europe I haven't seen many cars with Latch (Isofix).

This'll be a backup seat later. It'll probably travel with us on the plane again. It'll never be the main seat, we'll be using the Britax for a lot longer.

I'm not overly impressed with the belt positioners, it seems to be too tight and will be hard to keep snug once we get to that point.
It is as described. Lighter than others. Easy to put in a small car. Or just a car in general.

Last week we were involved in a car accident.  Someone ran a red light and hit us on the driver side front.  The front of our van was destroyed but my little boy (who was seated behind the driver) was completely fine.  This car seat is a tank and I know he is very safe in it.  I love Diono and their customer service is excellent.  I chatted with c.s. because I had a lot of questions about the RXT vs. 3RXT.  She was very patient and helpful.  We considered going with another company to get a replacement seat that sounded fine and was cheaper but we decided Diono is more than worth it.  We've seen the proof.  The reason I'm only giving 4 stars is because it is such a pain to install.  It's very heavy and the instructions are not clear.  There are no videos on the 3RXT.  It would be great if Diono would put one on their website.
Seriously I have four kids and three I babysit out of all the car seats I have owned this one is my favorite so far

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: This strap would only work for a very small case.

I like that it extends for more foot room but dont care for the head being pushed forward my little one is 1 year and 2 months and he can lift his head ny himself but I wouldnt be good for smaller babies

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: This saved us on our trip to Disney with my four year old niece.  Easy to pack and use -- a real winner!

We have two of these seats, one in each car. The seat is easy to install. We watched a video on You Tube and followed the instructions. The seat is cushy, and my daughter is comfortable riding in it. We have taken two road trips with 7+ hours each way in the car and she did not have any issues, was able to nap comfortably in the seat. Once she is seated, it is very easy to adjust the strap to tighten it according by pulling the cord. It is very easy to get her out of the seat by releasing the click-tight button. We had the Britax B-Safe Infant seat which we were happy with, so it was a no-brainer to continue using Britax products.
You would feel more safer in more higher value items

I simply love this seat.  I steer folks away from the Forever and to this seat almost daily.  Side by Side, they are basically the same seat without a few recline adjustments (you don't need anyways), minus a cupholder, and minus the backless booster.  Even when you have to buy a backless booster, you're still saving money over the Forever.  Honestly, save your money and buy this seat.  It is a breeze to adjust and even easier to install.  You won't be disappointed.  If you need a slimmer seat, go with the Graco Slimfit, which is the same as the Milestone but narrower.

Exactly like description. The only thing, but is not a big deal for me, is that it came in a blank box, I mean, is not  box from Safety Brand but the car seat comes with instructions, guarantee and perfect condition.

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: Have used chicco for both my kids and dnt regret it! They are user friendly and great quality
I really like that this seat has latch system. A little cumbersome to install but worth it for the added safety.

Leaves it unsafe and after several attempts I removed it and no longer use it for my child. Looked appealing until actually purchased and put in. Maybe works for others, just not our combination- Graco 4 in 1 seat.

Special Features: Includes LATCH connectors that attach to vehicle, keeping the booster seat secure when not in use., The backrest on the Viaggio HBB 120 can be removed for easier travel and transport.
Review:
I am thrilled with this seat! Lightweight, folds to slide easily into the back row of the van, child can reach the buckle because there are NO ANNOYING ARM RESTS in the way. It's leather so it wipes easily and it looks classy at a glance thru the window. Only one complaint...the belt path threading at the top headrest tends to catch the belt in the plastic crevice where it is attached to the seat. When that happens, my kids pull too hard and lock the ratchet system of the car. So that's aggravating to then need to disengage the ratchet and rethread the belt.

I have 6 children. I've used a variety of seats (all high end) and I frankly wish I'd bought these sooner.
I love my diono radian rxt seats but not as a booster because you can't get to the buckle without taking skin off your hand. These seats replace my radians now that my oldest are 65lbs.

This car seat is great! It’s actually my second one after getting one for my son too. Both my kids are tall for their age and this seat is super comfortable! We have gone on long road trips and they didn’t complain once.
I am missing the cupholder please send one
Bulky and very hard to adjust the harness to secure and remove the child
Great seat. Very easy to use and looks good too.

I am absolutely thrilled with this car seat. We originally had another car seat with a latch system that wouldn't work in our car. We installed it with the help of our fire department, and we were horrified to find that our son was wiggling it loose by pushing on the back of the seat. It simply wasn't safe. Our son is small for an 18 month old, and keeping him rear facing is a safety necessity. After much shopping, we decided to make the investment in the Britax. My husband fought tooth and nail against spending the money, but we couldn't ignore the steel reinforcements and compact size.

We received the car seat two days after our purchase, which was an amazing bonus, even with free shipping! Installation could not be easier. The latch system is ingeniously designed with both straps coming from the front, not the rear like other seats. 5 minutes, and the car seat was comfortably installed in the middle, rear facing. The bonus of the tether system meant that the car seat did not budge. My husband pushed on it as hard as he could, but it didn't move an inch.

The best part is that our son loves it. The fabric is soft and comfortable, the side wings support his head when he snuggles against them to go to sleep during long car rides. The straps are so easy to adjust, and clearly more comfortable than the ones on our old car seat. The seat has a very small foot print and fits in our very small car.

This was a brilliant investment. We got our money's worth, and I sleep easier at night knowing that the car seat is the safest seat money can buy.
I prefer the Boulevard over the Marathon my husband uses in his car. This carseat has great head support, seems more slimline then the Marathon, the cover comes off and is machine washable...SCORE!!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Good booster seat, took it on a trip and easily fit on a backpack.
This is great only it doesn’t attach directly into the seat of the car so it moves around a lot ...but my son loves it. Comfortable.

This car seat is such a disappointment. I read review after review and saw nothing but good things and then we got it and it was not what it seemed. It BARELY reclined. Definitely not enough for a newborn, let alone my 7 month old. I could see it maybe being ok for a 2-3 year old, but isn't this supposed to be an elite, convertible seat? And you can take any of the padding out for when your child gets bigger except for the infant padding. It is incredibly flimsy and does not feel like it would prevent anything in a car crash. Extremely I satisfied and sending them back immediately.

Love this seat for many reasons. It’s comfortable for our son, light weight, great quality and easy install. However, the recline is so far back! Take up a lot of room, even in our truck and suburban.
Daughter loves sitting in her purple big car seat. She takes naps in it on longer drives.

We're now using this car seat for our second baby and it's still holding up really well.  These are high-quality car seats for smaller babies.  The cloth cover comes off quite easily for cleaning which is a huge plus if you've ever had to deal with those mid-car poop-splosions or the ever-popular car vomit episodes.  You can leave the base installed in your vehicle and just pull out the car seat portion which is great for when your baby is sleeping.  This car seat also installs easily without the base by slipping a lap/shoulder belt in the provided slots (needs to be rear-facing I think).

We are really happy with this car seat. It is adjustable enough so any kid could fit in I guess. We looked a lot for car seat before buying this one and we do not regret it (after 1.5 years using it).
This car seat is difficult to install. It is terribly difficult to lock.
Great and safe for the baby
We love this car seat. We put our son in it starting at 8 months. We have two compact cars (Hyundai Sonata and Elantra) and they fit great.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Doesn’t sit up high enough and no cushion.  Gets the job done

this car seat is not good as your child get bigger. Looks great I bought it for my new born baby. But as she starter growing up her head started going down all the time. This car seat design doesn't hold the head with comfort.By the 2nd year I had to change it.

These are the best. Keeps my kids rear facing longer - my son is 3 and still has plenty of room. I will run out of backseat space before he runs out of leg room. Works perfectly in our Expedition (we have 2 of these back there). Lots of padding for the kids, seems to be a very comfortable carseat.

We picked this car seat because of how long you can rear face.  My son is 3 years old and still refacing at 38 inches tall and 33 lbs.  It's easy to install with the LATCH system and you can use the lower anchors until 45 lbs with this seat.  Once my son is 40+ lbs we will probably turn him forward facing and just use the belt path for the install.  The only complaint I have is the cover is hard to  remove and put back on when you wash, and the fabric stains.

I debated for a very long time on which car seat to buy for my twins after they outgrew their Peg Perego Prima Viaggio 4-35 infant car seats. I finally chose this one and bought two. I'm so glad i did. The car seat is very well made and cushiony for my little ones.  Some of the reviews said they are very wide, which they are, but i have two in my back seat botb rear facing and can still fit my 4 year old niece in. My car is a crossover so it's not huge but it's not an SUV either. If you have a small car it would be very difficult to fit 3 across. Other than that these are fantastic seats. I love the look and all of the safety features.  I feel very comfortable putting them in them and going on a long road trip. I travel alot on highways so the extra side impact protection was a very important feature for me. This car seat is constructed very well and I'm very glad i bought it.

Special Features: 2 cup holders, 3 harness height positions, 5-point adjustable sagety harness, Superior side impact protection, Padded shoulder and crotch covers
Review: Easy install, love the booster option
Love this seat.  I got it for my wiggle worm 4.5 yr old and she will be in this for many yrs to come

Pluses
------
- feels very safe; lots of protection and very snug
- unlike other users, we find this very easy to move from car to car. We were house hunting for 4 months and removed our car seat 2-3 times a week to move into the realtor's car and were able to do it easily. You have to loosen the 2 straps linked to the locking mechanism and then tighten after installing to make it a breeze.
- we have used it in the rear facing and front facing modes and our kid finds it comfortable

Minuses
-------
- very heavy; we traveled with it and it is heavy to lug around the airport
- CANNOT BELIEVE that the cover is not MACHINE WASHABLE
- CANNOT BELIEVE that cover cannot be put in a DRYER
What do you do, Britax, when your kid spits up or throws up? Hand wash and then drip dry and not drive for that time? For this price Britax should have given us a spare cover!!!
I love the fact that I could use it for both my oldest grandson and my youngest grandson

This was a great buy. Easy to put together & takes up much less space than the forever carseat we had. The only reason I’m not giving it 5 stars is that I didn’t realize the main difference between the LX & regular is just the Latch system. You don’t really need Latch with a booster seat because it uses a seatbelt, so I feel like I paid extra for nothing.

My wife and I bought the Britax Boulevard G4 for our grandson so when we baby sit we will have the ability to take him with us in the car. My daughter also has the same car seat and loves it. We both bought it because it is highly rated for quality and safety. I would recommend this seat to anyone.

Took a risk and bought this sight unseen. I am very pleased. Installation is easier than a Britax Roundabout, although taking is back out is harder (different LATCH buckle). I love it that there are hard plastic guides for the booster seat car seat belt. I've been looking for this for years as the sewn ones catch the seat belt and then it hangs loose. I love the adjustable head rest. I agree that one handed in or out is easier in the Roundabout, but I never looked at a Frontier. The seat is not as cushy as the Roundabout, I was a little disappointed, but no complaints from my daughter. Love the cupholder and the cubbies, although they may attract grunge. My only question is how the harness can truly go to 65 lbs with the top harness slots as they are. My daughter is not quite 4, and 30 lbs and seems to need the highest strap setting now. Something to investigate if you have a tall child.

I was able to install very securely in my Mazda minivan, but ONLY if I took the headrest off. If your headrests "jut out" over the seat back and are not removeable, try before you buy.

This is a great seat for the price. I have a 13 yo and 11 yo and have been buying car seats for years. Too bad it took this long for companies to "get it" about the five point for older kids, as well as a good belt positioning system.
Great light weight seat!!!
Easy, fits my 99 perctile kids (tall, slim). Sturdy enough.
Love this seat-

My daughter was due for her big girl car seat and we do t regret purchasing this one. Fits perfect In our grand Jeep Cherokee. Happy can also lean it back a bit so when she’s napping her head it’s to uncomfortable
Love this car seat. Came in no time at all and my son loves it!

I was really excited about this for the price.. until it arrived. It's very difficult to install. The shoulder straps don't stay in place. They're supposed to be easy to move up and down (instead of taking everything apart) but I don't feel safe with how easily they move. I've installed this car seat in a 2016 traverse, 2013 altima, and a 2006 explorer.. all are hard to install (rear facing) and need a pool noodle to have the line on the side be even with the ground. Not a ton of leg room rear facing for my 23 month old (compared to graco fit4me)

I bought this for my baby who was 7 months at the time and he loves it. He would always cry when we go on car rides and when I switched to Graco car seat, he started enjoying car rides. It has a lot of cushion so it’s nice and comfortable for him.
Seems sturdy and looks great.
THIS IS A VERY GOOD PRODUCT, AND CONVERTS INTO A BASE UNIT FOR WHEN MY GRAND SON GETS OLDER AND WAIGHS MORE!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Liked

It's gigantic. I have a Toyota sequioa and it barely fits behind the driver's seat. Definitely not for smaller vehicles. The button in lap is difficult to release. My mother-in-law had to buy a separate carseat for her car because she has arthritis and couldn't unlatch my son. I do love how sturdy and protected my little guy is though.

I purchased this car seat about 3 weeks ago and I love it. It has cup holders that are great for bottles, sipppy cups,toys, and teethers. My daughter is 7 months and she fits in it comfortably ( I was worried she would swim in it). I'm only giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because its large..i mean large. I drive a full size car, barely 1 person can fit in the back with the seat. Good value for the price if your an over-protective mom, easy setup and instructions.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Totally awesome for travel.  Bought this because it is small and light and my daughter could carry it in her own backpack through the airport.  When we landed, I just blew it up and off we went.  Great not having to check baggage or arrange for a booster seat in a rental.  I thought it might be too small for my 6 year old to be comfortable but she was content and made 1 hour stretches of driving without any complaints and never hesitated to get back in the car.  Easy to install and use, worth every penny and when I purchased amazon had it cheaper than other big box stores.

I purchased this carseat for my precious grandchild, and my daughter loves it.  It has extra air bags on each side, and the fabric is just perfect for our baby, who coincidentally is named "ANNA".......When we first got the seat, we were afraid that the material might be too hot for the summer time in Tennessee, but we were wrong.  It is just perfect!
This car seat is amazing! So easy to use and install! I highly recommend!!

Just bought this car seat for my 9 month old. She hates the infant car seat and does not want to be seated. I wanted to get a convertible so that she  feels it's more of a seat vs. car seat. I have had this for 3 days now and so far she likes it and has not cried. The quality is great and it was easy to install for someone who is challenged when it comes to handy work. So far so good. I researched a lot and narrowed down to britax and this for the safety but decided on prego for the quality and luxurious look and feel. It was not much different from britax from w cost stand point. It's worth the additional spend

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Awesome. Easy to inflate and deflate.  So light and easy to put in carrying case and put in overhead above airplane seat. Perfect for traveling with my 5 year old granddaughter. I highly recommend it for grandparents to have on hand.
Excelente

Love this seat!! We have been in 2 wrecks where we were rear ended and this seat has done exactly what it was supposed to and kept our son safe! (Obviously replaced seat after each accident). Love the extra features like the smart adjustable buckle, the extra leg room and plush seating.  My son is 5 1/2, forward facing and still in the 5 point harness and will be until he hits max weight/height.  Paramedics at our last accident told us he was the safest person in the accident in the seat he was in and the 5 point harness. Will recommend this seat always!!

The slim-ness of this carseat is awesome especially when there are 2 car seats taking up backseat space instead of just 1! Install is same as most car seats so not much there. Graco is a great brand so I knew this carseat would live up to the brand name and it does. So far no complaints.
Comfortable, adjustive, light and safe.

Big design flaw! The strap is way too short even for a 27lbs toddler. It says it can fit 60lbs. I can't believe how short the strap is. At first I thought there must be some tricks to extend the strap. After some online research, I realize it a problem complained by many customers.

We love this carseat. We have 3 of them. Pretty easy to install once you get the hang of it. I use my front seat to keep it secure in place. Wasn't too expensive either.  Also not too heavy if you need it for a sitter or something either. Overall a very good carseat! We love this one!
The quality of this booster seat is great. The kids have not complained and the option to take the back off is easy for them to do themselves.
The head support really doesn’t provide support but the fabric is light and breathable.
Everything is good. My kid loves her new seat. But after we drop our kids off and drive to work, the empty seat is rattling. It is quite annoying all the way to work.

We purchased this seat a year ago as a back in a vehicle not driven as often. Of course price payed a role since it wouldn’t be used often. The cover on this seat has been difficult to keep on since day one! I readjust it, attempt to get it tightly on the seat and sit my child in, cover pops back off. There are no hooks being missed, I have searched every inch of this seat. We have the camouflage printed one that isn’t currently available so possibly may be a defect with it, I am unsure. What I am sure of is I would not purchase this again. It’s frustrating to use and when my child is sitting in it, it looks like he has a blanket around him because the cover is peeling off of the seat.

This car seat saved my sanity! My grandbaby absolutely hated car rides in her infant carrier type seat. I thought I would try this out and she no longer screams on "all" car trips. Fully adjustable from birth up!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review:
This is a great concept - and done very well. I can fit a seven year old on it in the middle seat of a Mazda 3, with a regular booster with a four year old on one side, and a Diono for a 18 month old on the other.

However, one important thing: CHECK THE INFLATION OFTEN! We've had two of these, and one sprung a leak. It kept deflating after a single car ride due to a puncture. I've put in a claim with the manufacturer to have it replaced under warrantee.

Very well padded, but a little bulky. I feel like I hit my son's head on the car door due to the bulkiness of the seat. Overall, good protection. I like how it converts from rear facing to forward facing. I feel this is a seat I will be able to use for awhile.
We're very happy with this car seat. I love the feature that assists you in tightening the straps to the proper tension.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
