Review: My son loves this booster seat and I love that it doesn’t shift anywhere. I asked and he assured me that the seat is super comfortable. I will buy the same seat when my daughter needs one.

Lightweight and convenient for a second booster seat for our son. We wanted something simple for a spare to have at the house incase his everyday car seat was somehow not available or another family member needed to pick him up unexpectedly. The seat material has held up well (we've had it for over a year now) with occasional use, and our son loves the pattern.

I was just in a car accident five days ago. So thankful for this cat seat. My 3 year old granddaughter only had slight bruising on her neck unlike me that ended up with a thick bruise outlining my seat belt. We were in  a Ford Fiesta and got plummeted by a USPS mail van that failed to stop for a red light. She was so well protected. I'm forever grateful.

We're very happy with the Graco Milestone car seat.  Seems comfortable for our 15 month old.  It's super easy to adjust as he grows, just pull the lever and move the back up.  The shoulder straps go up with the back, no need to rethread the straps.  We bought it before we went on a long trip and it worked great.  There is an adjustment to lay the seat back for different age kids.  We used it to lay our little one back to sleep.  We can reach back from the front seat and pull the lever to lay it down when he gets tired.  The adjustment goes nearly horizontal which allowed him to sleep comfortably without putting a kink in his neck.  I would highly recommend this car seat.

So far this is a great Carseat. I have only used it for one week.  It is lightweight and I still feel like it is good qulaity and great protection for my baby.  I love the quick click connect on the graco products.

I owned all Graco things when I had my son 5 years ago so I can say from experience that their products have definitely taken a turn downward in quality. I got this car seat mostly because it was the only Graco one I could find in pink and I really liked that brand before so I wanted to go with it again. It was cheaper than the other options but I just thought that was because it was an older model. I didn't get the more expensive seat so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt in saying it is just their 'low end' model.
While I'm sure the seat itself is safe, it is pretty cheaply made. The canopy doesn't open or close very easily, I have to tug it both ways pretty hard and work with it to get it completely open or shut. The cover on the car seat fits tight in the seat so it's not a suffocation hazard but is really loose around the bottom of the car seat.
We still had the base from five years ago so I can also tell you the base is SUPER low quality on this one. It used to be much heavier duty and had a better mechanism for making sure the seat is at the right angle for the baby (there was a ball thing in the side). This one just has a red line that you have to somehow figure out whether or not it's 'parallel' to the ground below the vehicle... The base doesn't need to be lightweight, it stays in the car. I'd much prefer the superior quality.
As the seat and the base do seem safe, I'll use it but the quality digression between now and five years ago is pretty astounding.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Easy to tip over and doesn't work for bigger babies

The description of this item says it will work for rear or forward facing children. However, this item cannot be safely installed rear-facing unless the child is an infant who is unable to sit on their own. This product cannot be securely placed in a car for a child over 20 lbs. While the car seat was made nicely and seemed comfortable, it is not safe or suitable. I am disappointed as I was pleased with the price and quality of the product.

The brand has a good reputation for a reason - they have a quality product. This is no exception. Great quality product, great color, easy to install (well as easy as a carseat can be). Great purchase for parents
Easy to install. Also, very easy to get my wiggly kid in and out of and a breeze to tighten the straps.

I bought this for my newborn son to use (and last). This car seat seems just as good quality as my daughters Graco carset that's just like this one. (I usually prefer Graco brand nowadays).
I will update my review if I have any complaints when we install in and put our son in it

I bought this car seat about a month ago to replace a similar style Graco that had a broken LATCH connector. The first thing I noticed was how lightweight and flimsy it was compared to the Graco. Basically every time my 3 year old grabbed the headrest while climbing in, he bent it back an inch or two. It is easy to take in and out, and my child is secure when fastened in. So it's not terrible for the price but next time I'll pay more for a better one.

We got this for a trip for my 7 year old to use in Uber, Lyft and Taxis. She’s 48” and about 68lb, and it was perfect for her. Comfy, easy to secure in the cars, and very quick to inflate and deflate. It’s light, so it wasn’t heavy to have rolled up in my backpack when we weren’t using it. Highly recommend this!

It's a fine carseat, and I like how it will stick with my oldest until she's ready to just sit in a seat. My biggest/main issue is that the cup holders are on the small side--I cannot fit my daughter's contigo in them at all. And most kids' sippee cups/bottles are going to be too big for these cup holders. So just be aware, you'll need a slimmer bottle for these for long car trips. Or maybe just use them to hold goldfish.

I haven't found anything I don't like about this car seat. The latches are nice because it doesn't slide around when my son gets in and out. He says it's comfortable. The shoulder strap holder is really convenient and the cup holder is great. I'd buy this again in a heartbeat.

My little fella is very comfortable I'm this chair.  He's a large child so the strap adjustments are a must.  I us this chair in my Toyota Tacoma and it fits perfect.  In the Tundra he rides like a big boy.
i love that it has the latching system to secure it to the auto -  great seat for the kiddo and priced great

Great Seat, very comfy. We upgraded to this seat from a Graco infant seat. Daughter was 12mo & 20lbs.  I was concerned that she would be too small for it and although the seat looked big for her, she fit snugly.  My only disappointment was the 3 position recline.  It hardly declines, maybe an inch?!  Since my daughter is still young & sometimes falls asleep, her head does tip forward. It's not enough of a recline for her, maybe when she gets bigger? The color & cloth is nice, thick but still comfy. No problems with the latch, she was used to the same one in her Graco infant seat.  She loves the cupholder.  She can barely reach it but loves to put her bottle in there. Then lean over & grab it again. I would definitely recommend this seat.  I read lots of reviews before purchasing it. Again, only disappoinment was the recline was not enough.

This seat is amazingly easy to install! We’d debated over whether we “needed” the click-tight version and I’m so happy we decided to go for it. We’ve easily moved it between cars. The seat appears comfortable (kids have liked their Britax seats over some other brands we tried) and the straps are easy to adjust. We started with a Britax seat for our eldest several years ago, moved up to a Britax booster, and happily continue with the brand for our youngest.

A con is weight. It’s heavy, really heavy.

To be more specific, I would rate this just over 4.5 stars.

My daughter has been a different person since we switched to this car seat. She almost never cries in the car, unless she was crying before being in the car haha, and is noticeably more comfortable. She's still rear facing, and now is able to see out of the window. It's definitely safe, and it looks like no shortcuts were taken on padding and support.

Unfortunately, I recently had to clean glass from our window being shattered out of the car seat, and found out that this seat is very easy and simple to clean even if you have to remove the clothe.

An additional positive before my only negative, this car seat is larger than the one we previously had, and yet it gives us more room in the car. My passenger seat does not have to be as far up as it used to be. So if you're hesitant on this model because of the size, you might be very pleasantly surprised.

Only Con:

It's incredibly difficult to remove/reinstall if you have to switch cars or need it out for any reason. I understand that I could view that as a safety feature, but in the rain, heat, cold, etc, it's not fun to take out and put back in.

I’m not really sure why this car seat has such bad reviews. Yes the tie downs that aren’t super secure are a little weird but this car seat is honestly fairly cheap for what you get.

I don’t have to worry about it moving a ton when the kids aren’t in it. The kids still love it because they can use the normal seat belt and they get a cup holder that is really steady since it doesn’t go in like the other Graco models. Is it the safest car seat on the market in this style? Who really knows? I appreciate the reasonable price range and the basic features so it’s reasonable to move from car to car for whoever happens to have the kids that day.

This was actually a back-up for grandmas car that we took to use full time when our second son needed a car seat if that tells you how much we truly did like it.

If you found this useful, make sure to click helpful/yes so others like you will see this

Very heavy and hard to install, rattles when empty. I would look and try in person than purchase online. I had to move it from the position of middle and behind passenger seat to behind drivers seat so I could see out the window.
I use it for my One year old baby

It's easy to install and comfortable for my baby.  It fits well in the back of my honda civic. The buckle clicks smoothly and releases easily. It seems very safe.  I don't like  all of the padding around the buckle; it makes it hard to buckle. Also, the mechanism for loosening the straps is really irritating because it's very far inside the seat inside a little opening.
We bought this as an extra for the grandparents car. Our first convertible one was the Pavilion but I hate the CS part that clicks and this is the same thing without the clicking. We love it!

I love that you can put your little one in it from the start. We just got it for our 7 month old and it works a lot nicer than the chicco infant carrier we have. It was a hassle getting him in and out of the car when we didn't want to carry the whole car seat. This was tightens a lot easier. At first it is a little stiff to tighten the strap but it has gotten smother to tighten. Also in our truck we only have the seat clips on the outside passenger seats, in the back, and these straps are longer enabling you to have you child in the center of the back seat, using on mount from each seat.

I love that it reclines and we will be able to use this until he gets big enough for the booster seat.

We love these car seats. Bought two of them, one for my 4 yr old and one for my 6 yr old. We can now fit them and an infant car seat all on one row! They’re super slim, easy to install, and easy to travel with. They are heavy (like 30lbs) but they fold up well and haven’t had any problem checking them on a plane.
I love it my son is a chubby little baby now he has a nice comfy car seat with enough room to move around I’m great full that I found something for him

This seat is amazing! Our DD loves being in it, and it is a perfect fit for three across in our Jeep. It's lightweight, so I don't mind when we have to switch vehicles. I would definitely buy this seat again and again!

I moved my child to this booster car seat, from the traditional car seat as soon as possible.  It is better priced, easier to take in and out, and will be the last seat I need to buy for my child due to the harness removal after child grows, and only the vehicles seat belt is needed.  I am glad that this kind of child car seat is offered.  It is a quality built product, and appears to have great head protection. Hopefully I never have to find out how good the protection is, but it appears to be the best on the market from my research.

I needed two... I already had the exact same seat but I couldn't find it again in stores.  I'm so glad I found it on Amazon.  It's easy to use and my daughter (5yrs old) has no problems with it.  I'm definitely pleased with it.

I got this for when my grandchildren come to visit so their parents don’t have to lug a car seat through the airport.  Only negative is that the seat is not as padded as I had hoped.  I just put some padding under the seat cover and that did the trick. The size is perfect and would accommodate three across the seat if I needed that many.  I also like the many different configurations as the children grow.
it’s the perfect size. the arms are soft and raised alittle my son loves it

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Very good ultraportable booster for an older child!

I got this seat for my 2 yr 9mo old and she loves it.  She is very comfortable (no longer kicking the back of the seat) and can still sleep in the car.  She loves the cow print and the cup holders.  I couldn't be happier.
This car seat was the best option for the size of my small vehicle.

This booster seat is a joke! The photos make it look like a cushion, but it is a plastic mold covered by a thin elastic fabric that slides around. On top of being uncomfortable, this is extremely unsafe to seat your child. Please do not purchase!

Special Features: Online Chat via ParentLink, Live Video Installation Support, EasyClick LATCH
Review: Bought for daughter and she loves it!

We have had 2 of these seats and they both ended up leaking even though they have only been used according to instructions. I would say they are good for 2 months if your just needing a temporary solution.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: My kids love this, they are five and seven. It’s perfect for both girls!
Confortable and pretty. Good quality material.
So the manual just doesn't detail enough on how to properly install the car seat. You can get the straps tight enough for rear facing latch system.

This is an awesome car seat and my child looks so comforable in it! I don't see why there are negative reviews, cause for around $100 (depending on the color you choose) this is a great product! Everything is so easy to adjust. Haven't used the reclining feature (my son doesn't really sleep in the car), but I'm sure it will come in handy when I do.

beautiful product.  I have another one, "car" print, and very happy with it (at my 2nd car).  I am buying this one as a spare for car pool or to take inside the restaurant my 2 1/2 yr old to use (so no need for disgusting high chair).  Very happy with it, solid product!  Great to have cup holder as well!

Excellent car seat! I feel my son is safe and comfortable.  First day using it, he vomited in it and it was tough cleaning it.  Taking off the cover and putting back was a little challenging.  I have a spare car seat that in comparison, was so easy to take the cover off and put back on, although not as sturdy as the Graco Extend2Fit.  But with several videos on YouTube, I was able to figure out how to put the car seat back together.
We love this seat. It's our second Chicco and we won't need a third because our little boy will be out of a seat soon.
Very great grace brand and car seat I bought this item for my baby sister and I was overall pleased with the product and how safe and easy it was to install in my car.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Very pleased. Made well and easy to install and move from car to car.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Very cheap looking and made.

I purchased this as an inexpensive second car seat so my family could have one in each car for convenience purposes. I have been extremely pleased with it, and actually prefer it to our $300 Chicco one. It's easy to install and uninstall, it's attractive, and it's quick and easy to get my child into and out of. It also takes up less of the backseat than our other carseat, which comes in handy as well.

Toyota Tacoma Access Cab and a 2 year old that weighs 51lbs and is 3 feet 3 inches tall... thats us. We started with the Graco 4n1 DLX which afforded me 1/2 inch leg room. Moved to the Britex Boulevard aka Bulky Brat. Lastly we tried the Radian 3 on a whim after Wal-Mart stocked a few. BEST CAR SEAT EVER. Optimal leg room.. optimal sizing for my heavy hut also TALL baby. sleek design.. makes me wish I was riding it. My son loves it. We are now well past the new carseat honeymoon phase and we still love this carseat so much I bought an extra just in case they discontinue it. Its so sturdy, hugs my Subaru seats like melted butter on toast. Its easy to pack on the plane. its easy to install. Its easy to vehicle transfer. I never write  reviews (so subjective) and i didn't even buy this seat from Amazon... but here I am. Believe the hype, this one is the real deal.
Está muy cómodo y seguro

The installation is not as easy as they make it seem if you have the seatbelt pulled tight. I was only planning on buying one and changing them between cars but ended up having to buy another because of the installation. You definitely don’t want to have to do it every day. The other thing is when it’s installed you can’t change the recline position. That really bothers me. You have to un-install it just to recline it a little bit... Wish I knew these two things before buying. Other than that, it’s a good car seat I like it.

It's a great size for my Jeep. I can still fit two other people in the back seat if I need to. My little one who HATED his infant car seat is happy as a clam in this seat. It is also fairly easy to transfer from vehicle to vehicle. Oh, and not to mention, the cup holders!! I'm super happy with this purchase.

Easy to install. No need to adjust seatbelt as child grows, you pull up the top part to give them more slack.
Light weight, comfortable for child
Confortable for long rides, our daughter sleeps without getting her hear hanging.  Compact, perfect fit for SUV
Easy to install and love the face that it grows with the child. My son is 9 months and we just upgraded to this one because he grew out of his old one. Wish I would have go this one to begin with.

This is a great car seat...we used it for our road trip this weekend. The slim fit allowed for additional room across the seats. The only complaint I have is that my daughter likes to put her arms up behind her head when she sleeps and because it is a slim fit she wasn't able too.
Did not recliner enough rear facing and the straps didn’t tighten evenly
Great car seat

I have the Graco 4 in 1 and got this for my other car. My baby seems like to like this one a lot more. He seems comfortable and is happy to be in it whereas he'd always start complaining after a short time in the graco. My one complaint is that the buckle doesn't open so easily. It always takes me an extra few seconds or another try to get it.
This carseat is great - the versatility and ease of use are top notch.  Recline, cupholder, compartments for snacks/etc, convertible.. a great deal.

I LOVE this car seat! Very easy to install, works great with the latch system in our car, easy to buckle and unbuckle my son quickly and he's is very comfortable in it. He doesn't use the cup holder at all, but there is enough room beside him to nestle his sippy.

I took me three purchases to finally find the right fit.  This seat fits perfectly for my 7 year old. It’s not snug on the hips and he sits perfectly to see out the window. The hooks to prevent the seat from moving makes me feel safer knowing he’s secure in the back seat.

Pretty excited about our son’s new car seat. Got it set up pretty easy in the car. Perfect fit and we drive a Nissan Altima. Took him on a drive around town and he seemed very comfortable and secured. Will update review if problem does arrive
Great quality material, easy to install and very secure.

My daughters love these boosters. They say they are the most comfortable boosters we’ve ever had. I like that they hook to the seat so they aren’t easily moved. Also, the width of these seats is fantastic. If your child has chunkier thighs or is heavier set, I would absolutely go with this booster!

This seat is beautiful (I received the Boho style)! I receive compliments on it every time we go out. Aesthetic aside, this seat is also very lightweight compared to other seats I’ve handled which is another great feature. Luckily I haven’t had any accidents to test it’s safety/durability but I can testify to it’s sturdy structure and supportive cushions. Even as a 6lb newborn my son was snug as a bug in this seat!  Other reviewers claimed staining on their baby from red dye but we didn’t have this issue, even after a diaper leak dampened the seat. Installation was pretty simple but I still had a professional help me just to be safe. I am so in love with this purchase I cannot say enough good things.
Haven't used it yet, but it looks very sturdy.  We don't have a Britax carseat, but it looks pretty universal.

So far we really love this car seat! Budget friendly, installation was fairly easy and it fits well in my 08 chevy Malibu. Installing almost needs two people, I am a female and did it myself but if you had one to pull the straps tighter and one to push the car seat it would
Make it much easier. The fabric almost feels as though it has memory foam underneath and my son seemed to be very comfortable in it! The only thing I'm not in love with is the the bottom part that you click the buckles into is pretty short so unbuckling can be kind of awkward at first. Otherwise we are happy with our purchase!!!
Easy to instal correctly in the car with the  latch clips and adjustable belt. Very easy to adjust shoulder height as your toddler grows.
very easy to use and very convenient for travel. great product.
Great value for a backup when we have to take extra kids in the car.

The Maxi Cosi Magellan is made from premium materials and with a good eye toward design. It fits in very well in our luxury car. I particularly like the soft, stretchy material. It feels nice to the touch and is good at disguising baby messes. If you have a nice car and want a seat the blends in to your black interior, I think that you would be hard pressed to do better than the Magellan.

We currently have the Magellan in rear facing mode. It was easy to install, though it took a minute of examining the routing of the straps on the seat and in the manual to understand how to access and route everything. Once I verified that it was properly installed the seat feels rock-solid. With the SIPS protection and multi-point restraint, I feel comfortable knowing that my kid is cocooned in all of the latest safety features.

Other excellent features include the cup holders, which function perfectly and remove easily for cleaning. I also appreciate how easy it is to adjust the seat and how flexible it will be as my kid grows.

My only (very modest) gripe is that the supplemental support pillows for small infants can tend to wander since they are not affixed.
Can see dirt easily
Great car booster. My daughter says it's very comfortable and I like the expandable cup holders on the side!
We live this car seat. We have 5 car seats and this is by far the best. In love.

So far, my son has adjusted to this car seat from a Graco infant carrier/car seat. He loved his other car seat, and this one seems to be just as comfortable for him. He has taken many naps in it! It seems to be of good quality and had a great safety rating. I love that the buckle clicks when it is tight enough. I was not aware that it did this until we installed it.

I feel very good about him being in this seat.
These serve their purpose, but I do not like them. My 6 year old granddaughter has a hard time getting her seatbelt fastened in this
Have four of these. For both boys and both cars, never an issue up to 3 years old and maybe a little longer... we shall see...

I researched a lot of booster seats before deciding on the Graco Affix highjack booster. I got 2 red ones for our twin 4 year old boys. One labeled it his "cool red seat" before I even had them assembled :D If you follow the directions it really is pretty straight forward on how to assemble. Since I had 2, the second when really fast cuz I had it figured out. The shoulder strap of the car seat belt stays well controlled in the specified slot (again, as long as you actually slide it in as directed) and the boys can help pull their seat belt over to be buckled which they love. Unfortunately, one figured out how to unbuckle his seat belt the very next day *sigh*
My twins are pretty slender and probably could have stayed in a 5 point harness seat however, their previous ones had angled bases which was causing them some discomfort on long drives because they are too big for that. My goal was a booster with a flatter base, arm rests, cup holder, and longevity. This one had it all at a great price and the design is aesthetically pleasing as well.
Very comfortable and lots of space

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: Cool concept, but didn't work without skimming the ground (and risking car seat damage) with two different carry-on luggage pieces and two different car seats tested out.
Love it, easy to put together.
The measurements are not correct as listed and will not fit in my vehicle how I needed it. Will be returned. Looked comfy though.

This beautiful invention is a game changer!  This past summer was so hectic with a new job and last minute schedule changes that having these was such a blessing! Several times I've had my kids pack them in their back packs, just in case some one else needs to pick them up from school! The kids were able to pick up on how to set it up themselves pretty quickly too! Currently saving to buy a set for my mom (who has a billion grandchildren and could totally use them lol)
Love this seat, easy to install and reinstall and feels super safe.

Fits behind drivers seat on prius v with angle adjuster and did fit in mazda 3 behind passenger seat with more space in front seat than with infant seat back there but went with a graco seat for mazda3 beauty of how small the back seat is.  However fits awesome in my prius and still can use middle seat which is huge when needing to cram 3 in back seat
Exactly for what I was looking.
For my grandson, we have 3 of these car seats. (My daughter has 2, one for each car.)  Also have  2 Graco Infant Seats, with 3 bases. Three vehicles, 2 grandsons.  We like these seats.

I bought a different booster seat for my son, but just wasn't happy with it.  I have always used Britax for my car seats, so going back to the brand I trust just made sense.  My son loves this seat.  When we moved the old one to his dad's car, he refused to ride in that car.  I am happy with this product.  It feels safe to use, and it fits my son well.  I would recommend it.
Looks great and clean cut.  The seatbelt hangs up in the red shoulder strap slot when trying to buckle
These booster seats were so easy to install and very good quality!

In general, I'm very happy with the car seat. It has a very compact shape (not very big as other alternatives). Our son liked it. I feel that it's safe. A big plus for me is that it's very easy to remove it from the car.
Second one ordered for second grandchild
This is a great car seat. Easy to adjust the straps!
This is a very soft and comfortable car seat for my grandkids! They loved it on the long ride to Daytona Beach! Great price as well!

I hate this carseat. I grumble everytime I have to place my son in it. The straps are cutting into my son's thighs and I now have to buy a new carseat because customer service cannot replace the straps. My son is only 18 months. Save your money and buy another brand.

Built to keep baby safe.  Very large for back seat of sedan.  For a novice at car seat installation, was difficult to install.  Asked county sheriff to help, and they did a wonderful job to ensure it is installed safely.  Not intended to be used once in a while and taken out of car in between uses.

We started out with the Graco Nautilus but my son, who is 5, 35lbs and 44 inches tall, was complaining about the crotch strap hurting him and his back hurting.  The Britax has much more padding and 3 slots for the crotch strap, compared to 2 on the Nautilus.  My son is much more comfy in the Britax.  It was a breeze to install in my Chevy Cobalt.  I was also able to get a 3 across with a RF Combi Coccoro and a RF Graco Myride(which I hate because of the buckle).  It is tight but doable. I installed it in less than 5 minutes and it is rock solid.  I love the no rethreading harness on it.  We are going to stick with Britax from now on!  We also have the Marathon in a spare vehicle.  The Britax are so easy to install and they also have so much more padding than the Graco.  I couldn't be more happier with my purchase.  We should have started out with the Frontier and skipped the Nautilus.
I buy this for My niece  It work good fits good  and I will tell more of my family  and friends.
Very nice seat. Fits well and stays put. The kiddo likes it.
Highly recommended ! It's a little big for my car , but still fits & very easy to install.
Love that this high back booster anchors, has a storage for snacks/toys and a cup holder! Great value for the price!
Thank you!! I bought this carseat for granddaughter and I am very pleased with the purchase!! :)
This product is great quality, easy to use and easy to travel with!

We received this as a gift for our daughter before she was born. It was bought with the intention that we cold use it instead of also buying an infant car seat. After getting it out of the box and using my friends 2 month old to "test" (in the house) I realised it would NOT work for an infant! Even at nearly 9lbs our infant would not fit and it did not tilt far enough back to support her head and neck safely. We ended up having to buy and infant seat as this was not supportive enough for an infant, she was to small to use it safely until around 5 months.

We started using it at about 6 months in our additional vehicle and planned to use it as our main one when we transition out of her infant car seat. At first I really liked it but I did struggle to get it tightened down properly. Even my 6'3" 200lb husband and 2 firefighters at our local car seat safety clinic couldn't get it to secure tight, it always moved more than 1 inch. We even tried a towel underneath (like the manual suggested) and pool noodle but nothing worked. We were using the latch system not the lap or shoulder belt option, and have 2 Subaru's we tried it in (outback and impreza)

Over the course of our first month using it full time I noticed the left seat belt clip (for baby) began to come undone if our daughter put enough pressure on it and became very hard to get to actually clip in. The latch tethers keep getting more and more loose so we constantly had to re-tighten as much as we could but it never felt like it was tight enough. Also the fabric cover has begun to come undone, it doesn't want to stay on the side.

On the plus side my daughter was comfortable with the fabric and padding, she never slept in her infant seat but slept better in this one. Personally I think she looks uncomfortable (her head always seemed forced forward to much) but she'll sleep in this one and NEVER did that in the infant. I like the headrest and back support pillows it came with but they only fit right when she hit about 9mo. Also for a convertible it's fairly lightweight and easy to carry if need be.

My last straw with this one was a few weeks back when I turned the corner and the whole car seat shifted, almost slamming into the door because the latch tether had slipped AGAIN! I had to pull over and fix it! I was so tired of trying to tighten it down all the time and it slipping all around, this is one of the most important piece of baby equipment you should buy IMO! I didn't want to put my child's safety at risk anymore. I took it out and bought the Britax Marathon 70-G3. I LOVE the Britax so much and realise how unsafe this graco one was by not securing properly.

We just purchased this seat for our second child. We had the older version for our first child.  They have made several really nice improvements for this new model. The cover comes off easily and can be removed without taking the seat out of the car. The base is nicer - seems not to dig into the leather car seat as much and has latches for holding the attachment points if you wanted to travel with it and not have buckles and straps swinging around.  The fabric is plush but also seems to stay cleaner.  Overall, a nice improvement to an already great seat.
I absolutely love this car seat. My son seems so comfortable in it! I will definitely stick with this style if we have more kiddos or need another car seat!
Our second one! We were in an accident and Praise God our son didn't even wake up!! Of course we would immediately replace the old one with an exact new one!

I was looking for a low profile car seat for my son that would last us a long time and this product fit the bill. It has everything I was looking for and my son doesn’t mind sitting in it.

The last car seat we had he put up such a fight to sit in. With this seat he fought us a little in the beginning but grew to like it after a while. The seat is a lot more open where the previous seat we owed was cushy but hotter than heck for him to sit in. He would sweat in the other seat and that is not the case with this product.
Easily adjustable for growth, my 7mo old son always falls asleep in it on our way home

We were in a wreck and my son was in this seat. He didn't even seem to realize something happened. It holds him safely and comfortably. So when I needed to replace it after the wreck, I wanted another just like it.
Mom of three, this is my favorite infant car seat I've used! It's lightweight and easy to carry. Easy to get in and out of car using the base.
I hate the straps aren't adjustable like regular ones. But you get what you pay for
I didnt receive a cup holder for it but my daughter loves it
Amazing seat, so safe and cozy. A little heavy and big so check your cars capacity before buying.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Met expectations! Would highlly recommend! Easy and simple to manage. Light 🏋 wieght and convenient for travel!
My baby head is fully secured and he is at ease while I’m driving and he’s drinking his bottle or feeding
A great seat my son loves it
My daughter liked it from day 1. Looks stronger than my previous Graco. Easy to install and the access to tighten is great feature.you cant ask for more for this price.

We got this for my son to transfer out of a five point harness. Happy with it except he cannot buckle himself. The seatbelt weaves through the car seat at the shoulder and it is difficult even for me to pull the seatbelt through. We are constantly untwisting the seatbelt. I realize safety is most important but I find this car seat inconvenient to use. We have had multiple britax car seats and this is my least favorite purchase/model.

This is our third Britax Advocate ClickTight. We love this carseat, primarily because of the safety, but also because of the ease of installation. The carseat can grow with your most valued little person. We have one for each car, yes they are expensive, but we feel good about each purchase knowing our child is in the safety possible carseat. Thanks Britax, we will be lifetime customers no doubt. We also like that they last 10 years, our next one will use them as well!
I love everything about this car seat. My one year old now rides so comfortably. We also have the same car seat for our 3 year old. Love love love.
Cant get it to tighten down.  Now I have to take time out of my day to return this piece of junk. Reviews on Amazon are worthless.

Currently using it in the front seat of a 2011 Ford Ranger as a rear facing seat without the latch system, only has fold down jump seats in the back so I have to put it in the front seat with the passenger airbag disengaged. Not entirely sure if it will even fit in my 2001 Mercury Cougar because that vehicle has two scooped back seats and not much room without the front seats all the way forward. This seat does not recline unless you roll a thick towel and put it under the seat. My LO Loves to fall asleep during car rides and needs to recline back plenty. He tends to get a little fussy on longer car rides (over an hour and a half) but Im not sure if thats because the seat is uncomfortable or if its cause he wants to assert his independence and move around. The seat doesnt feel like its got a lot of padding and is probably uncomfortable on longer car rides. It works pretty good as a back up car seat for the price.

After reviewing lots of car seats, checking consumer reports and other sites, this seemed like a great fit. It’s a good price but highly rated for safety. Spending hundreds of dollars doesn’t ensure your child’s safety which isn’t how these products are marketed. It was simple to install and is easy to get a child in and out. As they grow, it has gotten harder to keep the straps tight, but I don’t know that that’s a flaw of the seat so much as a sign the child is close to needing a new seat or configuration.
Very easy to put together. It's very cute too. My son loves his seat. He's 23mo

So i finally upgraded my 2 year old from her infant carrier to this car seat (she’s on the petite side) we installed this seat forward facing and she’s loving it so much! The car seat is very durable, sturdy and very padded which gives her a ton of comfort! We love the head rest. Keeps her head in place while giving her comfort while leaving her room to move her head from side to side. Also love how easy it is to position the straps. Just have to move the head rest either up or down to get the straps in the correct place (right at her shoulders). This seat was over all easy to install. After looking at a bunch of different convertible car seats, I went with this one and I’m so glad I did! I love how it will grow with her and she won’t ever need another car seat after this one! This car seat has met all of our expectations and then some. I can tell she is very safe and comfy in it which is all I can ask for. Highly recommend!

Wonderful car seat.  The simple, yet very important question of height limit has never been answered.  I bought this car seat and have absolutely loved it and so did my daughter, however seat height is an issue.  What is the maximum height  child can be and safely ride in this seat......45 inches.  My daughter is 42 inches at just 4 years.  Wish this car seat extended to 52 inches like the maxicosi 85 or I wish I had not wasted 350.00$  on a car seat  she only got 4 years use.

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: We been using chicco from the beginning and very satisfied with our purchase.

If youre here reading the reviews trying to decide to get this car seat let me be the first to tell you YES GET THIS CAR SEAT. I am so happy with my choice of getting this one. It was easy to install and easy car seat to understand. I was worried it would be too big in the back of my small hyundai elantra but it fits just perfectly! I am very picky and always do research before getting something and I would recommend this car seat to everyone I know. There are absolutely no cons to it and the best pro is that its one of the only car seats if not the only one that can rear face to 50 pounds! I love feeling like my baby is safe in the car and he loves it just as much as me! And the best part is this car seat can grow with baby so it will get good use out of it for the next few years!
We used this on a trip to Orlando.  It was so easy to store and quick to inflate.  Perfect for our 5yr old.  I felt my son was safe and he said he was comfortable when we had him use it.

After many carseats with 4 kids this is by far my favorite! Many great points with this seat.
~the high weight rear facing i,want to keep my littles rear facing for As long as possible
~The latch hooks are insanely easy to get right all latch hook systems should be like this
~9 recline positions
No matter how your seat is you can always get a. Perfect angle with no head falling foward
~My 36lb newly 2yr old looks so comfy in this seat and has plenty of leg room still
~beginning at 5lbs with the infant insert
So this is the only seat you need for infant to booster! Why spend money on a infant seat when you can start right off with this seat
~Does not make my child sweat like other seats have done
~Does not absorb liquid for the most part
~Shoulder straps So you dint feel inclined to buy after market ingress that are unsafe to use
~2 position chest clip to grow with child
~Easy to adjust to the next height
I absolutely hate rethreading shoulder straps when they grow ...with the chicco nextfit you just push down on the orange button on top and pull the head rest up....so easy!
~2 positions for buckle between legs so you can move it out further as they get older and very easy to do as well

I,do dislike house easy the chest clip is to unbuckle
Also that the zip cover wasn't out when i bought (came out 1 month later :( ) so it is a little harder to clean which is a necessity with a carseat that will be with your child for such a long time

Bought this for my big 2 month old, who was suffering terribly in his bucket seat due to reflux. He loves the new seat. It is difficult to fit in a car in the recline position as we have to pull the drivers' seat far forward, but I find it comparable to my DDs britax convertible, except the anchors-- they're a nuisance. BUT that's my only complaint, and I love the seat and the price.
Really great
great chair.  seems comfortable. would definitely recommend.

I have one child and I have purchased six different car seats. We have had a Chicco Keyfit30 Infant Carrier, a Graco MyRide 65, a Safety 1st Complete Air 65, a Graco Nautilus, a Britax Frontier 85, and the Graco Smart Seat. I loved the Chicco, the MyRide, and the Britax. I loathed the Safety 1st and was lukewarm about the Nautilus. The Smart Seat is way better than the Safety 1st and the Nautilus. If my child was smaller and still rear-facing I would probably prefer the Smart Seat over the Frontier as well. The Smart Seat is great because it can really be the only seat you will need once you transition from an infant carrier. I love that the Smart Seat has a recline feature. Its very useful anytime my son falls asleep in the car. The seat is huge, but it fits in my Honda Civic without an issue (but again, I don't use it rear-facing). It is fairly easy to install and the built in lock off clip is really neat for a seat belt install if you need it. It is a pain to move this to other cars (like when Grandma takes the kid for the weekend), but part of that might be that I refuse to shell out another $100 for a second base for occasional use. There are some things I just plain don't like about this seat. The armrests are a joke. They move, but they don't really stay up. The up position on the armrests doesn't get them out of the way when you are trying to put the kid in the seat either. It is a pain to get my son in and out of this seat because it sits so high up and the armrests are always in the way. Its a little bit easier in cars with more headroom than the civic, but its still a pain. The crotch buckle can be difficult to release and there have been a couple of times that I thought I wasn't going to be able to get my kid out of the stupid thing. Overall, if you are transitioning from an infant seat, this is a great car seat to consider because its so versatile. I like the Smart Seat and my complaints may seem minor, but these are the things that keep me from loving this seat. If you have an older child that is already forward facing, look into the Britax Frontier 85 because it has a higher height/weight limit for the harness and higher limits as a booster without being as cumbersome.

I have downgraded this car seat for two reasons: First, the hooks for the LATCH system are poorly designed and very difficult to release. Second, the Owner's Manual is something that only a lawyer could love. On the positive side, the seat feels sturdy and seems safe, but I will leave that judgement to competent consumer testing labs.

The attachment hooks for the LATCH system are question mark shaped, spring closing type devices. Attaching and releasing the hook from the rear anchor is not a problem since the rear LATCH anchor is visible and easy to reach. This is not the case with the seat level LATCH anchors which are hidden below the crease between the seat bottom and the seat back. Attaching the hooks to the lower LATCH anchors is a bit of guesswork and removing them is a total pain in the derriere. Since they are not visible and the spring takes some directional strength to remove, it is challenging to release them. I am a sixty plus year old grandparent and thought it might be me that couldn't make these hooks release easily. However, my son-in-law ( thirty years old; six foot five inches; 210 pounds) struggled for some time to remove the hooks. By contrast, we also have a Britax seat for a smaller child that has a push-button release for the seat level LATCH anchors. The release protrudes above the crease between the seat and back and so is easy to access and operate. This is much better design.

If you are a parent and installing the seat for a long period of time, this may not be too big of a concern. If you are a grand parent or other relative who will be installing the seat for shorter periods of time as kids visit, I would recommend considering another car seat.

The manual: Clearly written by a lawyer with a talent for obfuscation. It jumps back and forth between built-in harness/no built-in harness/back support/no back support/with LATCH/with car lap and shoulder belt. Vehicles built since 2002 have the LATCH system installed, but the LATCH instructions come last in each discussion of harness/no harness ....... - It is unnecessarily confusing. The installation with LATCH should be in a separate section at the first of the manual. Without LATCH should be after that and a note should be given at the first of the manual which section to read. Similarly, all with harness and without harness should be grouped. It's not that hard.

My niece (8 yrs old) loved this booster & could even put herself in it without any help from me. Definitely recommend.
Great car seat.

I like the car seat however there is only one side to tighten down. It seems like that would be more convenient however it doesn't get as tight as I would like. Wish both sides tightened down like my old one. Nice material and well built.
Some people wrote that this carseat is hard to install but we found it to be quite simple, just like any other carseat. The value and quality are top notch.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: We loved the bubble bum, but after 2 months of use, it no longer holds air, so it’s totally useless now, but our return window closed 6 days ago. 😢

Easy to install, friendly for everyday use. I got the tan and wished I would have gotten a different color as it shows everything and looks dirty, but it does clean easy when I feel motivated to get it out!
Granddaughter loves sitting in this one

We purchased one of these for our daughter over a year ago and now our boy needed a car seat too so we went with the same type as they worked so well. We took it out the box and put it in the living room and our little boy jumped in it straight away and within 20 mins was passed out and fast asleep. He loves it, everytime we go out in the car he just settles down and relaxes. He has plenty of room, can see out the windows and see everything that is going on and when he falls asleep, which he has done everytime so far, we can tip him back so he is more comfortable (although he is obviously more then happy even in the upright position).

We have quite a small car, a Ford Focus Wagon, and now ahve one of thes on each side. There is enough room in the middle for a small child or bags etc but not enough for a 3rd child seat but we don't need one yet. I read some coments about certain parts not being very well made and I have to disagree, our daughters will be 2 years old this summer and has been put in and out of the car hundreds of times, it has been jumped on, bounced on, used a play toy in the house, dragged around the house, washed and everything and is still in perfect condition. They are large but they are car seats, in our car there is not much leg room for anybody in the back so I expected that the kids would be able to reach the back of the seats and they do, I reconmend these to anyone who wants to have their children safe, secure and comfy and especially the ease for taking them in and out with the strap release is just another great feature, you can take the kids out after they have fallen asleep and just loosen the straps to get them out. Plus the price is great for all the added function and features.

If I ever need 3 car seats I will guarantee the 3rd one will be another one of these just in a different pattern again!!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Love that I can fit 3 in the back and have my son buckle himself too! Perfect for rental cars.
This is a great seat especially for the price
The best and good price im happy
Nice and light which was great for traveling. Easy to install and uninstall. Buckle is not sticky or hard to click.

We have bought four of these car seats this month alone! We had a cheaper car seat for my very tall 3 year old (42" 50lbs) and she complained non-stop. She does not complain about this car seat. The cup holder is streamlined and doesn't catch on legs and clothing like some other cup holders can. Installation was easy - there are separate latch belts for forward facing and rear facing for installation ease (no taking the whole thing apart to switch from rear to forward facing). Ours are forward facing, and are less bulky than other car seats; however, with a new baby coming, we chose an infant carrier, because this car seat rear facing would take up a lot of room. The straps are adjustable with a handle at the top (one of my must have features, because who wants to take apart the whole car seat because the straps don't fit right?!). It's more expensive than some other car seats, but for ease of use, it's definitely worth the $$$.

Special Features: 2 cup holders, 3 harness height positions, 5-point adjustable sagety harness, Superior side impact protection, Padded shoulder and crotch covers
Review: Works great! Had to put a little thought and back into installing, but not too hard. :) Bought this for my mom's car but I'm going to get one for 3 more cars!

I loved this chair and everything about it, even more than the preg pereggo primo viaggio. however, for infants i wish it would be better, baby's head kept going forward. i LOVE my cybex sirona, but can only bu used with isofix and is much more expensive, but after having those 3, the sirona is my fave and babies' too.
Works great, easy install.

Really impressed with safety 1st quality and the comfyness. The optional lumbar support cushion is a plus I think.
Also matches dad's interior so another plus on top of that. I use the latch system.
My 3 year old loves it!
highly recommend

This car seat is very easy to put in and out of the car, which I have to do often between my husbands and my car.  Considering buying another one.  Definitely worth the money.  The pattern is gorgeous!

Great car seat. Straps are more difficult to tighten compared to Uppababy Mesa and Chicco next zip.

Install: A little difficult to get tight ENOUGH to feel really secure.

Really like the amount of padding/security for the head.

Heavy and bulky so there might be better options of you are going to be moving these from car to car frequently. But on the same point they give you that added sense of security and safety for your little ones. We have two of these plus a Chico Kefit three wide in our Honda Pilot 2nd row, with a few inches to spare. One is forward facing and one is rear facing so it might be a tighter squeeze if both were forward, since the top sides flare out a bit. Also, we can't use the LATCH for the middle install because it is too close to the Drivers side LATCH for these seats. But the seatbelt install works fine in these for the middle seat, and feels more than tight enough when installed properly.

The LATCH system will not get tight enough and moves more then an inch from side to side and I cannot tighten the harness straps enough.  I pull as hard as I can and it just will not get secure my son enough. My sons head flops forward as others have complained about as well. Very disappointed considering the price.  Should have gone with a well known name brand.
Had one before, I do like the cup holders
Love the chairs.  They are just a little bulky
Super easy to install. And love the recline options.
Almost every time seat belt locks and I literally have to remove the whole car seat to undo the seat belt. Pain

We have a 2008 Toyota Yaris & a 2012 Toyota Carolla and needed to upgrade because our baby was an inch from outgrowing his other seat at only 9 months of age. We originally had a Baby Gear carrier seat which forced us to place it behind the passenger seat because the seat had to be moved up a lot. I did a search to find a carseat that would fit comfortably in our cars and this is the seat we found. My son can actually sit in the middle REAR facing in my husband's car & both him and any passenger has plenty of leg space (my husband is 5'11") and it fits perfectly behind the passenger seat of my Yaris with plenty of leg room for my friends that are over 6' tall. I was surprised we had so much more room compared to the carrier we were using. My son loves this seat and I would definitely recommend it. The straps are super easy to adjust with a lever at the top of the seat above the headrest which also adjusts the height as your child grows and the lever that adjusts the position of the seat is under the front of the seat.

Perfect! For my almost 6 year old
He’s
40 lbs
Great seat, easy set up, good drink and snack cups, easy for my 5 year old to get in himself, it's just a bit heavy to travel with.

3 car seats will not fit in the bench seat of a Chrysler Town and Country. Van.
Sure wish that they would.
Very well made and easy to install.

My 1 1/2 year old loves it.  He falls asleep almost instantly every time we hit the road.  The only thing about it is he can easily kick the back of my chair.  I drive a 15 passenger van, so there is usually decent leg room for adults, but my son's baby seat is close enough to my seat to kick.
Very nice seat. works great
We love this car seat. Great price and yet safe and durable. We have one for each kid and for both cars!
Light and easy to move.  The seat hook strap is very hard to tighten.  Am going to get a replacement from the manufacturer.  Working well otherwise.

I've researched and couldn't find any difference between backless or with so bought this to use while we were travelling. It came with a seatbelt adjuster which was nice and I didn't realize so my kid could make sure the seatbelt went over the shoulder nicely. Having 2 cup holders was definitely a pro
Excellend

Works OK.

Surely it is compact. But it takes the small ones quite some time to buckle it up, sometimes even need help from me. Also it is much less comfortable compared to the traditional ones.

I have twins, and this Graco convertible car seat came after our Chico infant seats. This Graco is a basic seat. It performs it's job well for the money, but it doesnt have much cushioning (it has removable pads that shift around and are a pain in the rear) and the seats rattle when I drive without my kids in the car. One of the twins puked all over the seat and we had to remove the cover to wash it. My husband had a difficult time getting the cover back on but I can say it did wash up nicely.  The covers are a light green and get dirty easily, but I do like the color when they are clean. The seats were easy to install. They easily adjust to several reclining positions. One really nice feature is the ability to adjust the straps to diiferent heights without having to take the whole seat apart. The red handle up top works quite easily to raise the straps as your child grows.

My daughter has been in this seat for several months now. She absolutely loves it!! She's tiny for her age so we waited until she was 5 to move her to a big booster like this. She's now 6 and has enjoyed this seat very much. She reports it's comfortable, cute, and she's able to buckle herself in on her own (even with a heavy winter coat on).

The seat comes in several pieces, but assembly is super easy. It took about 5 minutes (maybe less) to put it together. Once it's constructed, all you do is put it in the car and run a shoulder seatbelt strap through the appropriate slot. That's it!

My daughter isn't much of a car sleeper, but she has fallen asleep in this seat a few times. So it's possible.

I highly recommend this booster. It's easy to move, doesn't weigh a ton, it's easy to put together, and it's visually appealing to both kiddos and adults. We'll be ordering a second one soon when my youngest is old enough.
Great deal
Excellent!  Arrived on time and everything was just as expected 😊
It’s a great inexpensive seat. My son doesn’t put up a fuss when I put him in. It doesn’t stain easy. I would recommend.

This is my second round of Boulevard CS carseats. Kid #1 is still using hers at 3.5yrs, and will probably stay in it for the next 2 years. Kid #2 just moved into this one and is much more comfortable than in the carrier carseat.

This seat has a metal frame and is very solid from side to side, which makes me happy. Installation takes zero skill. The only drawback is that they are not small or slim - a bit too wide for airplane seats (you have to put the armrest up) and, when rear-facing, I have to slide the passenger seat forward slightly. An ok trade-off for me, though.
My son loves this carseat. Its made extremely well and sturdy. I will be buying another one once my youngest is big enough to use it.

What I admire about this car seat is the durability and strength of it. It is heavy, and best not to be taken in and out of the vehicle, unless you have someone to lift it.

There is more than enough padding to protect a small baby, or toddler. You can simply remove the insert once a baby outgrows it. I like to protect the seat as much as possible, and I use a fabric guard just in case of milk spills or baby accidents. My grandchild will soon outgrow it and we will use the Extend.

Note! Keep the booklet! It is very helpful when making any adjustments. The cup holders are helpful, but once in, they might be hard to put in again. This is fine quality, well-designed and of heavy construction and padding.
These are awesome. If you have a smaller vehicle these can fit x2 plus a booster seat because they are not as wide as other car seats.
good cost
All in time , fabulous!

Overall it is below average.

I have following issues with it:
- harness latches are relatively hard to unlatch
- rattles a lot more than a snake if unoccupied
- seat padding is almost non-existent

It is an amazing carseat! I kind of pain in the butt to adjust and figure out the settings but once done it fits in the van perfectly. Dreading having to adjust it again as she grows but once you spend a few moments figuring it out (because the directions are not the best) it can be done.
Exactly what I wanted and it came faster than it said. So I’m very happy
Our granddaughter loves this booster. She said it's comfortable and she likes the armrests and cup holders, which are nice features. The fabric is not plush, but for the price, it will be fine.
What can I say. My son loves this seat. Now he wants to ride with me all the time on his new seat jajaja. Feels nice and secure and its a perfect fit for him with plenty of room to grow.

While I like the car seat and loved the way it felt. I feel the straps never fit just right, the base is terrible, the adjustment light gray piece is so flimsy it just bent and made me feel the carseat was no longer safe for my daught

Nice car seat. Problem figuring out how to secure the child. The shoulder straps could not be tightened enough. Grand child is 23 lbs. Could be user error as it is the first car seat we purchased and installed in over 30 years and they have become so much more. will last us for many years because of the flexibility in design and weight guidelines. Would recommend.

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: We love our Chicco carseat! Best on the market very easy to install, cleaning is a breeze. I own 2 Chicco carseats. I also love how when my kids are sleep their heads don't flop.

bought this based on a recommendation of the "car crash detective" website. After researching this seemed to be best bang for buck. Had some old carseats that were actually pretty unsafe and wanted to upgrade. Many people dont know but if you want best protection you must keep you child in a rear facing seat as long as they can... and this does until 50 lbs vs others at 40 lbs. These seats were super easy to install vs my older ones. Levelers on side makes it easy to properly install. A bit bulky tho... I could only install on my passengers side back seat because of size.

update. taking 1 star off as when s child sleeps their head will slump over in this seat.
Works great for our son in our 2012 Ford Fusion.
It's absolutely perfect and easy to install, my 4 year old loves it and it's so easy to use.
Easily adjusted and installed. Removing and reinstalling the back separate from the seat is also easy. My daughter loves the fact that she can now buckle her self in like a big kid.

Love this carseat, this is the second one we've gotten.  We needed a spare that wasn't too expensive, and thankfully I caught this one on sale!  We had a problem with an older carseat we had purchased, so we contacted Graco, they reimbursed us and we bought a new one!  Graco is the best!

Fair warning this seat is heavy, my son was 9 pounds when he was born and it's a little strenuous at times. I do love the seat, it's super easy to adjust the straps and it's cozy for him. I would and have recommended this car seat. It is a little big, (I drive a suburban) but I'd rather my infant be safe. Overall the structure and function is the best I've experienced (mom of 5).
This car seat is easy to get in and out of the car. It is simple to buckle and unbuckle. It can get heavy if you are carrying it around, though.
Baby loves this seat! She looks very comfy in it and doesn’t sweat a ton in it!
Works great! He sleeps fine in it and brother and sister loved using his cup holders until he figured out how to pick them up.
Would buy again for sure. Easy to install and feels sturdy
I'm almost driven crazy by the noise made by this car seat in my Model Y..................... I'm going to return it, now! If you are neither deaf not insensitive to constant noise, don't buy it.
Very nice
The perfect car sit. Súper secure and comfortable! My kid lo es to go in a car ride!

Not much to say except it does its job and is sold here at a great price.  Plus it ships free if you meet the $25 threshold.  For those wondering it does have a cup holder, which is a necessity for my daughter!
Love this seat as it will grow with my grandson and I feel he is very safe. Bought the most highly recommended by Consumer Reports.
We bought this for our 7 years kid... It is very comfortable for long trips. It has one bottle holder. Material of this car seat is very good..
Great
We were expecting less due to the price but it’s a great seat. We also have a grows 4 me but I should have gotten 2 of these instead!!
It's a little narrow, but it's a good seat. My son says it's comfortable.

I loved this car seat! It was on an awesome prime day deal and couldn’t resist purchasing for my daughter! It fits her perfectly! Great quality car seat! True to picture and description! It’s still big in the car but not as big as other car seats and that’s what I love about the slim car seat. I would definitely buy again!
This seat is expensive but its steel reinforced and super comfortable for my baby.

Love this seat. Wish it was lighter in weight, but a trade off for safety. My son seems comfy so far. So easy to adjust the straps. The blue color is nice, very neutral. I've read they have a longer replacement piece for buckle between legs, have yet to confirm this still. Also, I have read how hard this was to install. In my opinion, if you don't want to learn proper installation, just don't buy this. It may be a pain, but feeling safe is so worth it.
Easy to install.

My 3 year old was getting close to the weight limit on her old car seat and after reading reviews and doing research we decided to go with this seat. The main reason was the functionality of it, it goes up to 110 lbs, converts from a 5 point harness to a high back booster (just remove the harness straps), and has 2 cups holders which was a bonus as our child always takes a cup of milk and juice wherever we go. It was east to install, its lightweight and most importantly, our 3 year old loves it. I plan on buying 2 more, 1 for our other car and 1 for my parents car.

Does the job. Carries babies up to 30 lbs. I hate the plastic seat bel clipping. Metal clips is just my preference. Most people are okay with it but I always have a problem putting the belt together and clipping it into the buckle. Overall, a great second car seat for our car.
We were looking for something affordable, not too bulky, and safe. This car seat has definitely met out expectations. It's very basic. Would work well in a smaller vehicle, too.
Excellent chair at a great price. Its light so we can move it easily between cars.

Pros:
My son 5 year old likes it and feels likes a big boy in it.
My son can buckles and unbuckle himself. (Took at little practice but he got it pretty quickly.)
Small
Easy to attach and unattach

Cons:
There is almost as much freedom as an adult in the regular seat with the seatbelt to move around. I don't like that my son can easily flop to the side, bend down with his chest to his legs. Just doesn't "feel" as secure and makes me nervous.
The red belt positioning plastic pieces don't lock into place very well so I find that they adjust to different settings during travel sometimes.
I wish there was a piece that somehow attached it to the seat (like latch system anchors) because the booster seat can move around a bit.

I really really wanted to love this booster seat, but I don't.
Love how lightweight this is and the cup holders
Great seat. Super easy to install, works well in a small car (saturn ion).
Very flimsy and not sturdy but I guess you get what you pay for.

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review:
I waited a year to write this review so I can really recommend this product and let me just tell you, I LOVE THIS CAR SEAT!

When comparison shopping for a car seat my biggest issue with almost all other seats I looked into was size when used rear facing. I drive a Nissan Versa note (very small and compact) so having a car seat that I could use rear facing for as long as possible was the most important factor. This car seat, even when reclined all the way, still allows me to fit in my drivers seat. The only space issue is the width of the seat. If I install it in the center seat then there is almost no room on either side for another adult. When installed on either side it leaves enough room for one person to comfortably sit. It’s perfect for us because we are a family of three but definitely something to consider.

The absolute game changer has been how comfortable this car seat has been for my child. I live in a city with heavy traffic and I also travel to a neighboring city which is two and a half hours away regularly and my daughter has not once had a meltdown in her car seat. Yes you read that right, in one year of use NOT ONE meltdown. She just turned two and is in the 70th percentile for height but still can comfortably ride rear facing.

All in all this is a great car seat and I cannot believe I waited so long to buy it. The only regret I have is not going with the zipper version for easier washing but tbh it doesn’t make it or break it for me.
bought this when my son couple years ago and it was nice especially on long rides ended up giving to my cousin and her child loved it too.

I have had nothing but Britax seats for my son and have always loved them.  I feel they are the safest and I won't buy anything else.  I specifically bought this seat because I wanted to use it as a booster at some point and it is the only one I know of that can be both latched and anchored.  While I still feel it is very safe, it is certainly a pain to deal with!  First, installation is far from easy.  You certainly don't want to be moving this thing around very often.  It's heavy and huge.  I didn't have many problems when I was using the 5 point system, but now that I have converted over to the seat belt/booster seat with my son, it is extremely annoying.  The belt gets stuck in the shoulder routing area each and every time he uses it. It gets twisted and mangled and my son cannot even buckle himself in because of this.  Now I have to strap him in every time.  I thought a booster seat was supposed to build a child's independence.  Instead, now I have to strap in my 6 year old every time he gets into the car.  Additionally, the belt will not retract when he unbuckles himself, again because it is stuck in the seat's shoulder routing area.  It just hangs twisted and loosely, often getting shut in the car door. After spending close to $300 on this seat, I really don't want to have to buy another one, nor do I want a less safe seat for him.  However, I'm far from happy about how this seat is functioning as a booster.
Great booster seats.  We have a pair in both of our vehicles.

I purchased this seat for my 1yr old daughter. She is about 23 pounds. We put her in the seat and she immediately loved this seat. The crying has stopped. She sits up like a big girl and we do not even know she is back there now. This seat is very comfortable. The only thing I do not like is that it do no recline back much at all. Overall I love this seat. I will keep my fingers crossed and hope everything goes well when we hit the highway again!
Arrived on time & grandson likes it as is more comfortable than old seat.

We have two forward facing diono RXT’s and an infant urbini. They fit 3 across (with some room to spare) in a 2017 Kia Sorento. They will undoubtedly fit 3 across when the time comes.
They are very narrow, which is nice, but also very long which isn’t so nice. If we had either seat rear facing it would have made for pretty uncomfortable ride for the front seat BUT that’s with any rear facing seat I suppose.

Will update more after a month or so of use.
Only one cup holder came with the car seat
Still have this carseat now using it for my daughter love it
Absolutely love the car seat! He seems to be very happy as well!

The best car seat by far!!  We have 2 britax seats and a chicco nextfit and this one is the best. My younger son screamed every time we put him in the car. I mean screaming to the point of gagging and throwing up sometimes. It was the worst. After buying this seat he is like a whole new child. He sits up higher and can see out the windows and I'm sure it's more comfortable due to all the padding and the softer material. Plus it looks really good in my SUV!!  Definitely recommend this.
The best car seat, my baby love it. I am very satisfied with the transport speed and the car seat's quality.

This is a really nice booster seat and is super easy to install. The push on snaps for your car clips makes it so easy to install and uninstall your seat with ease. The seat itself is very comfortable with lots of padding. My little one loves riding in her big girl seat now and actually sits in a car now without complaining. I love the fact how roomy it is.

With a new Grandson in our family. We needed a safe, dependable easy to install car seat
for his safety. His parents live in another state so we decided to invest in a car seat
to make traveling with a baby easier for them. The detail and comfort are both things
we were looking for and this met our needs.
Love this car seat except that it’s a pain to get it to stay at the correct angle. I had to use 2 rolled up towels to feel secure. It’s now not moving anywhere.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: It says it can be used up to 100lbs but my 50lb son can’t use it without it losing air after 10 minutes. It’s unusable for us. I wouldn’t buy this again.
It’s nice
great seat.  Only shortcoming is when in the under-2 (rearfacing) position, toddler's legs are crowded against the back seat.
I ordered three of these for different vehicles. One of the boxes was missing the arm pad/cushion, but had everything else. All in all not a bad purchase for $20. Easy to install and move.
Excellent !!
Great quality and so easy to use.  My second car seat by Britax.  Really recommend them.  This version is very easy to adjust and to clean.
Love this ClickTight car seat! It is our second one and is a breeze to adjust and install.
Love this seat!
Pleased
Great product! As advertised!
Love the size
We love this car seat. Excellent padding/head protection.
This car seat and base is so much easier to use than my other one. Plus, it just seems sturdier, and I love that it works with our Bob.

I haven't personally sat in this seat but I have to say it looks like the little guy is VERY comfortable.  Our past trips in the car were a LOT of screaming and him wanting to get out and stretch but with this seat he actually quietly played and napped on a MUCH longer trip.  The baby is 16months old and is 30lbs and 97% in height (for reference).
Granddaughter loves Wonder Woman and loves this seat.  It’s light and the movable cup holder is very handy.
best price for this level, easy to move from one car to another, fit for my 6 years old son

Seems to be just what we wanted as far as safety features, particularly the latch system. For that I gabe 3 stars.

The disappointment with the seat is that the Grapeade is not really purple or the color of "grape ade" or juice, but a purple-tinted gray.

Our kiddo specifically wanted a pretty pink or purple seat for her new carseat, so that is the bummer with this. It is not a kids' color, more of a grownup grayish purple.
Purchased this car seat for my nephew.  He looks so happy and most importantly protected.  Thank you
Love how lite and easy it was to install. I had to look at YouTube videos though.
Great Car seat for a really low price. Saved me over $100.
Love that it's easy to install and I can take apart the fabric to wash each part separately

I have to say... this is the best built seat I've ever seen. It's heavy, it's solid steel framing. We are trying to put 3 seats in my 2020 Camry, so my Graco 4Ever was way too big. We ordered the booster seat from the same company for the middle and will get a thinner infant car seat for the other side, but apparently, these can be 3 across. I'll consider getting a second one of these to use as an infant seat, but I like the removable infant seats for when they're little little.

My grandson is big for his age, but we still feel he needs the safety of a car seat rather than a booster seat.  At 45 pounds he still has grow room in this seat.  My only frustration is getting to the buckle on the seat when he is in the seat.  The cup holder is great.  We took him on two vacations this year traveling about 3000 miles with assurance of his comfort and safety.
I bought this as a gift and they love it.
Perfect for my  3 year old grandson in my 2018 Ford Edge

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: I used the Chicco keyfit and loved it.  When Baby outgrew that, I bought the Britax Marathon for the sitter's car.  (She's a new driver and I wanted the highest-rated for safety)  I bought the Nextfit for my car based on the great reviews.  Plus, it is lighter weight than the Britax Marathon so I thought it would be food for air travel.  I have an advanced degree and watched several videos on YouTube but found this to be impossible to install rear facing with a seat belt.  It was clear after removing the crotch buckle cover that I was never going to get it threaded again.  I wrestled in the backseat of my Honda Accord for 45 minutes before I decided that this simply wasn't the car seat for me.  Removing the cover, which is required to thread the seat belt, further convinced me that this is not all that washable.  Plus, the fussiness of installation means it's not good for travel.  I mean, who's going to spend 45 minutes installing a car seat with the cab meter running?  Since it doesn't install quickly and is, therefore, not good for travel, I've decided to return it in favor of a second Britax Marathon.  I will say that that the fabric on the Nextfit was softer and more plush that then Britax.  So maybe it's better for car trips.  But in no way was this as easy to install as the Keyfit or the Britax . . . and since it isn't any cheaper or safer than Britax, that seems like the much better choice for our family.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: So happy I didn't spend 70$ on a cart!
Easy to install
Nice
Kids love the (dinosaur) print and prefer the comfort of this seat over the other style we have. Highly recommend!

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review:
Where was this seat when my older children were younger!

It’s worth the price, comfortable and easy to switch between vehicles. It’s light enough my daughter can carry it and switch seats with her siblings. Perfect for older children still required to use a booster in vehicles.
I like it

I love it because it pops right into my Britax B Agile stroller. Love that. It makes life very easy. Between the two sun shades I have full coverage, no need for anything to cover baby in the Dr. office or when he is asleep and I am out. It really is made well and the clasps are easy to work, along with snapping it into the car seat.
