I can't say anything bad about it, but … I did just get it, so if something should happen I will update my review to reflect that. Good value, however, considering the name brand.

This is my first Diono. I’ve always used chicco car seats with my kids, but after researching this company and having the opportunity to try this car seat out for free I jumped at the chance.

I love that Diono is a US based company, and one that works prioritizes safety. Like I’ve said I’ve always used chicco, and while I’ve had no complaints about their car seats I do feel like Diono is a step up, though the prices are fairly comparable.

First impressions of the Radian 3RXT….. WOW! It was packaged nicely. And the instruction booklet has a handy little pocket on the side for storage! I know that doesn’t seem like a big deal, but when you’re transitioning the car seat with your growing child and you can’t remember what’s what because you can’t find the booklet, this will be so nice.

Loved the bright red color. The fabric is very nice, quality stitching. Chest straps are cushioned well and have sort of an anti-slip texture on the back side. That comes in super handy for us parents with those kids that love to adjust their own straps when they shouldn’t!

It folds for travel, although you might rethink that because this thing is BEAST! It is heavy! I’ve lugged caresses through the airport before, but I’m not sure I’d recommend this one for travel.

It also has a nice memory foam cushion in the seat.

Now as far as using the seat, I don’t have much input on the infant or reverse stages. I used it for a few months in the forward facing five point harness stage. And currently using the high back booster. I felt comfortable with my daughter’s safety in both stages. It was just as easy to install as our chicco.

Initially I was not a fan of the seat belt placement of the chest strap. On our other booster there is a plastic holder that you slide the belt into and with the Diono you just slide it beside the headrest. It just seemed a little awkward for placement, but it’s worked fine and I used to it now.

I love the slim design. I always have two car seats in my vehicle and it can be difficult squeezing between them, when you need that third seat. I wish my other car seat was like this one! And even though it’s slimmer, my little still had plenty of seat room.

It took my a second to figure out the cup holder! Just shove it in there and turn! Again another thing that initially threw me, but now it makes so much more sense!

And with the 120 lb weight maximum, I don’t anticipate ever having to buy another car seat!

Overall, I’m really impressed. This is definitely a car seat company I’ll be recommending in the future.
The only rear facing sitting on this car seat is laying down.  So only an infant or forward facing child for this car seat. Unfortunately I need a rear facing for a child who wants to sit up.

I have a large 3 year old boy and have had such difficulty with finding him both a car seat and booster seat that he could get out of.  I purchased this because of the latch system and it’s so much better if you have a wiggler like mine!  The cup holder and snack trays are a nice bonus
Great booster seat for my growing boy! He can climb and buckle himself in and likes to do so, before we inspect, of course. Cup holders fold in and out and work great!

This functions well as a car seat for a child too large for a baby seat as well as serving as a booster seat indoors. Adjustable armrests have two very functional adjustment stops that prevent collapse.

Very pleased with this product.
Best Car Seat I have owned so far. And this is my fourth child. The ease of changing the strap sizes is amazing. Reclining the seat is easy. My son no longer screams on long car rides.
We have 3 carseats in the back. fits great! We use it for our 22 month old. it's perfect.
Great booster
It sits good in the car. Granddaughter likes it.
Great seat to transition our little one into after the infant bucket. Very secure, fairly easy to install, and well made.

I purchased this car seat as a back up for days when my daughter is with her grandma. The car seat was flimsy feeling and lacked cushion. The padding on it is very thin and was basically like sitting on just the hard plastic itself. I returned this item and went to a nearby store and bought a better quality car seat.
We were in an accident and my son was kept safe. Buying another one because I love the peace of mind knowing my baby is safe. I would give 100 stars if I could.
Grandson loves his new "big boy" car seat. It will be great for years to come and for the second grandson.
Lightweight

Special Features: Washable FabricWashable FabricAdjustable CanopyAdjustable CanopyRemovable Seat Cushion
Review: I love the design of this seat, the extra protection bar is also nice for easy lifting out of vehicle.

Good size for small car , My kid 2 yrs like it .
Affordable price .
Product was perfect!
Wish I bought this seat for all of our vehicles (mine,  and two care givers)... Takes up a Small amount of space -  works great in my husbands Camano. ..the  Stable cup holder is a plus!
My son HATED his infant seat but loves this one.  We do have trouble every now and then because you have to pull the strap really hard to get it tight enough.  Overall, though we are very happy.

Perfect for grandkids of both sexes. Now my grandson doesn't mind having to sit 'in a girl's seat. (He's a little outnumbered at 8 grandgirls to 2 grandsons.)

I love that it's lightweight and easy to attach (I am disabled.) The fabric cleans up well. The kids love having TWO cup holders. I was able to put it together easily. Best of all I feel better knowing my grandkids are protected. I have used Graco products for over 30 years. Twice I have had a problem and they replaced the item.
My son is 20 months and I bought this for a short trip. I couldn’t get it rear facing comfortably for him. Nope
perfect! fast shipping
This is the second one I’ve purchased for my grand kids. It is great quality, works rear facing and forward facing, is easily adjustable and should last a long time.

I have a huge issue with the seatbelt on this chair. It's so difficult to get my daughter tightly secured in this carseat. I have found that extending the length gives more room to pull the belt but its always an ordeal. This is in my mothers car thankfully and not in mine. I spent more money on our Graco 4Ever but I absolutely love it. This seat just doesnt compare. My mother didn't want to spend the extra many and well, you get what you pay for.

After installing per the instructions, I couldn't find a way to not have it feel very loose in the seat. Not sure if it only works with certain vehicles but my jeep compass has flat seats in the back and this car seat could slide back and forth a significant amount. Will be returning it. If it was safe it would be perfect. The features are great.
The only problem I have is the safety harness click belts. Its a pain to switch it from rear-facing to rear-facing. The harness just doesn't stretch or tighten.
It’s not light weight
Love the Booster Seats
We have had it for a month and have yet to install it. I bought it and we couldn’t get it installed and then I read the reviews stating this is hard to install! Very pretty car seat
This is my second car seat i love it
Easy to use and perfect for the 3 year old that we bought to grow into.
I love the safety features of this seat. Purchased for the slim fit feature and it is perfect.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: It’s great

I LOVE this seat.  I originally purchased a different seat in a hurry due to a last minute overseas move and ended up hating it- the straps were difficult to adjust and was just overall bulky.  But not only is this one easy to install, it is also easy to adjust.  My son seems to be comfortable in it and when the day comes, we will purchase another one for his baby sister.  I also appreciate that it is much narrower than a lot of other car seats, but still has plenty of room for my son to be comfortable.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: I admit that this is a cool concept, but the problem we had with it was our seven year old's rear was just too big for this seat.  He has just outgrown his Britax Frontier and though I knew this wouldn't be as wide as that, but I thought that it would give him a lift in the bucket seat without causing him discomfort despite it's small width.  My son sat on it for about four minutes before he said it was making his butt go numb.  For reference, my seven year old is 85 pounds and about 48 inches.  My five year old is a tiny guy and he fit well on this seat, but then we have the opposite problem for him -- at 48 pounds and 44 inches, it just doesn't seem safe to not have him in a full-back booster.  I'd say this seat has a very specific market.  I'm sure it's great for travel, but not totally practical for every day use for our family.
Very cute and very supportive , great for newborns less then 4 weeks , tho tiny can adjust straps to them !!
the best car seat . very easy to put in and out of the car, the comparable stroller is awesome. don't look any further buy it you will love it.

This is the best car seat on the market for extended rear facing! My son is 4.5 years old, 44” y’all and roughly 45 lbs and he’s still completely comfortable rear facing in this seat. It’s so easy to raise the headrest too, no need to rethread the straps.
Extended rear facing is so much safer for our precious kids. This seat is a great deal and makes it easy to continue rearfacing to the maximum!
Great upgrade as my little girl grows up!  Love Graco brand car seats - two daughters raised on these :)

I've been using this car seat for my 15mo old son for about a week. It seems very comfortable for him and was super easy to install. I was skeptical about the super cinch being as easy as they say but it truly was. The only down side is I feel the belt tightening strap is a bit hard to pull tight, but not unmanageable and will probably get better with more use.

Sorry to Amazon up front but you can find this much cheaper. I paid $240 incl shipping from an online and manufacturer recommended store using a coupon.
Easy to install and move between cars.  Like the velcro on the sides to keep the straps out of the way when setting child in the seat.

The seat itself looked really comfortable and roomy.  I need it rear facing but the "latch" strap was too short.  To get the seatbelt threaded was a battle.  Eventually gave up and threw it out of the car.  If my son was old enough for forward facing, it would be about perfect.
My son love sitting in his new booster! He is very comfy in it and he loves having more freedom!
I love it

After a lot of research, we bought this carseat. We had a Diono prior and thought the steel frame made it safer. But after looking at crash test data, discovered this carseat was actually much higher rated! Maybe it's just because we got this after the unnecessarily heavy and difficult to adjust Diono but this carseat is amazing! You can adjust the height quickly and while you're buckling them in. The legroom makes extended rear facing more feasible. And it is so light and easy to switch between vehicles!

10/10 recommend.

It gets dirty verrrrry easily, even with just water or diluted juice or hot-day sweat.
Have to wash them constantly! (I bought two) But as far as customer service and delivery, they were great!!
My baby falls sleep in this car seat. It looks si comfortable
Fabric very hard to keep clean, does not wash well, not comfortable, my son hates it and loved his last car seat

I Didn’t order from Amazon but I was looking for weight and height..Live this car seat bought it a few years ago.it was pretty pricy but my daughters safety is what’s important. However she’s 5yrs and 1/2 about 60lbs she’s tall for her age and has seem to have outgrown it 😕No matter  how I Adjust the straps they are Too tight for her! also very tight on the leg crotch area. I was really hoping yo use it till she was big enough to transition to seatbelt but looks like that won’t happen. I don’t know if I feel a booster seat is safe yet!! I really wish they made the straps and crotch buckle with more slack! That’s the only downfall for me..

like the carseat, this second one i bought. i have a 2 year old & 5 year old both in this car seat. the coda cover material is cheaper than my other one. probably why it was cheaper. i have no problem washing the cover, but the buckles to release the belts for latch are extremely hard to loosen when trying to install/ uninstall in car. comfy seat to sleep in...better than nautalis i also have.

I like our graco nautilus way better. Didn't like the lack of cup holder and the straps are hard to use especially for people who don't use them daily like grandparents. It does have nicer material than the nautilus though.
Easy to assemble & install in truck.

Purchased this to replace my 16 month granddaughter 's seat that she grew out of. Wish I had just purchased this one. I installed it in the middle back seat in my Subaru wagon in less than 10 minutes.The seat fits perfectly in the rear facing position. Strap adjustments couldn't be any easier. It's obvious that a lot of thought went into the design and safety features of this seat.
Great Seat for my 13 month old, I feel she is secure & safe after reading so much about the Britax line.

I purchased this while my spouse got a more expensive brand. I should say you get what you pay for. It’s pretty flimsy. The red button to unlock is pretty poorly designed. I’ve to wiggle the latch out of it everyday. The shoulder stretch keeps flipping and doesn’t stay put. I have to adjust it every 2-3 days.  Not satisfied with this product.
Not easy to use and does not seem comfortable for our boys legs

This car seat is the best I’ve ever had. Feels the safest for my son out of any car seat I’ve ever installed. Very sturdy but easy to uninstall and reinstall in 5 minutes. Safety is the most important thing and I genuinely feel safe with my 16 month old in this.

Not as easy to put it in as they make it look! About broke my wrist trying to close the lid! And yes I had all the slack out of the seat belt
And the rebound bar comes with very little installation instructions. I’m not sure it is I in right.
It looks nice tho. And baby has lots of room to grow. But I would definitely not put newborn in it! Not enough head support
We love the car seat. It was easy to install and my son is very comfortable and likes sitting up.

This seat is easy to get my grand daughter in and out of. Looks good and she is comfortable in it. She is two and a half and this will last her a long time, also bought another one for another one of our cars.
Works great, easy to use, good quality.
I was hoping he would set up a little higher, guess he just needs to get taller.  All the little storage around the seat a pretty useful

Got this on clearance for $40. Would have been disappointed if I'd paid more I think. It's definitely safe and serves it's purpose, but it's absolutely base- no bells and whistles at all. The handle is not as sturdy as I would like. You could get a sturdier, nicer seat on sale at the $80 price.

I love all the features of the car seat.  It is an awesome car seat and you could take it from one car to another and adjust from rear-facing infant to forward facing 4 y/o in a minute or two.  The features are awesome.  I've now owned it for 2 years.
I assembled 2 of them and once I got them hooked into the hooks in my car, it works amazingly!

Purchased this for our second child - probably the tenth infant seat I've installed between us, our family, and helping out friends. It's fine for the kid - very good angle when rear-facing, quick to get the little one in and out.

But I wouldn't recommend this to anyone - because it is extremely difficult to install. When installing in rear-facing mode, the vehicle seat belt is fished between the cushion and the frame - just like most other seats. However, the opening is extremely small. My hands aren't especially thick, but I can't get them into the opening. It takes a half-dozen attempts, squeezing my fingers through the tiny openings on both sides, hoping I can catch the seatbelt latch and pull it through without locking the shoulder belt. And the plastic around the inside of the openings isn't finished - just square cuts with very rough edges. I've lost skin on my hands all three times this seat has been installed.

Always check out the seat belt openings at a store before you buy a car seat. If you can't get your hand comfortably through the opening - find a different seat. You never know when an emergency can cause you to move a safety seat - make sure you can do it quickly, comfortably, and without any confusion.

We have an early 2013 model, and some reviewers have said there have been changes made... but the straps have some horrible flaws: A) they are not long enough... especially if your child has a jacket on... you have hardly any working room to get them tightened B) the awful shoulder pads, need I say more... read other reviews C) you cannot move the straps out of the way before putting the child in, so you will be digging underneath your child to find the straps, and in the process you will end up getting the slideable buckles reversed on the straps... this is a great joy to have to fix while your kid is squirming around let me tell you...

Other than that, the padding material looks very comfortable and holds up well... maybe a little hot for summer time... but it looks like it is quality and wont get broken down for a long time...
Perfect, but NOT a deal.

Special Features: Online Chat via ParentLink, Live Video Installation Support, EasyClick LATCH
Review: Never realized how big of a difference a small latch makes. EasyClick LATCH system is amazing. Makes removing seat for adult guest not an ARGHHH moment. The large head bolsterings make it a little more difficult to put kids in and out of car

This was a gift for my grandchild.  They love it!  My son is tall and he finds the handle long enough for him. It is easy to open and close. I would definitely by it again.  It hooks in and out quickly and safely. I also bought the stroller and a second base as well.  All our great and good quality.
ok,
This item was purchased for my granddaughter and I bought two one for each car, she is loving the room and the safety features

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: My nephew fit perfectly, it is comfortable, easy to clean and fold. I’m very impressed on how easy this chair makes life for parents
Hasn't held up as well as I hoped, but still does the job.

This child seat is very well made. I read the reviews before purchase and was very impressed by them. This seat provides maximum of protection and is large enough that it will last through all the child safety seat requirements until child is old enough not to need a safety seat.

Cuando leí la descripción sobre 3 en 1, realmente no lo podía creer. Esto ha sido una maravilla! Saber que estaremos usando esta silla por mucho tiempo me hace saber que es una excelente inversión. Graco siempre ha sido mi marca favorita de sillas para niños, y con este artículo simplemente nos enamoro. La silla es confortable, segura y de alta calidad.

I have been using this now for a year, and have no problems at all. Installs very easily with the latch system, just stripped it down and washed it, and after a year, looks almost like new again. If properly installed, barely budges, and is simply to adjust the angle, the height, set it for rear or front facing, etc. Would buy again if I needed to.
One thing to watch out for, if the child figures it out, they can lean forward, making it seem like the harness is tighter than it is. I’ll usually set him in, strap him up, distract him for a second or to, and readjust if needed.
Best car seat and it is not bulky.

I saw the designer give a presentation for this seat at a Child Passenger Safety Conference and decided to give it a try. I bought one as a test seat for our 2 children who still need seatbelt adjustment. Our intention was to buy another if it worked for both kids as we have a smaller back seat and the space saving design was a huge bonus for us and their older brother who has been cramped by several booster seat trials. We have 2 very different sized children: a wirey boy, age 10, 4'4", 65 lbs; and a tough as bricks girl, age 6, 3'4”, 70 lbs
What we determined:
This is a great seat for my small framed 10 year old. He loves that he is not in a little kid booster seat and I love that he is being protected. He also loves that he has more padding in the seat than his previous booster seat. Long rides were always a struggle as he begged to stop frequently to get a break from his previous seat.
However, our 6 year old, who is built differently, weighing more and with a wider hips, hated this seat. She complained that the plastic, adjustable sides pinched her and she really struggled with getting the seatbelt threaded correctly.
Overall, we are pleased with the purchase and will continue to use the Mifold for our son as long as we can.

Car seat is good “bang for your buck.” Was relatively easy to set up and put in car. Baby trend has app which also helps with videos for installation. Car seat has sleek look as well! I purchased 2, one for each vehicle. I am very pleased with purchase.
Love these bc I have to put 3 in one row of the new SUV’s which is a much smaller seat, fits!
But, not the seats fault. I have a small car and the seat does not fit well. I am not sure any seat would.
Absolutely love this car seat

Loved this seat because of the colors and the fact my 3 year old could grow into it. Recieved it and put my daughter in it, and the straps were horrible. They dig horribly into her neck on every setting..... The spacing between the  strap slots on the back are far to close.... We are overseas, so now I have to pay a bunch just to ship this to return it.

This was a good deal, so that’s why I purchased it to have as a secondary car seat. It is advertised as rear, facing or front facing, but the seatbelt doesn’t reach in most cars to cause it to face backwards so I would say do not buy this if your baby is only able to rear face right now. This is definitely more for forward facing only! When I put it in the rear facing position, it wiggled a looooot. Also, the cushions are not attached to the seat. I wish that they had Velcro at least.

my son finds it very comfortable. After we tried one of these, the price was so good, we bought one for the other car.  and, they are convertible. They can have the back removed to make it a simple booster seat when the child is old enough.  good quality, good price and very safe for your child at the right weight and age!
Really nice, arm rests come off a little too easily
The material is not really good, dont like the strap buckle. Just use it for 3 weeks, dont know yet
Love it! Perfect choice
Easy and light

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: I wish I had never bought this car seat!! We love the ease of installation of this car seat . But that is as far as it goes . Every time we travel very far my grandson cries because he says his back hurts. It only has two crotch buckle slides and doesn’t let out enough for my grandsons comfort. (He is only 4) unfortunately car seats are too expensive to just go out and buy another one.
Love this car seat
Wonderful product.  Thank you.

As with many of the reviews I read, I did have trouble tightening the harness straps.  However, I watched some videos on Youtube and read some other suggestions and I think I have it figured out.  I am very satisfied with the seat and my 18 month old granddaughter rides very well in it.  I feel safe with Graco products and it is very comfortable.  I think people have to get used to the difference between the infant carrier seats, which you can tighten while not in the car, and this carseat that requires a different approach to tightening in the car.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: Now that we have to cart around the toddler seat, I was trying to figure out the easiest way that I could manage on my own. I was going to get the GoGo Kidz Travelmate, but found this one as well. I figured that for $15, might as well try this one out first! It works great! So easy and simple. Even my husband who usually rolls his eyes when I come home with "gadgets" for the baby thinks it's great. We've used it for 4 flights so far and my husband even went through security and took the car seat on the plane with this, carrying our little guy in his seat the whole time. We're very happy with it and hope it continues to work well for us as he gets bigger!
Built really good, safety first, love it
Love it.

I just installed this car seat today into my crossover SUV.  If I can do this anyone can, its that simple.  I was timing myself and needed this to be done in 10 minutes or less.  This took me 3 minutes.  It was so fast i was thinking that i forgot to do something or missed s step, but the bubbles told me i was just fine.  My son is 8 months old and average weight and height and looks very cozy inside the car seat.  I the shoulder straps are kinda a pain in a butt, so far though he doesn't seem to mind.  Only issue is the tightening system.  I cant seem to get it as tight as I want it without making baby mad or myself!  It just wont tighten.  I have to play around a lil more and maybe it will get easier.  Otherwise the car seat is beautiful and so comfy it just feels so cushy, not like other ones I tested.  All my friends get the Britax but i didn't love the feeling of those ones.  We are going to NH this weekend (2+ hours) so this will be a test of how long the baby can tolerate the car ride.  I got the INFINITY color from BRUS.  ALso Im wondering if the recline at this point should always be set to '1'?

I am in love with this. The straps pull great, and adjusting is a breeze! I haven't take the cover apart to wash it yet, my little one doesn't eat much in his seat, so we haven't had the need. The quicklatch system is amazing! And I loved the little bubble level that is handy for rear facing installation. There are so many different incline levels, I didn't need to add any extra oomph under the base, which was a bonus! Another bonus: the straps can tuck inside under the cushion when they move up to a backed booster.

We were so excited to get this, especially after being disappointed with our previous purchase of a MaxiCosi. This seemed sturdier and much, much more well-made. The vehicle latch system is easy to use, as well as using the belt path installation. Love the stroller release on the handle.  Plus the added bonus of clicking right in to our Vista stroller! Definitely worth the extra money to purchase. Can't wait to use it with our little girl.

This is a great car seat.  I have a narrow back seat and it let me fit 3 across, two of this seat and a rear facing infant seat.  It is super easy to install when using the upper anchor and a lap belt, we couldn't use the lower tethers since we needed three across.  The best thing of all to my mind is that the liner comes out really simply once the car seat is out of the car, it's also washable, and the strap that goes from the shoulder to the crotch is all one piece that the buckles thread onto so you can remove the whole thing, put the buckles in the dishwasher and the belt and cover in the washer and get it all clean.  The buckle that comes up from the crotch doesn't come out but it doesn't have the crevices that the other pieces do so it wipes down easily.  If you need a skinny car seat or have a travel sick kid this seat is a must!
Great for 6 year old plenty of growing room.

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: We had a keyfit for our first and kept the base. The new seat also fits the old base. Great infant seat

We have been using this seat for about 3 years. It has been about 1 year ago I converted from using the 5 point harness to using it as a backed booster.  I was cleaning the seat yesterday and happened to look in the strap storage compartment and the straps were covered in white fuzzy mold!  They were only moldy where they were inside the compartment, meaning that moisture is getting into that area without a way to circulate.  We have been to the beach many times and the pool, and along with normal spills, this has obviously been gathering for a year.  I am frustrated I need to dispose of an otherwise good seat and replace it because of a part I am not using that cannot be removed to be cleaned.

I have been a fan of Britax, due to their safety, quality and comfort.  This seat is a great value and works well for my 7 month old daughter.  I can see her growing into this seat easily.  I opted for the 55 pound, instead of going with a higher weigh model.  I figured by the time she is 55 pounds, she would prefer a high back booster with a seat belt, rather than a 5 point harness.  Note:  The car seat meets all of my expectations, though I wish the harness didn't need to be rethreaded in order to adjust-this is time consuming and while not difficult, definitely takes work.

I wanted to really love this booster seat.  I have a 5-year-old who is taller than over 99% of kids his age, so we cannot have him in a 5pt.  But I wanted something a bit more solid than the average booster seat.  I liked how this one attaches to the car (I think for convenience, I do not think it is practical in helping in an accident by the design).  It does not slide around when the kids are climbing in and out of the van.  It is a nice seat except the drawer does not slide and only makes my son frustrated.  We did not get any cup-holder.  And the BIGGEST problem, the only real reason I am leaving a less than 4 or 5 star review is that the part on the headrest that the seat belt feeds through does not fit the seat belt!  The seat belt must be crunched and folded to fit in, and then it is spit out by the booster every time my son gets unbuckled.  So we either have to feed it through every single time, and deal with the twisted belt, or not use it.  What is the point of a high-back booster if you cannot use that part?  I would have returned this except I did not keep the box because it never dawned on me we would have a problem with something as simple as a booster seat!  I have 5 children, and have been through countless car seats and booster seats over the last 12 years and this is the first time I have seen this!  Even the cheapie seats have a belt feeder that fits through them.
Loved it easy to assemble.
Excellent car seat. Very sturdy, durable, comfortable and safe for baby.

We bought a Britax car seat because they are the safest car seats on the market, and when it comes to our little ones we would rather spend the money and be sure they are safe than to settle for a cheaper seat and regret it if something were to happen. This color is nice because it’s gender neutral and doesn’t show dirt easily. We also have a cowmooflague version for our daughter and we love that one too. They are a pain in the butt to install, but we also rarely take them out and we love how sturdy they are in the backseat of our car.
My only two complaints are that the straps are HARD to tighten. I mean, I'm a stronger woman and I have to TUG. And his leg room sitting reversed, but he is a bigger boy...otherwise great!
My son almost outgrew this car seat at 2 months . Very tight inside car seat and shoulder straps are horrible to adjust. Canopy is not functional and does NOT fit good into the universal snap n go.
I loved it but it didn’t last long 💔
Great car seat.  Comfy. Roomy. Easy install and removal. Easy recline and strap adjustment.
Our grandson loves his new booster seat.

We bought two...we love them.  They're comfortable, safe, easy to install and even look nice in the car.  The ONLY downside of it is it's heavy.  So if you intend on keeping it in your car, it's fine BUT...if you need to carry it around or you travel a lot, I would not buy this.  We actually bought an inexpensive car seat for when we travel...this one was just impossible to travel through an airport with.
Perfect seat for my growing little she enjoys sitting in it rather than the original baby carrying car seat
LOVE this car seat! Wish it had a head rest but that’s my only complaint.

I bought two one to use forward facing for my almost three year old and I love it. For my one year old it's rear facing and I'm not the biggest fan. It doesn't tighten easily. Definitely only recommend for forward facing.

I got this seat just before we were to leave for our six hour car ride for Thanksgiving with the family. Our one year old daughter loved the seat and sang part of the way. Didn't fuss once. Even though her tummy was upset and threw up all over the place (chocolate milk). The seat cleaned very nicely and the straps were a tight enough weave that the vomit came right out -no smell. I only have one place for improvement, the handy velcro straps that hold the harness out of the way when you put baby in the seat are too low on the seat to do much good. They help so baby doesn't sit on the buckle but you still have to pull the buckles from behind their back.
I love that it only took me about five minutes to install the seat and I was so comfortable with it that I didn't feel the need to go to the fire dept and have my installation checked. I got the mommy's helper seat shade for summer and it fits very nicely and easy to get on and fold back up.

What is good about it is that it is narrow and you can fit it three across. It is also very sturdy and seems like it would hold up well in a crash. Of course that means that it is very heavy.  Install is harder than with other seats which is one reason why the NHTSB rates it very poorly for ease of use and is why Consumer Reports put it dead last in its category overall. The instructions are poor and installing front facing with the belts isn't easy because the belt path is so narrow that it scratches your hands to pieces. To install rear facing in anything but a very large vehicle you need to buy the optional angle adjuster or move your seats far forwards. The mechanism for tightening the harness also requires a lot of pulls. If it is loose it will take 20-30 pulls to tighten and takes far long than with other seats.
Excellent quality and easy to install. Many are not! Purchased for convenience of transporting Granddaughter.
Grandson transitioning from Full Back carseat to this one ...He reacted well with the transition
Great seat - easy to clean - light weight.
Good
Britax hit it out of the park on this one.  This is our 3rd britax seat and by far the best.  No styrofoam rattle kids sleep in it and tell me it’s confortable after 2 - 8 hour car rides.
Love this car seat! Super comfy for my girl & easy to install. I feel so safe with her in this seat.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: These are great for Airplane Travel. We have three in boosters (7, 9, 10) and didn't want to check three seats for the rental car. These fit in carry-on luggage and were super easy to inflate when we landed. Stayed inflated for an entire week and deflated/rolled up in less than a minute when we arrived back at the airport. Definitely use the guide buckles, especially for smaller/skinnier kids, to make sure the seatbelt is positioned correctly. Note: for younger/smaller kids who still use high backs, this might not be enough support. It is smaller than a typical booster and doesn't have sides.
We like the size of the Diono, but our two year old isn't a fan of the lack of cupholders and she says it's not very comfy.
This is a great great product that my baby enjoy a lot. I like it because fit on many sizes. i recommend it widely with my friens and family.

GREAT for airport travel. Used it when I traveled alone with my 2 year old. Used a cheaper luggage cart previously for car seat airport travel. Should have just splurged and bought this one to begin with!!! It's very sturdy and easy to use. Used with Diono Ranier. Wasn't able to roll down the isle, but I was on the smaller regional flights. However, it was easy to find someone willing to help carry it down the isle.

Finally with our 11 th baby we have found the BEST carseat. So easy to adjust the straps. Easy to anchor or belt in. Tiny ones love to recline and so easy to adjust to upright for older brother. We have had this seat for almost 2 years & plan to keep it until we have grandchildren!

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Bought this for my very hefty 1 year old when I set it up I was afraid he wouldn’t fit in it lol but he does so easy to clean highly recommended it takes up hardly any space basically comes assembled in the box
Great value, very comfortable for the little passenger!
Nice

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Good quality and price.
Very good
Awesome car seat worth every penny!
very sturdy, fairly heavy and hard to move around. not one to move back and forth between cars.

FAA approved! Great quality. Provides protection and security for your baby on the car and even on the plane. Only draw back is, you will always have to use sealtbelt extensions (in the plane) for easier assembly and disassembly. Otherwise, you will be there for a while.
Easy to install and great for kids
Easy to install, looks good, compact enough. My kid likes his new seat.
Me encanto
After 4 years of use it is still in great shape.
Durable but not too bulky or heavy. Completely comfortable

Of any 5-point harness seats I could have purchased for my 3.5 year old daughter I feel I got the best one. I drive a *small* Jetta (2000) and it is a very tight fit, but I don't know any other seat for her weight range (over 40 lbs.) would have been any smaller.  It is a little difficult to install as the width of the seatbelt/seat is more narrow than it should be, but it is still secure. My daughter seems very comfortable in it as she's been falling asleep more frequently on our half hour drive every morning than she had in her old seat. This was an upgrade for us from a smaller Britax model.
Terrible. Would not recommend buying it does not stay in place in the car and is very cheaply made.

I have been price matching for awhile now trying to find the best place to buy. With this beng 139.00 in stores with the 13 + in tax this product was close in price. But i got free shipping as well so to account for that this was actually 3$ cheaper. Ilove my new seat and so does my son.
Is nice and light.  Easy to move
Item shipped exactly as expected. I amean completely satisfied. Exactly as pictured. I'm all smiles...Thank you!
In love so glad I went with this one instead of a 300$ graco 4 ever!

I purchased this car seat for my mother's car.  It looked low profile, and I thought it might be easier for her to operate with my daughter.  She has several health issues so it was important that I got her a car seat that was as easy as possible to navigate.  This car seat is perfect!  She has no trouble getting my daughter in and out of it.  It is much easier for her to lift her into the seat because the sides aren't raised - and the low profile design make it easier to grab the buckles from under my daughter as well.  The seat is very heavy, but you don't mess with it after it is installed so the weight isn't a big deal (assuming someone can install it).  It took my husband a while to install it, but that might just be because he was out of practice.  Would highly recommend!
Excellent car seat
It was very easy to assemble and install in our vehicle. We are very satisfied with the product! Would definitely recommend for a transition booster seat
Love all the adjustment options!  Easy to install. Seems to be very comfortable for our little one too.
I replaced my other car seats with this car seat and am very happy with the quality and how easy it was to install
My little guy LOVES this seat!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: If you have room it would be easy to install. I was putting it between two car seats which were close together so it takes a couple of minutes to do it, but nothing else would fit between the seats and now my grandson can wear the seat belt correctly.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Excellent quality! Easy to secure and comfortable!
I dislike this seat. We’ve used it for a couple months and my son cannot sleep comfortable in this. Almost seems unsafe the way his neck hangs. If I could return this, I would.
I like that this booster seat is latched in and also has a high back for added protection. Putting the back on it a bit hard though.

It is light weight, easy to use, and my daughter enjoyed the print.  I have been quite pleased with the purchase, until I removed the seat yesterday to sell the vehicle and found my leather seats rubbed raw.

I wanted a reasonable car seat that would go both rear facing and forward facing. The downfall to this car seat was finding the button to loosen the belt. Also, when I installed it rear facing, I didn't realize I would have to use a rolled up towel or blanket (per direction) to keep the car seat from moving forward and backwards. I am petite, but found I had to literally put my knee in the seat to tighten the latch belt. It was difficult to tighten it - even my husband struggled. Personally I just didn't feel like it was ever installed to my satisfaction or that I was confident it was tight enough. I ended up returning this item for a different brand.

I have used the Extend2Fits for both if my children now ans I have to say it is hard to ima g.j ine how to improve on this car seat. We have owned (between 2 parents and 2 grandparents) a total of 8 of these exact models and have had no problems whatsoever. The seat is extremely easy to install, lighter weight than other seats of it's size, durable, and comfortable for the child. We are extremely please and recommend these seats to anyone we know with a new baby.

Word to the wise, however. Get one of the seats with the black seat material, not the mesh. 2 of the ones we have had are the teal color with the grey mesh, and they show wear and stains eventually. I'm happy to say after 3 years of constant use I just washed the pads on two of the pink seats with black naterial in the seat and they look absolutely brand new!
Easy to use, set up and store
We are using it.  As it says great product.  Color is beautiful amd easy to clean.

We recived this product this past week and I cannot tell you how glad I am to have it. The peace of mind from knowing how truely safe my daughter is, is priceless. We love it so much we have ordered a 2nd one for my older son to sit foward facing in.

We drive a 2006 Lincoln Navigator and when rear facing it fits in the center of the 2nd row perfectly! Putting it in one of the side seats of the 2nd (or 3rd) row would be possible but tight.

One thing we also really love is that my daughter can stay rear facing much longer and then we can turn it around and still have just as much safety! And with the 2nd one we have purchased, once my son grows out of it we can give it to my nephew!

I love the extra softness and comfort that this careseat has over ones we've had in the past!

I really can't say enough great this about this carseat! BUY IT! You can't put a price on your child's safety!
really great car seat for my 1 1/2 year old.  The quick connect buckles make the seat worth it alone.

It took awhile for our daughter and us to get used to this car seat. Our daughter is small for her age (at 1 year she was only 17 lbs). At this point the straps and chest plate fit but are on the big side - it's been 2 months and it is beginning to fit better finally. I think she cried the first 2 weeks we used this car seat. But we utilized her favorite blankie, nook, and mirror which really helped. We recently took a 4+ hour drive and she rode like a champ. I'm really looking forward to being able to turn her around. LOVE that the straps tighten from the front, as our infant seat didn't and it was enough to make us hate that seat.

Since she is so small the head rest does prevent her from seeing out the window but I think once she is bigger it won't be an issue.

My husband installed the seat and he said it is pretty easy. We have a 2013 Subaru Outback and we have no issues with room.

Overall we like the car seat. I think it was hard because we expected an easy transition and it wasn't. It took about a month, but now it's her seat and she's used to it.

I decided to write a review after I borrowed my sister in law's Maxi Cosi Pria 70.
It gives me joy in knowing that I made the right decision going with the Chicco.
Maxi Cosi Pria 70 is a great car seat.... but what a pain in the butt it is to install the thing.
What is this tether strap thing, Maxi Cosi Pria 70? It is so tacky!!

I literally had no problem with the Chicco Nextfit at all from the moment I got our seat.
I also feel the Nextfit has a more sturdy exterior.

I hardly notice the problem with the shoulder pads or the harness.
Was a little hard to get set up but it’s a really good car seat. Worth the purchase! Buy it. I got it on sale and it’s the best purchase I’ve made and I can use it for a very long time.

After 10 minutes my baby is drenched in sweat!!! The a/c will be in him & his feet will be cold, but his back & the back of his head will be just covered with sweat from sitting in this seat! We have moved to a convertible, but I've heard the same complaint form every mama I know who has had this seat! Which was about 10! Other than that, it was a good seat, but that's a pretty big problem, as it makes car rides miserable!

Really happy with these.  Bought 2.  I think if needed they could go 3-across in my backseat!  Not sure about fitting 2 in with a car seat though.  They’re comfortable for the kids and the cover is easy to take off and wash.  The kiddos love the drink holders.  Super happy with this purchase!

This seat is ingenious!!!! I bought one recently and am now buying a second one as my kids love it. It is giving me so much more space in the car as it is so easy to store and it has become our everyday seat. I have now given our older bigger car seat away to my neighbor as this is so much easier to use.
Great Value.  Bought two, one for my wife's car and one for mine.  Simple to assemble and install.  Sturdy and functions just as expected.  Great price to value ratio as well.

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review:
I was on the fence about this car seat but I love it!

I love the rotating concept without the giant thing on the bottom like the other brand offers. It is pretty large but it fits good in a Honda Civic!
Looks very comfy for both my kids 8months and 2 years that are both still rear facing.

Only con is I wish it had an extender for extended rear facing and more option in the reclining position! Other than that it’s GREAT!
Love this booster. Its a lot slimmer and fits better in my truck.
TODO BIEN EXCELENTE COMPRA
It's ok for the price. .

This was a game changer for our recent trip.  It fit easily in the front of my carry-on.  No bulky booster to drag along. It was helpful to watch the videos and practice once or twice to make sure I did it correctly before I needed to use it in the taxi/uber.

I like the best of best so I figured this was the best of the best. WRONG. Here is why and I'll be brief because I'm doing this review from my phone as I look at the horrible red pressing marks on my 3 day old sons little thighs.

I read the reviews after I bought this and installed it and got nervous after reading so many reviews about how tight and uncomfortable this is for the baby but they are all correct.

First the tech at the hospital that walked with us outside to put our baby in the car when my wife was released immediately saw the seat and said "oh boy, you guys will be returning this, this seat hurts babies"! It took the tech about 10 minutes to get our baby in. He cried for a bit then stopped so we figured the seat was fine. This AM we had a docs appointment and it was time for us to put him in the seat. Our baby is 8.0lbs, 19 inches and I pretty much had to smoosh and stuff our little babies legs and arms into the harness. He cried louder than ever and the straps dug into his thighs creating these horrible red marks that im looking at now. We tried to get him in the seat as perfect as possible so we are positive the seat and harness are just to small.

The seat looks great and the Quinny stroller also looks great but I'm taking this thing back today. I'm 6'1 and 260lbs, so I'm not a small guy but this car seat is heavy, 10+ lbs for the seat and almost 20+ lbs all together with baby. My wife is 5'4 and 115lbs so I think she may have some issues moving this in and out of the SUV on her own.

Also...anyone that says this car seat fits their baby great and is lightweight is obvoisuly either being paid by the company to write a fake review or doesn't have the straps on the baby.

Remember, our baby is under 9 lbs and barley fits into this seat and the company says it fits up to 30 lbs, yeah RIGHT!

AVOID this seat if your babies comfort is important. I don't buy that the baby has to be in pain in order to be safe and secure.

The only disadvantage is that it’s hard to loosen up the belts- you have to stick your finger in a hole at just the right angle and if you have nails… it’s hard or impossible to push the button. Other than that little issue- it’s great

The seat itself in use is just fine, but wow the installation was a pain. I read so many reviews about it being simple but ended up spending way too much time on a hot July day getting increasingly frustrated by the minute having to take things apart and readjust in several areas. A few tips in case you find yourself in my position--We are moving to this seat with a one-year-old who is clocks in at 31" tall. The seat clearly comes set up and ready to go for the smallest babies, so before you go to the hassle of installing this thing, if you are putting in a larger baby, remove the infant cushions, lengthen the harness straps and move the buckle between the legs to the outer slot. I made the mistake of installing as is and even with the harness straps extended as far as they would go, my daughter just started screaming immediately because her thighs were being pinched terribly. If you use the latch installation, I found the button to release the strap almost impossible to unlock. It has to be a glitch in ours, but I spent several minutes battling this thing just trying to push the button to loosen the dang strap (also I learned that if you over-tighten the latch straps, the clicktight will not click. So, trying to loosen the thing back up to get this thing just to close became my nightmare). Without easily loosening the strap, it's also nearly impossible to remove the clips from the latch bars. I may try to the seatbelt method next time we remove it because that's what other reviewers seem to be finding so simple. Anyway, when all is said and done my daughter seems to be comfy in it, I'm just dreading the next time we need to take it out of the car.
Love it!!
Could not get it level because the hold down straps where a little to short.

This seat was OK. I returned it for one with a higher rear-facing weight limit. Felt sort of cheap when compared to my Diono Radians. Very light weight though. Might be a good extra seat or for travel.
Good
Easy install. Works great
Perfect height.. comfortable and all around great buy!

This car seat is very easy to install & adjusting the straps is quick & easy also.  The base shows you if the seat is in correctly or if it's off balance.  Overall, the seat is fairly light, easy to carry & clean.  My daughter seems very comfortable in it.
Love the fact that my son can sleep in the reclined position without his head bobbing around. Very robust, feel safe. I just wished it had a cup holder. Britax is that too much to ask for?
Bought this seat for 2.5 year old who is off the charts it weight and height. He loves it, I love it! I love the price too!

This is my second car seat I have purchased from Amazon, the first one is a Recaro that's in my car and the Britax is in the grandparents car. My son is one and a half years old an I have to say after reading the reviews and deciding to try this one I'm a little disappointed, for starters I adjusted the harness and they don't really seem to stay over his shoulders and fall off his arms, I think this seat is more suitable for bigger kids 2 plus. The other thing is the seatbelt latch is a little finicky because you have to put the 2 halves together before you can insert them, it can be a small hassle at night, the Recaro seat you only have to click one side in at a time. If you are looking for a car you thats easy to put in and take out this one is not it, but luckily the grandparents don't drive much or have a need to remove it. Overall the quality seems good and it's soft and padded as well as easy to clean, so if you don't have to remove it often and don't mind the latch then I say try it otherwise try looking at the Recaro, it uses the latch system that's installed in most newer vehicles just 3 hooks to latch on, where the Britax uses the vehicles seat belt that you have to maze around through the seat.

Some of the installation options are not clearly covered in the instructions. Also, this thing is still pretty heavy for air travel, despite being one of the lighter options out there. All in all, it's a decent car seat, and the 2yr old likes facing forward instead of rear-facing like her last seat. Hope that it will last as long as advertised with the convertible options.`

We just started using this seat & love it.  It wasn't overly difficult to install, although it is a HUGE seat.  I fit in it!!  I wouldn't try to use it in a small vehicle, but in our Suburban it fits just fine.  My son says its very comfy & loves it too!

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Love the color and is easy to clean.
The only thing I don’t like is that the cup holder comes out of place easily.

We are very pleased with this purchase. We bought the Chicco for my SUV and the Britax Marathon for my husbands truck because we could not decide between the two of them. My daughter is a toddler and seems to like both seats equally. The Chicco has nice cushioning around the head and the seats are plush. This was rated the #1 car seat for 2015 so you cannot go wrong with this purchase.

This seat is AMAZING! We have had ours for 10 months now and I won't ever buy a different seat. When we first got it we were locking the seatbelt (didn't read our manual thoroughly enough!) and having such a hard time installing that I made myself sick over the $$ I spent! After looking around for some help and watching the videos I realized my mistake and started installing I correctly and since then I can't get over how easy and securely it is installed! Worth every penny and more! I never worry about her seat not being tight enough. It is super comfortable material and pulls apart for cleaning easily. We ordered the gray and purple seat and I have been very impressed with how well stains from food, puke, and even a marker wash out with minimal scrubbing! I recommend this seat to everyone I know and will definitely be purchasing more with future kids!
Easy to install, well made and great price.
Good
Super easy to install, comfortable and safe!

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: Just used this for the 2nd time and I LOVE IT! Easy to use...makes traveling SO much easier...we left the stroller at home and just used the car seat as our stroller through the airport. EVERYONE stopped us and asked where we got it! WAS FANTASTIC! The car seat you use has to have the "latch" system to hook into it - most car seats now a days have that so not a big deal = We used a cheap car seat that we bought at Walmart for traveling - keeping our fancy one in the car...If you travel a lot I recommend that too... just makes for easier transfering....SERIOUSLY if you dont absolutely HAVE to have a stroller where you are going to - leave it at home and use this! WORKS GREAT!
I feel so safe now that my son has a better car seat. Everyone he rides with has this car seat.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Usually leave at home in chair, pushes up to table. Folds up nicely when we go somewhere!
Went through 4 other seats before getting this one.  It is comfortable for my daughter and we love the "click" feature.  Recommend to friends and family.

This car set has a great safety rating and I love how it can fit my child through various stages. The cup holders are a must! A few considerations -
1. As kids do sometimes, mine threw up all over this car seat twice. It is easy to dissemble for cleaning but the crevices make it really hard to get completely clean (maybe this is unavoidable for this type of item?)
2. The seat cushion started wearing nearly right away. The fabric pills and frays.
I loved this it was great look exactly like in the pic. Very stylish and unique. I've have recieved plenty of compliments. So worth the money and great timing on shipping very satisfied
This car seat looks great. Took about an hour to properly install. That was the only con
Great product
Very Good Buy
Just OK.

How does a car or booster seat come without anchors. We ordered two of these and neither came with anchors. Contacted Graco and was told since we purchased from Amazon they couldn’t help or send parts.

This car seat is NOT SAFE and should not even be on the market as far as I am concerned. While it is rather easy to install it is not worth the safety of your child/children. Straps do not tighten all the way, it does not matter what way you pull or how hard you pull you cannot get this thing fully tightened. I have no idea why this car seat has so many good reviews.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Very hard to take the tray off and on

I never submit reviews but I was really disappointed with this product. We brought it on one vacation with us and it was great. But we went to use it a few months later and it basically only holds air for one usage. It's still usable, but you have to add more air to it every time.
Great car seat! True to size, and quality!
Nice and roomy.  Easy to install.  my daughter loves it - she is 4 and this will last her a couple years I would think and keep her in a 5 point harness as long as possible
Cute seat but it does not work for my child. The leg straps get tight but the chest remains loose. Ended up getting a better seat.
My daughter loves this seat. Very comfortable and easy to adjust and install. Simple to keep clean and easy to access.
lo compramos para un viaje, y la verdad que cumplio las espectativas, facil de utilizar, y queda muy bien en niños de 4 años o mas.

Easy everything, my son loves it and he is comfortable even on a long drive.
I love that it has 2 cup holders and that it has enough cushion.
My daughter loves it. The cupholders are a nice addition. Its lightweight, easy to put together, comfortable.

It is so easy to get her in and out of the car. Love how it rotates. Great when she falls asleep her head rests on the side instead of falling forward. That was the issue with the other one we had. Worth the money!!!
Seguro
And can open with one hand, for me it does take 2 hands to buckle, but easy off. Very comfortable for my 2 year old
Uncomplicated installation. Sturdy rear facing. Cover set came out of the wash well. Small base so it fits in the car easier. Overall a great car seat!
The booster seat is of good quality and comfortable. It is a little big in width so it may be hard to put 3 across in smaller cars.
...it does the job....

I've looked at tons of seats, compared consumer reports, read reviews and this is by far the best one I've found.  It just seems stable and looks comfortable for the baby.  My son sleeps in it just as easily as he did his KeyFit 30 (which we absolutely loved).  We bought a Costco seat first and quickly returned it because it was so lightweight, had zero padding, and moved all over the place even with towels propping it up (yes towels... ugh).  This seat is fairly easy to install and it doesn't really shift when jostled.  The only thing we found slightly annoying is that it has a back tether and neither of our cars have a hook on the floor for rear facing mode.

The seat is ok. The design is not very comfortable for the kid strapped in. The bottom is too deep like a V shape making odd position. Been using it few times not sure if it is comfortable for my kid.
Perfect! My 1yr old loves it! Lots of padding, cup holder is great and love that it reclines!! Worth every dollar!

Switched my daughter at about 10 months from the infant carrier, great quality and very comfortable for her. I haven’t had any issues with her head hanging forward while sleeping! That was the biggest thing for me when shopping for a new car seat.

So glad i got this! My 2 year old is uncomfortable on his old carsest. I was also worried about the open gap he had by his hips and if anything where to hit the side of our car he is is.. Would his hips be safe or was the was his old one was just a style that made me feel like some areas on him were nit safe..

My friend has one fornher daughter and when my son was it in, he seemed more relaxed and it wasnt so bulky and not to mention he sat further back in the seat than how us adult do in the front seats.

So definitely worth buying because its honestly really comfortable and lightweight. Also took me maybe 5mins to put it in the car and about the sams to adjust the straps, and clip for his size.

Also if you want to set it. Go to walmarylt or target and have your kid sit in one. Its amazing and honestly worth the price!
Really enjoying her big girl seat.  Has a lot of support in the head area and fits great in the car.  I would absolutely recommend this booster
We love the seat! My son sits very comfortably in it!
Does the job but hard to install

This seat has worked out very well.  My grandchild stated "this is very comfortable.  I like it"  I was happy to find a booster seat with a latch system .  I also like the high back for increased head/neck safety and for support of my grandchild's head if there is any snoozing.  I would highly  recommend this booster seat.  Delivery was quick too!
Car seat is not stable in car. Significant effort needed to figure out safe use of this seat
Big car seat but very nice and easy to manage
We have 4 car seats and this seems much more secure and easier to put down compared to other car seats.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Really nice product. Very happy with it.

Great seat!  I love that it is light and travel friendly.  I have another seat I paid $200 for so i was not using that for travelling to just get messed it.  I was apprehensive on buying this at first b/c it was so less expensive (safety being my priority) but it proved me wrong!  It's just as safe/secure as my expensive one and light enough to travel thru busy airports, handing on my stroller. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars is b/c the brand needs to offer more colors.  I'm not a fan of pink but I didn't want the bland color of black/grey either for my princess.
Great price for a Great product...
I have a Special Needs Granddaughter with SMA (spinal muscular atrophy) and scoliosis and it works great for her. Well worth the money!
Love this car seat!

First, do not purchase this from CapitalKidz. They faked the shipping confirmation and it took 3 weeks to receive the item.

This is a very sturdy car seat. Only issue is the strap you pull to tighten the unit. It's impossible to get the button to push down to release the strap. Other than that, we feel very safe with car seat and would recommend it.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Great product and convenient for carpooling.  Use it every time we need to pick up our daughter friends.  Fits between two car seats in standard family car.

I bought 3 of these for international travel. Let me tell you. If your kid has a boney no chub bootay, do not buy this product. It's painful for their boney behinds. Especially during long periods of sitting. I ended up giving these away to another family at the airport because I didn't want it in the trash. Good for kids that have meat on their bottoms only. Not comfy for the skinny bottomed kiddos. FYI.
The only complaint I have is the seat seems to be really heavy compared to others I’ve had. I also have a RECARO and it’s way lighter than the Diono.

The car seat is really awesome, does not detach for you to carry baby in it. My daughter was 6lbs13oz at birth and did NOTTTT fit in the car seat. We followed the manual to a T. I would definitely invest in a cheap alternative for newborn-1mo and then get this one for the long haul. It is a great seat!

I do not trust Britax. I think they have a liability problem on their hands. Here's why:

1) I have the 2015 model, which was recalled to replace a cheap red button that is supposed to allow you to release the straps (the 2014 also had a previous bulletin where some models manufactured earlier in the year came without the straps properly attached to the actual seat---and parents had no idea because it was hidden). The solution for my red button issue was a mailed packet of grease (no joke!). Now I have a greasy button that still does not function properly. In fact, it might be worse because, despite wiping it down as instructed, sand and cheerios crumbs get stuck to it. I asked if the 2015 model was any different and they said they only fixed the red button (I am not so sure---and if you read other reviews on here and NHTSA---you will see I am not alone).

2) The straps are ALWAYS uneven (which may still be related to the red button) and I can't get them to the point where they are even, so one shoulder is always loose, the other too tight. I have called Britax on 3-4 occasions and when I actually get a human, they seem to deny this is an issue and give me all sorts of steps to go through with the straps to make sure they are not caught somewhere. I do everything and the problems remain. I never fail to get pushback as if I must be doing something wrong (4 different times).

3) This barely fits my son at 21 months. Again, you will read other reviews about Britax Clicktights and see the myriad of complaints about false promises of this seat being appropriate to the lengths/weights provided. I have also asked Britax about this issue and am met with denial (again, when I actually get a human). A car seat inspector told me she approached Britax at a convention (when it was in Chicago, I believe) about this issue of making seats too small for the children for whom they claim they are made.

4) There is now a recommendation to not use the tether in the rear facing position (or not) in my model. I say the "or not" because the last I looked, the updated PDF manual says not use the strap, but another document said it was ok. When I called and got a human, I pointed out the discrepancy and she basically told me she thought it was ok to use but she sounded really, really unsure. Now I'm really confident (sarcasm implied).

The only positive I can say is that this does install quite easily (if you can overlook the weight and bulk)....but can I really trust it given everything else?

I held off for a long time in complaining about this product in a public forum or to the government, but I've had enough. I guess they need to be hit by the only thing they care about: $$$, whether through the loss of sales, government intervention, or a terrible accident that leads to a liability claim. I was spurred today by not getting any response from Britax again (a fun 10-15 minute circle through the phone tree) and by seeing others make the effort to report these same issues to NHTSA when I researched it after no one would take my call. If you also have a complaint about this seat, file a complaint with NHTSA and call them (you will noticed the Advocate Clicktight is listed twice so the complaints are broken up). Britax won't listen so I will make sure someone will. I try to address my consumer problems by giving companies multiple chances to address things outside of the public eye, but I can only take so much when it comes to my son's safety.
Absolutely great! Easy to operate, comfortable for the baby, very stable and most of all i feel my baby is safe!

Review: Great for the little ones, much better than having a big bulky booster or car set. It's perfect for traveling especially on the airplane.
Daughter loves it! Very light. Easily secured and stays tight. Not a single issue or complaint.

Overall the seat is great. Easy to install. I was fairly disappointed with the new Click Snug Harness system. For one, it seems like the straps themselves don't expand to a long enough length. It can be difficult to get my 31 pound, 32 month old son's arms under the straps when he's wearing his winter coat. Yes, I know, I'm supposed to take his coat off. Just saying that compared with my other Britax seat, I have no problem getting his arms in and out with his coat on.

Also, it seems that the harness clicks to tell you it's snug when it's not as snug as I feel it should be. Again, perhaps this is due to the extra thickness that occurs due to cold weather clothing.

The installation was easy and it has stayed very secure in the months since. The only complaint that I have- and it is minor, not even worth removing a star- is that I wish there was something to keep the lap buckles from falling all the way to the bottom of the straps. I have to dig them out from underneath the baby EVERY time!

Yup we pretty happy with this seat. Going to be ordering a second one for second car here soon.

So far, this is an excellent car seat.  After reading some of the negative posts, I was leary of the tight straps and near impossible latch system.  I bought strap covers with the purchase of this car seat and eliminated the first issue right off the bat.  I, however, think the latch system is great.  With my previous car seats, I have had to get my husband to install and uninstall the seat because I didn't have the strength to do it by myself.  There isn't a "button" to push to loosen the straps, but all you have to do is flip the hard plastic piece away from the strap and it loosens enough to unlatch it.  I have successfully installed and uninstalled this seat 3 times in the last week alone.  I also love how easy it is to loosen and tighten the harness straps, and the cup holders are an added bonus. I am in need to two car seats, but only purchased one initially to make sure I liked it.  I will definitely get a second of this same model!

Review:
We bought this for a trip to Europe last summer. We have since used it on an additional trip to Europe, as well as when using car share services and can't bring our larger car seat. It works great for our 5 year old and is very easy to inflate and install in the car. The one minor annoyance is that the air valve doesn't prevent air to flow out, which means it can be tricky to close the valve while avoiding too much air to flow back out.

During our second Europe trip we got a puncture wound on the car seat bladder. Customer support was very helpful and offered to send a replacement free of charge!

We are very happy with the purchase and will probably by additional ones once the younger kids are old enough to use one.

Customer service

Our first priority was safety and after researching this product and talking with people that already had this model, we bought it.  The cup holders are nice but we still have sippy-cups with handels so obviously they dont go in easily.  Maybe future models could have cup holders with 2 slots for handels, but that is very small.  Our daughter always falls asleep no matter how fussy she is going into the car.  So that must be a good sign of its comfort.  She currently is only 24 pounds and is very petite so she looks a little small in this big chair, but she loves it.  Its nice having the little storage compartments inside the arm rests so some of her toys can be hidden inside and she can easily access them to her liking.  The connections are ok.  There is a learning curve to efficiently getting her buckled up, but you dont want buckles that are too easy to lock and unlock because kids get smart and you wouldn't want them getting out. Great design over-all.

First of all, I'd like to say I'm an avid Amazon shopper, and I read reviews on most if not all the items I buy here.  Thanks to all the positive reviews, I bought this home last night from a store that carries the pink and grey color that me and my DD prefers.  If only Amazon had this color, I'd definitely pass up on paying extra 7% tax to the store.  Installation is a breeze!  Latch hooks are the easiest to install and when I tighten them up, they stay put, tried to tug and pull on it, it won't budge! I don't need to fasten the seat to the car each time. I highly recommend this one, for a booster seat with latch at this great price?  And most importantly my DD loves it, too!

I researched A LOT of car seats before I finally decided to buy this one, and I'M GLAD I DID. First, here's some information about the seat:
In the rear-facing position, this seat holds infants from 5 - 40 pounds AND the top of their head must be at least 1" below the top of the seat back.
In the forward-facing position, this seat holds toddlers from 20 - 65 pounds AND less than 50" tall.
FYI, children need to be in a car seat/booster seat until they are 4'9" tall (57") OR age 8, and the average 8 year old boy, according to growth charts, is 50" tall. So if I understand this correctly, that means that if your child just turns 8 years old, and they're 50" or less, than they don't need a car seat anymore. So if that's the case with my child, this could be the last car seat he'll ever need. But if he's above average height, he'll outgrow this seat if he gets to 50" tall before his 8th birthday.
I did not have this car seat with a newborn. We were using a Graco Snugride 35 infant car seat. I had to push the passenger seat forward about halfway to get the car seat to fit in my 2006 Honda Civic. With this convertible car seat rear-facing, I have a couple more inches for the passenger seat to be pushed back, which is very nice for me (5'9" tall) and my husband (6'1" tall). Both of us can now sit in the passenger seat much more comfortably. The seat can't be pushed all the way back, but it can most of the way. I plan on keeping him rear-facing as long as possible to keep him safe, so I'm really glad this car seat goes all the way up to 40 pounds rear-facing, which is a little hard to find in a car seat. And even harder to find in a car seat with that weight max for this price. All the other ones are 100 dollars more.
We just got this car seat when my son turned 9 months old. He's about 21 pounds and about 30" tall, so right around average for his age. His infant car seat was getting too small for him, and especially too heavy to carry. He fits great in this seat now. He looks very comfortable. PLENTY of room to grow...he's got about a foot of room to grow up the seat back. This car seat is very well padded, nice head rest cushioning (not quite as much cushioning as his infant car seat, but he doesn't need as much now that he's not a newborn anymore), plenty of room in the crotch area, and the buckles are very solid.
The seat is up pretty high so he can look out the window, which is nice. I would say it's up just as high as his infant car seat was. So I still have to be careful getting him in and out so I don't bump his head on the door frame. Probably won't be an issue once he's forward-facing.
The cup holder is laughable. I didn't want him drinking when he's in the car anyway in case he chokes or spills everywhere, so I just didn't put it on the car seat.
I like how the the height of the harness can be adjusted just by sliding it up and down. I don't have to take the whole seat apart to re-thread it as my child grows like I had to do with his infant car seat.
Installation I thought wasn't too difficult. I was confused a couple times, but I figured it out. It took maybe 30 minutes to install on my own. I wish the straps came ready for rear-facing. Part of the instructions were to take the seat cover off to get to the straps underneath if you need the seat in rear-facing position. Just be sure to put the seat cover back on before you attach the seat to your car. which I assumed and did do, but I read another reviewer say they had an issue with that). And I did have to put a towel under the car seat to get the correct angle.
I love how the loosening/tightening lever is designed, though it's a little hard to get to the lever on the side to tighten and loosen the straps. In our car, our backseat cushion is in the way a little. The tightening and loosening lever is on both sides of the car seat though, so I usually just reach to the other side and use that lever instead, which I don't really mind.
I read another recent review of this car seat, and I just wanted to say that I think the chest buckle and shoulder straps work great. The chest buckle looks like it's built very solid and the shoulder straps lay right where they should on my child's shoulders.
So overall, I'm extremely happy with this car seat. Only a couple very minor cons, which I wouldn't even really consider as cons, so I absolutely give this car seat 5 enthusiastic stars!!!

I think that honest, well thought out reviews sometimes are forced to take the place of personal experience while online shopping. I've always appreciated the help I've received from reviews and work hard to return the favor as best as I can. I hope you found this review helpful and if there was anything you thought was lacking or unclear leave a comment and I'll do what I can to address it.
