We are very disappointed with the Graco Nautilus 3-in-1. I am particularly disappointed in the false presentation of this carseat by Graco. My husband and I have agreed we will hesitate before buying a Graco product again.

We have a 3 1/2 year old boy who is 35 lbs and average height. He is much too small for a booster and we wanted a good seat that would keep him in the five point harness as long as possible for safety. Statements like "The Nautilus features an extended five-point harness design that can accommodate children over the age of one, from 20 to 65 pounds in weight", "Forward-facing car seat can accommodate children up to 65 pounds." and "Its five-point harness accommodates children up to 65 pounds" convinced us to buy what seemed like a good affordable carseat. And it IS a beautiful carseat.

But the statement in the instruction manual that if the crotch strap is under your child then you need to change to the booster made us send it back! Our son is not large, he is very average to a little small in size and he was sitting directly on top of the crotch strap when the strap was in the furthest position. Not only would this be uncomfortable and unsafe, the manual says not to use the carseat this way. So we were faced with placing a 35 lb child in a booster seat! No Way!!

We shipped it back immediately (at a cost of $20) and bought the Apex 65 which he fits in very nicely with room to grow.

Graco either needs to add a third slot for the crotch strap to this carseat or change their advertising because their current wording is very tricky, bordering on false!
fits perfecf very roomy

This car seat is a pain! The straps aren’t sewn currently so one side of the belt is too tight while the other side is too loose. I’m beyond frustrated to now have to wait for a refund and purchase something else!

They are pretty easy to install and uninstall quickly, and they are very sturdy. I like that you can choose different colors as we have two different shades of pink for our two girls. Best lightweight car seat on the market today!  We now have two children riding in these car seats, and think they are just the greatest. Impressive design, really. Some products leave you wishing they had polished off the edges. But that costs extra money, and most businesses choose not to. But this Britax seat is elegantly and thoroughly designed.

Multiple seat angles, front and rear facing, FAA approved, aluminum frame, anchors on the front AND back for stability, short-distance caddie accessory option, built-in baggies to hold excess strap lengths, and even velcro on the straps to attach it to the side of the seat to make it easy to move the child in and out of the seat without having to dig for the strap harness. And it's so light! And super soft! Other competitors backing is just a hard surface with a very thin foam pad for the child's back. Britax's backing is very plush and comfortable. I'm 100% sold on this design. Comparing the different brands in the store was hard, but friends said to go with Britax so we did. Now that we've used it, we know right away all the ways it outperforms competitor designs.

Absolutely a no-regrets purchase.

This was such an easy transition from the carseat for my 5 year old. The cupholders make it convenience. I definitely recommend for anyone who has 3 car seats across. Especially if you have bulky full size carseats, it will definitely fit. The cupholders may not be able to pop out fully, but it's still functional.
Quality product at a good price. Quick arrival.
It has been perfect
great price and quality.. very fast shipping
easy to use.

Unfortunately I absolutely hate this car seat. My son looks uncomfortable while sitting in it and it is very hard to tighten the straps. It is a fight to try to get them right on him I would not recommend this car seat.

Review: Great as an emergency booster to keep in the grandparents car.  Would not recommend for regular use as there are no cup holders, etc.

The size says width is smaller when comparing to my diono car seat width, but it is way bigger. Ended up being to big for what I needed. My kid loved it though

We ordered this carseat to replace our infant carrier for our 7-month-old daughter. It arrived promptly and in good condition. It was not difficult to install in the car (we didn't need to use a towel for rear-facing as another reviewer did). My husband did need my help in getting the latch hooks fastened as tight as possible; I had to kneel on the seat while he pulled the strap taut. The owners manual is a bit confusing (as other reviewers have noted). We have not had issues with the release button being difficult like some did; I think the main reason we haven't had issues is that our infant carrier had a similar button that I think required even more force to release.  It has a good amount of cushion for the longer trips we have to make to see the grandparents. Our daughter has slowly gotten used to this seat as opposed to the carrier, and I think her biggest issue is that if she loses a toy, it's gone until we can stop to give it back to her as she was used to having toys on the carrier handle. The straps do keep her from moving forward to reach something she's dropped - which they're supposed to.  The price for this seat was unbeatable, and I'm sure our daughter will like it a whole lot more when we turn it around when she turns a year old. We did purchase some strap covers as some of the reviews of this seat mentioned chafing, so we haven't had any issues like that either.  Overall, we're glad we purchased this carseat, and we would recommend it others looking (as long as they're looking for a girl).

I wish they would have had these when my kiddo was little - I’m using them to haul other people’s kids around in my car and I can’t say enough good about these! Only one kid has complained about not being able to see out of the car as well as in a regular booster but I am crazy about how compact they are and their safe design. After I showed the kids once - they all can buckle themselves in correctly!

I did a lot of research and ended up buying this for my 2.5 yo for travel. We had it in a travel car seat bag and checked it at the airline counter and then quickly and easily installed in our uber via the latch system. Not sure if it would work on the plane. We haven't tried installing with the seat belt yet, so I can't say how easy that is, but it doesn't seem complicated. It is very simple, light weight and perfect for travel. I was shocked at how light the box was when delivered! This seat is great because our daughter is small and needs a 5pt harness right now and she is in the smallest setting. This will grow with her for many years to come. We will use this as a second seat for my husbands smaller car and for travel. Great for small cars, but the padding isn't as thick and comfortable as her daily seat, but then again that seat is much heavier! Highly recommend as a backup, secondary for grandparents or for traveling with young ones. No regrets here.

I was originally going to give this product a bad review because when I first installed it the bottom latch straps seemed too short to allow it to recline in the furthest forward facing recline position. I had purchased it specifically for it's reclining ability because my son had been using a Britax marathon, but every time he fell asleep his head would fall completely forward and he would constantly waken from his air being cut off (his head would end up falling 2 or 3 inches off the back of the seat). So I got the Graco extend2fit for the recline feature, but due to the short straps the base was brought close to the back of the seat not allowing the back of the carseat to recline much, . But when I called Graco customer service to see if they could send me a longer strap, it turns out that I was trying to latch the straps from the rear facing strap pass-through. Before installing this seat forward facing, you must reach under the seat pad and slide the strap up to the 2nd seat belt pass-through located more near the back of the seat. This will bring the straps closer to the car's latch system and allow the seat to recline properly. Now the seat's angle is very reclined and I am positive that when my son falls asleep he will rest comfortable, as it would be a physically impossibility for his head to drop forward from that reclined position.

as far as installation, the seat is standard installation other than having to move the latch strap which was slightly tedious.

pros:

removable seat pad should absorb most spills or accidents for easy removal and washing

love that it has cup holders as his britax did not. just put them in place then gave them a quick sharp pop with my fist to lock into place. (cup holder installation took less than 10 seconds. seriously. Don't know what other people were complaining about.)
5 point harness adjusts height with the headrest. very east to slide up and down. no re-threading shoulder straps. (this is an absolute must for me now. I will never re-thread straps again if I can help it)
The seat is lightweight but feels very heavy duty

Do you know how many times I flew a car seat across country and installed it in an airport pickup lane? Like 8. That is a lot. I don't have to do that anymore.

We love this carseat! We got it when we first switched out of the infant carrier so my daughter was rear facing for a while. When I turned her around forward facing I couldn't seem to get the back to tighten to where it wasn't sliding back and forth so I would use the cars seatbelts to secure it tightly. After having to take the carseat out to clean it I just happened to read in the manual that when you switch the carseat from rear to forward facing, the latch system actually gets moved to a different spot(I didn't even think about this when I first switched it as that's never been something I've haf to do with any other carseat). So after moving the latch system and reinstalling the carseat, it fits nice and snug with back and forth movement. Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: This is the first time I take the time to write a review. I've used this product for more than 6 trips.  You simply put the carseat (not infant seat or booster) against a small rolling suitcase (usually your carry on) latch the carseat to the straps and tada! Now you have a way to move your carseat AND your kiddo around with your suitcase, so you can carry his seat all the way to the gate. My son loved it! It was also great to have is carseat around when were just sitting around waiting at the airport, he's sit in his carseat(something familiar) and take a nap. I did the bags, I did the wheel not for me and a curious toddler. This is so simple not to mention cost effective! Used it for about 2+ I was about to give it to another friend now that my son is using a booster seat. Just found out we're expecting another lil one, I'll be keeping this a little while longer!  Total life saver :)

The booster is nicely padded and makes him feel secure. The arm rests are a plus because he knows to put his belt under em, but there aren't too low/high to use if he'd like. I love that the cup holders are more built in vs the harnesses booster (also pictured) cup holders. It is more narrow and added about 4 inches to the open space in our backseat (compared to the harnesses seats sitting side by side). We bought 2, one for each of our cars. It fits great in my mini van and fits great in any car my husband drives - he works in car sales and switches frequently.

I wanted a booster seat for my rather large 3 year old that still offered 5-point restraint.  Indeed this unit has it, but there are not enough adjustment slots for the crotch strap for growth.  Will have to go to lap belt sooner than I prefer.  Additionally, this uses the cheap, very thin straps that twist and frustrate.  The release button is very hard to press, which might be ok (even preferred by some), but no for me.  The plastic strap guides pop out of the fabric too readily.  Good features are comfort for kid, price.  If you are coming from a Britax, you will likely be disappointed.  I am also somewhat concerned that the stellar reviews for this product, and the seemingly negative votes for bad reviews are questionable.

Previously we had traveled with our Britax Boulevard G3 on a $25 folding hand truck, attached with a GoGoBabyz ratchet strap. That system worked well, although we never had our son ride in the seat and the base hung over the tow plate quite a bit.

For my most recent trip I anticipated having my 2 year-old ride in the newer, Clicktight seat in the airport, so I decided to spring for the Britax-specific cart. Although for the G3 or G4 models, the LATCH attachments would be a great advantage, the lower anchor connectors on the Clicktight models are suboptimal, so it took a few tries to get the right configuration. Ultimately, I used the lower anchor strap to install the seat on the cart in the same manner you are instructed to install the seat on the airplane. That is, through the forward-facing belt path but NOT under the Clicktight panel. For this purpose, I could have easily used that old ratchet strap, tightened more easily, and avoided the hassle of the lower anchor strap altogether. In fact, with the higher anchor point of the ratchet strap, the installation probably would have been more secure. As it was, my son was able to ride in the seat.

The cart does not lock open. It is reasonably lightweight and fit into the overhead compartment easily. As far as rolling it down the aisle, that would be completely car-seat dependent. The Boulevard Clicktight did barely fit down the aisle of an A320.

tl;dr version. When using a Clicktight convertible, the only advantage of this cart over a $25 hand truck is the longer tow plate.
light and easy to install, love the cup holder

perfect. Love it

We've now owned this high back booster for 3 years, and it's still the best booster system we've owned. Install is simple and it's extremely easy to clean the cover(s).  I simply pretreat any stains, machine wash on gentle cycle and hang dry. It is not stable, does not get snug enough, not wide enough for older kids, returned and went a different route.
Great carseat. I have to remove it daily and transfer it between vehicles and its not very easy in that aspect but once it's in, it's great.

This is my third Safety 1st Complete Air 65 purchase. I have over 2 years of experience with these car seats, and can say with certainty that I am a loyal Safety 1st Complete Air 65 fan.
About 6 months after buying my first seat (Decatur color), I was in a car accident with my 1.5 year old son in the back. Thanks to this seat, my son was left unmarked and tightly secured. After this incident, I went on to buy 2 more of the exact same seats, 1 as a replacement for my eldest son (as it is required to replace the seats after a high impact car wreck) and then went on to purchase this specific model (Seabreeze color) for my youngest son.
First and foremost, safety is always most important when considering a car seat purchase, and because of my personal experience of being in a car accident while putting this seat to use, I am very confident in the safety of this seat. So confident that they are the only seats I trust to protect my boys. Once you get the safety of the seat aside, it's refreshing to see how aesthetically appealing these seats are! The Seabreeze color pattern is very modern and mellow and is definitely not sore on the eyes. The seat covers are removable and washable, which definitely comes in handy when you have kids who eat or spill drinks while in their seat! The material is very plush and comfortable (almost sponge-like), so I was worried that cleaning it would be difficult. I was pleasantly surprised to realize that after being washed and reassembled, the car seat literally looked like it was brand new, fresh out the box.
The head rest is an excellent feature to help ensure the safety of your most precious cargo. It is easily adjustable (as are the body straps) for your growing tot. It is also nice that there is a detachable cup holder for the side of the seat which really has come in handy for my son to stick his sippy in when he's tired of holding it.
The seat itself is quite light, I am 130 lbs with not much upper body strength, so having a seat that I can install without overexerting myself was very important to me, and this seat definitely fit the bill.
This seat will definitely be a great one to grow with your child. My son began using it shortly after his 1st birthday; he is now 3 and this seat still works wonderfully for him. My single complaint is that the chest straps sometimes easily get turned/tangled up, but this is something that is easy to correct. If that is the worst flaw that can be found with this seat, I'm quite alright with that! If I ever decide to have another child, I would definitely buy another one of these seats without a hesitation.

We tried 3 different convertible car seats. The extend2fit was our favorite one. As we both work different shifts we bought 2 of them. One for each car. The extend feature is nice of you have room. We have a large suv and a small car. The seat itself is relatively small for a convertible car seat and fits great. But if you want to extend it to make more leg room you will probably have to move the front seat up that the car seat is behind. Which can make a front passenger be really short on leg room. Other than that the seat is easy to install and our baby loves it and sleeps on most every car ride in it.

As some have said yes the straps can be tough to tighten. I have to grab the belt behind the seat and pull down a little the pull the tightening strap by the feet.
It’s so convenient to grab and go!
One of the best car seat we have had!

Love, love, love this car seat! It's comfortable, stylish and fits in our car wonderfully. I LOVE that I can keep the harness straps out of the way with the little clips on the side, it makes putting my little guy in SO much easier!

Definitely worth the purchase! I scoured the internet for hours before deciding on this car seat and I'm so glad I purchased this one. As a first time mom baby gear purchases can be overwhelming, but this decision was one of the best ones I've made.

You can't go wrong with this one!
Easy to get in and out of and super comfortable. The 5 year old approves!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Loved the simplicity of the seat and how it's travel friendly. Used it during a family trip to Europe, easy to blow up and deflate. Kids loved blowing air into it so it was a win-win situation. Compact, light and when blown up stays in place and is comfortable.
Good quality seat but enormous!
Very good product
I get my grandkids every third weekend. These seats are easy to put in and take out.  The shoulder strap is also easy to adjust incase I get the two seats mixed up.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review: A booster seat seems pretty simple, but the fact that this one latches in place is PHENOMENAL!! It keeps it from sliding back and forth across the backseat while I am driving. But more importantly, when our child climbs up into our SUV, the booster seat stays in place when they grab onto it. We actually just ordered an additional GoFit Plus Backless Booster Car Seat so that we could have one in each of our cars. Hands-down worth the money!

Extremely easy to install and very well padded.  I'm told that this car seat is a little heavier than some alternatives, but it works great for us.  Our preemie baby fits snuggly with the straps properly adjusted and it's a breeze to use.

Great product, extremely safe. Easy to use tightening straps for latches which is on the front. Also includes a belt positioning strap which is super helpful to properly position the seat belt across my child's chest.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: We are car seat fanatics and research each seat/install multiple times, and I was definitely a skeptic. Where this seat really shines is it's portability in travel. It has NHTSA best safety ratings, I know it will be available, clean, and that I and my child know how to use it. I have heard too many horror stories about car rental companies that have dirty seats that are expired, may or may not have been in accidents, or no seats at all to risk it. This rolls up very well. My five year old is unable to buckle/unbuckle himself even after a week of regular use, but that's because the straps that hold it are tight (which I consider to be a good thing). He also didn't fuss about going back into his regular 5 point harness when we got home, which is another plus. I could also see it being extremely useful for regular use for an older child that still needs a booster, but doesn't want a "baby seat". Will definitely buy again as my children grow.
It good for the price

After reviewing a lot of convertible car seat I ended up choosing this one.
My principal concern was obvously the safety aspect and Britax seems pretty good in this area.
It's a rear and forward facing which is good since they recommended to keep your child rear facing as long as possible.
The car seat seems confy, and sturdy.
The only thing is that the user guide, doesn't really guide you...My husband and I have a little bit of a hard time to figure how extend the harness and the recline system is not very easy to manuver.
And this seat is heavy, we planned to take it to the plane, I think we will have to buy some of GoGo Babyz Travelmate Booster Car Seats (http://www.amazon.com/Go-Go-Babyz-QRKIDZ-Kidz-Travelmate/dp/B000JJK9EY/ref=cm_lmf_tit_3_rsrssi0), otherwise it will be too hard to carry it around.

Great car seat, well constructed and the fabric is nice. My few complaints are the slight lean it has due to the shoulder belt when locked pushing the seat. I wish it had the recline bubble on both sides. And the straps don't seem to tighten smoothly as my other seats.
Love it !! Very durable and easy to use

After two weeks of research using [...] and Amazon, I stumbled across the Nautilus in another person's review. After trying out a couple of car seats in store we decided to buy the Graco Nautilus 3-in-1 for our 5 yr (38 lbs, 42in) daughter. She is too tall for her Cosco Alpha Omega, but I did not feel good about putting her in a booster because she is under 40 lbs. Plus, the new recommendations are that kids should remain in 5 pt harness seat for as long as possible. I was considering the Britax Regent (Britax's website has excellent info on exact measurments of their seats) The hightest strap placement on the market-but is way too big to fit comfortably in my Ford Escape, no cup holder or booster option, and daughter said not comfortable. The SafeGuard Go (the second highest strap placement but top tether is required for install), two of my friends have this seat and love it. I liked compactness and portability, but really wanted a bit more padding and recline option. The Britax Frontier sounds good, but no stores have it yet and the Nautilus is very similar for almost half the price. What I like about the Nautilus is that it's well padded and reinforced with steel. My daughter is in the next to highest strap setting, so I'm hoping I can get two years out of the harness option. In any case she will be well over 40 pds by the time she grows out of the harness and will be able to use it as a booster. I like the cup holder (while this may seem like a small thing there have been several fights in my car about cup holders between my girls) it's part of the seat so it doesn't stick out and seems deep enough to prevent tipping, it also has two nifty cubbies on the inside of the chair. I'm hoping they won't be major dirt collectors, but daughter likes them for her little toys. It is very easy to loosen and tighten straps unlike the Alpha Omega where I really had to tug and still wasn't satified with tightness. I put it together and installed in about 1/2 hour and that included reading the manual. Moving the straps up or down is not complicated, but it does need to be removed from car to do. It has a recline option, but I have to say it is very negligible, like 5% at most. My daughter does not sleep in the car and no other seat of this nature has that option that I've found. We take a very long car trip every summer and I am concerned she will not be able to sleep through the night. I may get some kind of travel pillow. I would think for a younger child who still naps this might be a problem. I had no problems installing using latch & tether, it is nice and tight. (again read manual b/c once child is over 40-48 lbs you need to use seatbelt to install which would probably add time to install. I think the Nautilus is a great option for keeping your precious cargo safe and secure for a very good price. This is the 8th carseat I've purchased between my two kids, grandma and aunties' car and feel I have quite a bit of expierience when it comes to different features. Do your research and decide what features YOU need. All car seats have to meet minimum standards and correct usage and installation is the most important part. Know your child's height/weight and limitations of the seat. Most kids grow too tall for a seat before they reach the weight limits. If you are looking for a harness option for your older child I think this is a great seat!!
My daughter still uses this carseat  it cleans up nice after spills and easy to wash.  I love that it has two cup holders
Great and easy to use
Was just as described and arrived on time
Best car seat I've ever used

We bought this seat for our 1 year old who seemed quite ready to face forward.  He love it so far!  We have been using the seat for about 3 weeks and it seems to fit him well and he seems to be comfortable in it.  The cup holder is handy for both a toy and sippy cup.  The fire dept seemed to think that it was a little tricky to install, but they did it.  We just left the head rest off for now, as he is still pretty small in the seat.  I am excited that this is the only seat we will have to get for him until he rides with out one!  It is very affordable for its long usage, and there are coupons out there at babies r us etc that can be used towards discounting the price further!

it's pretty narrow, which is a huge plus, because we have two of these (one pink and one gray) and a booster seat bench in the back seat of our toyota rav4.  if it were not for its narrow size, we would not be able to fit all three of our kids in the backseat.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: It is perfect!
Simple to install and light weight
Perfect for our 2nd car
We are rear-facing as long as possible. My son is 2 but the size of a three year old. He fits just fine in it. We really love it. I have a 2015 Nissan Pathfinder and it fits well behind me.
Me encanto!!!

Just received this seat to move our 7 month old into the next level of car seat, mainly because she was getting too heavy for me to carry her around in her infant bucket seat. This car seat is sturdy, fits in my Honda Accord easily, and was super easy to install. She has no complaints about being in the seat and it's pretty easy to buckle her in and out. I will say there is velcro on the sides which I thought would be super handy to keep the straps out of the way when putting her in the seat, but the velcro patch on the straps doesn't line up to the patch on the side of the seat so we can't utilize that feature. Oh well, good thought.

This is the best investment we did. After reviewing so many car seats online, we finalized this and thankfully our son likes it very much. He sits in it comfortably as he outgrew his previous baby car seat.
My granddaughter loves her big girl seat, she is 3 and it is perfect

Other than the fact that we received a red instead of a gray that we ordered, this seat is pretty much what we were looking for. With a third kid on the way and little desire to get a new car, we decided to get this to go between two rear-facing seats in our Ford Edge. This seat fits great between our Graco Size4Me 65 and Graco Snugride. Our kid enjoys sitting a lot.
I love this car seat, bought it for my 23lb 7 month old. Will have it for years to come. Can't go wrong with a Graco and Amazon's prices. Got it on sale for a great price.
To expensive
We have loved this car seat. My baby loves it and it's light compared to the others I have tried! The pink is super cute too!!

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review:
My DD love this booster seat ! It left her up just the right amount and make the seat belt
much easier and tolerable ! We absolutely love it !

These seats were comfortable.  We have a Britax Parkway SGL as well.  The Britax looks more comfortable (thicker cushion, etc) but is larger so a little more difficult to seat belt than these seats.  Ironically, my daughters prefer these seats, claiming that there are more comfortable than the Britax.  I think that it's because it's a little easier getting in and out of.  There is some concern  expressed by one of the reviews  that this cannot be tightly attached.  I think that is wrong.  One of the other reviews pointed out that you need to pull on each of the straps separately rather than both at the same time.  That works very well.  I have no trouble keeping the chair attached tightly.  These are good chairs and we will be buying another set for my parents so that they can take the grand kids out
Kid loves it.  Belt position system does help much.  Haven't used the cup holder.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Works great and fits in my suitcase while traveling!
This car seat is used for our grand daughter when we go get her from time to time?

Very happy with the quality and ease of use with this product. We flew out of state recently and this was easy to pack (comes with a drawstring bag). I was skeptical on the ease of inflating it but it took less than 30 seconds and the quality was great. My son didn't complain while sitting on this and it stayed in place. It allowed the seat belt to go comfortably across his lap.

I am planning on ordering a second one for my younger child as well now as it's safe and easy to for travelling.

This carseat is perfect! My son fit comfortably and very spacious! The extra features are amazing! Very easy to install and not heavy like some carseats. Its machine washable and is very simple to put back on after! Love this car seat. Great buy!
Overall very good item and safety comes 1st But very difficult to put and clip to seat belts.

I purchased this seat for my grandson who I pick up from preschool a few times a month. The seat was less than 6 months old- and had minimal usage. The area around the bottom buckle is torn after such a short period of time & very little use. I cannot recommend this seat to parents. Also, side note - customer service was very slow to reply ( more than a week between responses) and has refused to replace the cover material because I did not keep my receipt from more than 5 months ago. The car seat’s model info even showed that it was less than 6 months old. They do not stand behind their warranty or quality. Pay a little more and get better quality and service.

I love this car seat! Installing it is super easy! Love that you can lift the middle of the car seat and just buckle the seat belt and boom the car seat is and feels so secured!! Definitely love it knowing it’ll be keeping my daughter safe at all times in the car. Only thing I would say is I wish I could place her in the middle seat but with the way my suv is set up , is if her car seat is in the middle it’ll be almost impossible for anyone to sit and buckle their seat on either side of her. So I have her behind the passenger side. No biggie tho.  Great car seat and definitely recommend
This car seat is a lot better than the actual pic .... It is rugged and durable enough to last the 3 stages that it was designed for, this is a very good buy.
I got this for my 4 year old. It is comfortable and perfect. Make sure to fit properly to your car seat as it might move if its not fixed correctly.
Made it so much easier to travel with several kiddos.
My daughter is 19months and love it. Super comfortable, she doesn’t sweat in it. Fits in the back of Volvo S60 with no issues (my car has a small backseat).

This is the 2nd Britax I have purchased. This one is for the 2nd grandson who is a bit huskier than the first grandson. it is a little wider than the boulevard model and I like the light grey color as I am in a very hot/sunny area it reflects the heat. I have it installed in rear facing now and it takes up quite a bit of leg room - I have a Toyota double cab and the front seat cannot go back all the way as I have it tethered to the seat rail (our CHP is the one who installed it like this). It was easy to install and the latches and buckles are easy to use. I like the velcro sides to hold the seat belts away while putting him in and out of the seat. Great buy.
Great buy. Not hard or soft. Easy for my daughter to carry and use. Seat belt adjuster is easy for her to use.

Suitable for a larger infant and older. The seat does not seem to tilt back far enough for small newborns and my baby's chin falls to her chest while in the seat. It does not seem to be safe for her at this time, but when she's bigger and can support her head more it will be a good fit for us.

Shoddy construction with regard to the softer material that provides comfort to your child..  the padding on ours fell off within a couple of years and was impossible to put back into place.  To be sure this car seat seemed great and very solid at first... but doesn’t hold up well over time.  I’d recommend a less expensive, battle tested model.  We bought this one assuming that the high cost would mean high quality.  We were wrong.  The “core” construction is solid but it seems as if the team that designed the soft cloth and upholstery (if you will) were not holding themselves to any goal beyond satisfying short term cosmetic appearance needs for “wow-ing” consumers.

I recently purchased the Triumph for my daughter who has two pricier car seats so that she could provide her babysitter with a safe carseat.  We have a total of 5 of these car seats in our family at this point and the quality and safety rating is very good without paying a fortune for the high end seat.  I find two downsides to this carseat--one:  the car seat is not the easiest to attach to your car because it needs to be tight to be safe (I can't put it in myself)--two:  the tightening knob on the harness system is rather difficult to turn -- I wish it worked a little easier as I'm the grandma and don't have the best strength in my hands.  Otherwise, the carseat is fairly well padded, it is safe and reliable.  I would recommend this product.
Thank u
perfect fit. easy to use
great seat for the older child
Love it, super padded and comfy for my munchkin.

This car seat does not sit level when rear facing. It's difficult to adjust and install. The harness adjustments in the back are not easy to adjust to the baby. It's lightweight and easy to clean. We use it as a backup. I'm grateful to have an Urbini as the primary car seat. Its way easier to use and just as safe.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: These boosters are easy to install/uninstall.  We have two in each of our vehicles.  Easy to clean.
Works fine; as expected. Cute pattern that the kid loves!
Hard to get seat belt underneath arm rest. Our granddaughter does say it is comfortable so that is the important part.

Other than being in the heavy side for
Carrying a baby I love this car seat. It is durable and easy to clean and looks nice.

There are several things I really like about this seat. I was drawn to it initially because it was at a great price point, which was important to me, because we needed to purchase two for our twin boys. I really like that it has two cup holders, one for drink and one for a snack and they come out easily for cleaning! I recommend strongly looking at measurements and/or testing this seat out in your particular vehicle to make sure it will fit, because it is very large, especially rear-facing. It fits well in the captain chairs of our mini van, but may be too big for smaller vehicles. Easy to tighten and loosen the straps, once you get used to it. All of the nooks and crannies that all car seats have vacuum out very easily. The process of adjusting the strap height is very easy to do as well. Good seat all around.
Like other comments, this seat's straps need to be adjusted from the back. Once you get used to that, it's fine.

I was very excited to get this car seat for my 10 month child as she had long out grown her infant car seat that I still lugged around. Currently it needs to be rear facing with her size and weight. At first when I attempted to put it in, it just didn't look like it seemed secured enough to be rear facing. There is no slot like the seat has for when it is facing forward to slid the seat belt and fasten it through tightly. I had to visit a friend who is a volunteer firefighter to make sure I installed it correctly, and he had to really tighten it to make it secure.  Overall its a great product, the colors match my vehicle and so far its been very easy to maintain for food and formula spills. I bought it based off of previous reviewers recommending it but I do wish it had a more easily accessible slot to install the seat when rear facing.
I assumed all car seats have hooks or something to attach to the car itself but this one doesn’t. It was a great price and I’m sad to have to return this and spend more money.
my 18 months daughter laves it!

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Yes

We bought this WAYB Pico Travel Car Seat earlier on during its first introduction. Seat is great but has a major design flaw... it locks upright in one position only and we couldn't tilt it a little back without unlocking the bottom aluminum snap-on lock. When we traveled on Spirit airline, the airplane seat by default was bit tilted and this seat's backrest couldn't be tilted back snugly against the plane seat backrest without us unlocking the Pico's bottom snap-on lock otherwise the Pico seat kept on moving to-n-fro whenever our child tried to move. We couldn't firmly put on the plane seat belt unto this Pico seat without tilting it's back which would then raise its bottom base up. So throughout the trip we had to keep the Pico seat bottom base snap-on lock unlocked. Just wondering if others have also pointed this out and whether they made improvement to the design of the seat to make it tilt through some option in lock position.
All the colors hide the spills that kids have, good seat!

I love this carseat! It's durable, heavy duty, super easy to install, and feels so much safer than our 2nd carseat. We actually bought this one to be the secondary, but once we got it we loved it so much that it became the primary! I love that it grows with your child.

This was my first Chicco product and I've got three kiddos.
With that said I've had this seat for about four months now and this is by far the BEST seat ever!
A lot of complaints are the strap tightening position, my 2015 Yukon seats recline so I have no problem.
Another complaint is the sides of the seat being too high, my toddler sits next to the door, so the hight of the seat is a plus in my book. I'm just a little more careful putting my child in the seat.
I've had to spot clean and the best product I've found for that is warm soapy water or Watkins all purpose cleaner.
If I'm blessed with another child I'll deffently purchase another one!
Wanted to love the seat but I am retuning it. The crotch buckle is very short and I could not get a proper fit on my small 11 month old.
This car seat fits perfect in my VW Jetta. The car seat is very sturdy and the padding is comfy for my baby.

While my granddaughter could still ride in her old seat, she felt restricted in what she called a baby seat. This seat lets her sit up teller and get in and out by herself, like a big girl. We love it!
Love this car seat! I'm a big fan of britax and wouldn't buy anything else. The print is super cute and girlie. Fast shipping. No complaints

We were pleased with our Britax Marathon, so decided to get another Britax with room to grow. It has a low profile - the seat is closer to the car's seat, and the back isn't as thick.  Works well in our compact car.  Love that no re-threading is required to adjust the height.  While not terrible, we found this more complicated to put together and install than the Marathon.  Cup holders are a nice feature, but are placed too far forward to be effective for our toddler. Our daughter is comfortable in the seat, and we appreciate the breathable fabric during a hot summer.

I have used multiple car seats for my son and so far this has been the best one. After about a month of use, I can say that I highly recommend this car seat.
Lightweight but sturdy, this car seat is easy to install and then take out of the car while my baby is sleeping in it. Very easy to install and remove, doesn’t even wake my son up at all.
Very easy to adjust the straps to secure my son in the car seat.

Arrived fast, great packing, love the car seat. It's a lot lighter than the previous one we had, using it for my 3 year old. It's comfortable and the cup holders can be pushed in and pulled out as needed, saves us so much space in my small sedan.
Great quality product so far. Not a ton of padding, but didn't expect it. Easy install, daughter is 16 mo and comfortable. Looks nice. Great product for $60.
I have a happy 5 year old!! He tells everyone that he has an Avengers car seat!

We bought two of these. These seemed to work ok, as neither of our kids really seemed to mind sitting on them, although one of them struggled to stay on the seat.

My biggest critique is, while a relatively simple concept, instructions were lacking - especially regarding the seatbelt retention strap.

Even when going to the manufacturer’s website as suggested, there was no evident setup instruction on either the “product instructions” page, nor on the page for the UberBoost item page, itself. We ended up on a 3rd party “mommy blog” to even figure out what it was for.

Additionally, for our younger child, the seat moved out from under him on a regular basis. While the bottom of the seatcover IS very grippy, it seems like there should be some better way to secure the seat. Again, this may have simply been due to a lack of good instructions.
Very easy strap adjustment as baby grows!

I am a 54 yr. old Memaw of 4 grandbabies, with 2 more coming!  I transport all of them often, and have come to detest most car seats.  I am currently on the hunt for a convertible car seat that 1 woman can properly install and tighten sufficiently BY HERSELF.  I purchased the Britax Boulevard for over $300 this week.  The English version of the instructions is 46 pages long.  I worked for an hour last night, and an hour this afternoon, attempting to install it by myself.  Impossible.  I am 5' 9" tall, 120 lbs., and an avid practitioner of yoga, and I still do not possess the weight or contortionist skills necessary to get the job done.  The description on Amazon clearly states "easy installation".  If they are referring to the installation of the BABY, then okay, sure, it is not the worst car seat to buckle a small child into.  But if they are referring to the installation of the car seat into a vehicle, they are DEAD WRONG.  Not to mention, that if the car seat is installed behind my drivers seat I cannot drive the vehicle....I have to move the seat all the way forward to get the dang car seat in the back.  At 5' 9", I gotta have some leg room.  If the car seat is installed behind the front passenger seat, then there is no room for a passenger to ride in the front for the same reason.  This is beyond ridiculous.  I will continue the hunt until I find something I can actually use safely.  BIG thumbs down on the Britax Boulevard.

Beautiful carseat. We've never owned anything but Britax, the quality far surpasses anything else on the market. My grandson is 8, and still fits into his Britax Pioneer. This one is for my granddaughter, still rear facing. But I know she'll be using it for years to come. Love the pattern on this !!!

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: We take it everywhere we go is so easy to assemble and light in weight. We love it 😍

Mifold booster seats are AWESOME!  My Mom has two stashed in her car (fitting easily under the front seat) for transporting the grandkids when needed.  Much easier than switching booster seats between cars.
I bought this specifically for traveling through the airports with my toddler. Worked out great very easy to set up carseat and very quick to breakdown.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: The best thing I found to help travel with a carseat for a toddler. I would recommend for everyone who travels on planes. My 2 year son loved it and everyone made comments about it.
Ended up buying 2 of them. The seat is nicely made and fjt  in our vehicles easily and our kids love them.

I really wish I had spent the extra money to just buy another Clek carseat. This carseat is cheap for a reason. Very difficult to get tightened down when installing and the shoulder straps are very difficult to tighten. I do not recommend this carseat.

Great car seat. The kids like sitting in it and the latch system is extremely easy to use. Our other Graco & Brittax seats also have a latch system but have to be tightened individually (and in the back). I like the single tightening cord in the front. It's easy to adjust and makes migration between vehicles very easy.

Wouldn't hesitate to purchase another one.

I was making a solo trip with my 5 year to California and needed a car seat when we landed. I bought and shipped this to my brother's house to have in the car when he picked us up. This car seat is GREAT!! super light, easy to install. Comes equipped with the latch system for easy in and outs and is very comfortable. I brought this back with us on the airplane. Remember, solo momma with a five year old, her bag, my bag, whatever stuffies and pillow she had and this on my back through San Francisco Airport. With what I thought would be impossible, wasn't with the lightness of this cat seat (11 pounds). With that said I couldn't be happier with my purchase. It's a great seat all around!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: We bought this for a trip that included limo service to/from the airport, a couple flights, and a rental car while we were there and this was the perfect travel booster seat solution.  Just a few quick breaths and we had it ready for the limo ride, quick open of the valve and rolled up into our carry-on bag, then blew it up again to use the whole time in the rental car, then again just as easily back into our carry-on for easy access and quick use again for the limo ride home.  No complaints from the seat's occupant although I had read some felt like they were slipping off, etc, we didn't see that issue with our 8 year old.  I would strongly recommend this as a travel solution for kids needing booster seats.  Keep in mind booster seats are not permitted for use on planes unless they have been FAA approved so again, something like this that stores quickly, compactly, and easily into a carry-on or suitcase is likely to be the easiest solution.
This car seat is easy to install and adjustable. No complaints from my son.  He loves the cup holder and side tray, Seat latches were a must which is why I chose this model.

This is our third Britax car seat purchase and I have yet to regret buying their products. This time we decided to also purchase the b-agile stroller to combine with the infant seat. LOVE IT! The car seat snaps right into the stroller seamlessly and rides so incredibly smoothly. This infant carrier is just a little bit heavier than other carriers but the safety benefits are worth it in my opinion. Installation of the base is easy and straight forward and the carrier snaps in and out with no trouble. Let’s not forgot about this adorable cow print. I highly reccommend Britax!!
Loved it so much we bought two! Easy to install and move and very comfortable! I am now a Britax fan!

It's takes just a few minutes to install. I love the latch system. It is a quality built seat. I feel like my daughter is actually safe. Once it's properly installed it is very secure. It's the best carseat we have ever had. We love it. I haven't figured out how to take the stap pads off as others have said they have. But I still give it 5 stars. Amazon delivered it very quickly too.

Special Features: Parent Link Customer Service, Live Video Installation Support
Review: Perfect for the older kid. Easy to get in and out of.
Perfect for my 5 year old!
Nice and easy to install. Love it
Very easy to install in the car, a lot wider than the first car seat we had and fairly priced.

We purchased this as a "travel" carseat to take on a trip. It was perfect for our purposes: light weight, easy to install etc.
No problems getting it through the security at the airport.
Easy to install via the latch system in the rental car.
CHEAPER than renting a carseat - carseat rentals are $10-$12 per day and often come with unsafe, dirty, crappy car seats. This was a MUCH better way to go.
Our 2.5 year old loved the seat and thought it was very comfy (installed rear facing).
Our primary car seat for home is a Clek Foonf and I have to say the Foonf seems a lot more sturdy than this seat, but it weighs like 40 lbs and would be totally impossible to take anywhere. For travel, I would highly recommend this seat.

The seat is definitely a slim fit. It does not spill into the middle seat. I also love that my 12 month old, 20lbs child is very well supported. She is a bit more lifted with the recommended seat position. It is very easy for me to put her into and take her out of the seat. She definitely looks very comfortable and I am having a better experience at driving longer distances with her. Her previous car seat seemed to allow her to sit a bit more crunched but this seat has a little back support. The installation was a bit tricky because there are so many straps and pieces to the support of the seat. But once figured out it is easy to use.  I suggest adjusting the seat before installing into the car because it makes it ten times easier.

I've had the Graco Cargo Platinum for about 2 years now - got it for my son when he was about 2-1/2.

Pluses:
Comfy for the child
Removable cup/toy holders.
Reasonable cost
Lightweight
Decent looking
Cover comes off so it can be cleaned easily.
Buckles operate & adjust easily.

Minus:
We've had to replace the styrofoam padding twice on this seat because it got broken, probably from flexing as the child climbs in and gets in position. Behind the cover is a U-shaped piece of styrofoam (um, "EPS energy absorbing foam"), covering the back and wrapping the around the side bolsters. So when the child grabs onto the sides they may flex and break. The replacement cost from Graco is reasonable - about $15 - but it seems that such a safety-related part shouldn't be so fragile in normal usage.

We bought this for when we take trips and don't want to lug our heavy Britax Marathon seat. This is light weight and easy to tote around. My son was comfortable in it. Pretty easy to install. Doesn't work too well in reverse mode, though, too hard to install that way. Much better forward facing. We are really happy with it.
These are great! So light yet so padded and comfortable. I can't believe how easy they are to blow up. My kids like to use them in the kitchen chairs as well as the car.
Very good , nice & Safety 👍👍

Since we have 2 kids, we needed a second carseat, so we bought a second marathon. This one is better because the anchors plug into the seat itself so that they're not dangling when moving the carseat. It feels just as sturdy as the last and Britax is known for its safety, so I am very pleased with the purchase. The only issues I have are that the buckle is so short that I always have to dig it out from underneath my kid and when rear-facing, it's very difficult to adjust the straps (although this might be a global issue with rear-facing carseats).

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: This was a lifesaver when I traveled alone with my 2yr old. I was in a situation where I couldn't check a bag and needed the carseat with me (not only because I think kids do much better having the carseat to sit in on the plane!). Having a stroller, carry-on, carseat, backpack and 2yr old was just not an option so I was delighted to find this to cut out the stroller! She was able to ride when we were hurrying, it reduced the number of items I had to carry, and it was useful for transporting other things like food and drinks when she walked. Fabulous purchase!
Fast delivery. Great product :-)
The color is so pretty worth every penny
Don't like
Mu comodo y ami nieto le encanto por él dibujo
Great Seat!  Very easy to use.
Seat is just like our britex boulevard, except without the click tight technology. Which I don't mind not having. Great seat for the price range. I would recommend it highly.

The slim fit of this seat is perfect for big families with several kids in car seats. It's slimmer, so it will fit three across easier than bulkier seats. This fits front or rear facing from 5 - 100 lbs, so will grow for many years with your child. it's an amazing investment!
My grand-daughter is thrilled....wonderful product.  I'll get one for my grand-son when he reaches the age for a booster seat.
i bought this for my 9 month's baby, i saw this is high rating in AMAZON, so i bought this one, but the bad thing is it cant adjustable for baby when they sleeping in the car

Not the best !  I got Chicco brand on same day, Big difference in quality and manufacturing. I will not buy Garco brand anymore. Also Straps are very small for average  toddler, fabric cheap harsh nylon.bulky not as described

We have tried different carseats and this one has been the best all the way around. Our oldest actually would climb into this one on his own over some of the other brands we have tried! It is comfortable, very easy to clean and install, and I love how long my kids can use it for! We purchased the double pack with booster seat so the grandparents can have something easy to use for their cars too. Great product for a great price.
Good

We've had this about 2 years, and it's has its high points (cleans up well, and my daughter finds it comfortable), but there are 2 flaws worth calling out:

#1: The cupholders are just way too shallow. They're designed to fit something short and squat, like a sippy cup. So if your child has a regular-size water bottle or, say, a cup of pop, you'd better be careful not to brake hard ever, or it'll be on the floor. We just bought a new car and for this reason alone I would not buy another Turbobooster, because I don't want to be drying off/cleaning up stuff off the floor mats.

#2: The seatbelt guides aren't really well designed. The seatbelt is constantly falling out and it's really annoying.

On the GOOD side, it's easy to position the seatbelt on my daughter's shoulder in this seat, and the lower portion fits flat on her thighs as it should. So for seat belt fit, as long as the seatbelt hasn't fallen out yet again, it's doing its job.

I did a lot of research before spending this kind of money - it's super safe and very comfortable, but the thing that really got me to buy it was all of the friends I had who couldn't stop raving about this brand.  I put out a question on Facebook and the majority of my parent friends used this brand and they didn't just have one, they had 2 or 3 (for all their cars and kids) Great car seat - highly recommend.
Would definitely buy again!

I was worried it would be too big for my Kia Soul but it fits perfectly! Easy to install, super easy to adjust, and very securely installed! I was concerned about the installation being difficult after reading the negative reviews but I read the booklet, made sure to familiarize myself with the seat before taking it to the car to install, and checked my vehicle owners manual first so installation was a breeze! I love that I can adjust the fit of the harness so easily even when my toddler is squirming while being buckled. I would definitely recommend this seat to someone looking for a seat that's easy to install, good quality, and easy on the wallet! I'm so happy with this purchase and my munchkin loves her new seat!
Great car seat
3rd seat that we have gotten, love them. Strong and safe (I assume) but the main reason is the ability to fit many in smaller cars.

Excellent design other than the bottom pf the seat. All the weight sits on two small areas that damaged my leather seats permanently. I used it with a cheap seat protector on one seat. Since i really liked the booster seat i went ahead and ordered a $40+ seat protector. I moved the booster seat to the opposite side of my wife's brand new suv. Booster seat went ahead and left insentions on the new leather. Would never buy again or pirchase it as a gift.

I purchased this as the 2nd car seat for our daughter since she outgrew her infant seat. It has worked very well for the last year for us and I'm excited that we won't have to buy another one again! It's super easy to install, and it's not that heavy so it's easy to transfer between vehicles. I love the fact that it will grow with our daughter.
My granddaughter fits great in this. Should have bought it when she was born, instead of having to purchase this after her infant one. Definitely recommend this for infant to 8

I love this carseat, I have 2 vehicles and was getting tired of taking the carseat out each time I wanted to drive a different car so I wanted another Graco all in 1 4ever bit couldn't seem to find thw exact 1 already have in pink so I decided to go with this 1 and I LOVE IT. The fact that it gives my daughter more leg room and thw headrest/harness adjusts to 10 different levels was great. My daughter is 2 and only 24lbs so I still have her rear facing because to me it seems safer with her weight. I'm ready to put the other Graco 4ever in my husband truck and buy another 1 of these for my car lol. Oh and it arrived 1 day after ordering it. I chose this carseat when I read the reviews and the lady totaled her car but her daughter was unharmed due to this carseat. I'm glad I chose it, easy to install and its really cute.

I read that these car seats are good for twins because they are lightweight so our friends purchased two of them off our amazon baby registry. As first time parents the instructions were difficult to understand as the seat needed to be adjusted underneath to accommodate a newborn. Although the canopy is as saggy as the other reviews state, the true problem came last week when the stroller clip completely broke off one of the seats. I use a stroller daily for transporting my twins and now I cannot safely. I emailed customer service twice and have gotten no response.
[[VIDEOID:e4a1aa4660c08112053a24baec96e230]] My box came damaged the bag that the car seat was in was all torn not fully together and no Instructions or information on how to put it together
So far so good. My grand baby is comfortable an safe when riding. Quality too.
A little hard to lift my granddaughter over the side of it without hitting her head on the top of the car door frame but this is  common to most of them that are made for the toddler weights

I just purchased this carseat for my 15 month old. So far it has been great! It is easy to install rear facing and forward facing. I love the quick release buttons for the latch system. It is very easy to take my daughter in and out and she seems very comfortable in it.
Great car seat, easy in and out.  I would buy the one with easily washable cover if I had to buy it again.
Really great, affordable booster seat for my 3 (almost 4) year old
Love the cupholders. Fits perfect with my other son's car seat

Originally purchased a Evenflo Amp for one vehicle and this one for the primary vehicle. This seat is very sturdy and appears to be constructed well and my daughter loves it. The Evenflo was obviously less quality than less.

My daughter moved into the booster seat when she was 4.  She is tall for her age and she fits well in it.  She is now almost 6 and the chair still supports her.  The adjustment levels for height are great.  it allows us to keep her in the booster seat longer with the back support.  she likes the back support on long trips because she can still lean up against the side when she falls asleep verses slumping over without it so she also has asked us to keep it on.  The only draw back is that the cup holders are too shallow to hold cups.  They topple over.  i wish they could be a little deeper or have some grip on the sides to help hold the cups in them.
Seems well built.
Love it
I have 3 of these carseats. Instal for forward facing isbpretty simple, however,  i did have to watch a video to install rearfacing.
Very satisfied with the Graco car seat, I highly recommend
We loved this car seat that we purchased for our granddaughter's visit. It was easy to use, Easy to install, and worked wonderfully with the companion stroller.
Won't install correctly in honda fit 2010.

This car seat is very difficult to keep in the right position. I wish I could still return it but I’m out of time. It slides back and forth and doesn’t stay level. Also the buckle strap has slid off the hook several times luckily I have noticed it while buckling my child in so I can fix it before driving down the road. I would suggest looking at other seats before purchasing.

Special Features: Includes LATCH connectors that attach to vehicle, keeping the booster seat secure when not in use., The backrest on the Viaggio HBB 120 can be removed for easier travel and transport.
Review: Who said their Peg Perego isn’t made in Italy? Not true, as you can see mines IS made in Italy and I love it. Fully adjustable for the backseat of my BMW 4 series Gran Coupe. My daughter loves it and is super comfortable.

We have had problems with this car seat from day one and our child is now 6 months old. For newborns, the seat is way too upright and provides no head support for a small baby (6 lbs). Now that our daughter is an infant we still have issues. She just hates this seat. There isn't any padding and she is visibly uncomfortable. She rarely falls asleep in the seat, even on long trips, and is generally agitated as soon as we put her in. We have taken our car to our local hospital to have the installation/settings checked several times and everything checks out. Our daughter loves riding in one grandma's Graco size4me convertible seat (that was half the price of this seat) and the other grandma's Chicco KeyFit seat (also less expensive). We are going to go ahead and upgrade to a convertible seat because this one has been such a disappointment, won't use it for baby #2.

The only drawback is the belt guide for the shoulder belt is really flimsy so the belt comes out every time the kids take the seat belts off. Annoying to have to lace that back in every time I buckle them in. Overall a good chair though.
great

We bought this for my 3.5 year old daughter as a spare car seat in a small (Ford Fiesta) car. I like that it clips in (car anchors) so that I don't have to buckle it in when there's no child in it, as most of the time it is empty in the back seat of our work/commuter car.
Simplemente bonita y perfecta
Used for my 26 month old granddaughter!

We have 3 different models of Graco carseats. For some reason, this one is insanely difficult to tighten. Like, throw full weight of 200+ lbs man to try to get it tight enough to be safe. It's nice that we might be able to have the seat rear-facing a little longer, but not at the cost of the seat belt never being tight enough
My two year old tells me daily how much she likes her new seat :-).
Great product. Worth the money.
Love this carseat and so does my baby !!
My son is comfortable in this seat and I feel he is very secure. My mom bought a seat as well.

We have 2 of these car seats and they are awesome. My husband and I drive compact cars so space was an issue, but we chose this seat based on safety ratings, ability to convert to a booster with a 5 point harness, and affordability as well.  This seat fits perfectly and my child has room to grow.  It is easy to install with the LATCH system and she seems comfortable and safe.  The buckle is a little difficult, but I have gotten used to it and I would rather it be too hard than too easy (for little hands to figure out!).
This product feels so solid and comfortable. The 5point harness is also very secure and comfortable around the neck. Slim fit helps to get two booster seats across the back seat too!
Well made and and our great grandsons sit real comfy in it , they even fall asleep !
Perfect for long travels.

I absolutely love my Diono Car Seats. They are so sturdy and stable which is so reassuring when driving my kids. I love how high the weigh limit is on rear facing and that this goes from birth to 120lbs so I never have to buy a new car seat. Love the colors too!!
My daughter who is 4 loves her new car seat. She especially likes the cup holder.
VERY HARD TO INSTALL! So light that it didn’t feel safe. Didn’t look comfortable at all. Returned.
I ordered 2 both realized had small leak in seam .. luckily was in time to return one but the other I was outside the return window .. won’t buy again
don’t waste your money.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Perfect for travel so you don't have to lug around a regular booster
We picked this over their standard model so that the kids would be comfortable, and they weren’t. They hated them. We will use them for travel but that’s it.

We had a car accident with this car seat when we got rear ended by a texting driver and sandwiched into another car in front of us.  Air bags deployed in the front and on her side of the car in the backseat.  My husband broke his hand, but my 7lb infant seems to have been unaffected, thanks be to God. We ordered the exact same car seat again since we know first hand it does it’s job well.
Great car seat....no issues. A bit difficult to get apart first time for cleaning seat cover, but got easier to do with repetition.

My Son loves this seat... Matter of fact, he falls alseep in this thing quicker than anything else. This seat is comfy. I can see where folks would complain about it being bulky but the back seat is for my son so i dont mind. the moo pattern is cool he likes it and it gets lots of complements. I first used it as a back facing seat and have since then turned my son around. The only - ONLY drawback is, complaired to my sons other seat ( alpha omega) the wings on this seat are higher up, so he cant crawl in it himself, and picking him up over it will only work for so long until i hit his head on the roof picking him up over the sides.
Just what the kids wanted. Easy to install.
Great car seat. My 4 month old fits in it great.

This car seat is incredibly light weight, but it is bulky. Takes up a lot of space when used backwards facing, probably would not fit in a very small car.  We have not used it forward facing yet. Bought this thinking ot would be great for occasional travel by car and plane, but I was wrong. Not sure it would even fit a plane seat, and there is no way I would lug this around an airport!! My son seems very comfortable in it though, and its a very nice looking design.
I found the  car seat to be  very difficult to  correctly hook my grandchildren in.  I like how compact it is, but would definitely not want to use this car seat on a daily basis.
Works well. Great Protection for little ones!

I love this carseat. So much that I bought two, one for each car. I have always used the graco brand, with my daughter I bought a much cheaper carseat, but I spent a little more for a convertible carseat with my son because he grows like a weed! He started in this car seat around 6 months, he is now 2 and it's still going strong. It is extremely easy to spot clean, as well as take apart and throw in the washer. The cup holder and little storage compartments are great for my son, he always finds something to stick in there. And it is nice to know that this carseat will grow as he does!
as long as it serves it's purposes, then I'm happy with it. In fact it's quite durable as well

I would not recommend this seat if you are able to fit any other seat. This is heavy,  difficult to install, and almost impossible to get tight. In RF you absolutely have to use the RF tether to get it to within the allowed 1" movement. Nuts. LATCH install works a little better than seat belt, but the LATCH weight limit is really low, I think 30 or 35 lbs because the seat itself is a whopping 25lbs. IMPORTANT: The bottom part of the seat is really low, so I could not get this to work with stalk buckles. The buckle would rest against the seat's side, making it simply impossible to pull the belt tight enough. I ran into this problem in an Acura MDX. For recessed buckles, this wasn't an issue, but it's still really hard to get the seat tight enough because it's so tall and the bottom is so low. You really have to use the tether to stabilize the seat, like a very tall mast! The harness also doesn't have an ez slide adjust like many other seats... I don't know why for 25 freaking lbs, they couldn't put one of those, or built in lock-offs. If I didn't need to make space for a 3rd passenger in the back seat, I'd get something else.
It serves its purpose. Nice colors but the arm rest keeps slipping off every time my son gets out of it. Other than that it was a good purchase.
Pretty color and spacious, arrived quickly.

Special Features: Includes LATCH connectors that attach to vehicle, keeping the booster seat secure when not in use., The backrest on the Viaggio HBB 120 can be removed for easier travel and transport.
Review: Wonderful seat! Crazy fast to install or uninstall when switching vehicles. Very sturdy and my daughter says it's comfortable.

We like this car seat overall. Cup holders arent the most solid and is difficult to take fabric off to clean but we love the look and my toddler is comfortable as can be in it. We like how adjustable it is. Thankfully we havent tested the safety features/been in any car accidents but I'd recommend it to any friends based on ease of installation.
Excellent fit the baby loves it.
So heavy for a carseat!!!  But protective and gives peace of mind when traveling with our infant.
My 3 yr old son loves this car seat.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: This would be great if it were more durable.  We had 2 of these, they both developed leaks after a couple months' use.  The customer service from the manufacturer was non- existent to get any replacements. They are the perfect size for smaller cars when you have 3 kids to fit in a row.  But, if they deflate, they are useless.
This carseat felt very flimsy. I did not trust the safety of my child with with it. I ended up returning it for another Graco. This is the first Graco product I've ever felt was low quality.

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: I LOVE our NextFit! We had a Saftey 1st Grow N Go before this and although it was lighter, installing it was a pain and the straps would get stuck when adjusting. The NextFit is ridiculously easy to install and I’ve never had the straps get stuck! I love that it’s comfy for the kids and it has many recline settings! Will be purchasing for my second for sure!
My one year old daughter loves this car seat. The cup holders are a plus.

There's a reason why Peg-Perego seats are in nearly every Prius in LA. It's no secret that European car seats are subject to different regulations (and many feel they are better) than American ones -- for example, in the EU, for Side Impact Protection (SIP), brands need to comply with the EU standard for SIP. But in the US, there is no unified standard at this time, and SIP isn't even a requirement.

The Primo Viaggio's head panel is also EURO-NCAP compliant, an additional safety measure which European companies can further push their standards. Just placing your child in this seat, you'll FEEL the snug security this offers. Peace of mind is instant, inside and out.

Installing this seat is easy thanks to the two buckles that are stored in the base. We use this seat in NYC when we rent cars, each time with different makes/models. We have never had a problem with installation, no matter what type of car.

This seat is compatible with the Booklet stroller [[ASIN:B00STTQ8J6 Peg Perego Booklet, Onyx]], which clicks in easily.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review: Nice seat, light and secure, easy to install

It's a good steady car seat works great I feel my son is vey safe rear facing but the car seat is only secure in my car cause I have the anchors that attach to the frame of the car my husbands car doesn't have them and the cAr seat moves around so much rear facing no matter how much we tighten the seat belt because he doesn't have the anchors. In my car tho I've never seen a car seat so secure you can't move it whatso ever.

Love this car seat however the straps don't tighten against my daughter properly without some force. It takes some muscle to pull them tight. We have taken the seat out to make sure nothing is caught and it continues to happen. I have contacted Graco for assistance and haven't herd anything back. We love the seat, just wish it wasn't so difficult to tighten. It is our secondary seat in my husband's car so not used as much, but it's still a pain.
Love this car seat, very roomy for a growing child. Easy to clean and very soft, my boy loves it.
Awesome

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: We really like this carseat : it is comfortable, easy to install it has a leveler that ensures our child is sitting at the correct angle. Our favorite thing about it,other than its safety ratings, is the zip cover that keeps our child warm and the canopy that comes down far enough to give our child privacy. One thing i wish it had was a leveler on the detached part the actual seat not just the base. Lastly the canopy diesnt push back as easily as i would like it to. Overall super content with our decision to purchase this carseat.
Perfect 👌

I have a tall 2.5 year old who just meets the minumum requirements for this chair (see product description).  She was getting too small for her convertible car seat so we went ahead and made the change.  This seat still feels very safe.  There is a red plastic loop (near the shoulder piece) that you insert the seat belt shoulder strap through, which I love because it ensures that her seat belt is staying on and in the right spot.  She LOVES the pull out cup holders.  I like how you can detach the back so later it will just be a seat.  Would be great for a plane trip too, as it's light.  Great get!  And about $10 cheaper than Target.

Special Features: 2 in 1 High Back and No Back Booster
Review: This seat is perfect when your child has outgrown the baby seat, the seat belt adapter keep the seatbelt off their face, and they can buckle it themselves! (Just be sure to check it discreetly)
Esta muy bien asegurado muy buen producto le doy 5 estrellas
Super convenient to keep in my diaper bag because it deflates nearly flat. It prevents back pain for my baby to sit a little higher. Great product!

I really like the colors and pattern of this seat.  My daughter is very comfortable in it and there seems to be plenty of adjustments available to make it last her a long time (she is 21months now).  The only thing I don't like is the way the buckle works.  I wish the two pieces came together and then went into the buckle instead of buckling them individually but that is something I should've checked into closer before purchasing.
Great booster for the price.
This is a must have for anyone traveling with a compatible car seat.  Child can sit in car seat while being wheeled through the airport.
Easy to use and great to have rather than move and adding the big bulky seats .
Great seat!! Love how it reclines and you dont have to move the strap to different slots as they grow. Everything is easy to adjust

This is quite possibly the best car seat ever!  My child and i love it. My almost two year old was so happy when we got it. Not only is it beautiful and i love the blue colors, but it’s comfortable and easy to use.  Its not super light weight but also not super heavy either and wasnt hard to install. And its very adjustable for your childs height. I love that it can be used from birth all the way up so no need to buy different seats through the years.  And it can be installed forward or rear facing.  I haven’t tried the rear facing but it seems like it would take up more space that way and seemed a little harder to install. I definitely recommend this seat.

Special Features: Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, Forward Facing Seat
Review:
Seriously so easy to install & remove from the car!!
Purchased for when I have my nephew with me. I needed a simple yet safe solution for I’m constantly switching his seat with my granddaughters depending on whose with me.
He loves his seat and claims it’s comfortable.
Great price, light weight and easy to install.

This is my third Britax...i bought it for my 5 yr old as her other seat was nearing the end of its life. I was concerned about the size since as i drive a 2000 four door honda civic.

with both the new marathon model and this carseat, there is no room in the middle for someone to sit in the back seat. My daughter LOVES the seat because it is very comfortable, has arm rests and cup holders.

Pros: easy to clean, easy adjustable straps and five point harness....the side impact protection is great!

Cons: (1) I do not like how the lower latch connectors can be removed (flimsy), and (2) i do not like how they removed the additional seatbelt lock that is standard on the marathons. I like the added protection in having the seatbelt lock off (which is important if your car is an older model and does not have the lower seat latch connectors)

Only 2 cons, but those were important to me...luckily my other car has the lower latch connectors. I wouldn't return the carseat, because i trust this brand.

Excellent seat, features and it's awesome it lasts until our child will be out of the car seat and booster area. Easy to install, the instructions if you're putting behind the driver seat are in Spanish but the ones facing the passenger side are English, can be difficult to read while trying to adjust/install.
