First of all, it seems like it's a safe carseat, and that's the most important thing. I wouldn't know though, of course, and thank God. But I do really like the side impact protection aspect of it, and that's why we bought it.

As far as ease of use--which I believe is actually a HUGE safety factor--I think it's fairly difficult to figure out how to use at first. I'm a very particular guy who figures out how to use things really easily, and this thing left me puzzled for a couple hours. Now truth be told, I've never used a baby car seat before--never had a reason to. But being a new dad, I wanted to get this right.

I think any company making a safe baby seat--or any baby seat for that matter--should have very clear instructions about how to install it properly. Especially considering the frightening statistics that a majority of parents improperly install their baby car seats. So what good is a safe seat if you can't install it properly?

If I weren't a first time user, I would have less trouble, but that doesn't take them off the hook.

The instruction booklet it comes with is not very helpful whatsoever--just a scrap paper that has some images.

We were able to use it when our baby first came out of the hospital, without feeling like it was too big for her. The seat was huge, but the straps can be "restrung" in a way that it fits even an infant--our baby was 8-9 pounds. So very safe there. The little infant cushioning worked well for the first month or so, before she outgrew it.

The baby seat is big, which is a negative in terms of having to scoot the passenger seat forward uncomfortably (for whoever is sitting there), but we wanted a bigger one so that it would last longer for our child and save a few bucks.

One of the negatives of this (along with the stroller) that has driven us nuts is that it doesn't always click and lock in properly when we put it on the base. Nor is it easy to remove. That's a safety issue because if it's not clicked in properly your baby will go flying in an accident. They say that there should be a loud "snapping" sound on each side that clicks in so that you absolutely know when it's on properly. That's true, but it doesn't always make that sound, and it doesn't always click in right. The way the plastic works there, it could be a better design. So that always makes me question whether I have it in or not, and then I yank the darn thing around to make sure, which you should always do, but I do it particularly violently (unfortunately for my sleeping baby) to make sure she's locked in.

Then when my wife tries to remove the car seat (especially when the passenger seat is slightly bumped against it), she can't get the darn thing unlocked and out. She's a patient woman who's being tested (by the baby and now this seat). I've figured it out more easily, but sometimes it still takes a few tries to get out, and by then you've woken up your baby again.

In case you don't read my review of the stroller that you can buy with it $69.99 - it really sucks. I don't think you have another option, but if I had to do it again, I wouldn't buy this car seat for that reason alone. The thing is awful--the wheels don't turn properly and the lock mechanism doesn't work well not to mention has jammed my fingernails a couple times.

Good luck for those of you with this thing. I do believe it will keep my baby safe, but there are issues with this that shouldn't be there.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Not very easy to fold
Our little guy loves his new seat. Very comfy & well protected. Easy to adjust.
This is a great seat! My 15 month old son outgrew his other rear facing seat so we bought this one. This seat has so much room. My son loves it!

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Easy to assemble.  Very attractive.  I like that it adjusts according to the height your child needs.
No complaints, good price, good quality
Fits well in our cherokee trailhawk jeep, easy set up and load our daughter in and out of. She seems comfortable in it as well
i wish the base was adjustable to work with bucket seats
Love it and so does my son!
Love this seat! It fits perfectly in my RAV4 & my son LOVES it!

I find it very hard to get my granddaughter into this car seat.  It is very narrow and the straps are hard to adjust.  It almost feels too small but it is supposed to be for up to an older age.  We shall see.  She is only a year and half now.
We love this seat and diono products. I have been a diono consumer for 10 years for all of my kids. We love this new addition to our car. Very comfortable. Easy install.
it is very lite and easy to go from car to car
It's amazing. Comfortable. Easy to install sleek looking and my daughter loves it.
So far so good!

This seat is fantastic. It fits my 8 month old fantastically...we've had it a few months an it's a breeze to instal using both the latch an a reg seat belt for instal...I love the no rethread harness it's awesome...fabric is really nice and did not stain when we had a nasty blow out diaper which is great...I'm happy about how long the seat should last us as well...

I love this seat!

- It has terrific safety features, typical Britax.
- They use really nice, and so far durable materials for kid comfort. The kid's been using it for only about two months, and he's only 10+ months old, so he's not in a position to do much damage yet. Time will tell.
- Installation is a breeze! The ClickTight feature makes sure the seat is really secure and tight, since it actually presses down on the belt straps to increase tension.
- The little window on the side for angling is very intuitive, so it's easy to make sure the angle is appropriate for the age of the child.
- The lever to angle the seat is super easy to operate.
- The lever at the top of the seat makes it REALLY easy to adjust the height of the headrest, and it controls the strap height at the same time.
- Finally, The button to release the straps is very easy to access, easier than on their B-Safe infant seat.
- The fit and finish is top quality. It better be, for the price.

They've really thought through the details. But the most important selling feature to me was the ability to fit it in my car. I have a late 80s E30 BMW 325iX 4-door, and the back seat is not very roomy. I tried the Diono Radian because it has such a wide weight range and can be converted to a booster seat, but there was no way it was gong to fit in my car, the back is way too tall. The Britax has a very nice curved back, very low profile, and it actually fit! I doubt any other seat would have fit, but the compact shape works, though not at the expense of weight/height range. So I'll have to buy a booster seat eventually.

I've used Britax products before, with the B-Safe seat/B-Agile stroller combo. LOVED that system as well, it's the reason I went back to them for the Boulevard. The airline broke our stroller, and when I called Britax to try to get a replacement part, they explained that the part wasn't available separately due to being too difficult to replace. So with no questions asked, they simply took all the steps necessary to replace the entire stroller in the quickest, most convenient and pain-free way possible. They had all my info available from registration, and it couldn't have been easier. It never occurred to me before I was a parent how much I would value the ease and lack of stress of replacing product. Clearly, Britax understands how little time and energy parents have to give to stuff like this, and have implemented great processes to make it as easy as possible on their customers. While it's not THE deciding factor to buy Britax product, poor or lacking customer service would be a deciding factor to NOT buy from car seat brand.

The only feature I'm not that fond of are the rubber pads that surround the straps where the chest clip sits. They have to float on the straps so that their position can be adjusted, but it does mean one more thing to make sure it's in the correct spot. I won't take them off, since they're part of the safety and comfort of the strap system, and I have gotten used to it, so it's a quicker process now to buckle the kid in. But it's just slightly annoying.

I have a 2019 Chevy Equinox and needed to be able to fit three car seats across the backseat. I have two Diono Radians (1 FF, 1RF) and a Britax BSafe 35, and I can fit them all. The RF Radian is behind the passenger seat and renders the front seat pretty much useless. I’m 5’6” and my knees were almost touching the dashboard. I do not have the angle adjuster for the seat. This isn’t a dealbreaker for us because the Equinox is not our primary vehicle and that RF seat will soon be turned FF. My major complaint, though, is that I have a tall 5 year old, and he has nearly outgrown the seat at the highest position. In our other vehicle we have a Graco 4ever, and he will easily fit in that seat for another year! For the price point of this seat, I was disappointed that it will not last him very long, and I’m not looking forward to having to buy another type of seat soon. Installation was not as bad as the reviews make it sound! At 20 weeks pregnant I was able to easily install the seats by myself, and I’m very confident that they are securely installed. Just watch a quick installation video on YouTube! All in all, if you need three across, these are great seats.

I bought the ever popular Graco 4Ever and this extend to fit. I read all the reviews for both and ultimately ended up returning the 4Ever and keeping this extend to fit. The leg room it provides on backwards facing is super cool. It’s just as easy to install as the 4Ever, and just as light and compact.

We bought this car seat with our oldest who is now three and now our one year old is using it.

Both kids love it and the oldest say's that it's very comfortable especially compared to the Graco (that we actually hate but was given to us) that is in my husbands truck. We looked for about a year before we finally settled on this one, what actually sold us was the car crash related reviews & the side impact features.

The kids love the cup holder! It comes off and can be moved to either side which is good if you need to make room in the back or have a smaller car. I have read a few reviews on the recline & belting of this but we have not had any problems with belting it in rear or forward facing. As for the recline.. we have a really good recline with it in my scion xb & my husbands ford truck it may just depend on the vehicle.

The only complaint that we (mainly I) really have is that the older models seems to be kind of wider and not as slim as the newer one's we have seen recently in store. I am 5'2, 125 lbs and at times it is kind of annoying to lug from car to car but my husband is not bothered by it.

We recently purchased a Britax booster for our oldest and I honestly feel that this is just as good of not better in some aspects as the more popular Britax brand. I have noticed that when we moved the Britax to the center seat (my son get's car sick) that the Safety 1st is so wide that it pushed the Britax over to the side some rather then right perfectly in the center of the seat but that is something we are trying to correct. I don't know about the newer models latch but if they would change them to the kind that just clicks on and also the belt path to where it is in front (like Britax) then I would sale the Britax in a heartbeat!!

Overall this is one of the best car seats that we have owned or looked at and I am very confidant that it is very safe should something bad ever happen. We are looking to perchance a newer model of this so that we have a extra for my husbands truck!

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Absolutely LOVE these chairs! Compact enough to travel with, and very easy to set up in any chair. The kids love them too! The tray that comes with the chairs are perfect size. My baby girl was in it as early as 1, and my son is still using it at age 3. They are wonderful!

I bought this for my husband's car- a Dodge Dart.  We were looking for something that would allow me to sit in the passengers seat without my knees hitting the dashboard.  DH was skeptical of it at first, as it looks huge coming out of the box, but it fits well, and he think's it's the best car seat we've ever bought. He especially likes how the harness tightens at the bottom, instead of over the shoulders.  Was also one of the easiest installs for him.
it works well .
Love it.  Easy to buckle. Easy to install.  Easy to clean.  Love the built-in cup holder.  Not cheap - wait for a sale.

I bought this since I was tired of renting car seats when I traveled for vacation. I could have bought this one a few times over by now.
I was mainly looking for something that was safe and lightweight. I can only go by the ratings and other people's reviews for the safety, but I consider this lightweight. There are others that might be considered ultra lightweight, but for me I was able to get this to the airport and to the rental car with minimal effort in a car seat carrying backpack.
Installing was not anymore difficult than the car rental seats I had used in the past, but might be tougher if you are used to a more "deluxe" seat. The tightening process during install requires you to push down on the seat to make it snug, I typically use my knee in the seat.
There are adjustments for belt shoulder height and buckle space which should be done before install, but nothing else.
Overall it has already paid for itself. The weight range is wide so I expect to use this for a long time.
Son loves it. Super Comfy

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review:
It’s great and the best that does not get so much space, my daughter loves to set here

She’s 7months

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: Easy install. Works great. Very convenient.
My son recommend this for us to purchase for our grandson. It was a bit complicated to put together but does the job.
I love the way it expands so you don't have to take it out to adjust the car straps. He loves his new car seat!!
It was great
Outstanding safety product and great price.

I prefer a 5 point harness for my 6 year old boy
but as a backup seat for friends or a seat to ship
to Grand-Pa for when we visit, this is a great value
and a good seat.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Ordered these for a trip to a city where we would be using taxis/Ubers to get around - no rental car.  These worked great for my two kids ages 3.5 and 5.5.  The 3.5 year old fell just below the minimum requirements but I still felt he was securely strapped into the taxi seat.  These are so easy to inflate/install/deflate which is necessary when quickly hailing cabs! They are pretty small and stored easily in a stroller seat basket or in a tote bag/backpack.

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: Bought for my son and daughter-in-law for their new baby boy.  It was their pick and they love itQ

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review: If you’re like me and live in Texas… with a child… you know there is nothing like trying to get a kid in the car in this heat. I thought it would be easy… not so much! The top also wobbles a lot and apparently that’s just normal. My child is still rear facing so maybe it gets easier once you turn it around. But I am not a fan of this carseat for instillation reasons and the belts themselves are also difficult to tighten vs every other car seat I have used being very easy for that. 2/5 for the inconvenience
its pretty poor material

Purchased this today from a local chain-store (think of a bow and arrow and you will get it) as we had family visiting the area and needed a child seat quickly. Paid $40 more than Amazon's price, too. While this has some helpful features, it just barely fit my grandchild who weighs 46 lbs and is 48 inches tall. Putting the shoulder straps at the highest level (top slots), he just fit under those straps. The crotch strap was marginal now and by next visit he would need it moved forward too the outer slot. That's what caused me to return this item. To verify that I could adjust that C-strap latter, I tried to relocate it. Well, no matter how hard I tried, even with a pair of heavy duty pliers, I was not able to pull the anchor bracket edgewise up through the narrow lot in the metal and plastic base. Looked like a slam-dump task in their manual, but someone at the factory must have made this slot narrower  (or the anchor thicker) as it just would not come out. The combination of the robust metal anchor and the webbing were just too wide for that slot. Need to look elsewhere for a car seat now.
Very easy to use and install!!
First one we bought, liked it so much we bought another! Easy to use and install !

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: I bought this chair to use with my 1 1/2 year old nephew. It is so easy to clean and store away. He seems to like sitting in the chair. I use it for food and play time.

I have the Chicco Nextfit but needed another seat for our second child. The straps are easier to adjust than the Chicco but are much thinner. The buckle gets turned around incorrectly and I have to flip it over often. Also the headrest is flimsier than the Chicco but the Chicco is double the price.
Reasonable quality for the money. Easy to assemble and install but the seat cover tie downs are a bit iffy, frequently coming loose and needing to be re-attached

Best car seat I've ever used. So easy to adjust, install, and take out. The only downfall (if it even is one) is it's huge. Of course, this is why it is one of the safest car seats on the market. However, if you plan on buying this and own a small car, smaller SUV, or use multiple car seats in the back, you might have to rethink this seat. For me this seat works perfect because I have it in my Suburban and it's the only car seat I need as my other children are older.

1-2 years after I bought this car seat, my children and I were in a wreck that landed us in the ditch upside-down. My son was in this car seat, and he's the only person who came out of this accident without a scratch! No bumps. No bruises. NOTHING. The seat stayed secure and he stayed safe. Since you're not supposed to use car seats after they've been through an accident, we obviously have to buy another one, and you better believe we are going to get him this exact seat again. Thank you Evenflo for keeping my son safe.

Love this car seat. It is the only one I could find here that wasn't hideous, came with a cup holder, wasn't too heavy, was simple to install (for car seat standards) and had straps that weren't tricky to buckle all at a decent price.

One thing that bugs me is that there is a ton of extra space at the top that seems unecessary. The instructions tell you that the point where the shoulder straps come out of the seat should be positioned at the same height of your childs shoulders and not dip below this point. This makes it so there is at least 6 inches of extra space above my childs head. The sides still cover my childs head so her head is still protected but just barely. It seems like a pretty big design flaw to have all that unused headrest above their head.

We move it from car to car a lot and it really isn't very heavy when you compare it to other brands like a graco I borrowed once. I do find that I have to kneel in the seat while tightening it into place to really get it secure without wobbling. It does make it very secure though and isn't too difficult. I have dealt with worse and this is my first child so I don't have a lot of experience on my side yet,

Overall I would definitely recommend. The only cons I have are listed and they are very far from deal breakers especially when compared to the alternatives.
Out of the 3 car seats we have this one is the best, we are buying a 2nd

We have been really happy with this seat. The straps are easy to adjust and tighten and the cushions provide snug support for our daughter, who's on the small size (only about 22 pounds at 15 months old).
My son loved it and he feels like a big boy

Seem like a decent product, but when we attempted to install as rear facing, it is impossible to get the strap tight enough for these seats to be safe. You have to remove the seat cover to be able to pull on the tightening strap at the appropriate angle to actually tighten it enough, the cover is then physically impossible to properly reinstall once the seat is tight. It's also physically impossible to then get the seat to recline as it's supposed to for safe operation. Maybe if you drive a megavan and have plenty of space to maneuver around the seat it's doable, but for a normal passenger vehicle it is literally physically impossible to safely install this seat rear facing.  Save yourself the headache and buy something else.
Perfect fit, easy to assemble and put in the vehicle!

We have now have 5 kids in a 2007 Nissan Quest, the kids are 9, 7, 4, 2, and newborn. This carseat is the only one that would allow the 4 year old to be in a convertible seat in the third row with the 7 and 9 year olds in boosters. It's also the most sturdy, safe feeling carseat we've purchased.
great car seat

Never having had my own kids I'm having a steep learning curve as I'm about to be a grandparent (long story)

Car seats for the uninitiated are confusing. The online video makes it easier for a neophyte like me to understand not just the safety but the features that are in the car seat.

The shade is a little tight to move around the swinging arm -- which really is rather annoying.

without the base and without the baby the car seat does seem light.

My 6 year old son was in this seat today and we were in an accident. The seat was destroyed! The frame twisted and was a total mess! Our son didnt have a single mark on him! This seat did its job well! Thank you for keeping g him safe!
My daughter loves these seats.  They are very comfortable and easy to install.

I originally bought this for my son to be his only car seat. YAY for trying to save money. When he was born he was 20 inches and 7lbs and didn't fit safely in this seat. We couldn't get the straps small enough no matter how much adjusting we did. NO biggie, we thought, we'll save it for later.
Here's where I'm really really torn. This carseat is so easy to install and comfy for long car rides. My son loves it. BUT even at a year, he's maybe 32 inches and 18lbs and we struggle with the straps still. His shoulders seem too narrow for the straps, even when I have the straps below the shoulder (per RF guidelines). Also, we've had a couple of EPIC diapers....and once the poo is out of the diaper, it can drip into the cracks of the carseat and get into the underneath part. EW. We've since purchased a waterproof liner for the bottom, but for a $250+ carseat, I don't want extra hassle for cleaning up messes. Looking into the future with potty training, his bladder will be bigger than the waterproof liner will hold. Yes, I can wash the fabric, but it's also a hassle. I'm not looking forward to wrangling a wet toddler and having to clean the underneath cavity and fight to strip off the cloth material to wash it.

I so so so wanted to love this seat. Its one of the best fits for my car (Volvo XC60) -- it gives the passengers in the back the most seat space and the most leg room for the passenger up front. I love how sturdy it is and how easy it is to install and move from car-to-car. (it's HEAVY but install is a snap).

Consider the above if looking at this. If my son were a little bigger, I don't think I'd be as concerned about the straps.
Works great for my grandkids either rear or forward facing.  Very good purchase.
He Loves it
As my boy is little.  The car seat is bigger for him however we like it and also hie feel safe in it.
Material on seat cover is not very durable.  Had fraying within about two weeks after use began.
Really easy to put in. Cute pattern. Feels comfortable.
Cumplió con mis expectativas
Love BRITAX Parkway. We use this everyday with no issues and I have a 7 year old ridding in it.
Very easy to use and fits my 7 year old granddaughter perfectly
Excelente
Love this!!!!!!! After threatening to cut car seats out to remove.  This is such a pleasure !!!!!! Pleasure I say.  And ready to use until baby out of car seats !!! You wont be disappointed
Dependable product. Highly recommended!
Great car seat!!
Best car seat ever. Easy to get baby in and out of.
Worth every penny!

We bought this to use in our main vehicle and have the Contender as our backup seat. We love this one much better! The straps adjust so easily compared to the Contender, and I love this seat will last us so long. Our toddler loved the transition from infant seat to this...much happier car rider!

I sent this down to my parents in Florida, so we don't have to rent one  for the rental car, and it worked out perfectly. My dad picked up the kids from the airport and had it installed perfectly. Our son felt safe and secure the entire ride.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: I had a hard time getting the larger booster seat that my daughter had in the middle of my suv. This is so much easier for her and comfortable now that she is stuck in between two car seats! I would buy this again!!

I like that it's rollover tested and well cushioned. But that's all I liked. It was hard to strap down into the car, I needed to get someone else to do it for me, and it took an extensive amount of adjusting. I had to buy an additional tether as the normal one wasn't holding it as well as it should. When reclining, it was either way back or completely upright. Not sure if it was just a defect with mine but no in between meant my son was all the way up or all the way back. It was hard to remove the outer cover for washing and stains easily. Also pretty bulky for my Hyundai Sonata. Although it only took up 1 2/3 seats, so could be worse. The main concern I had, was that the straps are so difficult to adjust in order to tighten or loosen them. Strapping in my kid takes a lot of strength and it sticks a lot. I checked everything, it wasn't twisted, it just takes a lot of force to tighten, resulting in straps that end up hanging off my son's shoulders because it won't tighten any further no matter how hard I pull. He's chunkier, 11months and 24lbs/30".. I'm hoping mine was just an exception, however, reading other reviews online, not just on here... a lot of people had similar issues with the straps.

I ended up ordering a Graco Mileston off the Black Friday sale and will test that out instead. Safety wise, the straps were the only reason I was getting rid of this.

Even after washing the smell from this fabric is permeating our entire living area. Not sure what is going on but we will try washing again I guess. It kind of smells like chlorine.. we bought this as a travel seat for our toddler and will update review once we have used it. If we can ever get this smell to go away!
Easy
Easy to install securely
It is a great product for the money.
The product is as indicated and is very helpful

I love this car seat. It's tricky to get it set up, but once it is, it's incredibly convenient to get kids into and out of. But pray that your child never throws up in it. Cleaning this carseat thoroughly is impossible. It's a nightmare to get the fabric off and back on, and there are endless nooks and crannies that will never get clean. We made it 6 months without incident, now I'm considering if we can even keep using it.

I hate this car seat. I have it set up in rear facing mode right now. The adapter that snaps on the bottom for rear facing contains two large plastic protrusions that appear to meant to be wedged between the seat crevice. However, that is not how it works. What is does is force the seat to sit back several inches and recline at an extreme angle. This takes up a lot of precious space. So much that the front seats cannot be placed back far enough to be comfortable to drive. These things are also very sharp and hard and likely to tear or puncture leather if not using some type of protective pad.

I have a mid-sized sedan. Not a small car. I thought this compact car seat would be ideal. It doesn't fit in a regular car. Apparently this is only meant for people driving Suburbans or giant vehicles with ample room.

Other engineering fails:
- storage compartment is tiny and everything needs to pack very particularly to close it.
- cup holder does not lock, worst design I've ever seen
- it's touted as travel friendly but doesn't have a handle to carry it around
- the padding is pretty lacking
- box had "MadeOfSeattle" written all over. An obvious attempt to subliminally convey a made in USA message. However, the product is made in China. Pretty deceptive marketing.
Love this for my 1 year old and 4 year old. Converts for every size needed and for a fraction of the cost. Loved it so much I bought 2 of them.

This is the 5th Graco car seat and the 3rd SnugRide infant car seat I have bought, not counting the ones I gifted my best friends for their newborns. That may give you an idea of how big a Graco fan I am. Graco car seats became our first choice because they offer the best value for the money we spent -- combining quality, style and safety -- and fits our budget perfectly!

My favorite thing about this particular car seat is that it is super easy to install and to use. The seat is easily and securely attached to the base with one "click". Another great feature is that it is lightweight, which makes a huge difference when you have to carry a big baby around with the seat. The handle provides a firm and comfortable grip for the adult doing the heavy lifting. I also love the pattern and color combination of the fabric. It's stylish, dust resistant, and goes well with almost any car interior. I'm pleased that it looks nicer than in the picture. My baby seems to like the contrasting colors on the inside of the canopy because he keeps looking up with curiosity and even smiled at it several times.

Speaking of the canopy, it helps shield the baby from strong sunlight, making it easy for him to open his eyes wide or to doze off to dreamland. Both the head support and the detachable cushions around the straps help make baby feel comfortable and secure during the ride.

As an experienced mom, I love this car seat and would highly recommend it to new parents, especially those who are budget conscious, value driven shoppers.

This has been an awesome car seat, kept at grandmas house for infrequent visits. The seat is now too small for the girl and has been used very little - still in the box - if anyone wants it! Make an offer. I would watch my little granddaughter fall fast asleep easily in this car seat so it must've been very comfy.

Great booster car seat, the little guy loves it my only problem with it are the cup holders, they're not very deep so most cups and thermos just fall out. I found out the hard way and had quite the the mess to clean up

The latch is so short, I cannot even reach the bar at the back of the seat in my 2012 Toyota Sienna. I am very disappointed. The top latch reaches all the down though. Seems like a good car seat otherwise. I will update if I notice anything else.

Have had this for over a year, and it's still great.  Easy to adjust, easy to move from vehicle to vehicle, and nicely padded for my little one's comfort.  It is a bit of a pain to take apart to wash, but it can be done, and all the pieces have washed fine in the washer. It is of excellent quality, and was bought at a great price.  This has been a great purchase!

I like this seat for many reasons, but there are a few thins I would alter to make it perfect (which i don't think there is a perfect car seat so this has worked great for us). After using the Chicco Fit 30 from newborn to 9 months, I bought the Britax. So it took a little getting used to, but I really like it now. I feel like she is super secure. The only thing I had a problem with at first was the click portion for the straps or the crotch strap. It was very short and my LO has chunky legs. But after reading that there was another hole and making the adjustment (close to seat, further away), I haven't had any problems with it looking like her legs are getting pushed out.
Britax is the best - easy to use, easy to install, comfy, and safe. Love.

It's a bit bulky takes up more space than u wanted and if you are rear facing, it is hard to allow AC in the area because it's high. My baby's head is sweating when I take her out of car seat. Other than this, it's a great car seat. Quality built, and I do like it. I will be front facing soon so hopefully that will help her get AC.
Very comfortable for my 2.5 year old toddler!
Great seat for 3 across. Easy safety latches for newer car with that feature built in or easy to use seatbelt method.
Great product as advertised!

I would give this car seat zero stars if I could.  We liked it pretty well at first, but after using it for almost a year, the no-thread harness adjuster in the back completely broke making it impossible (and unsafe) for my child to use.  We had to throw it in the trash.  Not happy after spending so much money on what I thought was a quality seat.  I will not buy Britax again.

This is a reletively inexpensive car seat. It’s a great 3-1. We’ve used it in 2 of the 3 configurations. Rear facing and forward. I feel like it’s a little cramped for a rear facing seat if your child is tall and light. My sons legs were always touching the rear seat. We had to switch him a bit early because his legs were so cramped. Thankfully he met the weight recommendation at that time. Fairly easy to clean. Everything snaps off to be washable but my kids still made it a mess between washes. Easy to install. Great chair overall
Comfy and nice looking, easy to install. But did not fit 3 across in 3rd row which is essential for me as a foster parent
Fit perfectly well! Love it!
this came in on time and is perfect for my 4 year old son. It also has cup holders which helps a lot! Super easy to use and install
I love this carseat. The new latches are awesome. I have 2 in my car and love them so much. One for my 2.5 year old who's still rear facing and one for my 8 month old. 💙

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: love this carseat.  nice to look at, easy to use
We really like this, it’s comfortable and the perfect size
Terrible when my toddler falls asleep. His head is all over the place. LOVE the Graco Head Wise 70 Car Seat!
Very safe car seat per crash reviews. Love that it  grows with child, wonderful head support, even a sippy cup holder. Great price at Amazon Deal with Graco rebate. Couldn't ask for more.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: Wry easy to blow up and deflate when not in use.
My preschooler likes being able to see out the window and this seat raises him up just enough to do that. It even matches my vehicle decor.
Good product!!!
A lot smaller than expected.
Amazing car seat! My son loves it, falls asleep as soon as he seats down

This car seat is very comfy and I like it, the only problem I've had is that it's rather difficult to pull the bottom strap to tighten the belt around my baby.
She's 8 months and 18 pounds, so not a tiny infant... I pull with all my might but there's still a lot of space between her hips/legs and the strap (the infant insert is in place). The top area of the strap seems to be tight enough, but not the bottom. I've tried tightening from the top and pulling on the strap, but it still seems like there's a lot of room.
I called Britax and they told me that since the strap is rather long to roll it around my wrist and pull UP and OUT not to the sides or it'll cause friction against the strap and it'll eventually tear. I will try that today. The strap is really stiff and difficult to pull.

I just bought this car seat and I'm totally confused! The crotch buckle is too short. There is 3 different slots to adjust it but the actual length doesn't change. The baby I bought this for is under 20lbs. and very slim but the buckles stick into his legs and looks very uncomfortable and I don't understand how it could possible hold a child up to 65lbs. I'm just disappointed because I have a sports car with very limited space and researched for months trying to find a car seat that was short in height because most on the market are too tall. This car seat is going to have to go back. I don't understand why no one else is having this problem since the seat for good reviews.
Hard to put in car, comfortable for baby
Works well for my 3 year old
It came with everything but the cup holder.
Installing this car seat was pretty easy/straightforward. Took less time than I anticipated.

I purchased this item from AMAZON.COM and received a car seat that was fine for approximately 1 year. After 1 year the seat-belt buckle broke. GUESS WHAT?? GRACO DOES NOT MAKE REPLACEMENT PARTS FOR SEAT BELT BUCKLES! So I am stuck with a $200 piece of crap that I was expecting to last for years. 1 Year?

THANKS GRACO FOR PROVIDING MY FAMILY WITH CRAP! NEVER AGAIN !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Still loving it
Very easy to adjust and install!

Received 2 of these car seats from our baby registry for our twins. We used them for 11 months and had no issues whatsoever. I loved the fact that this car seat is a lot lighter than all of the other expensive brands we tested. Definitely a plus. And it looks pretty sharp. Easy to connect to strollers and adjust the straps as babies grew. I highly recommend this. Don't see a reason to spend 200$ plus on a carseat when Graco delivers just as good for less.
Angosto y espacioso.

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: Love it!
We returned a “safety first” brand car seat and splurged for the real deal (Graco). Very glad we did...feels/looks safe, tightens down well, and baby boy looks comfy!!!
Very good product.

The assembly was simple, you just need tough fingers to push in the armrests.
Other than that it works great.
Seat is beautiful and meets all functional expectations. My only comment is that it's difficult to get to the latch to loosen the harness., and I've read that this is an issue with most carseats.
I have 2 of these for each of my kids and I love them. They are perfect for getting through the airport pain free!  They can also be used as strollers if needed. My kids think the are so fun too.

These carseats are great for the price I previously had a 600$ cybex carseat for my toddler and this Diono beats it by far!! The material exceeded my expectations plus it was so easy to install al three of them! They are sturdy, lightweight and very comfortable!
My daughter-in law loved this purchase she is going to Australia with her 20 month old daughter and she can use the car seat on the travel cart and not have to carry her through the airports.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: We bought this to use on our trip to Disney and they were perfect. Fairly easy to pack away and inflate. Compact and fit into a back-pack during out time at the park. A must-have when travelling with young kids where you might need to uber or lyft to your destination.

Special Features: Online Chat via ParentLink, Live Video Installation Support, EasyClick LATCH
Review: I love, love, love this car seat!! I have purchased two of these seats. I love everything about it honestly! Easy to install, I feel like the ratchet helps get the seat as tight as possible, comfortable for my son, easy to adjust, but my favorite thing about this seat is how easy it is to take the fabric off and clean it without taking the harness out. And also it’s made in the USA so that is a huge plus for me!
